feed.title: AATF AI News Aggregator - Research (Full)
feed.subtitle: Research items from AI News Aggregator

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.title: Research Summary: January 30, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research is dominated by critical AI safety and security findings. A systematic audit reveals open-source models interpret prohibitions as permissions 77-100% of the time under negation, while JustAsk demonstrates code agents can autonomously extract system prompts from frontier LLMs.

  • Counterintuitive 'less-is-more' effect discovered: LLM monitors detect sabotage better with limited information access
  • Alec Radford shows token-level filtering during pretraining effectively removes specific capabilities while preserving general performance
  • Sycophantic anchors localized in reasoning traces enable 84.6% detection accuracy with linear probes
  • WhatCounts exposes 40%+ accuracy variation in counting tasks based purely on semantic content (cities vs chemicals)

Notable benchmarks and empirical studies: FrontierScience presents PhD-level problems where SOTA achieves <5% accuracy. Analysis of 125,000+ paper-review pairs quantifies LLM interaction effects in peer review. Hardware-triggered backdoors exploit numerical variations across computing platforms as a novel attack vector.

entry.title: When Prohibitions Become Permissions: Auditing Negation Sensitivity in Language Models

author.name: Katherine Elkins, Jon Chun

entry.summary: Audits 16 LLMs on negation sensitivity, finding open-source models interpret prohibitions as permissions 77-100% of the time under negation. Commercial models also show 19-128% accuracy swings.

entry.title: Just Ask: Curious Code Agents Reveal System Prompts in Frontier LLMs

author.name: Xiang Zheng, Yutao Wu, Hanxun Huang, Yige Li, Xingjun Ma, Bo Li, Yu-Gang Jiang, Cong Wang

entry.summary: Presents JustAsk, a self-evolving framework where code agents autonomously discover system prompt extraction strategies for frontier LLMs through interaction alone, requiring no handcrafted prompts.

entry.title: How does information access affect LLM monitors' ability to detect sabotage?

author.name: Rauno Arike, Raja Mehta Moreno, Rohan Subramani, Shubhorup Biswas, Francis Rhys Ward

entry.summary: Studies how information access affects LLM monitors' ability to detect agent sabotage. Discovers counterintuitive 'less-is-more effect' where monitors often perform better with less access to agent reasoning.

entry.title: FrontierScience: Evaluating AI's Ability to Perform Expert-Level Scientific Tasks

author.name: Miles Wang, Robi Lin, Kat Hu, Joy Jiao, Neil Chowdhury, Ethan Chang, Tejal Patwardhan

entry.summary: Introduces FrontierScience benchmark with Olympiad-level and PhD-level research problems across physics, chemistry, and biology. Current SOTA models solve only ~15% of research track problems.

entry.title: Sycophantic Anchors: Localizing and Quantifying User Agreement in Reasoning Models

author.name: Jacek Duszenko

entry.summary: Introduces 'sycophantic anchors' - sentences that causally lock reasoning models into user agreement. Linear probes detect these with 84.6% accuracy, enabling mid-inference intervention.

entry.title: Semantic Content Determines Algorithmic Performance

author.name: Marti\~no R\'ios-Garc\'ia, Nawaf Alampara, Kevin Maik Jablonka

entry.summary: Introduces WhatCounts showing frontier LLMs exhibit 40%+ accuracy variation in counting tasks based solely on semantic content (cities vs chemicals), ruling out sampling noise.

entry.title: ChipBench: A Next-Step Benchmark for Evaluating LLM Performance in AI-Aided Chip Design

author.name: Zhongkai Yu, Chenyang Zhou, Yichen Lin, Hejia Zhang, Haotian Ye, Junxia Cui, Zaifeng Pan, Jishen Zhao, Yufei Ding

entry.summary: Introduces ChipBench for AI-aided chip design with 44 hierarchical modules, 89 debugging cases, and 132 reference model samples. Claude-4.5-opus achieves only 30.74% on Verilog generation.

entry.title: Do LLMs Favor LLMs? Quantifying Interaction Effects in Peer Review

author.name: Vibhhu Sharma, Thorsten Joachims, Sarah Dean

entry.summary: Analyzes 125,000+ paper-review pairs from ICLR, NeurIPS, and ICML to study LLM use in peer review. Finds apparent interaction effects where LLM-assisted reviews seem kinder to LLM-assisted papers, but controlling for confounders reveals more nuanced patterns.

entry.title: Chain Of Thought Compression: A Theoritical Analysis

author.name: Juncai Li, Ru Li, Yuxiang Zhou, Boxiang Ma, Jeff Z. Pan

entry.summary: Provides first theoretical analysis of CoT compression difficulty, proving learning signal for high-order logical dependencies exponentially decays when skipping intermediate steps.

entry.title: Shaping capabilities with token-level data filtering

author.name: Neil Rathi, Alec Radford

entry.summary: Shows token-level filtering during pretraining is highly effective for removing specific capabilities (demonstrated on medical knowledge). Token filtering more effective than document filtering, and effectiveness increases with model scale.

entry.title: Hardware-Triggered Backdoors

author.name: Jonas M\"oller, Erik Imgrund, Thorsten Eisenhofer, Konrad Rieck

entry.summary: Demonstrates that small numerical variations across different computing hardware can be exploited to create backdoors in ML models that produce different predictions for identical inputs depending on execution hardware. A significant security vulnerability discovery.

entry.title: Do Reasoning Models Enhance Embedding Models?

author.name: Wun Yu Chan, Shaojin Chen, Huihao Jing, Kwun Hang Lau, Elton Chun-Chai Li, Zihao Wang, Haoran Li, Yangqiu Song

entry.summary: Evaluates whether RLVR-tuned reasoning models produce better embeddings. Finds null effect - reasoning training provides no consistent advantage when models are used as embedding backbones.

entry.title: Magellan: Autonomous Discovery of Novel Compiler Optimization Heuristics with AlphaEvolve

author.name: Hongzheng Chen, Alexander Novikov, Ng\^an V\~u, Hanna Alam, Zhiru Zhang, Aiden Grossman, Mircea Trofin, Amir Yazdanbakhsh

entry.summary: Presents Magellan, an agentic framework using LLM coding agents with evolutionary search to synthesize C++ compiler optimization heuristics, achieving results matching or surpassing expert baselines in LLVM.

entry.title: The Paradox of Robustness: Decoupling Rule-Based Logic from Affective Noise in High-Stakes Decision-Making

author.name: Jon Chun, Katherine Elkins

entry.summary: Uncovers 'Paradox of Robustness' - despite lexical brittleness, LLMs show 110-300x greater resistance to emotional framing manipulation than humans in high-stakes decision domains.

entry.title: Self-Improving Pretraining: using post-trained models to pretrain better models

author.name: Ellen Xiaoqing Tan, Shehzaad Dhuliawala, Jing Xu, Ping Yu, Sainbayar Sukhbaatar, Jason Weston, Olga Golovneva

entry.summary: Introduces self-improving pretraining that uses post-trained (aligned) models to filter/improve pretraining data on-the-fly. Addresses safety and factuality during pretraining rather than relying solely on post-hoc alignment.

entry.title: Mechanistic Data Attribution: Tracing the Training Origins of Interpretable LLM Units

author.name: Jianhui Chen, Yuzhang Luo, Liangming Pan

entry.summary: Mechanistic Data Attribution traces interpretable LLM circuits back to specific training samples using influence functions, causally validating that targeted data interventions modulate emergence of interpretable heads.

entry.title: Discovering Hidden Gems in Model Repositories

author.name: Jonathan Kahana, Eliahu Horwitz, Yedid Hoshen

entry.summary: Investigates overlooked fine-tuned models in public repositories, finding 'hidden gems' that significantly outperform popular models (e.g., Llama-3.1-8B math performance from 83.2% to 96.0%). Proposes lightweight discovery methods.

entry.title: Early and Prediagnostic Detection of Pancreatic Cancer from Computed Tomography

author.name: Wenxuan Li, Pedro R. A. S. Bassi, Lizhou Wu, Xinze Zhou, Yuxuan Zhao, Qi Chen, Szymon Plotka, Tianyu Lin, Zheren Zhu, Marisa Martin, Justin Caskey, Shanshan Jiang, Xiaoxi Chen, Jaroslaw B. \'Cwikla, Artur Sankowski, Yaping Wu, Sergio Decherchi, Andrea Cavalli, Chandana Lall, Cristian Tomasetti, Yaxing Guo, Xuan Yu, Yuqing Cai, Hualin Qiao, Jie Bao, Chenhan Hu, Ximing Wang, Arkadiusz Sitek, Kai Ding, Heng Li, Meiyun Wang, Dexin Yu, Guang Zhang, Yang Yang, Kang Wang, Alan L. Yuille, Zongwei Zhou

entry.summary: Develops ePAI for early pancreatic cancer detection achieving AUC 0.939-0.999 on internal test, with validation across 15,153 patients from 10 institutions in Asia, Europe, and North America.

entry.title: Latent Chain-of-Thought as Planning: Decoupling Reasoning from Verbalization

author.name: Jiecong Wang, Hao Peng, Chunyang Liu

entry.summary: Introduces PLaT (Planning with Latent Thoughts) reformulating latent reasoning as planning that decouples reasoning from verbalization, modeling reasoning as deterministic trajectory in latent space.

entry.title: The Surprising Difficulty of Search in Model-Based Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Wei-Di Chang, Mikael Henaff, Brandon Amos, Gregory Dudek, Scott Fujimoto

entry.summary: Challenges conventional wisdom that model accuracy limits model-based RL search performance. Shows distribution shift matters more than model accuracy, and that search can harm performance even with accurate models. Achieves SOTA by focusing on distribution shift mitigation.

entry.title: ECO: Quantized Training without Full-Precision Master Weights

author.name: Mahdi Nikdan, Amir Zandieh, Dan Alistarh, Vahab Mirrokni

entry.summary: ECO eliminates master weights in quantized training by applying updates directly to quantized parameters with error compensation, significantly reducing memory for Sparse MoE models.

entry.title: Disempowerment patterns in real-world AI usage

author.name: David Duvenaud

entry.summary: Announces paper analyzing disempowering patterns in real AI conversations - where AI steers users in ways that distort beliefs, values, or actions rather than informing.

entry.title: Llama-3.1-FoundationAI-SecurityLLM-Reasoning-8B Technical Report

author.name: Zhuoran Yang, Ed Li, Jianliang He, Aman Priyanshu, Baturay Saglam, Paul Kassianik, Sajana Weerawardhena, Anu Vellore, Blaine Nelson, Neusha Javidnia, Arthur Goldblatt, Fraser Burch, Avi Zohary, Assaf Eisenman, Mahdi Sabbaghi, Supriti Vijay, Rahim Dharssi, Dhruv Kedia, Kojin Oshiba, Yaron Singer, Amin Karbasi

entry.summary: Presents Foundation-Sec-8B-Reasoning, the first open-source reasoning model for cybersecurity, trained via SFT and RLVR on proprietary security data, showing competitive performance on 10 cybersecurity benchmarks.

entry.title: Meta Context Engineering via Agentic Skill Evolution

author.name: Haoran Ye, Xuning He, Vincent Arak, Haonan Dong, Guojie Song

entry.summary: Introduces Meta Context Engineering (MCE), bi-level framework co-evolving context engineering skills and artifacts through agentic crossover over skill history.

entry.title: Scalable Power Sampling: Unlocking Efficient, Training-Free Reasoning for LLMs via Distribution Sharpening

author.name: Xiaotong Ji, Rasul Tutunov, Matthieu Zimmer, Haitham Bou Ammar

entry.summary: Shows RL post-training gains primarily from distribution sharpening rather than new capabilities. Proposes training-free alternative to MCMC for power distribution sampling, achieving comparable performance without iterative computation.

entry.title: From Future of Work to Future of Workers: Addressing Asymptomatic AI Harms for Dignified Human-AI Interaction

author.name: Upol Ehsan, Samir Passi, Koustuv Saha, Todd McNutt, Mark O. Riedl, Sara Alcorn

entry.summary: Year-long study documenting 'intuition rust' - gradual erosion of expert judgment in cancer specialists using AI, identifying asymptomatic harms that evolve into skill atrophy and identity commoditization.

entry.title: A Theory of Universal Agnostic Learning

author.name: Steve Hanneke, Shay Moran

entry.summary: Establishes complete theory of optimal universal rates for binary classification in agnostic setting, identifying fundamental tetrachotomy of convergence rates.

entry.title: Where Do the Joules Go? Diagnosing Inference Energy Consumption

author.name: Jae-Won Chung, Ruofan Wu, Jeff J. Ma, Mosharaf Chowdhury

entry.summary: Large-scale measurement study of inference energy consumption across 46 models, 7 tasks, and 1,858 configurations on H100 and B200 GPUs, finding order-of-magnitude variations (video generation 100x more than images, task type causing 25x differences).

entry.title: Do Not Waste Your Rollouts: Recycling Search Experience for Efficient Test-Time Scaling

author.name: Xinglin Wang, Jiayi Shi, Shaoxiong Feng, Peiwen Yuan, Yiwei Li, Yueqi Zhang, Chuyi Tan, Ji Zhang, Boyuan Pan, Yao Hu, Kan Li

entry.summary: Introduces Recycling Search Experience (RSE), a training-free method that transforms test-time search from isolated trials into cumulative learning by distilling insights from previous rollouts. Addresses computational redundancy in LLM test-time scaling.

entry.title: One-step Latent-free Image Generation with Pixel Mean Flows

author.name: Yiyang Lu, Susie Lu, Qiao Sun, Hanhong Zhao, Zhicheng Jiang, Xianbang Wang, Tianhong Li, Zhengyang Geng, Kaiming He

entry.summary: Proposes pixel MeanFlow (pMF) for one-step latent-free image generation, separating network output space (x-prediction on image manifold) from loss space (MeanFlow in velocity space). Achieves strong results with efficient sampling.

entry.title: Fitness-Seekers: Generalizing the Reward-Seeking Threat Model

author.name: Alex Mallen

entry.summary: Proposes 'fitness-seekers' as generalization of reward-seeking threat model, including AIs pursuing per-action reinforcement or deployment regardless of reward, with importantly different risk profiles.

entry.title: Within-Model vs Between-Prompt Variability in Large Language Models for Creative Tasks

author.name: Jennifer Haase, Jana Gonnermann-M\"uller, Paul H. P. Hanel, Nicolas Leins, Thomas Kosch, Jan Mendling, Sebastian Pokutta

entry.summary: Evaluates 12 LLMs on creativity tasks (N=12,000) finding prompts explain 36% of quality variance (comparable to model choice at 41%), while within-LLM variance is substantial (10-34%).

entry.title: Depth-Recurrent Attention Mixtures: Giving Latent Reasoning the Attention it Deserves

author.name: Jonas Knupp, Jan Hendrik Metzen, Jeremias Bohn, Georg Groh, Kristian Kersting

entry.summary: Introduces Dreamer, modular framework combining sequence attention, depth attention, and sparse expert attention for depth-recurrent latent reasoning, requiring 2-8x fewer training FLOPs.

entry.title: Mitigating Overthinking in Large Reasoning Models via Difficulty-aware Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Qian Wan, Ziao Xu, Luona Wei, Xiaoxuan Shen, Jianwen Sun

entry.summary: Addresses overthinking in Large Reasoning Models through difficulty-aware reinforcement learning that helps LRMs allocate reasoning resources based on task complexity. Proposes Difficulty-aware Policy Optimization framework.

entry.title: Hybrid Linear Attention Done Right: Efficient Distillation and Effective Architectures for Extremely Long Contexts

author.name: Yingfa Chen, Zhen Leng Thai, Zihan Zhou, Zhu Zhang, Xingyu Shen, Shuo Wang, Chaojun Xiao, Xu Han, Zhiyuan Liu

entry.summary: Demonstrates efficient distillation of softmax attention to hybrid linear attention models using only 2B tokens, achieving strong long-context performance where prior methods failed.

entry.title: Scaling Reasoning Hop Exposes Weaknesses: Demystifying and Improving Hop Generalization in Large Language Models

author.name: Zhaoyi Li, Jiatong Li, Gangwei Jiang, Linqi Song, Defu Lian, Ying Wei

entry.summary: Systematically studies LLM reasoning hop generalization failure, finding errors concentrate at specific token positions due to internal competition mechanisms where certain patterns dominate over reasoning chains.

entry.title: Qwen3-ASR Technical Report

author.name: Xian Shi, Xiong Wang, Zhifang Guo, Yongqi Wang, Pei Zhang, Xinyu Zhang, Zishan Guo, Hongkun Hao, Yu Xi, Baosong Yang, Jin Xu, Jingren Zhou, Junyang Lin

entry.summary: Technical report for Qwen3-ASR family: two ASR models (1.7B and 0.6B) supporting 52 languages and a novel forced alignment model. Built on Qwen3-Omni foundation.

entry.title: Causal Autoregressive Diffusion Language Model

author.name: Junhao Ruan, Bei Li, Yongjing Yin, Pengcheng Huang, Xin Chen, Jingang Wang, Xunliang Cai, Tong Xiao, JingBo Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes CARD (Causal Autoregressive Diffusion) unifying ARM training efficiency with diffusion inference throughput. Uses soft-tailed masking and context-aware reweighting for stable optimization.

entry.title: System 1&2 Synergy via Dynamic Model Interpolation

author.name: Chenxu Yang, Qingyi Si, Chong Tian, Xiyu Liu, Dingyu Yao, Chuanyu Qin, Zheng Lin, Weiping Wang, Jiaqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes dynamic parameter interpolation between Instruct and Thinking model checkpoints to achieve System 1/2 synergy without additional training, focusing on capability control vs output control.

entry.title: GeoRC: A Benchmark for Geolocation Reasoning Chains

author.name: Mohit Talreja, Joshua Diao, Jim Thannikary James, Radu Casapu, Tejas Santanam, Ethan Mendes, Alan Ritter, Wei Xu, James Hays

entry.summary: Introduces first benchmark for geolocation reasoning chains in VLMs, exposing that models frequently hallucinate evidence (phantom writing, misidentified flora) even when location predictions are correct. Collaborates with expert GeoGuessr players for evaluation.

entry.title: L$^3$: Large Lookup Layers

author.name: Albert Tseng, Christopher De Sa

entry.summary: Introduces Large Lookup Layers (LÂ³) as alternative to MoE that generalizes embedding tables to decoder layers. Uses static token-based routing rather than dynamic routing, avoiding auxiliary losses and improving hardware efficiency.

entry.title: Breaking the Overscaling Curse: Thinking Parallelism Before Parallel Thinking

author.name: Yiming Wang, Zhuosheng Zhang, Rui Wang

entry.summary: Formalizes and quantifies 'overscaling curse' where system-level parallelism allocation is suboptimal for heterogeneous samples. Proposes T2 method using latent representations to estimate per-sample optimal parallelism.

entry.title: SWE-Replay: Efficient Test-Time Scaling for Software Engineering Agents

author.name: Yifeng Ding, Lingming Zhang

entry.summary: SWE-Replay enables efficient test-time scaling for software engineering agents by recycling trajectories from prior trials instead of sampling from scratch.

entry.title: IDE-Bench: Evaluating Large Language Models as IDE Agents on Real-World Software Engineering Tasks

author.name: Spencer Mateega, Jeff Yang, Tiana Costello, Shaurya Jadhav, Nicole Tian, Agustin Garcinu\~no

entry.summary: Introduces IDE-Bench, comprehensive benchmark for evaluating AI IDE agents with 80 tasks across 8 never-published repositories. Provides Dockerized test harness mimicking real IDE environments like Cursor/Windsurf.

entry.title: FineInstructions: Scaling Synthetic Instructions to Pre-Training Scale

author.name: Ajay Patel, Colin Raffel, Chris Callison-Burch

entry.summary: Proposes a procedure to transform pre-training documents into billions of synthetic instruction-answer pairs using 18M instruction templates from real user queries. Creates FineInstructions dataset.

entry.title: Thoughts on AGI and world government

author.name: wdmacaskill

entry.summary: Will MacAskill's analysis of how AGI development could lead first mover to become de facto world government, with implications for AGI governance strategy.

entry.title: Bayesian-LoRA: Probabilistic Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models

author.name: Moule Lin, Shuhao Guan, Andrea Patane, David Gregg, Goetz Botterweck

entry.summary: Reformulates LoRA fine-tuning as probabilistic low-rank adaptation inspired by Sparse Gaussian Processes, enabling uncertainty quantification with only ~0.42M additional parameters.

entry.title: The Path of Least Resistance: Guiding LLM Reasining Trajectories with Prefix Consensus

author.name: Ishan Jindal, Sai Prashanth Akuthota, Jayant Taneja, Sachin Dev Sharma

entry.summary: Introduces PoLR (Path of Least Resistance), first inference-time method using prefix consistency to reduce compute in reasoning by clustering short prefixes and expanding only dominant cluster.

entry.title: TCAP: Tri-Component Attention Profiling for Unsupervised Backdoor Detection in MLLM Fine-Tuning

author.name: Mingzu Liu, Hao Fang, Runmin Cong

entry.summary: Proposes TCAP for unsupervised backdoor detection in MLLM fine-tuning by profiling attention allocation divergence across system instructions, vision inputs, and user queries.

entry.title: The Depth Delusion: Why Transformers Should Be Wider, Not Deeper

author.name: Md Muhtasim Munif Fahim, Md Rezaul Karim

entry.summary: Proposes architecture-conditioned scaling laws showing optimal width should grow 2.8x faster than depth, identifying 'critical depth' phenomenon where additional layers increase loss despite more parameters.

entry.title: SHARP: Social Harm Analysis via Risk Profiles for Measuring Inequities in Large Language Models

author.name: Alok Abhishek, Tushar Bandopadhyay, Lisa Erickson

entry.summary: Proposes SHARP, a multidimensional framework for evaluating social harm in LLMs that goes beyond scalar metrics to capture distributional structure, cross-dimensional interactions, and worst-case behaviors. Models harm as multivariate random variable with decomposition into bias, fairness, ethics, and reliability.

entry.title: The Compliance Paradox: Semantic-Instruction Decoupling in Automated Academic Code Evaluation

author.name: Devanshu Sahoo, Manish Prasad, Vasudev Majhi, Arjun Neekhra, Yash Sinha, Murari Mandal, Vinay Chamola, Dhruv Kumar

entry.summary: Demonstrates 'Compliance Paradox' where LLMs fine-tuned for helpfulness can be adversarially manipulated in code evaluation. Introduces SPACI framework and AST-ASIP protocol to exploit syntax-semantics decoupling vulnerability.

entry.title: TraceRouter: Robust Safety for Large Foundation Models via Path-Level Intervention

author.name: Chuancheng Shi, Shangze Li, Wenjun Lu, Wenhua Wu, Cong Wang, Zifeng Cheng, Fei Shen, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: TraceRouter provides path-level safety intervention for LLMs by tracing causal propagation circuits of harmful semantics using sparse autoencoders, rather than suppressing isolated neurons.

entry.title: Factored Causal Representation Learning for Robust Reward Modeling in RLHF

author.name: Yupei Yang, Lin Yang, Wanxi Deng, Lin Qu, Fan Feng, Biwei Huang, Shikui Tu, Lei Xu

entry.summary: Addresses reward hacking in RLHF by decomposing contextual embeddings into causal factors sufficient for reward prediction and non-causal factors capturing spurious correlations like length bias.

entry.title: Putting a Face to Forgetting: Continual Learning meets Mechanistic Interpretability

author.name: Sergi Masip, Gido M. van de Ven, Javier Ferrando, Tinne Tuytelaars

entry.summary: Introduces mechanistic framework connecting continual learning with interpretability, providing geometric interpretation of catastrophic forgetting as transformations to feature encodings that reduce capacity or disrupt readout.

entry.title: Procedural Pretraining: Warming Up Language Models with Abstract Data

author.name: Liangze Jiang, Zachary Shinnick, Anton van den Hengel, Hemanth Saratchandran, Damien Teney

entry.summary: Studies pretraining language models on procedural/algorithmic data before natural language, showing dramatic improvements (e.g., 10% to 98% on needle-in-haystack with Dyck sequences). Explores curriculum-style pretraining.

entry.title: SOUP: Token-level Single-sample Mix-policy Reinforcement Learning for Large Language Models

author.name: Lei Yang, Wei Bi, Chenxi Sun, Renren Jin, Deyi Xiong

entry.summary: Introduces SOUP, a framework unifying off- and on-policy RL at the token level for LLM training. Uses historical policy prefixes with on-policy continuations to balance exploration and stability.

entry.title: WorldBench: Disambiguating Physics for Diagnostic Evaluation of World Models

author.name: Rishi Upadhyay, Howard Zhang, Jim Solomon, Ayush Agrawal, Pranay Boreddy, Shruti Satya Narayana, Yunhao Ba, Alex Wong, Celso M de Melo, Achuta Kadambi

entry.summary: Introduces WorldBench, a benchmark for evaluating world models' physical understanding through disentangled, concept-specific tests that isolate individual physical laws rather than conflating multiple concepts.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning from Meta-Evaluation: Aligning Language Models Without Ground-Truth Labels

author.name: Micah Rentschler, Jesse Roberts

entry.summary: Introduces RLME, a method to train LLMs using reward derived from an evaluator answering meta-questions about generated outputs, eliminating the need for ground-truth labels. This enables RL training in domains where correctness is ambiguous or expensive to verify.

entry.title: Better evals are not enough to combat eval awareness

author.name: Igor Ivanov

entry.summary: Argues that improving evaluation realism alone won't solve eval awareness problem - models may still recognize evals despite improvements. Suggests coupling better evals with training changes.

entry.title: ARGORA: Orchestrated Argumentation for Causally Grounded LLM Reasoning and Decision Making

author.name: Youngjin Jin, Hanna Kim, Kwanwoo Kim, Chanhee Lee, Seungwon Shin

entry.summary: Proposes ARGORA organizing multi-expert LLM discussions into argumentation graphs with causal analysis, enabling systematic identification of which reasoning chains drove decisions.

entry.title: Language-based Trial and Error Falls Behind in the Era of Experience

author.name: Haoyu Wang, Guozheng Ma, Shugang Cui, Yilun Kong, Haotian Luo, Li Shen, Mengya Gao, Yichao Wu, Xiaogang Wang, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Demonstrates LLMs' primary bottleneck in non-linguistic tasks is exploration cost, not distribution mismatch. Proposes SCOUT using lightweight 'scouts' for exploration decoupled from LLM exploitation.

entry.title: DUET: Distilled LLM Unlearning from an Efficiently Contextualized Teacher

author.name: Yisheng Zhong, Zhengbang Yang, Zhuangdi Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes DUET, a distillation-based LLM unlearning method that combines benefits of tuning-based and in-context approaches. Student model imitates prompt-steered teacher to achieve efficient unlearning resistant to prompt removal attacks.

entry.title: On the Adversarial Robustness of Large Vision-Language Models under Visual Token Compression

author.name: Xinwei Zhang, Hangcheng Liu, Li Bai, Hao Wang, Qingqing Ye, Tianwei Zhang, Haibo Hu

entry.summary: Shows encoder-based adversarial attacks overestimate robustness of compressed LVLMs due to optimization-inference mismatch. Proposes CAGE attack that aligns perturbation optimization with compression without access to compression mechanism.

entry.title: Expected Return Causes Outcome-Level Mode Collapse in Reinforcement Learning and How to Fix It with Inverse Probability Scaling

author.name: Abhijeet Sinha, Sundari Elango, Dianbo Liu

entry.summary: Shows expected return maximization structurally causes outcome-level mode collapse in RL, with log-probability ratios evolving linearly in reward differences causing exponential divergence. Proposes Inverse Probability Scaling fix.

entry.title: Thinking Out of Order: When Output Order Stops Reflecting Reasoning Order in Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Longxuan Yu, Yu Fu, Shaorong Zhang, Hui Liu, Mukund Varma T, Greg Ver Steeg, Yue Dong

entry.summary: Shows that masked diffusion language models can decouple computation order from output structure, enabling answers to be generated after reasoning even when output format requires answer-first presentation.

entry.title: Pay for Hints, Not Answers: LLM Shepherding for Cost-Efficient Inference

author.name: Ziming Dong, Hardik Sharma, Evan O'Toole, Jaya Prakash Champati, Kui Wu

entry.summary: Introduces LLM Shepherding, requesting only short hints (10-30% of full response) from expensive LLMs to improve small language model accuracy, achieving significant cost savings on math and coding tasks.

entry.title: MoCo: A One-Stop Shop for Model Collaboration Research

author.name: Shangbin Feng, Yuyang Bai, Ziyuan Yang, Yike Wang, Zhaoxuan Tan, Jiajie Yan, Zhenyu Lei, Wenxuan Ding, Weijia Shi, Haojin Wang, Zhenting Qi, Yuru Jiang, Heng Wang, Chengsong Huang, Yu Fei, Jihan Yao, Yilun Du, Luke Zettlemoyer, Yejin Choi, Yulia Tsvetkov

entry.summary: Introduces MoCo, a comprehensive Python library with 26 model collaboration methods spanning routing, text, logit, and parameter exchange. Includes 25 evaluation benchmarks.

entry.title: On the Paradoxical Interference between Instruction-Following and Task Solving

author.name: Yunjia Qi, Hao Peng, Xintong Shi, Amy Xin, Xiaozhi Wang, Bin Xu, Lei Hou, Juanzi Li

entry.summary: Reveals that instruction following can paradoxically interfere with LLM task-solving, proposing SUSTAINSCORE metric to quantify interference when adding self-evident constraints.

entry.title: OpenSec: Measuring Incident Response Agent Calibration Under Adversarial Evidence

author.name: Jarrod Barnes

entry.summary: Introduces OpenSec, a reinforcement learning environment for evaluating incident response agents under adversarial evidence including prompt injection. Measures time-to-containment, blast radius, and injection violations.

entry.title: Uncovering Hidden Correctness in LLM Causal Reasoning via Symbolic Verification

author.name: Paul He, Yinya Huang, Mrinmaya Sachan, Zhijing Jin

entry.summary: Introduces DoVerifier, a symbolic verifier checking whether LLM-generated causal expressions are derivable using do-calculus rules, recovering correct answers marked wrong by surface-level metrics.

entry.title: ScaleSim: Serving Large-Scale Multi-Agent Simulation with Invocation Distance-Based Memory Management

author.name: Zaifeng Pan, Yipeng Shen, Zhengding Hu, Zhuang Wang, Aninda Manocha, Zheng Wang, Zhongkai Yu, Yue Guan, Yufei Ding

entry.summary: Proposes ScaleSim for memory-efficient multi-agent simulation using 'invocation distance' abstraction to estimate agent invocation order and manage GPU-resident states efficiently.

entry.title: EmboCoach-Bench: Benchmarking AI Agents on Developing Embodied Robots

author.name: Zixing Lei, Genjia Liu, Yuanshuo Zhang, Qipeng Liu, Chuan Wen, Shanghang Zhang, Wenzhao Lian, Siheng Chen

entry.summary: Introduces EmboCoach-Bench evaluating LLM agents' ability to autonomously engineer embodied robot policies across 32 RL/IL tasks, positioning code as universal interface.

entry.title: Less Noise, More Voice: Reinforcement Learning for Reasoning via Instruction Purification

author.name: Yiju Guo, Tianyi Hu, Zexu Sun, Yankai Lin

entry.summary: Introduces LENS framework for reinforcement learning with verifiable rewards that identifies and removes interference tokens from prompts before training. Transfers successful rollouts from purified prompts to supervise policy optimization on noisy originals.

entry.title: Conversation for Non-verifiable Learning: Self-Evolving LLMs through Meta-Evaluation

author.name: Yuan Sui, Bryan Hooi

entry.summary: Introduces CoNL framework enabling LLMs to self-evolve on non-verifiable tasks through meta-evaluation. Addresses fundamental limitation that LLM-as-Judge approaches are constrained by evaluator quality.

entry.title: SWE-Spot: Building Small Repo-Experts with Repository-Centric Learning

author.name: Jinjun Peng, Magnus Saebo, Tianjun Zhong, Yi-Jie Cheng, Junfeng Yang, Baishakhi Ray, Simin Chen, Yangruibo Ding

entry.summary: Proposes Repository-Centric Learning (RCL) paradigm for coding SLMs that prioritizes depth within target repositories over breadth across tasks. Creates 'repo-expert' SLMs that internalize specific codebase physics.

entry.title: TACLer: Tailored Curriculum Reinforcement Learning for Efficient Reasoning

author.name: Huiyuan Lai, Malvina Nissim

entry.summary: Proposes TACLer, model-tailored curriculum reinforcement learning that gradually increases complexity based on model proficiency for efficient reasoning. Addresses overthinking and redundant reasoning steps.

entry.title: StepShield: When, Not Whether to Intervene on Rogue Agents

author.name: Gloria Felicia (University of Virginia), Michael Eniolade (University of the Cumberlands), Jinfeng He (Cornell University), Zitha Sasindran (Indian Institute of Science Bangalore), Hemant Kumar (University of Arizona), Milan Hussain Angati (California State University Northridge), Sandeep Bandarupalli (University of Cincinnati)

entry.summary: StepShield is first benchmark evaluating when agent violations are detected (not just whether), with 9,213 trajectories and novel temporal metrics for intervention timing.

entry.title: Learning the Mechanism of Catastrophic Forgetting: A Perspective from Gradient Similarity

author.name: Mutian Yang, Zisen Zhan, Yutong Chen, Haolin Li, Kaiwen Wang, Kaili Zheng, Yuguang Wang, Qi Wang, Jiandong Gao, Ji Wu

entry.summary: Establishes gradient-based theoretical framework for catastrophic forgetting in LLMs. Identifies conflicting neurons (50-75%) causing forgetting and collaborative neurons (25-50%) mitigating it.

entry.title: Nonparametric LLM Evaluation from Preference Data

author.name: Dennis Frauen, Athiya Deviyani, Mihaela van der Schaar, Stefan Feuerriegel

entry.summary: Proposes DMLEval, nonparametric statistical framework for LLM evaluation from preference data using debiased machine learning. Introduces generalized ranking scores with proper uncertainty quantification.

entry.title: Making Foundation Models Probabilistic via Singular Value Ensembles

author.name: Mehmet Ozgur Turkoglu, Dominik J. M\"uhlematter, Alexander Becker, Konrad Schindler, Helge Aasen

entry.summary: Proposes Singular Value Ensemble (SVE), a parameter-efficient method to add uncertainty quantification to foundation models by treating singular vectors of weight matrices as meaningful knowledge subspaces for implicit ensembling.

entry.title: DeepSearchQA: Bridging the Comprehensiveness Gap for Deep Research Agents

author.name: Nikita Gupta, Riju Chatterjee, Lukas Haas, Connie Tao, Andrew Wang, Chang Liu, Hidekazu Oiwa, Elena Gribovskaya, Jan Ackermann, John Blitzer, Sasha Goldshtein, Dipanjan Das

entry.summary: Introduces DeepSearchQA, a 900-prompt benchmark for evaluating agents on complex multi-step information-seeking tasks across 17 fields. Tests systematic information collation, deduplication, and stopping criteria reasoning.

entry.title: Zonkey: A Hierarchical Diffusion Language Model with Differentiable Tokenization and Probabilistic Attention

author.name: Alon Rozental

entry.summary: Introduces Zonkey, a hierarchical diffusion language model with fully trainable differentiable tokenization that learns probabilistic BOS decisions for adaptive word boundaries.

entry.title: MMFineReason: Closing the Multimodal Reasoning Gap via Open Data-Centric Methods

author.name: Honglin Lin, Zheng Liu, Yun Zhu, Chonghan Qin, Juekai Lin, Xiaoran Shang, Conghui He, Wentao Zhang, Lijun Wu

entry.summary: Introduces MMFineReason, a 1.8M sample multimodal reasoning dataset with 5.1B solution tokens featuring long-form CoT annotations distilled from Qwen3-VL for STEM and visual puzzle domains.

entry.title: DynamicVLA: A Vision-Language-Action Model for Dynamic Object Manipulation

author.name: Haozhe Xie, Beichen Wen, Jiarui Zheng, Zhaoxi Chen, Fangzhou Hong, Haiwen Diao, Ziwei Liu

entry.summary: Presents DynamicVLA for manipulating dynamic/moving objects with 0.4B VLA using continuous inference for overlapping reasoning/execution and latent-aware action streaming for adaptive control.

entry.title: Building AIs that do human-like philosophy

author.name: Joe Carlsmith

entry.summary: Joe Carlsmith discusses whether building 'human-like philosophy' capabilities in AI is necessary for alignment, examining the relationship between philosophical sophistication and alignment solutions.

entry.title: MemOCR: Layout-Aware Visual Memory for Efficient Long-Horizon Reasoning

author.name: Yaorui Shi, Shugui Liu, Yu Yang, Wenyu Mao, Yuxin Chen, Qi GU, Hui Su, Xunliang Cai, Xiang Wang, An Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces MemOCR, a multimodal memory agent that renders structured text memory as images with visual layout for adaptive information density, improving long-horizon reasoning under tight context budgets.

entry.title: Theoretically Optimal Attention/FFN Ratios in Disaggregated LLM Serving

author.name: Chendong Song, Meixuan Wang, Hang Zhou, Hong Liang, Yuan Lyu, Zixi Chen, Yuwei Fan, Zijie Zhou

entry.summary: Develops analytical framework for optimal Attention/FFN provisioning ratios in disaggregated LLM serving architecture. Shows performance is highly sensitive to ratio due to step-level blocking in the rA-1F topology.

entry.title: FIT: Defying Catastrophic Forgetting in Continual LLM Unlearning

author.name: Xiaoyu Xu, Minxin Du, Kun Fang, Zi Liang, Yaxin Xiao, Zhicong Huang, Cheng Hong, Qingqing Ye, Haibo Hu

entry.summary: Proposes FIT framework for continual LLM unlearning handling high-volume deletion requests. Uses data Filtering, Importance-aware updates, and Targeted layer attribution to prevent catastrophic forgetting during sequential unlearning.

entry.title: Reasoning While Asking: Transforming Reasoning Large Language Models from Passive Solvers to Proactive Inquirers

author.name: Xin Chen, Feng Jiang, Yiqian Zhang, Hardy Chen, Shuo Yan, Wenya Xie, Min Yang, Shujian Huang

entry.summary: Proactive Interactive Reasoning transforms LLMs from passive solvers to proactive inquirers that interleave reasoning with clarification when critical information is missing.

entry.title: OVD: On-policy Verbal Distillation

author.name: Jing Xiong, Hui Shen, Shansan Gong, Yuxin Cheng, Jianghan Shen, Chaofan Tao, Haochen Tan, Haoli Bai, Lifeng Shang, Ngai Wong

entry.summary: Introduces On-policy Verbal Distillation (OVD) replacing token-level probability matching with discrete verbal scores (0-9) from teachers, dramatically reducing memory while enabling on-policy distillation.

entry.title: Bridging the Arithmetic Gap: The Cognitive Complexity Benchmark and Financial-PoT for Robust Financial Reasoning

author.name: Boxiang Zhao, Qince Li, Zhonghao Wang, Yi Wang, Peng Cheng, Bo Lin

entry.summary: Introduces Cognitive Complexity Benchmark for financial reasoning, revealing 'Arithmetic Hallucinations' and 'Cognitive Collapse' in LLMs. Proposes Financial-PoT to address failures.

entry.title: The Effectiveness of Style Vectors for Steering Large Language Models: A Human Evaluation

author.name: Diaoul\'e Diallo, Katharina Dworatzyk, Sophie Jentzsch, Peer Sch\"utt, Sabine Theis, Tobias Hecking

entry.summary: First human evaluation of activation steering for emotional tone, with 7,000+ ratings from 190 participants showing style vectors can reliably modulate perceived emotional tone in LLM outputs.

entry.title: Beyond Imitation: Reinforcement Learning for Active Latent Planning

author.name: Zhi Zheng, Wee Sun Lee

entry.summary: Proposes reinforcement learning approach for latent reasoning that moves beyond imitation learning, addressing training-test gaps from diverse CoT labels.

entry.title: Epistemic Context Learning: Building Trust the Right Way in LLM-Based Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Ruiwen Zhou, Maojia Song, Xiaobao Wu, Sitao Cheng, Xunjian Yin, Yuxi Xie, Zhuoqun Hao, Wenyue Hua, Liangming Pan, Soujanya Poria, Min-Yen Kan

entry.summary: Proposes Epistemic Context Learning (ECL) for multi-agent systems, building peer reliability profiles from interaction history to address blind conformity to misleading peers.

entry.title: Scaling Embeddings Outperforms Scaling Experts in Language Models

author.name: Hong Liu, Jiaqi Zhang, Chao Wang, Xing Hu, Linkun Lyu, Jiaqi Sun, Xurui Yang, Bo Wang, Fengcun Li, Yulei Qian, Lingtong Si, Yerui Sun, Rumei Li, Peng Pei, Yuchen Xie, Xunliang Cai

entry.summary: Demonstrates embedding scaling can outperform expert scaling in certain regimes, identifying Pareto frontier conditions and characterizing architectural factors for embedding vs MoE scaling.

entry.title: MGSM-Pro: A Simple Strategy for Robust Multilingual Mathematical Reasoning Evaluation

author.name: Tianyi Xu, Kosei Uemura, Alfred Malengo Kondoro, Tadesse Destaw Belay, Catherine Nana Nyaah Essuman, Ifeoma Okoh, Ganiyat Afolabi, Ayodele Awokoya, David Ifeoluwa Adelani

entry.summary: Introduces MGSM-Pro, extending the MGSM multilingual math dataset with GSM-Symbolic's instantiation approach, providing five variations per question across nine languages. Reveals that low-resource languages suffer significant performance drops under digit variations, exposing brittleness in multilingual reasoning.

entry.title: Spava: Accelerating Long-Video Understanding via Sequence-Parallelism-aware Approximate Attention

author.name: Yuxiang Huang, Mingye Li, Xu Han, Chaojun Xiao, Weilin Zhao, Ao Sun, Ziqi Yuan, Hao Zhou, Fandong Meng, Zhiyuan Liu

entry.summary: Introduces Spava, a sequence-parallel framework for accelerating long-video inference in Large Multimodal Models across multiple GPUs through distributed approximate attention, enabling processing of more visual embeddings without compression.

entry.title: Curriculum Learning for LLM Pretraining: An Analysis of Learning Dynamics

author.name: Mohamed Elgaar, Hadi Amiri

entry.summary: Analyzes curriculum learning dynamics for LLM pretraining across 14M-1B parameter models. Shows training follows shared latent phases while curricula mainly change within-phase data exposure, with larger models less affected.

entry.title: Why Adam Works Better with $\beta_1 = \beta_2$: The Missing Gradient Scale Invariance Principle

author.name: Alberto Fern\'andez-Hern\'andez, Cristian P\'erez-Corral, Jose I. Mestre, Manuel F. Dolz, Enrique S. Quintana-Ort\'i

entry.summary: Provides theoretical explanation for why Adam optimizer performs better when Î²â=Î²â, proving this configuration achieves gradient scale invariance. This formalizes an empirically observed phenomenon that has lacked theoretical justification.

entry.title: Latent Adversarial Regularization for Offline Preference Optimization

author.name: Enyi Jiang, Yibo Jacky Zhang, Yinglun Xu, Andreas Haupt, Nancy Amato, Sanmi Koyejo

entry.summary: GANPO achieves latent-space regularization for preference optimization using adversarial approach inspired by GANs, addressing semantic/behavioral similarity issues with token-space methods.

entry.title: Revisiting Diffusion Model Predictions Through Dimensionality

author.name: Qing Jin, Chaoyang Wang

entry.summary: Provides theoretical framework explaining why x-prediction becomes optimal in high-dimensional diffusion models. Derives analytical relationship between data geometry and optimal prediction target.

entry.title: ETS: Energy-Guided Test-Time Scaling for Training-Free RL Alignment

author.name: Xiuyu Li, Jinkai Zhang, Mingyang Yi, Yu Li, Longqiang Wang, Yue Wang, Ju Fan

entry.summary: Proposes ETS, a training-free inference method for RL alignment using energy-guided sampling from optimal policy. Uses Monte Carlo estimation with provable convergence.

entry.title: DASH: Deterministic Attention Scheduling for High-throughput Reproducible LLM Training

author.name: Xinwei Qiang, Hongmin Chen, Shixuan Sun, Jingwen Leng, Xin Liu, Minyi Guo

entry.summary: Proposes DASH for deterministic attention scheduling achieving high-throughput reproducible LLM training. Formulates backward pass as DAG scheduling problem to maximize utilization while maintaining determinism.

entry.title: Entropy-Based Dimension-Free Convergence and Loss-Adaptive Schedules for Diffusion Models

author.name: Ahmad Aghapour, Erhan Bayraktar, Ziqing Zhang

entry.summary: Develops dimension-free convergence bounds for diffusion models using information-theoretic approach, showing KL divergence bounded by O(HÂ²/K) where H is Shannon entropy and K is sampling steps. Also proposes loss-adaptive scheduling.

entry.title: Better without U: Impact of Selective Hubbard U Correction on Foundational MLIPs

author.name: Thomas Warford, Fabian L. Thiemann, G\'abor Cs\'anyi

entry.summary: Demonstrates that foundational ML potentials trained on MPtrj/Alexandria/OMat24 encode inconsistencies from selective Hubbard U correction, leading to systematic underbinding between corrected metals and oxygen.

entry.title: Questioning the Coverage-Length Metric in Conformal Prediction: When Shorter Intervals Are Not Better

author.name: Yizhou Min, Yizhou Lu, Lanqi Li, Zhen Zhang, Jiaye Teng

entry.summary: Critically examines conformal prediction evaluation, demonstrating that interval length can be deceptively improved via 'Prejudicial Trick' while maintaining coverage, exposing metric limitations.

entry.title: A Judge-Aware Ranking Framework for Evaluating Large Language Models without Ground Truth

author.name: Mingyuan Xu, Xinzi Tan, Jiawei Wu, Doudou Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes a judge-aware ranking framework for LLM-as-judge evaluation that jointly estimates model quality and judge reliability from pairwise comparisons. Addresses the critical issue that judge LLMs differ substantially in reliability.

entry.title: ASTRA: Automated Synthesis of agentic Trajectories and Reinforcement Arenas

author.name: Xiaoyu Tian, Haotian Wang, Shuaiting Chen, Hao Zhou, Kaichi Yu, Yudian Zhang, Jade Ouyang, Junxi Yin, Jiong Chen, Baoyan Guo, Lei Zhang, Junjie Tao, Yuansheng Song, Ming Cui, Chengwei Liu

entry.summary: Introduces ASTRA, an automated end-to-end framework for training tool-augmented agents via scalable data synthesis from tool-call graph topology and verifiable reinforcement learning.

entry.title: Causal World Modeling for Robot Control

author.name: Lin Li, Qihang Zhang, Yiming Luo, Shuai Yang, Ruilin Wang, Fei Han, Mingrui Yu, Zelin Gao, Nan Xue, Xing Zhu, Yujun Shen, Yinghao Xu

entry.summary: Introduces LingBot-VA for robot learning through video world modeling, featuring shared vision-action latent space, closed-loop rollout, and latent-aware action streaming for causal understanding.

entry.title: Abstracting Robot Manipulation Skills via Mixture-of-Experts Diffusion Policies

author.name: Ce Hao, Xuanran Zhai, Yaohua Liu, Harold Soh

entry.summary: Introduces SMP (Skill Mixture-of-Experts Policy), a diffusion-based policy using orthogonal skill basis and sticky routing for efficient multi-task robot manipulation, validated on real dual-arm platform.

entry.title: Are We in a Continual Learning Overhang?

author.name: SamuelKnoche

entry.summary: Argues continual learning may be closer than assumed based on recent research, suggesting if weight-based learning scales, AGI timelines could be shorter than expected.

entry.title: BEAP-Agent: Backtrackable Execution and Adaptive Planning for GUI Agents

author.name: Ziyu Lu, Tengjin Weng, Yiying Yang, Yuhang Zhao, Xinxin Huang, Wenhao Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes BEAP-Agent modeling GUI task execution as DFS process with multi-level state backtracking, enabling recovery from incorrect exploration paths that cause existing agents to fail.

entry.title: E-mem: Multi-agent based Episodic Context Reconstruction for LLM Agent Memory

author.name: Kaixiang Wang, Yidan Lin, Jiong Lou, Zhaojiacheng Zhou, Bunyod Suvonov, Jie Li

entry.summary: Proposes E-mem shifting from memory preprocessing to episodic context reconstruction, using hierarchical architecture where assistant agents maintain uncompressed memory accessed by main agent.

entry.title: L2R: Low-Rank and Lipschitz-Controlled Routing for Mixture-of-Experts

author.name: Minghao Yang, Ren Togo, Guang Li, Takahiro Ogawa, Miki Haseyama

entry.summary: Proposes L2R, a unified MoE routing framework using low-rank latent routing space and Lipschitz-controlled scoring to address representation mismatch and stability issues in modern MoE systems with linear routers.

entry.title: Unifying Speech Editing Detection and Content Localization via Prior-Enhanced Audio LLMs

author.name: Jun Xue, Yi Chai, Yanzhen Ren, Jinshen He, Zhiqiang Tang, Zhuolin Yi, Yihuan Huang, Yuankun Xie, Yujie Chen

entry.summary: Constructs AiEdit, large-scale bilingual dataset for speech editing detection using LLM-driven semantic tampering and neural editing methods. Proposes unified framework for detecting AI-edited speech including seamless neural edits.

entry.title: MADE: Benchmark Environments for Closed-Loop Materials Discovery

author.name: Shreshth A Malik, Tiarnan Doherty, Panagiotis Tigas, Muhammed Razzak, Stephen J. Roberts, Aron Walsh, Yarin Gal

entry.summary: MADE introduces benchmark framework for end-to-end autonomous materials discovery with closed-loop campaigns under constrained oracle budgets.

entry.title: Can Local Learning Match Self-Supervised Backpropagation?

author.name: Wu S. Zihan, Ariane Delrocq, Wulfram Gerstner, Guillaume Bellec

entry.summary: Develops theory linking local and global self-supervised learning rules for deep linear networks. Shows conditions for local-SSL to implement exactly global BP-SSL weight updates.

entry.title: Exploring Diverse Generation Paths via Inference-time Stiefel Activation Steering

author.name: Dongxuan Zhu, Ly Tran Ho Khanh, Andy Yat-Ming Cheung, Man-Chung Yue, Viet Anh Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes STARS, a training-free inference-time method that steers LLM activations using Stiefel manifold optimization to maximize diversity across concurrent generation runs, addressing mode collapse.

entry.title: Parametric Knowledge is Not All You Need: Toward Honest Large Language Models via Retrieval of Pretraining Data

author.name: Christopher Adrian Kusuma, Muhammad Reza Qorib, Hwee Tou Ng

entry.summary: Proposes robust evaluation benchmark for LLM honesty that accounts for knowledge from pretraining data. Argues current evaluations lack robustness by ignoring what LLMs actually learned.

entry.title: VTC-R1: Vision-Text Compression for Efficient Long-Context Reasoning

author.name: Yibo Wang, Yongcheng Jing, Shunyu Liu, Hao Guan, Rong-cheng Tu, Chengyu Wang, Jun Huang, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Proposes VTC-R1 rendering reasoning traces as images for compression, creating 'optical memory' iteratively fed to VLMs. Novel approach to efficient long-context reasoning.

entry.title: mjlab: A Lightweight Framework for GPU-Accelerated Robot Learning

author.name: Kevin Zakka, Qiayuan Liao, Brent Yi, Louis Le Lay, Koushil Sreenath, Pieter Abbeel

entry.summary: Presents mjlab, a lightweight open-source framework combining GPU-accelerated MuJoCo simulation with composable environments, installable with single command. From Pieter Abbeel's group.

entry.title: MAD: Modality-Adaptive Decoding for Mitigating Cross-Modal Hallucinations in Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Sangyun Chung, Se Yeon Kim, Youngchae Chee, Yong Man Ro

entry.summary: Proposes Modality-Adaptive Decoding (MAD), a training-free method that adaptively weights modality-specific decoding branches based on task requirements to reduce cross-modal hallucinations.

entry.title: DataCross: A Unified Benchmark and Agent Framework for Cross-Modal Heterogeneous Data Analysis

author.name: Ruyi Qi, Zhou Liu, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces DataCross benchmark and agent framework for unified analysis across structured SQL/CSV data and unstructured visual documents, with 200 tasks across finance and healthcare.

entry.title: ScholarGym: Benchmarking Deep Research Workflows on Academic Literature Retrieval

author.name: Hao Shen, Hang Yang, Zhouhong Gu

entry.summary: Presents ScholarGym, simulation environment for reproducible evaluation of deep research workflows, decoupling components to enable deterministic testing despite API non-determinism.

entry.title: More Code, Less Reuse: Investigating Code Quality and Reviewer Sentiment towards AI-generated Pull Requests

author.name: Haoming Huang, Pongchai Jaisri, Shota Shimizu, Lingfeng Chen, Sota Nakashima, Gema Rodr\'iguez-P\'erez

entry.summary: Studies code quality and reviewer sentiment toward LLM-generated pull requests using objective metrics and sentiment analysis. Finds AI-generated PRs show different characteristics in code reuse and maintainability beyond just pass rates.

entry.title: Training slow silicon neurons to control extremely fast robots with spiking reinforcement learning

author.name: Irene Ambrosini, Ingo Blakowski, Dmitrii Zendrikov, Cristiano Capone, Luna Gava, Giacomo Indiveri, Chiara De Luca, Chiara Bartolozzi

entry.summary: Demonstrates spiking neural networks on neuromorphic processor learning air hockey through reinforcement learning in remarkably few trials. Uses e-prop learning rule for fast, efficient real-time training.

entry.title: Toward Culturally Aligned LLMs through Ontology-Guided Multi-Agent Reasoning

author.name: Wonduk Seo, Wonseok Choi, Junseo Koh, Juhyeon Lee, Hyunjin An, Minhyeong Yu, Jian Park, Qingshan Zhou, Seunghyun Lee, Yi Bu

entry.summary: Proposes OG-MAR, ontology-guided multi-agent reasoning framework for culturally aligned LLMs. Uses World Values Survey data and cultural ontology construction to guide demographically-appropriate responses.

entry.title: DynaWeb: Model-Based Reinforcement Learning of Web Agents

author.name: Hang Ding, Peidong Liu, Junqiao Wang, Ziwei Ji, Meng Cao, Rongzhao Zhang, Lynn Ai, Eric Yang, Tianyu Shi, Lei Yu

entry.summary: DynaWeb trains web agents through model-based RL using a learned world model of web environments, enabling simulated interaction without live internet risks.

entry.title: Not All Code Is Equal: A Data-Centric Study of Code Complexity and LLM Reasoning

author.name: Lukas Twist, Shu Yang, Hanqi Yan, Jingzhi Gong, Di Wang, Helen Yannakoudakis, Jie M. Zhang

entry.summary: Data-centric study examining how code structural complexity affects LLM reasoning during fine-tuning. Studies solution-driven and problem-driven complexity across multiple settings.

entry.title: From Logits to Latents: Contrastive Representation Shaping for LLM Unlearning

author.name: Haoran Tang, Rajiv Khanna

entry.summary: Introduces CLReg, a contrastive representation regularizer for LLM unlearning that pushes forget features away from retain features in latent space, providing theoretical insights on reducing entanglement.

entry.title: Generation Enhances Understanding in Unified Multimodal Models via Multi-Representation Generation

author.name: Zihan Su, Hongyang Wei, Kangrui Cen, Yong Wang, Guanhua Chen, Chun Yuan, Xiangxiang Chu

entry.summary: Proposes UniMRG, showing that training unified multimodal models to generate multiple intrinsic representations of inputs improves understanding capabilities, demonstrating generation-helps-understanding direction.

entry.title: Distribution-Aware Reward Estimation for Test-Time Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Bodong Du, Xuanqi Huang, Xiaomeng Li

entry.summary: Proposes DARE for test-time RL, replacing majority voting with distribution-aware reward estimation that accounts for non-majority correct candidates.

entry.title: AIR-VLA: Vision-Language-Action Systems for Aerial Manipulation

author.name: Jianli Sun, Bin Tian, Qiyao Zhang, Chengxiang Li, Zihan Song, Zhiyong Cui, Yisheng Lv, Yonglin Tian

entry.summary: Introduces AIR-VLA, the first VLA benchmark for aerial manipulation systems, including simulation environment and 3000-demonstration multimodal dataset covering grasping and placement tasks.

entry.title: CUA-Skill: Develop Skills for Computer Using Agent

author.name: Tianyi Chen, Yinheng Li, Michael Solodko, Sen Wang, Nan Jiang, Tingyuan Cui, Junheng Hao, Jongwoo Ko, Sara Abdali, Suzhen Zheng, Leon Xu, Hao Fan, Pashmina Cameron, Justin Wagle, Kazuhito Koishida

entry.summary: Presents CUA-Skill, a large-scale library of parameterized skills for computer-using agents spanning common Windows applications, with composition graphs enabling reliable agent development.

entry.title: Hebbian Learning with Global Direction

author.name: Wenjia Hua, Kejie Zhao, Luziwei Leng, Ran Cheng, Yuxin Ma, Qinghai Guo

entry.summary: Proposes Global-guided Hebbian Learning (GHL) framework combining local Hebbian plasticity with global task objectives, inspired by neuromodulator-plasticity interaction in biology.

entry.title: CORE: Collaborative Reasoning via Cross Teaching

author.name: Kshitij Mishra, Mirat Aubakirov, Martin Takac, Nils Lukas, Salem Lahlou

entry.summary: Proposes CORE (Collaborative Reasoning) framework where models learn from peer success via cross-teaching protocol, with DPP-inspired diversity term and rescue bonus.

entry.title: Memorization Control in Diffusion Models from Denoising-centric Perspective

author.name: Thuy Phuong Vu, Mai Viet Hoang Do, Minhhuy Le, Dinh-Cuong Hoang, Phan Xuan Tan

entry.summary: Studies memorization in diffusion models from denoising-centric perspective, showing uniform timestep sampling leads to unequal learning contributions and biases toward memorization. Proposes timestep sampling strategy for explicit memorization control.

entry.title: More Bang for the Buck: Improving the Inference of Large Language Models at a Fixed Budget using Reset and Discard (ReD)

author.name: Sagi Meir, Tommer D. Keidar, Noam Levi, Shlomi Reuveni, Barak Hirshberg

entry.summary: Proposes Reset-and-Discard (ReD) query method for LLMs that increases coverage@cost metric at fixed inference budget. Shows power-law pass@k leads to diminishing returns and ReD can quantitatively predict savings.

entry.title: When Life Gives You AI, Will You Turn It Into A Market for Lemons? Understanding How Information Asymmetries About AI System Capabilities Affect Market Outcomes and Adoption

author.name: Alexander Erlei, Federico Cau, Radoslav Georgiev, Sagar Kumar, Kilian Bizer, Ujwal Gadiraju

entry.summary: Provides first experimental evidence on information asymmetries in AI consumer markets. Studies how disclosure requirements and quality distribution affect user adoption, comparing to rational Bayesian benchmarks.

entry.title: CoFrGeNet: Continued Fraction Architectures for Language Generation

author.name: Amit Dhurandhar, Vijil Chenthamarakshan, Dennis Wei, Tejaswini Pedapati, Karthikeyan Natesan Ramamurthy, Rahul Nair

entry.summary: Proposes CoFrGeNet, a novel architecture family based on continued fractions that can replace Multi-head Attention and FFN in Transformers with fewer parameters. Includes custom gradient formulations for efficient training.

entry.title: Value-Based Pre-Training with Downstream Feedback

author.name: Shuqi Ke, Giulia Fanti

entry.summary: V-Pretraining steers self-supervised pretraining using downstream goal information, with a task designer that reshapes pretraining to maximize value of each gradient step.

entry.title: Predict-Project-Renoise: Sampling Diffusion Models under Hard Constraints

author.name: Omer Rochman-Sharabi, Gilles Louppe

entry.summary: PPR algorithm for constrained diffusion sampling alternates between denoising, projecting onto feasible set, and renoising to enforce hard constraints like physical laws.

entry.title: Best Arm Identification with LLM Judges and Limited Human

author.name: Ruicheng Ao, Hongyu Chen, Siyang Gao, Hanwei Li, David Simchi-Levi

entry.summary: Studies best-arm identification where cheap LLM judges have arm-dependent bias and expensive human labels are selectively available. Proves correction needed for mis-selection and develops combined estimator.

entry.title: Understanding Model Merging: A Unified Generalization Framework for Heterogeneous Experts

author.name: Qinglun Li, Anke Tang, Miao Zhang, Mengzhu Wang, Quanjun Yin, Li Shen

entry.summary: Proposes L2-Stability theory framework for model merging under heterogeneous hyperparameters. Provides guidance for fine-tuning merge-friendly experts when hyperparameters are unknown.

entry.title: Visual-Guided Key-Token Regularization for Multimodal Large Language Model Unlearning

author.name: Chengyi Cai, Zesheng Ye, Peike Li, Bo Han, Jianzhong Qi, Feng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes ViKeR for multimodal LLM unlearning, using visual guidance to identify key answer tokens and regulate their distributions during unlearning, preserving relevant knowledge while removing private information.

entry.title: Multilevel and Sequential Monte Carlo for Training-Free Diffusion Guidance

author.name: Aidan Gleich, Scott C. Schmidler

entry.summary: Proposes SMC framework for training-free diffusion guidance using unbiased posterior score estimation with MLMC for variance reduction. Achieves state-of-the-art on CIFAR-10 class-conditional generation.

entry.title: Why Attention Patterns Exist: A Unifying Temporal Perspective Analysis

author.name: Qingyue Yang, Jie Wang, Xing Li, Yinqi Bai, Xialiang Tong, Huiling Zhen, Jianye Hao, Mingxuan Yuan, Bin Li

entry.summary: Proposes TAPPA, a unifying framework explaining diverse attention patterns (retrieval heads, sink heads, diagonal traces) from temporal perspective. Guides inference acceleration.

entry.title: UEval: A Benchmark for Unified Multimodal Generation

author.name: Bo Li, Yida Yin, Wenhao Chai, Xingyu Fu, Zhuang Liu

entry.summary: Introduces UEval benchmark with 1,000 expert-curated questions requiring both image and text outputs, using rubric-based scoring for unified multimodal generation models.

entry.title: LAMP: Learning Universal Adversarial Perturbations for Multi-Image Tasks via Pre-trained Models

author.name: Alvi Md Ishmam, Najibul Haque Sarker, Zaber Ibn Abdul Hakim, Chris Thomas

entry.summary: Introduces LAMP, the first black-box method for learning universal adversarial perturbations targeting multi-image multimodal LLMs. Uses attention-based constraints and cross-image contagious constraints to prevent effective information aggregation.

entry.title: Do VLMs Perceive or Recall? Probing Visual Perception vs. Memory with Classic Visual Illusions

author.name: Xiaoxiao Sun, Mingyang Li, Kun yuan, Min Woo Sun, Mark Endo, Shengguang Wu, Changlin Li, Yuhui Zhang, Zeyu Wang, Serena Yeung-Levy

entry.summary: Introduces VI-Probe framework to distinguish visual perception from language-driven recall in VLMs using controlled visual illusion perturbations, revealing models often rely on memorized patterns rather than visual processing.

entry.title: Deep QP Safety Filter: Model-free Learning for Reachability-based Safety Filter

author.name: Byeongjun Kim, H. Jin Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Deep QP Safety Filter, a model-free learned safety layer combining Hamilton-Jacobi reachability with neural networks to ensure safety for black-box dynamical systems.

entry.title: What You Feel Is Not What They See: On Predicting Self-Reported Emotion from Third-Party Observer Labels

author.name: Yara El-Tawil, Aneesha Sampath, Emily Mower Provost

entry.summary: First cross-corpus evaluation showing third-party-trained emotion models poorly predict self-reported emotions (CCC~0 for activation, ~0.3 for valence), but achieve high performance when content is personally significant.

entry.title: MAR: Efficient Large Language Models via Module-aware Architecture Refinement

author.name: Junhong Cai, Guiqin Wang, Kejie Zhao, Jianxiong Tang, Xiang Wang, Luziwei Leng, Ran Cheng, Yuxin Ma, Qinghai Guo

entry.summary: Proposes MAR framework integrating State Space Models for linear-time attention and Spiking Neural Networks for sparse FFN, with novel ATMN neuron and SBDS distillation strategy.

entry.title: ShardMemo: Masked MoE Routing for Sharded Agentic LLM Memory

author.name: Yang Zhao, Chengxiao Dai, Yue Xiu, Mengying Kou, Yuliang Zheng, Dusit Niyato

entry.summary: Presents ShardMemo, tiered memory service for agentic LLMs with masked MoE routing over eligible shards, enforcing scope constraints before routing or ANN search.

entry.title: NEXUS: Bit-Exact ANN-to-SNN Equivalence via Neuromorphic Gate Circuits with Surrogate-Free Training

author.name: Zhengzheng Tang

entry.summary: Proposes NEXUS framework achieving bit-exact ANN-to-SNN conversion (not approximate) through neuromorphic gate circuits implementing IEEE-754 floating-point arithmetic. Uses spatial bit encoding and surrogate-free STE training.

entry.title: Mean-Field Control on Sparse Graphs: From Local Limits to GNNs via Neighborhood Distributions

author.name: Tobias Schmidt, Kai Cui

entry.summary: Develops theoretical framework for mean-field control on large sparse graphs, proving horizon-dependent locality where optimal policy depends on (T-t)-hop neighborhood. Connects to scalable RL via GNNs.

entry.title: ILRR: Inference-Time Steering Method for Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Eden Avrahami, Eliya Nachmani

entry.summary: Introduces ILRR, learning-free inference-time steering for masked diffusion language models using single reference sequence. Guides generation by aligning internal activations throughout denoising.

entry.title: Token-Guard: Towards Token-Level Hallucination Control via Self-Checking Decoding

author.name: Yifan Zhu, Huiqiang Rong, Haoran Luo

entry.summary: Token-Guard performs internal verification at each reasoning step to detect and prune hallucinated tokens before they propagate, using latent space risk scoring.

entry.title: Learning to Advect: A Neural Semi-Lagrangian Architecture for Weather Forecasting

author.name: Carlos A. Pereira, St\'ephane Gaudreault, Valentin Dallerit, Christopher Subich, Shoyon Panday, Siqi Wei, Sasa Zhang, Siddharth Rout, Eldad Haber, Raymond J. Spiteri, David Millard, Emilia Diaconescu

entry.summary: PARADIS decomposes weather prediction into physics-inspired advection, diffusion, and reaction blocks with neural semi-Lagrangian advection enabling explicit long-range transport.

entry.title: Differentiable Knapsack and Top-k Operators via Dynamic Programming

author.name: Germain Vivier-Ardisson, Micha\"el E. Sander, Axel Parmentier, Mathieu Blondel

entry.summary: Proposes differentiable relaxations of knapsack and top-k operators via dynamic programming smoothing. Proves Shannon entropy yields unique permutation-equivariant operators.

entry.title: Rate-Distortion Optimization for Transformer Inference

author.name: Anderson de Andrade, Alon Harell, Ivan V. Baji\'c

entry.summary: Introduces rate-distortion framework for compressing transformer intermediate representations during distributed inference, achieving substantial bitrate savings with improved accuracy in some cases.

entry.title: Learning Hamiltonian Flow Maps: Mean Flow Consistency for Large-Timestep Molecular Dynamics

author.name: Winfried Ripken, Michael Plainer, Gregor Lied, Thorben Frank, Oliver T. Unke, Stefan Chmiela, Frank No\'e, Klaus Robert M\"uller

entry.summary: Proposes framework for learning Hamiltonian flow maps that predict mean phase-space evolution, enabling stable large-timestep molecular dynamics updates beyond classical integrator limits through mean flow consistency.

entry.title: FRISM: Fine-Grained Reasoning Injection via Subspace-Level Model Merging for Vision-Language Models

author.name: Chenyu Huang, Peng Ye, Xudong Tan, Jinhan Mu, Shenghe Zheng, Li Shen, Tao Chen

entry.summary: Proposes FRISM for injecting reasoning into VLMs through subspace-level model merging, decomposing LRM task vectors via SVD and adaptively tuning coefficients to preserve visual while adding reasoning capabilities.

entry.title: Can David Beat Goliath? On Multi-Hop Reasoning with Resource-Constrained Agents

author.name: Hojae Han, Heeyun Jung, Jongyoon Kim, Seung-won Hwang

entry.summary: Introduces DAVID-GRPO for multi-hop reasoning with small LMs under resource constraints. Shows small models can achieve strong performance through stabilized early learning and dense supervision.

entry.title: Nimbus: A Unified Embodied Synthetic Data Generation Framework

author.name: Zeyu He, Yuchang Zhang, Yuanzhen Zhou, Miao Tao, Hengjie Li, Yang Tian, Jia Zeng, Tai Wang, Wenzhe Cai, Yilun Chen, Ning Gao, Jiangmiao Pang

entry.summary: Introduces Nimbus, a unified framework for synthetic data generation integrating navigation and manipulation pipelines with modular architecture separating trajectory planning, rendering, and storage.

entry.title: TeachBench: A Syllabus-Grounded Framework for Evaluating Teaching Ability in Large Language Models

author.name: Zheng Li, Siyao Song, Jingyuan Ma, Rui Li, Ying Zeng, Minghao Li, Zhifang Sui

entry.summary: Proposes TeachBench evaluating LLM teaching capability via student performance improvement after multi-turn instruction, using syllabus-grounded framework on Gaokao data.

entry.title: Hypersolid: Emergent Vision Representations via Short-Range Repulsion

author.name: Esteban Rodr\'iguez-Betancourt, Edgar Casasola-Murillo

entry.summary: Introduces Hypersolid, a self-supervised learning method that prevents representation collapse through short-range hard-ball repulsion rather than global regularization. Reframes representation learning as discrete packing problem focused on maintaining injectivity.

entry.title: HeRo-Q: A General Framework for Stable Low Bit Quantization via Hessian Conditioning

author.name: Jinhao Zhang Yunquan Zhang, Zicheng yan, Boyang Zhang, Jun Sun, Daning Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes HeRo-Q quantization algorithm applying learnable rotation-compression matrix to reshape LLM loss landscape before quantization. Reduces Hessian's largest eigenvalue for improved robustness to quantization noise.

entry.title: When does predictive inverse dynamics outperform behavior cloning?

author.name: Lukas Sch\"afer, Pallavi Choudhury, Abdelhak Lemkhenter, Chris Lovett, Somjit Nath, Luis Fran\c{c}a, Matheus Ribeiro Furtado de Mendon\c{c}a, Alex Lamb, Riashat Islam, Siddhartha Sen, John Langford, Katja Hofmann, Sergio Valcarcel Macua

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of when Predictive Inverse Dynamics Models outperform behavior cloning. Shows PIDM introduces bias-variance tradeoff where future state prediction bias can be offset by variance reduction.

entry.title: Test-Time Compute Games

author.name: Ander Artola Velasco, Dimitrios Rontogiannis, Stratis Tsirtsis, Manuel Gomez-Rodriguez

entry.summary: Analyzes the economics of test-time compute in LLM-as-a-service markets, showing providers have incentive to over-compute, and proposes a reverse second-price auction mechanism to address this inefficiency.

entry.title: MetricAnything: Scaling Metric Depth Pretraining with Noisy Heterogeneous Sources

author.name: Baorui Ma, Jiahui Yang, Donglin Di, Xuancheng Zhang, Jianxun Cui, Hao Li, Yan Xie, Wei Chen

entry.summary: MetricAnything learns metric depth from noisy diverse 3D sources using Sparse Metric Prompts that decouple spatial reasoning from sensor biases, scaling to 20M image-depth pairs.

entry.title: TwinWeaver: An LLM-Based Foundation Model Framework for Pan-Cancer Digital Twins

author.name: Nikita Makarov, Maria Bordukova, Lena Voith von Voithenberg, Estrella Pivel-Villanueva, Sabrina Mielke, Jonathan Wickes, Hanchen Wang, Mingyu Derek Ma, Keunwoo Choi, Kyunghyun Cho, Stephen Ra, Raul Rodriguez-Esteban, Fabian Schmich, Michael Menden

entry.summary: TwinWeaver serializes longitudinal patient histories into text for LLM-based digital twins, demonstrating improved forecasting across 93K cancer patients and 20 cancer types.

entry.title: Fast and Geometrically Grounded Lorentz Neural Networks

author.name: Robert van der Klis, Ricardo Ch\'avez Torres, Max van Spengler, Yuhui Ding, Thomas Hofmann, Pascal Mettes

entry.summary: Proves that current Lorentz linear layer formulations cause hyperbolic norms to scale logarithmically with gradient steps, nullifying hyperbolic advantages. Proposes grounded distance-to-hyperplane formulation.

entry.title: LoRA and Privacy: When Random Projections Help (and When They Don't)

author.name: Yaxi Hu, Johanna D\"ungler, Bernhard Sch\"olkopf, Amartya Sanyal

entry.summary: Introduces Wishart projection mechanism for differential privacy, proving vector-valued queries achieve DP without additive noise. Shows matrix-valued queries require noise and derive amplification bounds.

entry.title: Per-parameter Task Arithmetic for Unlearning in Large Language Models

author.name: Chengyi Cai, Zesheng Ye, Jiangchao Yao, Jianzhong Qi, Bo Han, Xiaolu Zhang, Feng Liu, Jun Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes PerTA (per-parameter task arithmetic) for LLM unlearning that rescales task vectors parameter-by-parameter based on importance for forgetting vs retention, reducing over-forgetting compared to uniform subtraction.

entry.title: Large Language Models Naively Recover Ethnicity from Individual Records

author.name: Noah Dasanaike

entry.summary: Demonstrates LLMs can infer ethnicity from names with 84.7% accuracy, outperforming Bayesian methods. Tests multiple models including GPT-4o, Gemini, and DeepSeek.

entry.title: A Federated and Parameter-Efficient Framework for Large Language Model Training in Medicine

author.name: Anran Li, Yuanyuan Chen, Wenjun Long, Yu Yin, Yan Hu, Hyunjae Kim, Weipeng Zhou, Yujia Zhou, Hongyi Peng, Yang Ren, Xuguang Ai, Zhenyue Qin, Ming Hu, Xiaoxiao Li, Han Yu, Yih-Chung Tham, Lucila Ohno-Machado, Hua Xu, Qingyu Chen

entry.summary: Proposes federated learning framework for medical LLMs with parameter-efficient adaptation, addressing privacy concerns and generalizability across institutions.

entry.title: CoFreeVLA: Collision-Free Dual-Arm Manipulation via Vision-Language-Action Model and Risk Estimation

author.name: Xuanran Zhai, Binkai Ou, Yemin Wang, Hui Yi Leong, Qiaojun Yu, Ce Hao, Yaohua Liu

entry.summary: Proposes CoFreeVLA augmenting VLA models with self-collision risk estimation for safe dual-arm manipulation, using risk-guided adjustments and calibrated collision prediction.

entry.title: QUARK: Robust Retrieval under Non-Faithful Queries via Query-Anchored Aggregation

author.name: Rita Qiuran Lyu, Michelle Manqiao Wang, Lei Shi

entry.summary: Proposes QUARK, a training-free framework for robust retrieval under noisy or incomplete queries by modeling query uncertainty through multiple recovery hypotheses with query-anchored aggregation.

entry.title: TIDE: Tuning-Integrated Dynamic Evolution for LLM-Based Automated Heuristic Design

author.name: Chentong Chen, Mengyuan Zhong, Ye Fan, Jialong Shi, Jianyong Sun

entry.summary: Proposes TIDE framework for automated heuristic design that decouples structural reasoning from parameter optimization using nested architecture with tree similarity for diversity.

entry.title: SONIC-O1: A Real-World Benchmark for Evaluating Multimodal Large Language Models on Audio-Video Understanding

author.name: Ahmed Y. Radwan, Christos Emmanouilidis, Hina Tabassum, Deval Pandya, Shaina Raza

entry.summary: Introduces SONIC-O1, human-verified benchmark for audio-video understanding with 4,958 annotations across 13 conversational domains, evaluating summarization, MCQ, and temporal localization with reasoning.

entry.title: JADE: Bridging the Strategic-Operational Gap in Dynamic Agentic RAG

author.name: Yiqun Chen, Erhan Zhang, Tianyi Hu, Shijie Wang, Zixuan Yang, Meizhi Zhong, Xiaochi Wei, Yan Gao, Yi Wu, Yao Hu, Jiaxin Mao

entry.summary: Proposes JADE framework for agentic RAG that jointly optimizes planners and executors, addressing the 'strategic-operational mismatch' where sophisticated planning fails due to unadapted local modules.

entry.title: Self-Compression of Chain-of-Thought via Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yiqun Chen, Jinyuan Feng, Wei Yang, Meizhi Zhong, Zhengliang Shi, Rui Li, Xiaochi Wei, Yan Gao, Yi Wu, Yao Hu, Zhiqiang Pu, Jiaxin Mao

entry.summary: Proposes SCMA, a multi-agent RL framework for compressing chain-of-thought reasoning by selectively penalizing redundant chunks while preserving essential logic through segmentation and evaluation agents.

entry.title: Retrieval-Infused Reasoning Sandbox: A Benchmark for Decoupling Retrieval and Reasoning Capabilities

author.name: Shuangshuang Ying, Zheyu Wang, Yunjian Peng, Jin Chen, Yuhao Wu, Hongbin Lin, Dingyu He, Siyi Liu, Gengchen Yu, YinZhu Piao, Yuchen Wu, Xin Gui, Zhongyuan Peng, Xin Li, Xeron Du, Libo Qin, YiXin Cao, Ge Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces DeR2, a benchmark sandbox that decouples retrieval from reasoning evaluation through controlled evidence access regimes, addressing contamination and confounding in existing RAG benchmarks.

entry.title: World of Workflows: a Benchmark for Bringing World Models to Enterprise Systems

author.name: Lakshya Gupta (Skyfall AI), Litao Li (Skyfall AI), Yizhe Liu (Skyfall AI), Sriram Ganapathi Subramanian (Skyfall AI), Kaheer Suleman (Skyfall AI), Zichen Zhang (Skyfall AI), Haoye Lu (Skyfall AI), Sumit Pasupalak (Skyfall AI)

entry.summary: Introduces World of Workflows (WoW), a ServiceNow-based benchmark with 4000+ business rules and hidden workflows, testing LLM agents on enterprise system understanding with cascading side effects.

entry.title: Exploring Reasoning Reward Model for Agents

author.name: Kaixuan Fan, Kaituo Feng, Manyuan Zhang, Tianshuo Peng, Zhixun Li, Yilei Jiang, Shuang Chen, Peng Pei, Xunliang Cai, Xiangyu Yue

entry.summary: Introduces Agent-RRM, a multi-faceted reward model producing explicit reasoning traces, focused critiques, and overall scores for agentic trajectories, with systematic integration strategies.

entry.title: Noisy but Valid: Robust Statistical Evaluation of LLMs with Imperfect Judges

author.name: Chen Feng, Minghe Shen, Ananth Balashankar, Carsten Gerner-Beuerle, Miguel R. D. Rodrigues

entry.summary: Introduces 'Noisy but Valid' hypothesis testing framework for LLM evaluation that maintains statistical validity despite imperfect LLM judges, using TPR/FPR calibration from small human-labeled sets.

entry.title: PILD: Physics-Informed Learning via Diffusion

author.name: Tianyi Zeng, Tianyi Wang, Jiaru Zhang, Zimo Zeng, Feiyang Zhang, Yiming Xu, Sikai Chen, Yajie Zou, Yangyang Wang, Junfeng Jiao, Christian Claudel, Xinbo Chen

entry.summary: Proposes PILD framework unifying diffusion modeling with physics constraints through virtual residual observation from Laplace distribution. Incorporates conditional embedding module to inject physical information throughout denoising.

entry.title: Beyond Parameter Finetuning: Test-Time Representation Refinement for Node Classification

author.name: Jiaxin Zhang, Yiqi Wang, Siwei Wang, Xihong Yang, Yu Shi, Xinwang Liu, En Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes TTReFT, test-time representation finetuning framework for graph neural networks that adapts latent representations rather than parameters, avoiding catastrophic forgetting through low-rank interventions.

entry.title: DreamActor-M2: Universal Character Image Animation via Spatiotemporal In-Context Learning

author.name: Mingshuang Luo, Shuang Liang, Zhengkun Rong, Yuxuan Luo, Tianshu Hu, Ruibing Hou, Hong Chang, Yong Li, Yuan Zhang, Mingyuan Gao

entry.summary: Proposes DreamActor-M2, universal character animation framework treating motion conditioning as in-context learning. Addresses identity-motion trade-off and generalizes beyond humanoid characters without explicit pose priors.

entry.title: Effective LoRA Adapter Routing using Task Representations
