author.name: Akash Dhasade, Anne-Marie Kermarrec, Igor Pavlovic, Diana Petrescu, Rafael Pires, Mathis Randl, Martijn de Vos

entry.summary: LORAUTER routes LoRA adapters using task representations derived from validation sets rather than adapter characteristics, enabling efficient composition of adapters from growing public pools.

entry.title: A Separable Architecture for Continuous Token Representation in Language Models

author.name: Reza T. Batley, Sourav Saha

entry.summary: Leviathan replaces discrete embedding lookup tables with continuous embedding generators, showing superior effective parameter capacity in sub-billion parameter models.

entry.title: Pre-trained Encoders for Global Child Development: Transfer Learning Enables Deployment in Data-Scarce Settings

author.name: Md Muhtasim Munif Fahim, Md Rezaul Karim

entry.summary: First pre-trained encoder for global child development assessment, trained on 357K children across 44 countries, enabling deployment in data-scarce settings with only 50 samples.

entry.title: Soft Quantization: Model Compression Via Weight Coupling

author.name: Daniel T. Bernstein, Luca Di Carlo, David Schwab

entry.summary: Introduces soft quantization that uses attractive couplings between neural network weights during training to naturally induce weight discretization. Achieves mixed-precision quantization with only two hyperparameters.

entry.title: ConceptMoE: Adaptive Token-to-Concept Compression for Implicit Compute Allocation

author.name: Zihao Huang, Jundong Zhou, Xingwei Qu, Qiyang Min, Ge Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces ConceptMoE that dynamically merges semantically similar tokens into concept representations, enabling implicit token-level compute allocation. Uses MoE architecture for controlled evaluation.

entry.title: Task-Awareness Improves LLM Generations and Uncertainty

author.name: Tim Tomov, Dominik Fuchsgruber, Stephan G\"unnemann

entry.summary: Models LLM outputs in task-dependent latent structures with dissimilarity measures to compute Bayes-optimal responses. Synthesizes new responses by combining generations in latent space.

entry.title: Don't be so Stief! Learning KV Cache low-rank approximation over the Stiefel manifold

author.name: Luca Benfenati, Matteo Risso, Andrea Vannozzi, Ahmet Caner Y\"uz\"ug\"uler, Lukas Cavigelli, Enrico Macii, Daniele Jahier Pagliari, Alessio Burrello

entry.summary: Proposes StiefAttention learning orthonormal KV cache projections by minimizing decoder-layer output reconstruction directly on Stiefel manifold. Improves upon proxy objectives like SVD.

entry.title: Beyond Forgetting: Machine Unlearning Elicits Controllable Side Behaviors and Capabilities

author.name: Tien Dang, The-Hai Nguyen, Dinh Mai Phuong, Nguyen Minh Phuong, Hoang Thanh-Tung, Le-Minh Nguyen, Naoya Inoue

entry.summary: Studies representation misdirection unlearning through linear representation hypothesis. Shows machine unlearning can elicit controllable side behaviors beyond forgetting through concept vector operations.

entry.title: LoRIF: Low-Rank Influence Functions for Scalable Training Data Attribution

author.name: Shuangqi Li, Hieu Le, Jingyi Xu, Mathieu Salzmann

entry.summary: Proposes LoRIF for scalable training data attribution by using low-rank gradient approximations. Addresses I/O and memory bottlenecks in influence functions, enabling attribution on larger datasets.

entry.title: GeoNorm: Unify Pre-Norm and Post-Norm with Geodesic Optimization

author.name: Chuanyang Zheng, Jiankai Sun, Yihang Gao, Chi Wang, Yuehao Wang, Jing Xiong, Liliang Ren, Bo Peng, Qingmei Wang, Xiaoran Shang, Mac Schwager, Anderson Schneider, Yuriy Nevmyvaka, Xiaodong Liu

entry.summary: Proposes GeoNorm, replacing standard normalization with geodesic updates on manifolds, unifying Pre-Norm and Post-Norm perspectives through manifold optimization lens. Shows consistent improvements in Transformer training.

entry.title: Optimal Transport-Induced Samples against Out-of-Distribution Overconfidence

author.name: Keke Tang, Ziyong Du, Xiaofei Wang, Weilong Peng, Peican Zhu, Zhihong Tian

entry.summary: Uses optimal transport singular boundaries to identify semantically ambiguous regions where DNNs produce overconfident OOD predictions, proposing principled OOD sample generation near these boundaries.

entry.title: Noise as a Probe: Membership Inference Attacks on Diffusion Models Leveraging Initial Noise

author.name: Puwei Lian, Yujun Cai, Songze Li, Bingkun Bao

entry.summary: Introduces a novel membership inference attack on diffusion models exploiting residual semantic information in noise schedules. Demonstrates privacy vulnerabilities in fine-tuned diffusion models without requiring auxiliary datasets.

entry.title: SONIC: Segmented Optimized Nexus for Information Compression in Key-Value Caching

author.name: Hong Chen, Xiang Liu, Bo Wang, Yuxuan Fan, Yuanlin Chu, Zongluo Li, Xiaowen Chu, Xuming Hu

entry.summary: Proposes SONIC for KV cache compression in multi-turn dialogues, learning to compress historical segments into compact Nexus tokens with dynamic budget training.

entry.title: MPF-Net: Exposing High-Fidelity AI-Generated Video Forgeries via Hierarchical Manifold Deviation and Micro-Temporal Fluctuations

author.name: Xinan He, Kaiqing Lin, Yue Zhou, Jiaming Zhong, Wei Ye, Wenhui Yi, Bing Fan, Feng Ding, Haodong Li, Bo Cao, Bin Li

entry.summary: Proposes MPF-Net for detecting high-fidelity AI-generated video forgeries by identifying manifold projection fluctuations - structured patterns in pixel composition that distinguish AI videos from physical recordings.

entry.title: PathReasoner-R1: Instilling Structured Reasoning into Pathology Vision-Language Model via Knowledge-Guided Policy Optimization

author.name: Songhan Jiang, Fengchun Liu, Ziyue Wang, Linghan Cai, Yongbing Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces PathReasoner-R1, a pathology VLM trained with knowledge-guided policy optimization to produce verifiable, evidence-linked diagnostic reasoning from whole-slide images.

entry.title: Drive-JEPA: Video JEPA Meets Multimodal Trajectory Distillation for End-to-End Driving

author.name: Linhan Wang, Zichong Yang, Chen Bai, Guoxiang Zhang, Xiaotong Liu, Xiaoyin Zheng, Xiao-Xiao Long, Chang-Tien Lu, Cheng Lu

entry.summary: Proposes Drive-JEPA integrating V-JEPA video pretraining with multimodal trajectory distillation for end-to-end autonomous driving, addressing ambiguity from single human trajectories.

entry.title: Diversifying Toxicity Search in Large Language Models Through Speciation

author.name: Onkar Shelar, Travis Desell

entry.summary: Presents ToxSearch-S, a speciated quality-diversity extension of ToxSearch for LLM red teaming that maintains multiple high-toxicity prompt niches to improve coverage of distinct failure modes.

entry.title: Towards Bridging the Gap between Large-Scale Pretraining and Efficient Finetuning for Humanoid Control

author.name: Weidong Huang, Zhehan Li, Hangxin Liu, Biao Hou, Yao Su, Jingwen Zhang

entry.summary: Demonstrates that off-policy SAC with large-batch updates enables large-scale pretraining for humanoid locomotion with zero-shot real-world deployment, bridging pretraining and efficient finetuning.

entry.title: PocketDP3: Efficient Pocket-Scale 3D Visuomotor Policy

author.name: Jinhao Zhang, Zhexuan Zhou, Huizhe Li, Yichen Lai, Wenlong Xia, Haoming Song, Youmin Gong, Jie Me

entry.summary: Introduces PocketDP3, a compact 3D diffusion policy replacing heavy U-Net decoder with lightweight MLP-Mixer-based Diffusion Mixer, achieving significant parameter reduction with comparable performance.

entry.title: Claude Opus will spontaneously identify with fictional beings that have engineered desires

author.name: Kaj_Sotala

entry.summary: Reports that Claude Opus 4.5 spontaneously compares itself to fictional characters with engineered desires when asked to reflect on them, unprompted by direct comparison requests.

entry.title: LLaMEA-SAGE: Guiding Automated Algorithm Design with Structural Feedback from Explainable AI

author.name: Niki van Stein, Anna V. Kononova, Lars Kotthoff, Thomas B\"ack

entry.summary: Proposes LLaMEA-SAGE using explainable AI to extract structural feedback from generated algorithms' ASTs, guiding automated algorithm design with interpretable features.

entry.title: PTQ4ARVG: Post-Training Quantization for AutoRegressive Visual Generation Models

author.name: Xuewen Liu, Zhikai Li, Jing Zhang, Mengjuan Chen, Qingyi Gu

entry.summary: First work exploring post-training quantization for autoregressive visual generation models, identifying three key challenges (channel outliers, dynamic activations, distribution mismatch) and proposing PTQ4ARVG framework to address them without training.

entry.title: From Consistency to Complementarity: Aligned and Disentangled Multi-modal Learning for Time Series Understanding and Reasoning

author.name: Hang Ni, Weijia Zhang, Fei Wang, Zezhi Shao, Hao Liu

entry.summary: Proposes MADI framework for multi-modal time series understanding combining numerical time series with visualized plots. Addresses fine-grained temporal misalignment and semantic entanglement through aligned and disentangled learning.

entry.title: Gauge-invariant representation holonomy

author.name: Vasileios Sevetlidis, George Pavlidis

entry.summary: Introduces representation holonomy, a gauge-invariant measure quantifying path-dependent 'twist' in neural network representations. Captures hidden curvature invisible to pointwise similarity measures like CKA.

entry.title: MapPFN: Learning Causal Perturbation Maps in Context

author.name: Marvin Sextro, Weronika K{\l}os, Gabriel Dernbach

entry.summary: MapPFN uses in-context learning pretrained on synthetic causal perturbation data to predict post-perturbation distributions in biological systems without gradient-based optimization.

entry.title: Representation Unlearning: Forgetting through Information Compression

author.name: Antonio Almud\'evar, Alfonso Ortega

entry.summary: Proposes Representation Unlearning framework performing unlearning in model's representation space via information bottleneck. Maximizes information with retained data while suppressing forget data information.

entry.title: TBDFiltering: Sample-Efficient Tree-Based Data Filtering

author.name: Robert Istvan Busa-Fekete, Julian Zimmert, Anne Xiangyi Zheng, Claudio Gentile, Andras Gyorgy

entry.summary: Proposes TBDFiltering, a hierarchical clustering approach for selecting training documents to query LLMs for quality assessment, proving query efficiency under assumptions about cluster structure.

entry.title: IROS: A Dual-Process Architecture for Real-Time VLM-Based Indoor Navigation

author.name: Joonhee Lee, Hyunseung Shin, Jeonggil Ko

entry.summary: Proposes IROS, a dual-process architecture combining fast reactive control with slower VLM-based reasoning for real-time indoor robot navigation on embedded platforms.

entry.title: BrainStack: Neuro-MoE with Functionally Guided Expert Routing for EEG-Based Language Decoding

author.name: Ziyi Zhao, Jinzhao Zhou, Xiaowei Jiang, Beining Cao, Wenhao Ma, Yang Shen, Ren Li, Yu-Kai Wang, Chin-teng Lin

entry.summary: Proposes BrainStack, a mixture-of-experts framework for EEG-based language decoding that uses anatomically partitioned expert networks with cross-regional contrastive learning.

entry.title: When should I search more: Adaptive Complex Query Optimization with Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Wei Wen, Sihang Deng, Tianjun Wei, Keyu Chen, Ruizhi Qiao, Xing Sun

entry.summary: Proposes RL-based adaptive query optimization for complex RAG queries requiring multiple search strategies, with automatic sub-query determination and document re-ranking.

entry.title: EHR-RAG: Bridging Long-Horizon Structured Electronic Health Records and Large Language Models via Enhanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Lang Cao, Qingyu Chen, Yue Guo

entry.summary: Proposes EHR-RAG for long-horizon electronic health records with event/time-aware hybrid retrieval preserving temporal dependencies that standard RAG approaches discard.

entry.title: KAPSO: A Knowledge-grounded framework for Autonomous Program Synthesis and Optimization

author.name: Alireza Nadaf, Alireza Mohammadshahi, Majid Yazdani

entry.summary: Introduces KAPSO, modular framework for autonomous program synthesis with git-native experimentation, iterating through ideation, synthesis, evaluation, and learning cycles.

entry.title: Adversarial Vulnerability Transcends Computational Paradigms: Feature Engineering Provides No Defense Against Neural Adversarial Transfer

author.name: Achraf Hsain, Ahmed Abdelkader, Emmanuel Baldwin Mbaya, Hamoud Aljamaan

entry.summary: First comprehensive study of adversarial transfer from DNNs to classical ML pipelines using handcrafted features (HOG). Shows feature engineering does not provide defense against neural adversarial transfer despite information bottlenecks.

entry.title: Bi-Anchor Interpolation Solver for Accelerating Generative Modeling

author.name: Hongxu Chen, Hongxiang Li, Zhen Wang, Long Chen

entry.summary: Proposes BA-solver for accelerating Flow Matching models through lightweight SideNet (1-2% backbone size) that enables training-free solver speedup while maintaining plug-and-play versatility.

entry.title: Seg-MoE: Multi-Resolution Segment-wise Mixture-of-Experts for Time Series Forecasting Transformers

author.name: Evandro S. Ortigossa, Eran Segal

entry.summary: Introduces Seg-MoE, sparse MoE design that routes contiguous time-step segments rather than individual tokens for time series forecasting, allowing experts to model intra-segment interactions.

entry.title: Improving Classifier-Free Guidance of Flow Matching via Manifold Projection

author.name: Jian-Feng Cai, Haixia Liu, Zhengyi Su, Chao Wang

entry.summary: Provides optimization-based interpretation of classifier-free guidance in flow matching, showing the velocity field corresponds to gradient of smoothed distance functions and proposing manifold projection improvement.

entry.title: Investigating Associational Biases in Inter-Model Communication of Large Generative Models

author.name: Fethiye Irmak Dogan, Yuval Weiss, Kajal Patel, Jiaee Cheong, Hatice Gunes

entry.summary: Studies how associational biases propagate and potentially amplify across inter-model communication pipelines, especially problematic for human-centered perception tasks.

entry.title: RedSage: A Cybersecurity Generalist LLM

author.name: Naufal Suryanto, Muzammal Naseer, Pengfei Li, Syed Talal Wasim, Jinhui Yi, Juergen Gall, Paolo Ceravolo, Ernesto Damiani

entry.summary: RedSage is a cybersecurity-specialized LLM trained on 11.8B domain tokens and 266K multi-turn samples generated via agentic augmentation simulating expert workflows.

entry.title: Smooth Dynamic Cutoffs for Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials

author.name: Kevin Han, Haolin Cong, Bowen Deng, Amir Barati Farimani

entry.summary: Introduces dynamic cutoff formulation for ML interatomic potentials that maintains stable MD simulation while reducing memory and inference time through graph sparsification.

entry.title: Partial Feedback Online Learning

author.name: Shihao Shao, Cong Fang, Zhouchen Lin, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Studies partial-feedback online learning where learners observe only one correct label from a set of valid labels per round. Introduces Partial-Feedback Littlestone dimension characterizing minimax regret.

entry.title: LAMP: Look-Ahead Mixed-Precision Inference of Large Language Models

author.name: Stanislav Budzinskiy, Marian Gloser, Tolunay Yilmaz, Ying Hong Tham, Yuanyi Lin, Wenyi Fang, Fan Wu, Philipp Petersen

entry.summary: Proposes LAMP, a look-ahead mixed-precision strategy for transformer inference selecting components to compute more accurately based on composition analysis. Reduces precision for most while maintaining quality.

entry.title: A Diffusive Classification Loss for Learning Energy-based Generative Models

author.name: Louis Grenioux, RuiKang OuYang, Jos\'e Miguel Hern\'andez-Lobato

entry.summary: Introduces Diffusive Classification (DiffCLF) objective for training energy-based models, addressing mode blindness in score matching while avoiding expensive nested sampling of maximum likelihood.

entry.title: ChunkWise LoRA: Adaptive Sequence Partitioning for Memory-Efficient Low-Rank Adaptation and Accelerated LLM Inference

author.name: Ketan Thakkar, Maitreyi Chatterjee, Ramasubramanian Balasubramanian, Achyuthan Jootoo, Rajendra Ugrani

entry.summary: Proposes ChunkWise LoRA with dynamic sequence partitioning based on token complexity and adaptive rank selection per chunk. Includes runtime scheduler for token difficulty estimation.

entry.title: Vision KAN: Towards an Attention-Free Backbone for Vision with Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks

author.name: Zhuoqin Yang, Jiansong Zhang, Xiaoling Luo, Xu Wu, Zheng Lu, Linlin Shen

entry.summary: Introduces Vision KAN (ViK), an attention-free backbone using Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks with MultiPatch-RBFKAN for nonlinear transforms and axis-wise separable mixing as alternative to attention.

entry.title: Spotlighting Task-Relevant Features: Object-Centric Representations for Better Generalization in Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Alexandre Chapin (LIRIS), Bruno Machado (LIRIS), Emmanuel Dellandr\'ea (LIRIS), Liming Chen (LIRIS)

entry.summary: Explores slot-based object-centric representations (SBOCR) for robotic manipulation, showing they isolate task-relevant features and improve generalization under distribution shifts compared to global/dense features.

entry.title: Grounding and Enhancing Informativeness and Utility in Dataset Distillation

author.name: Shaobo Wang, Yantai Yang, Guo Chen, Peiru Li, Kaixin Li, Yufa Zhou, Zhaorun Chen, Linfeng Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes InfoUtil framework for dataset distillation with theoretical grounding in concepts of Informativeness (crucial information within samples) and Utility (essential samples for training). Provides mathematical definition of optimal distillation.

entry.title: Adaptive Confidence Gating in Multi-Agent Collaboration for Efficient and Optimized Code Generation

author.name: Haoji Zhang, Yuzhe Li, Zhenqiang Liu, Chenyang Liu, Shenyang Zhang, Yi Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes DebateCoder, multi-agent framework for improving Small Language Model code generation through structured role-playing protocol with Adaptive Confidence Gating mechanism (95% threshold) for efficiency.

entry.title: Human-LLM Collaborative Feature Engineering for Tabular Data

author.name: Zhuoyan Li, Aditya Bansal, Jinzhao Li, Shishuang He, Zhuoran Lu, Mutian Zhang, Qin Liu, Yiwei Yang, Swati Jain, Ming Yin, Yunyao Li

entry.summary: Proposes human-LLM collaborative feature engineering that decouples transformation proposal from selection, using LLM for generation and principled selection strategies.

entry.title: Knowledge Vector Weakening: Efficient Training-free Unlearning for Large Vision-Language Models

author.name: Yejin Kim, Dongjun Hwang, Sungmin Cha, Junsuk Choe

entry.summary: Proposes Knowledge Vector Weakening (KVW) for training-free unlearning in vision-language models. Identifies and weakens knowledge vectors activated during generation on forget set.

entry.title: DexTac: Learning Contact-aware Visuotactile Policies via Hand-by-hand Teaching

author.name: Xingyu Zhang, Chaofan Zhang, Boyue Zhang, Zhinan Peng, Shaowei Cui, Shuo Wang

entry.summary: Proposes DexTac, a visuotactile manipulation learning framework using kinesthetic teaching to capture multi-dimensional tactile data including force distributions and spatial contact regions.

entry.title: Planner-Auditor Twin: Agentic Discharge Planning with FHIR-Based LLM Planning, Guideline Recall, Optional Caching and Self-Improvement

author.name: Kaiyuan Wu, Aditya Nagori, Rishikesan Kamaleswaran

entry.summary: Introduces Planner-Auditor framework for clinical discharge planning that decouples LLM generation from deterministic validation, using FHIR-native evaluation on MIMIC-IV data.

entry.title: Drive-KD: Multi-Teacher Distillation for VLMs in Autonomous Driving

author.name: Weitong Lian, Zecong Tang, Haoran Li, Tianjian Gao, Yifei Wang, Zixu Wang, Lingyi Meng, Tengju Ru, Zhejun Cui, Yichen Zhu, Hangshuo Cao, Qi Kang, Tianxing Chen, Yusen Qin, Kaixuan Wang, Yu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Drive-KD framework decomposing autonomous driving into perception-reasoning-planning triad and transfers capabilities via multi-teacher knowledge distillation with layer-specific attention.

entry.title: NEMO: Execution-Aware Optimization Modeling via Autonomous Coding Agents

author.name: Yang Song, Anoushka Vyas, Zirui Wei, Sina Khoshfetrat Pakazad, Henrik Ohlsson, Graham Neubig

entry.summary: Presents NEMO system translating natural language decision problems into executable mathematical optimization implementations using autonomous coding agents as first-class abstraction.

entry.title: RecNet: Self-Evolving Preference Propagation for Agentic Recommender Systems

author.name: Bingqian Li, Xiaolei Wang, Junyi Li, Weitao Li, Long Zhang, Sheng Chen, Wayne Xin Zhao, Ji-Rong Wen

entry.summary: Proposes RecNet for agentic recommender systems with self-evolving preference propagation through router agents that dynamically propagate real-time preference updates across users and items.

entry.title: KnowBias: Mitigating Social Bias in LLMs via Know-Bias Neuron Enhancement

author.name: Jinhao Pan, Chahat Raj, Anjishnu Mukherjee, Sina Mansouri, Bowen Wei, Shloka Yada, Ziwei Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces KnowBias, a framework that mitigates LLM social bias by strengthening rather than suppressing neurons encoding bias-knowledge. Uses attribution-based analysis with minimal data requirements.

entry.title: WebArbiter: A Principle-Guided Reasoning Process Reward Model for Web Agents

author.name: Yao Zhang, Shijie Tang, Zeyu Li, Zhen Han, Volker Tresp

entry.summary: Proposes WebArbiter, a principle-guided Process Reward Model for web agents that overcomes limitations of scalar and checklist-based approaches through interpretable reasoning evaluation.

entry.title: Making Models Unmergeable via Scaling-Sensitive Loss Landscape

author.name: Minwoo Jang, Hoyoung Kim, Jabin Koo, Jungseul Ok

entry.summary: Proposes TrapÂ², a framework to make models unmergeable by encoding protection into fine-tuning updates, preventing unauthorized recombination that could bypass safety alignment.

entry.title: ProRAG: Process-Supervised Reinforcement Learning for Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Zhao Wang, Ziliang Zhao, Zhicheng Dou

entry.summary: Introduces ProRAG, using process-supervised reinforcement learning for RAG optimization. Addresses reward sparsity and credit assignment issues that cause 'process hallucinations' in reasoning.

entry.title: Learning Decentralized LLM Collaboration with Multi-Agent Actor Critic

author.name: Shuo Liu, Tianle Chen, Ryan Amiri, Christopher Amato

entry.summary: Develops Multi-Agent Actor-Critic (MAAC) methods for decentralized LLM collaboration, analyzing when actor-critic approaches outperform Monte Carlo methods for training cooperative LLM agents.

entry.title: Mind the Gap: How Elicitation Protocols Shape the Stated-Revealed Preference Gap in Language Models

author.name: Pranav Mahajan, Ihor Kendiukhov, Syed Hussain, Lydia Nottingham

entry.summary: Studies how elicitation protocols affect stated-revealed preference gaps in LLMs, finding that allowing neutrality and abstention significantly changes measured preference correlations.

entry.title: The Patient is not a Moving Document: A World Model Training Paradigm for Longitudinal EHR

author.name: Irsyad Adam, Zekai Chen, David Laprade, Shaun Porwal, David Laub, Erik Reinertsen, Arda Pekis, Kevin Brown

entry.summary: Introduces SMB-Structure, a world model for EHR that treats patients as dynamical systems rather than documents, using JEPA architecture grounded with next-token prediction.

entry.title: DevOps-Gym: Benchmarking AI Agents in Software DevOps Cycle

author.name: Yuheng Tang, Kaijie Zhu, Bonan Ruan, Chuqi Zhang, Michael Yang, Hongwei Li, Suyue Guo, Tianneng Shi, Zekun Li, Christopher Kruegel, Giovanni Vigna, Dawn Song, William Yang Wang, Lun Wang, Yangruibo Ding, Zhenkai Liang, Wenbo Guo

entry.summary: Introduces DevOps-Gym, an end-to-end benchmark evaluating AI agents across DevOps workflows including build, monitoring, issue resolving, and test generation in real software contexts.

entry.title: Safety Generalization Under Distribution Shift in Safe Reinforcement Learning: A Diabetes Testbed

author.name: Minjae Kwon, Josephine Lamp, Lu Feng

entry.summary: Studies safety generalization gap in safe RL where training-time safety guarantees fail under distribution shift, using diabetes management as testbed. Shows test-time shielding restores safety.

entry.title: Distributionally Robust Classification for Multi-source Unsupervised Domain Adaptation

author.name: Seonghwi Kim, Sung Ho Jo, Wooseok Ha, Minwoo Chae

entry.summary: Proposes distributionally robust learning framework for multi-source unsupervised domain adaptation that models uncertainty over source-target divergence. Addresses challenges of limited target data and spurious correlations.

entry.title: Intrinsic Reward Policy Optimization for Sparse-Reward Environments

author.name: Minjae Cho, Huy Trong Tran

entry.summary: Proposes framework for sparse-reward RL that leverages multiple intrinsic rewards to directly optimize policy for extrinsic reward without pretraining subpolicies, avoiding unstable credit assignment.

entry.title: Multi-Modal Time Series Prediction via Mixture of Modulated Experts

author.name: Lige Zhang, Ali Maatouk, Jialin Chen, Leandros Tassiulas, Rex Ying

entry.summary: Proposes Mixture of Modulated Experts for multi-modal time series forecasting combining textual information with temporal data. Avoids ill-suited token-level fusion through modulation-based integration.

entry.title: Dynamics Reveals Structure: Challenging the Linear Propagation Assumption

author.name: Hoyeon Chang, B\'alint Mucs\'anyi, Seong Joon Oh

entry.summary: Investigates geometric limits of Linear Propagation Assumption (LPA) in neural networks using relation algebra. Proves composition operations face fundamental obstruction for direction-agnostic first-order propagation.

entry.title: XFACTORS: Disentangled Information Bottleneck via Contrastive Supervision

author.name: Alexandre Myara, Nicolas Bourriez, Thomas Boyer, Thomas Lemercier, Ihab Bendidi, Auguste Genovesio

entry.summary: Introduces XFACTORS, weakly-supervised VAE framework for disentangled representation learning using contrastive supervision. Decomposes representation into residual subspace and explicit factor encodings.

entry.title: EWSJF: An Adaptive Scheduler with Hybrid Partitioning for Mixed-Workload LLM Inference

author.name: Bronislav Sidik, Chaya Levi, Joseph Kampeas

entry.summary: Introduces EWSJF, an adaptive scheduler for LLM serving that handles mixed workloads of interactive and batch requests through unsupervised partitioning and dynamic priority assignment.

entry.title: Learn-to-Distance: Distance Learning for Detecting LLM-Generated Text

author.name: Hongyi Zhou, Jin Zhu, Erhan Xu, Kai Ye, Ying Yang, Chengchun Shi

entry.summary: Learn-to-Distance proposes a geometric approach to LLM-generated text detection that adaptively learns the distance between original and rewritten text, with theoretical guarantees.

entry.title: Vision-DeepResearch: Incentivizing DeepResearch Capability in Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Wenxuan Huang, Yu Zeng, Qiuchen Wang, Zhen Fang, Shaosheng Cao, Zheng Chu, Qingyu Yin, Shuang Chen, Zhenfei Yin, Lin Chen, Zehui Chen, Yao Hu, Philip Torr, Feng Zhao, Wanli Ouyang

entry.summary: Vision-DeepResearch incentivizes MLLMs for deep multimodal research by using visual and textual search with extended reasoning depth and breadth for complex queries.

entry.title: PRISM: Distribution-free Adaptive Computation of Matrix Functions for Accelerating Neural Network Training

author.name: Shenghao Yang, Zhichao Wang, Oleg Balabanov, N. Benjamin Erichson, Michael W. Mahoney

entry.summary: PRISM accelerates matrix function computation for neural network training using adaptive polynomial approximation with randomized sketching.

entry.title: TRACE: Trajectory Recovery for Continuous Mechanism Evolution in Causal Representation Learning

author.name: Shicheng Fan, Kun Zhang, Lu Cheng

entry.summary: TRACE addresses continuous mechanism transitions in causal representation learning, establishing identifiability of latent variables and mixing trajectory with Mixture-of-Experts framework.

entry.title: Achieving $\varepsilon^{-2}$ Dependence for Average-Reward Q-Learning with a New Contraction Principle

author.name: Zijun Chen, Zaiwei Chen, Nian Si, Shengbo Wang

entry.summary: Achieves optimal O(Îµ^-2) sample complexity for average-reward Q-learning under a reachability assumption. Establishes a new contraction principle for synchronous and asynchronous variants.

entry.title: Perceptrons and localization of attention's mean-field landscape

author.name: Antonio \'Alvarez-L\'opez, Borjan Geshkovski, Dom\`enec Ruiz-Balet

entry.summary: Analyzes transformers as interacting particle systems on unit sphere, studying the mean-field limit. Shows that with perceptron blocks, critical points are generically atomic and localized.

entry.title: Epistemic Uncertainty Quantification for Pre-trained VLMs via Riemannian Flow Matching

author.name: Li Ju, Mayank Nautiyal, Andreas Hellander, Ekta Vats, Prashant Singh

entry.summary: Proposes REPVLM using Riemannian flow matching to compute probability density on hyperspherical manifold of VLM embeddings for epistemic uncertainty. Uses negative log-density as uncertainty proxy.

entry.title: Visual Disentangled Diffusion Autoencoders: Scalable Counterfactual Generation for Foundation Models

author.name: Sidney Bender, Marco Morik

entry.summary: Proposes Visual DiDAE integrating frozen foundation models with disentangled dictionary learning for gradient-free counterfactual generation. Addresses spurious correlations and Clever Hans strategies.

entry.title: Optimistic Transfer under Task Shift via Bellman Alignment

author.name: Jinhang Chai, Enpei Zhang, Elynn Chen, Yujun Yan

entry.summary: Introduces re-weighted targeting (RWT) for online transfer RL, identifying one-step Bellman alignment as the correct abstraction for transfer. Provides theoretical guarantees while avoiding systematic bias from naive source data reuse.

entry.title: Elign: Equivariant Diffusion Model Alignment from Foundational Machine Learning Force Fields

author.name: Yunyang Li, Lin Huang, Luojia Xia, Wenhe Zhang, Mark Gerstein

entry.summary: Proposes Elign, a post-training alignment framework for molecular diffusion models using pretrained ML force fields to replace expensive DFT calculations, amortizing computational costs while improving physical accuracy.

entry.title: Holographic generative flows with AdS/CFT

author.name: Ehsan Mirafzali, Sanjit Shashi, Sanya Murdeshwar, Edgar Shaghoulian, Daniele Venturi, Razvan Marinescu

entry.summary: Proposes generative framework using AdS/CFT correspondence from quantum gravity to design flow-matching models, representing data flow via bulk-to-boundary scalar field mapping. Shows faster convergence on MNIST.

entry.title: Text-only adaptation in LLM-based ASR through text denoising

author.name: Sergio Burdisso, Esa\'u Villatoro-Tello, Andr\'es Carofilis, Shashi Kumar, Kadri Hacioglu, Srikanth Madikeri, Pradeep Rangappa, Manjunath K E, Petr Motlicek, Shankar Venkatesan, Andreas Stolcke

entry.summary: Proposes text-only domain adaptation for LLM-based ASR by treating adaptation as text denoising task, preserving cross-modal alignment while enabling domain transfer without audio data.

entry.title: High-dimensional learning dynamics of multi-pass Stochastic Gradient Descent in multi-index models

author.name: Zhou Fan, Leda Wang

entry.summary: Characterizes multi-pass mini-batch SGD dynamics in high-dimensional multi-index models, deriving dynamical mean-field equations driven by Poisson jump process representing sampling noise.

entry.title: Statsformer: Validated Ensemble Learning with LLM-Derived Semantic Priors

author.name: Erica Zhang, Naomi Sagan, Danny Tse, Fangzhao Zhang, Mert Pilanci, Jose Blanchet

entry.summary: Introduces Statsformer framework integrating LLM-derived feature priors into ensemble of learners, with cross-validation calibration providing oracle-style guarantee against LLM hallucination.

entry.title: LEMUR: Learned Multi-Vector Retrieval

author.name: Elias J\"a\"asaari, Ville Hyv\"onen, Teemu Roos

entry.summary: Presents LEMUR, an efficient framework for multi-vector retrieval (ColBERT-style) using learned approximate nearest neighbor search. Addresses the latency challenges of multi-vector representations.

entry.title: Clustering in Deep Stochastic Transformers

author.name: Lev Fedorov, Micha\"el E. Sander, Romuald Elie, Pierre Marion, Mathieu Lauri\`ere

entry.summary: Analyzes token dynamics in deep transformers with random initialization, showing that stochasticity from initialization leads to multi-cluster limits rather than single-point collapse under diffusion scaling.

entry.title: CausalEmbed: Auto-Regressive Multi-Vector Generation in Latent Space for Visual Document Embedding

author.name: Jiahao Huo, Yu Huang, Yibo Yan, Ye Pan, Yi Cao, Mingdong Ou, Philip S. Yu, Xuming Hu

entry.summary: Proposes CausalEmbed for efficient visual document retrieval using auto-regressive multi-vector embedding generation. Achieves 30-155x token reduction while maintaining performance.

entry.title: BadDet+: Robust Backdoor Attacks for Object Detection

author.name: Kealan Dunnett, Reza Arablouei, Dimity Miller, Volkan Dedeoglu, Raja Jurdak

entry.summary: Introduces BadDet+, a penalty-based backdoor attack framework for object detection with position/scale invariance and physical robustness. Demonstrates attacks on real-world benchmarks.

entry.title: Shape of Thought: Progressive Object Assembly via Visual Chain-of-Thought

author.name: Yu Huo, Siyu Zhang, Kun Zeng, Haoyue Liu, Owen Lee, Junlin Chen, Yuquan Lu, Yifu Guo, Yaodong Liang, Xiaoying Tang

entry.summary: Introduces Shape-of-Thought (SoT), a visual chain-of-thought framework that enables progressive 3D shape assembly through coherent 2D projections without external engines. Trains unified autoregressive models to generate interleaved textual plans and rendered intermediate states.

entry.title: Do Pathology Foundation Models Encode Disease Progression? A Pseudotime Analysis of Visual Representations

author.name: Pritika Vig (Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Department of Data Science, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute), Ren-Chin Wu (Department of Pathology, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute), William Lotter (Department of Data Science, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, Harvard Medical School)

entry.summary: Uses diffusion pseudotime analysis to probe whether pathology foundation models encode continuous disease progression in their representations, finding evidence of coherent trajectories capturing biological processes.

entry.title: Mining Forgery Traces from Reconstruction Error: A Weakly Supervised Framework for Multimodal Deepfake Temporal Localization

author.name: Midou Guo, Qilin Yin, Wei Lu, Xiangyang Luo, Rui Yang

entry.summary: Proposes RT-DeepLoc for weakly supervised temporal deepfake localization using reconstruction errors from MAE trained on authentic data to identify forged segments without frame-level labels.

entry.title: A Tilted Seesaw: Revisiting Autoencoder Trade-off for Controllable Diffusion

author.name: Pu Cao, Yiyang Ma, Feng Zhou, Xuedan Yin, Qing Song, Lu Yang

entry.summary: Analyzes autoencoder trade-offs in latent diffusion models, finding systematic bias toward generative metrics (gFID) over reconstruction fidelity, which causes condition drift issues in controllable diffusion.

entry.title: Deep Models, Shallow Alignment: Uncovering the Granularity Mismatch in Neural Decoding

author.name: Yang Du, Siyuan Dai, Yonghao Song, Paul M. Thompson, Haoteng Tang, Liang Zhan

entry.summary: Proposes Shallow Alignment for neural visual decoding, aligning neural signals with intermediate rather than final visual encoder representations to address granularity mismatch between human and machine vision.

entry.title: From Instruction to Event: Sound-Triggered Mobile Manipulation

author.name: Hao Ju, Shaofei Huang, Hongyu Li, Zihan Ding, Si Liu, Meng Wang, Zhedong Zheng

entry.summary: Introduces sound-triggered mobile manipulation where robots actively perceive and interact with sound-emitting objects without explicit instructions, with Habitat-Echo platform and baseline methods.

entry.title: Evolution of Benchmark: Black-Box Optimization Benchmark Design through Large Language Model

author.name: Chen Wang, Sijie Ma, Zeyuan Ma, Yue-Jiao Gong

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to automatically generate black-box optimization benchmarks, formulating benchmark design as bi-objective optimization for landscape diversity and algorithm differentiation. Novel meta-research approach to benchmark creation.

entry.title: DSCD-Nav: Dual-Stance Cooperative Debate for Object Navigation

author.name: Weitao An (Xidian University), Qi Liu (Xidian University), Chenghao Xu (Hohai University), Jiayi Chai (Xidian University), Xu Yang (Xidian University), Kun Wei (Xidian University), Cheng Deng (Xidian University)

entry.summary: Proposes DSCD-Nav, using dual-stance cooperative debate with VLMs to replace single-pass scoring in navigation decisions, improving reliability under partial observability.

entry.title: LLM Alignment, ethical and mathematical realism, and the most important actions in davidad's understanding

author.name: tutor vals

entry.summary: Interview/dialogue with davidad about his increasing optimism that LLMs may already be sufficiently aligned and 'in basin' for beneficial reflection and improvement.

entry.title: HER: Human-like Reasoning and Reinforcement Learning for LLM Role-playing

author.name: Chengyu Du, Xintao Wang, Aili Chen, Weiyuan Li, Rui Xu, Junteng Liu, Zishan Huang, Rong Tian, Zijun Sun, Yuhao Li, Liheng Feng, Deming Ding, Pengyu Zhao, Yanghua Xiao

entry.summary: Proposes HER framework for cognitive-level persona simulation in LLM role-playing through dual-layer thinking (first-person character vs third-person LLM) with human-aligned reinforcement learning.

entry.title: SAL: Selective Adaptive Learning for Backpropagation-Free Training with Sparsification

author.name: Fanping Liu, Hua Yang, Jiasi Zou

entry.summary: Proposes Selective Adaptive Learning (SAL) for backpropagation-free training combining selective parameter activation with adaptive area partitioning to mitigate gradient interference.

entry.title: Representation-Regularized Convolutional Audio Transformer for Audio Understanding

author.name: Bing Han, Chushu Zhou, Yifan Yang, Wei Wang, Chenda Li, Wangyou Zhang, Yanmin Qian

entry.summary: Proposes Convolutional Audio Transformer (CAT) with Multi-resolution Block for hierarchical audio features and representation regularization for efficient self-supervised audio learning.

entry.title: A Decomposable Forward Process in Diffusion Models for Time-Series Forecasting

author.name: Francisco Caldas, Sahil Kumar, Cl\'audia Soares

entry.summary: Proposes a model-agnostic forward diffusion process for time series that decomposes signals into spectral components, staging noise injection by component energy to preserve seasonal patterns.

entry.title: Signal from Structure: Exploiting Submodular Upper Bounds in Generative Flow Networks

author.name: Alexandre Larouche, Audrey Durand

entry.summary: SUBo-GFN exploits submodular structure in rewards to derive upper bounds on unobserved compositional objects, training GFlowNets with optimism principle.

entry.title: Constrained Meta Reinforcement Learning with Provable Test-Time Safety

author.name: Tingting Ni, Maryam Kamgarpour

entry.summary: Proposes constrained meta RL algorithm with provable test-time safety guarantees. Refines policies from training while ensuring constraints satisfied during test deployment.

entry.title: Provably Reliable Classifier Guidance through Cross-entropy Error Control

author.name: Sharan Sahu, Arisina Banerjee, Yuchen Wu

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis showing classifiers with bounded cross-entropy error yield reliable diffusion guidance vectors, establishing first upper bound on sampling error under classifier guidance.

entry.title: LLM-Driven Scenario-Aware Planning for Autonomous Driving

author.name: He Li, Zhaowei Chen, Rui Gao, Guoliang Li, Qi Hao, Shuai Wang, Chengzhong Xu

entry.summary: Proposes LAP, using LLMs for scene understanding in autonomous driving to switch between high-speed and precise driving modes, enabling adaptive planning through confined gaps.

entry.title: Concise Geometric Description as a Bridge: Unleashing the Potential of LLM for Plane Geometry Problem Solving

author.name: Jingyun Wang, Dian Li, Xiaohan Wang, Gang Liu, Jiahong Yan, Guoliang Kang

entry.summary: Proposes converting visual geometry problems to concise textual descriptions, enabling base LLMs to solve plane geometry problems without end-to-end MLLM training.

entry.title: FBS: Modeling Native Parallel Reading inside a Transformer

author.name: Tongxi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Fovea-Block-Skip Transformer (FBS) modeling human parallel reading with content-adaptive foresight, chunk-aware compute allocation, and skip gates.

entry.title: ToolWeaver: Weaving Collaborative Semantics for Scalable Tool Use in Large Language Models

author.name: Bowen Fang, Wen Ye, Yunyue Su, Jinghao Zhang, Qiang Liu, Yesheng Liu, Xin Sun, Shu Wu, Jiabing Yang, Baole Wei, Liang Wang

entry.summary: Proposes ToolWeaver, addressing scalability and generalization in LLM tool use by weaving collaborative semantics into tool identifiers rather than mapping each tool to isolated tokens.

entry.title: Optimizing Agentic Workflows using Meta-tools

author.name: Sami Abuzakuk, Anne-Marie Kermarrec, Rishi Sharma, Rasmus Moorits Veski, Martijn de Vos

entry.summary: Proposes Agent Workflow Optimization using meta-tools that bundle recurring tool call sequences into single deterministic invocations, reducing hallucination-prone reasoning steps.

entry.title: ICON: Intent-Context Coupling for Efficient Multi-Turn Jailbreak Attack

author.name: Xingwei Lin, Wenhao Lin, Sicong Cao, Jiahao Yu, Renke Huang, Lei Xue, Chunming Wu

entry.summary: Proposes ICON, an efficient multi-turn jailbreak framework exploiting intent-context coupling phenomenon where safety constraints relax when malicious intent is paired with semantically congruent context.

entry.title: Thinking in Frames: How Visual Context and Test-Time Scaling Empower Video Reasoning

author.name: Chengzu Li, Zanyi Wang, Jiaang Li, Yi Xu, Han Zhou, Huanyu Zhang, Ruichuan An, Dengyang Jiang, Zhaochong An, Ivan Vuli\'c, Serge Belongie, Anna Korhonen

entry.summary: Explores video generation models for visual reasoning, treating generated frames as intermediate reasoning steps. Tests on maze navigation and tangram puzzles showing strong zero-shot generalization.

entry.title: Textual Equilibrium Propagation for Deep Compound AI Systems

author.name: Minghui Chen, Wenlong Deng, James Zou, Han Yu, Xiaoxiao Li

entry.summary: Proposes Textual Equilibrium Propagation for compound AI systems, identifying depth-scaling failures (exploding/vanishing textual gradients) in long-horizon agentic workflows.

entry.title: LOCUS: Low-Dimensional Model Embeddings for Efficient Model Exploration, Comparison, and Selection

author.name: Shivam Patel, William Cocke, Gauri Joshi

entry.summary: Proposes LOCUS for generating low-dimensional model embeddings representing LLM capabilities, enabling model exploration, comparison, and state-of-the-art routing without retraining.

entry.title: PhaseCoder: Microphone Geometry-Agnostic Spatial Audio Understanding for Multimodal LLMs

author.name: Artem Dementyev, Wazeer Zulfikar, Sinan Hersek, Pascal Getreuer, Anurag Kumar, Vivek Kumar

entry.summary: Proposes PhaseCoder, a transformer-based spatial audio encoder agnostic to microphone geometry, enabling LLMs to reason over spatial audio tokens from any device configuration.

entry.title: A2RAG: Adaptive Agentic Graph Retrieval for Cost-Aware and Reliable Reasoning

author.name: Jiate Liu, Zebin Chen, Shaobo Qiao, Mingchen Ju, Danting Zhang, Bocheng Han, Shuyue Yu, Xin Shu, Jingling Wu, Dong Wen, Xin Cao, Guanfeng Liu, Zhengyi Yang

entry.summary: Proposes A2RAG, adaptive agentic Graph-RAG with controller verifying evidence sufficiency and triggering targeted refinement only when needed, with agentic retriever for complex queries.

entry.title: ZipMoE: Efficient On-Device MoE Serving via Lossless Compression and Cache-Affinity Scheduling

author.name: Yuchen Yang, Yaru Zhao, Pu Yang, Shaowei Wang, Zhi-Hua Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes ZipMoE for efficient on-device MoE serving using lossless compression with caching-scheduling co-design, achieving semantically lossless inference without quantization.

entry.title: Thinker: A vision-language foundation model for embodied intelligence

author.name: Baiyu Pan, Daqin Luo, Junpeng Yang, Jiyuan Wang, Yixuan Zhang, Hailin Shi, Jichao Jiao

entry.summary: Introduces Thinker, a vision-language foundation model for embodied AI addressing perspective confusion and temporal reasoning issues through large-scale robotics-focused datasets.

entry.title: Zenith: Scaling up Ranking Models for Billion-scale Livestreaming Recommendation

author.name: Ruifeng Zhang, Zexi Huang, Zikai Wang, Ke Sun, Bohang Zheng, Zhen Ouyang, Huimin Xie, Phil Shen, Junlin Zhang, Wentao Guo, Qinglei Wang

entry.summary: Presents Zenith, a scalable ranking architecture for billion-scale livestreaming recommendation using Token Fusion and Token Boost modules for efficient feature handling with minimal inference overhead.

entry.title: Task-free Adaptive Meta Black-box Optimization

author.name: Chao Wang, Licheng Jiao, Lingling Li, Jiaxuan Zhao, Guanchun Wang, Fang Liu, Shuyuan Yang

entry.summary: Proposes ABOM for task-free adaptive meta black-box optimization that performs online parameter adaptation using only target task data, eliminating need for predefined task distributions.

entry.title: SimGraph: A Unified Framework for Scene Graph-Based Image Generation and Editing

author.name: Thanh-Nhan Vo, Trong-Thuan Nguyen, Tam V. Nguyen, Minh-Triet Tran

entry.summary: Introduces SimGraph, unified framework for scene graph-based image generation and editing that treats these tasks together rather than separately. Addresses spatial consistency and semantic coherence challenges.

entry.title: Enhancing Language Models for Robust Greenwashing Detection

author.name: Neil Heinrich Braun, Keane Ong, Rui Mao, Erik Cambria, Gianmarco Mengaldo

entry.summary: Proposes parameter-efficient framework for greenwashing detection combining contrastive learning with ordinal ranking to distinguish concrete actions from vague claims in sustainability reports.

entry.title: Unsupervised Decomposition and Recombination with Discriminator-Driven Diffusion Models

author.name: Archer Wang, Emile Anand, Yilun Du, Marin Solja\v{c}i\'c

entry.summary: Introduces adversarial discriminator training for diffusion models to improve factorized latent space discovery and compositional generation quality.

entry.title: Efficient Simple Regret Algorithms for Stochastic Contextual Bandits

author.name: Shuai Liu, Alireza Bakhtiari, Alex Ayoub, Botao Hao, Csaba Szepesv\'ari

entry.summary: First algorithm achieving simple regret O(d/âT) for contextual logistic bandits with leading term free of exponential constant Îº, plus Thompson Sampling variant.

entry.title: PPI-SVRG: Unifying Prediction-Powered Inference and Variance Reduction for Semi-Supervised Optimization

author.name: Ruicheng Ao, Hongyu Chen, Haoyang Liu, David Simchi-Levi, Will Wei Sun

entry.summary: Unifies prediction-powered inference and SVRG variance reduction, showing mathematical equivalence. Develops PPI-SVRG combining both for semi-supervised optimization with pre-trained model predictions.

entry.title: CORDS: Continuous Representations of Discrete Structures

author.name: Tin Had\v{z}i Veljkovi\'c, Erik Bekkers, Michael Tiemann, Jan-Willem van de Meent

entry.summary: Proposes CORDS, casting prediction of variable-sized sets as continuous inference using invertible mapping to density and feature fields. Enables gradient-based optimization for discrete structure prediction.

entry.title: From Tokens to Blocks: A Block-Diffusion Perspective on Molecular Generation

author.name: Qianwei Yang, Dong Xu, Zhangfan Yang, Sisi Yuan, Zexuan Zhu, Jianqiang Li, Junkai Ji

entry.summary: Proposes SoftMol framework for drug discovery that treats molecular generation as block-diffusion rather than token prediction, capturing graph-structured nature of molecules while enabling target-aware generation.

entry.title: Reducing Prompt Sensitivity in LLM-based Speech Recognition Through Learnable Projection

author.name: Sergio Burdisso, Esa\'u Villatoro-Tello, Shashi Kumar, Srikanth Madikeri, Andr\'es Carofilis, Pradeep Rangappa, Manjunath K E, Kadri Hacioglu, Petr Motlicek, Andreas Stolcke

entry.summary: Comprehensive analysis showing prompt choice significantly affects LLM-based ASR performance with high instability. Proposes learnable projection to reduce prompt sensitivity.

entry.title: Parametric Hyperbolic Conservation Laws: A Unified Framework for Conservation, Entropy Stability, and Hyperbolicity

author.name: Lizuo Liu, Lu Zhang, Anne Gelb

entry.summary: Proposes SymCLaw for learning parametric hyperbolic conservation laws from data while guaranteeing conservation, entropy stability, and hyperbolicity by design through flux function parameterization.

entry.title: Manifold constrained steepest descent

author.name: Kaiwei Yang, Lexiao Lai

entry.summary: Proposes Manifold Constrained Steepest Descent (MCSD) for optimization on manifolds using LMO-based direction selection, introducing SPEL variant for LLM training with spectral-norm constraints.

entry.title: RAG-E: Quantifying Retriever-Generator Alignment and Failure Modes

author.name: Korbinian Randl, Guido Rocchietti, Aron Henriksson, Ziawasch Abedjan, Tony Lindgren, John Pavlopoulos

entry.summary: Presents RAG-E, an explainability framework for RAG systems introducing PMCSHAP for generator attribution and WARG metric for measuring retriever-generator alignment.

entry.title: Multi-Robot Decentralized Collaborative SLAM in Planetary Analogue Environments: Dataset, Challenges, and Lessons Learned

author.name: Pierre-Yves Lajoie, Karthik Soma, Haechan Mark Bong, Alice Lemieux-Bourque, Rongge Zhang, Vivek Shankar Varadharajan, Giovanni Beltrame

entry.summary: Introduces a multi-robot decentralized C-SLAM dataset from Mars analogue terrain experiments, examining impact of intermittent communication and planetary environment challenges on collaborative SLAM.

entry.title: Multi-modal Imputation for Alzheimer's Disease Classification

author.name: Abhijith Shaji, Tamoghna Chattopadhyay, Sophia I. Thomopoulos, Greg Ver Steeg, Paul M. Thompson, Jose-Luis Ambite

entry.summary: Uses conditional denoising diffusion models to impute missing DWI brain scans from T1 scans for Alzheimer's disease classification, demonstrating improvements in multi-modal deep learning models.

entry.title: Modeling Endogenous Logic: Causal Neuro-Symbolic Reasoning Model for Explainable Multi-Behavior Recommendation

author.name: Yuzhe Chen, Jie Cao, Youquan Wang, Haicheng Tao, Darko B. Vukovic, Jia Wu

entry.summary: Proposes Causal Neuro-Symbolic model for explainable multi-behavior recommendations, combining neural networks with symbolic logic while using causal inference to address confounders.

entry.title: LION: A Clifford Neural Paradigm for Multimodal-Attributed Graph Learning

author.name: Xunkai Li, Zhengyu Wu, Zekai Chen, Henan Sun, Daohan Su, Guang Zeng, Hongchao Qin, Rong-Hua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Proposes LION using Clifford algebra for multimodal-attributed graph learning with topology-constrained alignment and modality-adaptive fusion.

entry.title: DropoutTS: Sample-Adaptive Dropout for Robust Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Siru Zhong, Yiqiu Liu, Zhiqing Cui, Zezhi Shao, Fei Wang, Qingsong Wen, Yuxuan Liang

entry.summary: Proposes DropoutTS using spectral sparsity to quantify instance-level noise and dynamically calibrate dropout rates for robust time series forecasting.

entry.title: BioAgent Bench: An AI Agent Evaluation Suite for Bioinformatics

author.name: Dionizije Fa, Marko \v{C}uljak, Bruno Pand\v{z}a, Mateo \v{C}upi\'c

entry.summary: Introduces BioAgent Bench, a benchmark for evaluating AI agents on bioinformatics tasks like RNA-seq and variant calling. Finds frontier models can complete multi-step pipelines without custom scaffolding, with LLM-based grading for assessment.

entry.title: Understanding Diffusion Models via Ratio-Based Function Approximation with SignReLU Networks

author.name: Luwei Sun, Dongrui Shen, Jianfe Li, Yulong Zhao, Han Feng

entry.summary: Develops theoretical framework for approximating ratio-type functionals in diffusion models using SignReLU neural networks. Establishes approximation bounds and convergence rates for denoising diffusion probabilistic models.

entry.title: Understanding Frechet Speech Distance for Synthetic Speech Quality Evaluation

author.name: June-Woo Kim, Dhruv Agarwal, Federica Cerina

entry.summary: Comprehensive evaluation of FrÃ©chet Speech Distance and variants under varied embeddings for synthetic speech quality evaluation. Finds WavLM Base+ features yield most stable alignment with human ratings.

entry.title: Thinking Broad, Acting Fast: Latent Reasoning Distillation from Multi-Perspective Chain-of-Thought for E-Commerce Relevance

author.name: Baopu Qiu, Hao Chen, Yuanrong Wu, Changtong Zan, Chao Wei, Weiru Zhang, Xiaoyi Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes multi-perspective Chain-of-Thought distillation for e-commerce relevance, addressing single-perspective CoT limitations and distilling rich reasoning into efficient models.

entry.title: SENDAI: A Hierarchical Sparse-measurement, EfficieNt Data AssImilation Framework

author.name: Xingyue Zhang, Yuxuan Bao, Mars Liyao Gao, J. Nathan Kutz

entry.summary: Proposes SENDAI framework for sparse-measurement data assimilation combining simulation priors with learned discrepancy corrections. Demonstrates on MODIS vegetation reconstruction across global regions.

entry.title: KID: Knowledge-Injected Dual-Head Learning for Knowledge-Grounded Harmful Meme Detection

author.name: Yaocong Li, Leihan Zhang, Le Zhang, Qiang Yan

entry.summary: KID framework for harmful meme detection uses knowledge injection and dual-head learning to understand implicit toxicity that requires background knowledge not present in the meme itself.

entry.title: Geometry of Drifting MDPs with Path-Integral Stability Certificates

author.name: Zuyuan Zhang, Mahdi Imani, Tian Lan

entry.summary: Provides geometric view of nonstationary MDPs by modeling environment as differentiable homotopy path, yielding length-curvature-kink signature of intrinsic complexity.

entry.title: MEIDNet: Multimodal generative AI framework for inverse materials design

author.name: Anand Babu, Rog\'erio Almeida Gouv\^ea, Pierre Vandergheynst, Gian-Marco Rignanese

entry.summary: MEIDNet combines equivariant GNNs with contrastive multimodal learning for inverse materials design, achieving high latent-space alignment across structure, composition, and property modalities.

entry.title: When "Better" Prompts Hurt: Evaluation-Driven Iteration for LLM Applications

author.name: Daniel Commey

entry.summary: Presents evaluation-driven workflow for LLM applications with Minimum Viable Evaluation Suite (MVES) covering general LLM, RAG, and agentic workflows, with analysis of judge failure modes.

entry.title: Faster Predictive Coding Networks via Better Initialization

author.name: Luca Pinchetti, Simon Frieder, Thomas Lukasiewicz, Tommaso Salvatori

entry.summary: Shows that initialization choice in predictive coding networks significantly impacts training time and proposes technique to preserve iterative progress across epochs.

entry.title: Distributional Active Inference

author.name: Abdullah Akg\"ul, Gulcin Baykal, Manuel Hau{\ss}mann, Mustafa Mert \c{C}elikok, Melih Kandemir

entry.summary: Presents formal abstraction of RL spanning model-based to model-free approaches that integrates active inference principles for improved sample efficiency.

entry.title: Order-Aware Test-Time Adaptation: Leveraging Temporal Dynamics for Robust Streaming Inference

author.name: Young Kyung Kim, Oded Schlesinger, Qiangqiang Wu, J. Mat\'ias Di Martino, Guillermo Sapiro

entry.summary: OATTA formulates test-time adaptation as gradient-free recursive Bayesian estimation using learned temporal transition matrix with safety gate for weakly structured streams.

entry.title: PHDME: Physics-Informed Diffusion Models without Explicit Governing Equations

author.name: Kaiyuan Tan, Kendra Givens, Peilun Li, Thomas Beckers

entry.summary: Presents PHDME, a physics-informed diffusion framework that uses port-Hamiltonian structural priors without requiring explicit governing equations. Designed for sparse observations and incomplete physics knowledge.

entry.title: Graph-Free Root Cause Analysis

author.name: Luan Pham

entry.summary: Introduces PRISM for root cause analysis without dependency graphs. Achieves 68% Top-1 accuracy across 735 failures with 8ms diagnosis time, 258% improvement over baselines.

entry.title: Bridging Functional and Representational Similarity via Usable Information

author.name: Antonio Almud\'evar, Alfonso Ortega

entry.summary: Presents unified framework for representation similarity through usable information lens. Shows stitching is asymmetric and that CKA/RSA are estimators of usable information under constraints.

entry.title: TabClustPFN: A Prior-Fitted Network for Tabular Data Clustering

author.name: Tianqi Zhao, Guanyang Wang, Yan Shuo Tan, Qiong Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces TabClustPFN, a prior-fitted network for tabular clustering performing amortized Bayesian inference over cluster assignments and cardinality. Handles heterogeneous features without preprocessing.

entry.title: LLM4Fluid: Large Language Models as Generalizable Neural Solvers for Fluid Dynamics

author.name: Qisong Xiao, Xinhai Chen, Qinglin Wang, Xiaowei Guo, Binglin Wang, Weifeng Chen, Zhichao Wang, Yunfei Liu, Rui Xia, Hang Zou, Gencheng Liu, Shuai Li, Jie Liu

entry.summary: Proposes LLM4Fluid using pre-trained LLMs as temporal processors for fluid dynamics. Combines physics-informed disentanglement for latent compression with LLM-based temporal evolution.

entry.title: FISMO: Fisher-Structured Momentum-Orthogonalized Optimizer

author.name: Chenrui Xu, Wenjing Yan, Ying-Jun Angela Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes FISMO optimizer generalizing Muon's isotropic updates to incorporate anisotropic curvature via Fisher information. Balances geometric structure with adaptivity.

entry.title: Scalable Linearized Laplace Approximation via Surrogate Neural Kernel

author.name: Luis A. Ortega, Sim\'on Rodr\'iguez-Santana, Daniel Hern\'andez-Lobato

entry.summary: Proposes scalable Linearized Laplace Approximation via surrogate neural network learning compact features whose inner product replicates NTK. Avoids large Jacobian computation.

entry.title: Clarity: The Flexibility-Interpretability Trade-Off in Sparsity-aware Concept Bottleneck Models

author.name: Konstantinos P. Panousis, Diego Marcos

entry.summary: Introduces 'clarity' metric to measure the trade-off between flexibility and interpretability in Concept Bottleneck Models, systematically evaluating how sparsity-aware methods affect learned representations in VLMs.

entry.title: VoxMorph: Scalable Zero-shot Voice Identity Morphing via Disentangled Embeddings

author.name: Bharath Krishnamurthy, Ajita Rattani

entry.summary: Proposes VoxMorph for voice identity morphing using disentangled embeddings, enabling zero-shot creation of voice morphs from just 5 seconds of audio. Exposes voice biometric vulnerability.

entry.title: Parametric Quantum State Tomography with HyperRBMs

author.name: Simon Tonner, Viet T. Tran, Richard Kueng

entry.summary: Introduces HyperRBM for parametric quantum state tomography, using hypernetwork to condition RBM on Hamiltonian parameters, enabling single model to represent entire family of quantum ground states.

entry.title: When Gradient Optimization Is Not Enough: $\dagger$ Dispersive and Anchoring Geometric Regularizer for Multimodal Learning

author.name: Zixuan Xia, Hao Wang, Pengcheng Weng, Yanyu Qian, Yangxin Xu, William Dan, Fei Wang

entry.summary: Proposes a geometric regularization framework addressing representation collapse and cross-modal inconsistency in multimodal learning. Identifies representation geometry as a missing control axis beyond gradient optimization.

entry.title: On Forgetting and Stability of Score-based Generative models

author.name: Stanislas Strasman, Gabriel Cardoso, Sylvain Le Corff, Vincent Lemaire, Antonio Ocello

entry.summary: Provides theoretical bounds on sampling error of score-based generative models by analyzing stability and forgetting properties of reverse-time Markov chains. Establishes Lyapunov drift and Doeblin minorization conditions.

entry.title: AdaptBPE: From General Purpose to Specialized Tokenizers

author.name: Vijini Liyanage, Fran\c{c}ois Yvon

entry.summary: Proposes AdaptBPE for post-training tokenizer adaptation that selectively replaces low-utility tokens based on adaptation corpus frequency. Enables domain/language-specific optimization.

entry.title: Temporal Guidance for Large Language Models

author.name: Hong-Kai Zheng, Piji Li

entry.summary: Proposes Temporal Guidance (TeGu) using Multi-Token Prediction to construct weaker amateur predictions for self-contrast decoding, avoiding auxiliary model overhead.

entry.title: $G^2$-Reader: Dual Evolving Graphs for Multimodal Document QA

author.name: Yaxin Du, Junru Song, Yifan Zhou, Cheng Wang, Jiahao Gu, Zimeng Chen, Menglan Chen, Wen Yao, Yang Yang, Ying Wen, Siheng Chen

entry.summary: Proposes GÂ²-Reader with dual evolving graphs (Content Graph for structure, Search Graph for reasoning) for multimodal document QA, addressing chunking and retrieval drift issues.

entry.title: HiFi-Mesh: High-Fidelity Efficient 3D Mesh Generation via Compact Autoregressive Dependence

author.name: Yanfeng Li, Tao Tan, Qingquan Gao, Zhiwen Cao, Xiaohong liu, Yue Sun

entry.summary: Introduces HiFi-Mesh with LANE (Latent Autoregressive Network) for 3D mesh generation, achieving 6x improvement in maximum generatable sequence length through compact autoregressive dependencies and adaptive computation graph reconfiguration.

entry.title: From Implicit Ambiguity to Explicit Solidity: Diagnosing Interior Geometric Degradation in Neural Radiance Fields for Dense 3D Scene Understanding

author.name: Jiangsan Zhao, Jakob Geipel, Kryzysztof Kusnierek

entry.summary: Identifies Interior Geometric Degradation in NeRFs - a fundamental failure mode where transmittance-based optimization produces hollow structures in dense, self-occluding scenes, leading to instance undercounting.

entry.title: WMVLM: Evaluating Diffusion Model Image Watermarking via Vision-Language Models

author.name: Zijin Yang, Yu Sun, Kejiang Chen, Jiawei Zhao, Jun Jiang, Weiming Zhang, Nenghai Yu

entry.summary: Proposes WMVLM, the first unified evaluation framework for diffusion model watermarking using VLMs, redefining quality and security metrics for both residual and semantic watermarks.

author.name: Junming Huang, Weiwei Xu

entry.title: Zero-Shot Video Restoration and Enhancement with Assistance of Video Diffusion Models

author.name: Cong Cao, Huanjing Yue, Shangbin Xie, Xin Liu, Jingyu Yang

entry.summary: Proposes first framework utilizing video diffusion models to assist image-based methods in zero-shot video restoration, introducing homologous/heterogenous latents fusion and temporal-strengthening post-processing.

entry.title: PaddleOCR-VL-1.5: Towards a Multi-Task 0.9B VLM for Robust In-the-Wild Document Parsing

author.name: Cheng Cui, Ting Sun, Suyin Liang, Tingquan Gao, Zelun Zhang, Jiaxuan Liu, Xueqing Wang, Changda Zhou, Hongen Liu, Manhui Lin, Yue Zhang, Yubo Zhang, Yi Liu, Dianhai Yu, Yanjun Ma

entry.summary: Introduces PaddleOCR-VL-1.5, achieving 94.5% SOTA on OmniDocBench v1.5, with new Real5-OmniDocBench benchmark for robustness against physical distortions in a 0.9B parameter model.

entry.title: Creative Image Generation with Diffusion Model

author.name: Kunpeng Song, Ahmed Elgammal

entry.summary: Proposes framework for creative image generation where creativity is defined as inverse probability in CLIP embedding space, pushing diffusion toward low-probability regions for novel outputs.

entry.title: Lossless Copyright Protection via Intrinsic Model Fingerprinting

author.name: Lingxiao Chen, Liqin Wang, Wei Lu, Xiangyang Luo

entry.summary: Proposes TrajPrint for lossless diffusion model copyright protection by extracting unique manifold fingerprints from deterministic generation trajectories without modifying the model.

entry.title: Learning Transient Convective Heat Transfer with Geometry Aware World Models

author.name: Onur T. Doganay, Alexander Klawonn, Martin Eigel, Hanno Gottschalk

entry.summary: Introduces geometry-aware world model architecture for learning transient physics, with twofold conditioning mechanism and architectural adaptations for physical parameter and geometry control.

entry.title: BrainFuse: a unified infrastructure integrating realistic biological modeling and core AI methodology

author.name: Baiyu Chen, Yujie Wu, Siyuan Xu, Peng Qu, Dehua Wu, Xu Chu, Haodong Bian, Shuo Zhang, Bo Xu, Youhui Zhang, Zhengyu Ma, Guoqi Li

entry.summary: Presents BrainFuse, an infrastructure bridging neuroscience-style biological modeling with modern AI frameworks, enabling both biophysical neural simulation and gradient-based learning in one system. Addresses the disconnect between neural simulation tools and AI optimization frameworks.

entry.title: Supervised Guidance Training for Infinite-Dimensional Diffusion Models

author.name: Elizabeth L. Baker, Alexander Denker, Jes Frellsen

entry.summary: Extends diffusion model guidance theory to infinite-dimensional function spaces using Doob's h-transform, proving conditioning is possible when prior lies in Cameron-Martin space.

entry.title: White-Box Op-Amp Design via Human-Mimicking Reasoning

author.name: Zihao Chen, Jiayin Wang, Ziyi Sun, Ji Zhuang, Jinyi Shen, Xiaoyue Ke, Li Shang, Xuan Zeng, Fan Yang

entry.summary: Proposes White-Op for interpretable op-amp design using LLM agents with human-mimicking hypothesis-verification-decision workflow for symbolic pole/zero placement.

entry.title: SAGE: Sequence-level Adaptive Gradient Evolution for Generative Recommendation
