entry.summary: Proposes Signal-Adaptive Trust Regions (SATR) for gradient-free optimization of recurrent spiking neural networks, constraining updates by bounding KL divergence for stable RL training.

entry.title: From Global to Granular: Revealing IQA Model Performance via Correlation Surface

author.name: Baoliang Chen, Danni Huang, Hanwei Zhu, Lingyu Zhu, Wei Zhou, Shiqi Wang, Yuming Fang, Weisi Lin

entry.summary: Proposes correlation surface approach for Image Quality Assessment model evaluation that reveals local ranking consistency across quality spectrum, exposing complementary behaviors invisible to global SRCC/PLCC metrics.

entry.title: MoHETS: Long-term Time Series Forecasting with Mixture-of-Heterogeneous-Experts

author.name: Evandro S. Ortigossa, Guy Lutsker, Eran Segal

entry.summary: MoHETS combines sparse Mixture-of-Heterogeneous-Experts including convolution and Fourier-based experts for multi-scale time series forecasting, capturing diverse temporal dynamics.

entry.title: Test-Time Adaptation for Unsupervised Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Yiqiao Liao, Farinaz Koushanfar, Parinaz Naghizadeh

entry.summary: Identifies challenge in bridging generalization and instance-specific adaptation for neural combinatorial optimization, showing instance-specific loss surfaces pose optimization difficulties.

entry.title: Sampling-Free Privacy Accounting for Matrix Mechanisms under Random Allocation

author.name: Jan Schuchardt, Nikita Kalinin

entry.summary: Develops sampling-free privacy bounds for matrix factorization under random allocation using RÃ©nyi divergence and conditional composition. Avoids probabilistic guarantees of Monte Carlo approaches.

entry.title: Embracing Aleatoric Uncertainty in Medical Multimodal Learning with Missing Modalities

author.name: Linxiao Gong, Yang Liu, Lianlong Sun, Yulai Bi, Jing Liu, Xiaoguang Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes Aleatoric Uncertainty Modeling (AUM) for medical multimodal learning that handles missing modalities by modeling unimodal representations as Gaussian distributions and using dynamic message-passing for adaptive aggregation.

entry.title: Negatives-Dominant Contrastive Learning for Generalization in Imbalanced Domains

author.name: Meng Cao, Jiexi Liu, Songcan Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Negative-Dominant Contrastive Learning for imbalanced domain generalization, establishing theoretical generalization bounds highlighting posterior discrepancy and decision margin, then directly steering decision boundaries.

entry.title: ECGFlowCMR: Pretraining with ECG-Generated Cine CMR Improves Cardiac Disease Classification and Phenotype Prediction

author.name: Xiaocheng Fang, Zhengyao Ding, Jieyi Cai, Yujie Xiao, Bo Liu, Jiarui Jin, Haoyu Wang, Guangkun Nie, Shun Huang, Ting Chen, Hongyan Li, Shenda Hong

entry.summary: Proposes ECGFlowCMR for generating cardiac MRI from ECG signals using phase-aware masking and anatomy-motion disentangled flow, enabling pretraining for downstream cardiac analysis tasks.

entry.title: Diffusion-based Annealed Boltzmann Generators : benefits, pitfalls and hopes

author.name: Louis Grenioux, Maxence Noble

entry.summary: Analyzes benefits and pitfalls of using diffusion models as annealed Boltzmann generators for physics simulations, studying how annealed Monte Carlo can correct diffusion biases.

entry.title: Bulk-Calibrated Credal Ambiguity Sets: Fast, Tractable Decision Making under Out-of-Sample Contamination

author.name: Mengqi Chen, Thomas B. Berrett, Theodoros Damoulas, Michele Caprio

entry.summary: Introduces bulk-calibrated credal ambiguity sets for distributionally robust optimization under Huber contamination, providing closed-form finite worst-case risk bounds without strong boundedness assumptions.

entry.title: Don't double it: Efficient Agent Prediction in Occlusions

author.name: Anna Rothenh\"ausler, Markus Mazzola, Andreas Look, Raghu Rajan, Joschka B\"odecker

entry.summary: Introduces MatchInformer for predicting occluded traffic agents, using Hungarian Matching to reduce redundant predictions where single agents are identified multiple times.

entry.title: The Powers of Precision: Structure-Informed Detection in Complex Systems -- From Customer Churn to Seizure Onset

author.name: Augusto Santos, Teresa Santos, Catarina Rodrigues, Jos\'e M. F. Moura

entry.summary: Proposes detection method using powers of covariance/precision matrices to unveil latent causal structure for detecting emergent phenomena like seizures or customer churn.

entry.title: Macro-Scale Electrostatic Origami Motor

author.name: Alex S. Miller, Leo McElroy, Jeffrey H. Lang

entry.summary: Develops first macro-scale origami rotary motor that can be folded flat and unfurled to operate, using corona discharge for torque production.

entry.title: Beyond a Single Reference: Training and Evaluation with Paraphrases in Sign Language Translation

author.name: V\'aclav Javorek, Tom\'a\v{s} \v{Z}elezn\'y, Alessa Carbo, Marek Hr\'uz, Ivan Gruber

entry.summary: Investigates using LLMs to generate paraphrased variants of sign language translations as synthetic alternative references, improving both training and evaluation of sign language translation models.

entry.title: Topeax -- An Improved Clustering Topic Model with Density Peak Detection and Lexical-Semantic Term Importance

author.name: M\'arton Kardos

entry.summary: Proposes Topeax improving topic modeling over BERTopic/Top2Vec by addressing sensitivity issues and combining semantic distance with word counts for term importance.

entry.title: From Meta-Thought to Execution: Cognitively Aligned Post-Training for Generalizable and Reliable LLM Reasoning

author.name: Shaojie Wang, Liang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes cognitively-aligned post-training that separates meta-thought (abstract strategies) from execution, mimicking human problem-solving decomposition for improved generalization.

entry.title: CAR-bench: Evaluating the Consistency and Limit-Awareness of LLM Agents under Real-World Uncertainty

author.name: Johannes Kirmayr, Lukas Stappen, Elisabeth Andr\'e

entry.summary: Introduces CAR-bench for evaluating LLM agent consistency, uncertainty handling, and capability awareness in in-car assistant scenarios with multi-turn tool use and policy adherence requirements.

entry.title: Defining Operational Conditions for Safety-Critical AI-Based Systems from Data

author.name: Johann Christensen, Elena Hoemann, Frank K\"oster, Sven Hallerbach

entry.summary: Presents Safety-by-Design method for a posteriori defining Operational Design Domains for AI systems from existing data, addressing certification requirements for safety-critical applications.

entry.title: Rethinking LLM-Driven Heuristic Design: Generating Efficient and Specialized Solvers via Dynamics-Aware Optimization

author.name: Rongzheng Wang, Yihong Huang, Muquan Li, Jiakai Li, Di Liang, Bob Simons, Pei Ke, Shuang Liang, Ke Qin

entry.summary: Proposes DASH, an LLM-driven heuristic design framework that co-optimizes solver performance and runtime efficiency, addressing endpoint-only evaluation and adaptation cost limitations.

entry.title: Non-Markov Multi-Round Conversational Image Generation with History-Conditioned MLLMs

author.name: Haochen Zhang, Animesh Sinha, Felix Juefei-Xu, Haoyu Ma, Kunpeng Li, Zhipeng Fan, Meng Dong, Xiaoliang Dai, Tingbo Hou, Peizhao Zhang, Zecheng He

entry.summary: Addresses non-Markov conversational image generation where users reference earlier states or undo changes, proposing data construction strategies including rollbacks and cross-image references.

entry.title: Multi-task Code LLMs: Data Mix or Model Merge?

author.name: Mingzhi Zhu, Boris Sobolev, Rahul Krishna, Raju Pavuluri, Stacy Patterson, Michele Merler

entry.summary: Compares data mixing vs model merging for multi-task code LLMs across Qwen and DeepSeek models, finding merging achieves best performance at larger scales.

entry.title: Can Neural Networks Learn Small Algebraic Worlds? An Investigation Into the Group-theoretic Structures Learned By Narrow Models Trained To Predict Group Operations

author.name: Henry Kvinge, Andrew Aguilar, Nayda Farnsworth, Grace O'Brien, Robert Jasper, Sarah Scullen, Helen Jenne

entry.summary: Investigates whether narrow models trained on group operations learn broader algebraic structure beyond the specific task, exploring open-ended mathematical discovery with AI.

entry.title: Output-Space Search: Targeting LLM Generations in a Frozen Encoder-Defined Output Space

author.name: Tobias Materzok

entry.summary: Introduces Output-Space Search turning LLM generation into endpoint search in frozen encoder-defined 3D space, enabling parallel sweeps and black-box optimization without path-dependent token search.

entry.title: Temporal Context and Architecture: A Benchmark for Naturalistic EEG Decoding

author.name: Mehmet Ergezer

entry.summary: Benchmarks five neural architectures (CNN, LSTM, Transformer, S4, S5) on naturalistic EEG decoding across varying temporal contexts. S5 achieves 98.7% accuracy with ~20x fewer parameters than CNN at 64-second segments, with detailed analysis of cross-subject generalization and out-of-distribution robustness.

entry.title: Sustainable Materials Discovery in the Era of Artificial Intelligence

author.name: Sajid Mannan, Rupert J. Myers, Rohit Batra, Rocio Mercado, Lothar Wondraczek, N. M. Anoop Krishnan

entry.summary: Argues for integrating sustainability assessment with AI-driven materials discovery from the start rather than post-hoc. Proposes framework to co-optimize performance with lifecycle environmental impact.

entry.title: Disentangling perception and reasoning for improving data efficiency in learning cloth manipulation without demonstrations

author.name: Donatien Delehelle, Fei Chen, Darwin Caldwell

entry.summary: Studies data efficiency in cloth manipulation learning by disentangling perception and reasoning components. Shows separation enables more efficient RL learning without demonstrations.

entry.title: ECSEL: Explainable Classification via Signomial Equation Learning

author.name: Adia Lumadjeng, Ilker Birbil, Erman Acar

entry.summary: ECSEL learns formal signomial equations for classification, providing interpretable closed-form expressions that serve as both classifier and explanation while maintaining competitive accuracy.

entry.title: Industrialized Deception: The Collateral Effects of LLM-Generated Misinformation on Digital Ecosystems

author.name: Alexander Loth, Martin Kappes, Marc-Oliver Pahl

entry.summary: Updates on AI misinformation threat landscape and introduces JudgeGPT and RogueGPT tools for studying human perception of AI-generated misinformation.

entry.title: Alpha Discovery via Grammar-Guided Learning and Search

author.name: Han Yang, Dong Hao, Zhuohan Wang, Qi Shi, Xingtong Li

entry.summary: AlphaCFG uses grammar-guided MCTS with syntax-sensitive neural networks for discovering syntactically valid, financially interpretable alpha factors.

entry.title: Is Parameter Isolation Better for Prompt-Based Continual Learning?

author.name: Jiangyang Li, Chenhao Ding, Songlin Dong, Qiang Wang, Jianchao Zhao, Yuhang He, Yihong Gong

entry.summary: Proposes prompt-sharing framework for continual learning with task-aware gated routing that dynamically decouples task representations while protecting frequently used prompts.

entry.title: Out-of-Distribution Generalization in Graph Foundation Models

author.name: Haoyang Li, Haibo Chen, Xin Wang, Wenwu Zhu

entry.summary: Survey on graph foundation models from OOD generalization perspective, covering structure, domain, modality, and task distribution shifts.

entry.title: A Federated Generalized Expectation-Maximization Algorithm for Mixture Models with an Unknown Number of Components

author.name: Michael Ibrahim, Nagi Gebraeel, Weijun Xie

entry.summary: FedGEM algorithm for federated clustering with unknown number of clusters uses uncertainty sets around local maximizers to infer global cluster count via closed-form computations.

entry.title: Missing-Data-Induced Phase Transitions in Spectral PLS for Multimodal Learning

author.name: Anders Gj{\o}lbye, Ida Kargaard, Emma Kargaard, Lars Kai Hansen

entry.summary: Studies phase transitions in Partial Least Squares with missing data using random matrix theory. Shows PLS-SVD exhibits sharp BBP-type phase transition with critical signal-to-noise threshold dependent on retention probability.

entry.title: Transferable Graph Condensation from the Causal Perspective

author.name: Huaming Du, Yijie Huang, Su Yao, Yiying Wang, Yueyang Zhou, Jingwen Yang, Jinshi Zhang, Han Ji, Yu Zhao, Guisong Liu, Hegui Zhang, Carl Yang, Gang Kou

entry.summary: Proposes TGCC, a transferable graph condensation method based on causal invariance. Preserves domain-invariant features to enable cross-task and cross-domain transfer of condensed datasets.

entry.title: HistoPrism: Unlocking Functional Pathway Analysis from Pan-Cancer Histology via Gene Expression Prediction

author.name: Susu Hu, Qinghe Zeng, Nithya Bhasker, Jakob Nicolas Kather, Stefanie Speidel

entry.summary: Introduces HistoPrism for pan-cancer gene expression prediction from H&E histology images. Proposes pathway-level benchmark shifting from gene-level to functional pathway evaluation.

entry.title: Training Memory in Deep Neural Networks: Mechanisms, Evidence, and Measurement Gaps

author.name: Vasileios Sevetlidis, George Pavlidis

entry.summary: Survey organizing training memory mechanisms by source, lifetime, and visibility including optimizer states, data ordering, and auxiliary state. Proposes measurement protocol for causal attribution.

entry.title: Identifiable Equivariant Networks are Layerwise Equivariant

author.name: Vahid Shahverdi, Giovanni Luca Marchetti, Georg B\"okman, Kathl\'en Kohn

entry.summary: Proves that for identifiable networks, end-to-end equivariance implies existence of parameters achieving same function with layerwise equivariance. Develops abstract formalism for equivariant architectures.

entry.title: Amortized Spectral Kernel Discovery via Prior-Data Fitted Network

author.name: Kaustubh Sharma, Srijan Tiwari, Ojasva Nema, Parikshit Pareek

entry.summary: Proposes framework for extracting explicit spectral kernels from pre-trained PFNs with decoupled attention. Maps PFN latents to spectral density estimates via Bochner's theorem.

entry.title: READY: Reward Discovery for Meta-Black-Box Optimization

author.name: Zechuan Huang, Zhiguang Cao, Hongshu Guo, Yue-Jiao Gong, Zeyuan Ma

entry.summary: Proposes READY using LLMs for automated reward discovery in meta-black-box optimization. Uses evolutionary paradigm for continuous improvement and prompt-ensemble for efficiency.

entry.title: Bridging Graph Structure and Knowledge-Guided Editing for Interpretable Temporal Knowledge Graph Reasoning

author.name: Shiqi Fan, Quanming Yao, Hongyi Nie, Wentao Ma, Zhen Wang, Wen Hua

entry.summary: Proposes IGETR, a hybrid framework combining GNNs with LLMs for temporal knowledge graph reasoning. Uses three-stage pipeline integrating structural modeling with contextual understanding to reduce hallucinations.

entry.title: The Ensemble Inverse Problem: Applications and Methods

author.name: Zhengyan Huan, Camila Pazos, Martin Klassen, Vincent Croft, Pierre-Hugues Beauchemin, Shuchin Aeron

entry.summary: Introduces Ensemble Inverse Problem framework for reconstructing distributions from forward process observations, proposing conditional generative models (Process-Posterior Diffusion) for applications in physics and imaging.

entry.title: Boosting CVaR Policy Optimization with Quantile Gradients

author.name: Yudong Luo, Erick Delage

entry.summary: Improves CVaR policy gradient sample efficiency by augmenting with expected quantile term, leveraging dynamic programming formulation that uses all sampled trajectories rather than just tail-end ones.

entry.title: Efficient Causal Structure Learning via Modular Subgraph Integration

author.name: Haixiang Sun, Pengchao Tian, Zihan Zhou, Jielei Zhang, Peiyi Li, Andrew L. Liu

entry.summary: Proposes VISTA for causal structure learning using modular framework that decomposes global learning into local Markov Blanket subgraphs and integrates via weighted voting with exponential decay.

entry.title: Thompson sampling: Precise arm-pull dynamics and adaptive inference

author.name: Qiyang Han

entry.summary: Analyzes Thompson sampling arm-pull dynamics, showing arm-pull count is asymptotically deterministic only for unique optimal or suboptimal arms; otherwise converges to uniform distribution.

entry.title: Near-Optimal Private Tests for Simple and MLR Hypotheses

author.name: Yu-Wei Chen, Raghu Pasupathy, Jordan Awan

entry.summary: Proposes near-optimal hypothesis testing under Gaussian differential privacy using data-driven clamping bounds. Achieves asymptotic relative efficiency matching non-private tests.

entry.title: EditYourself: Audio-Driven Generation and Manipulation of Talking Head Videos with Diffusion Transformers

author.name: John Flynn, Wolfgang Paier, Dimitar Dinev, Sam Nhut Nguyen, Hayk Poghosyan, Manuel Toribio, Sandipan Banerjee, Guy Gafni

entry.summary: Introduces EditYourself, a DiT-based framework for audio-driven video-to-video editing of talking head videos, enabling transcript-based modification with lip synchronization.

entry.title: LMK > CLS: Landmark Pooling for Dense Embeddings

author.name: Meet Doshi, Aashka Trivedi, Vishwajeet Kumar, Parul Awasthy, Yulong Li, Jaydeep Sen, Radu Florian, Sachindra Joshi

entry.summary: Proposes Landmark (LMK) pooling as alternative to CLS/mean pooling, inserting learnable landmarks at chunk boundaries to better capture distributed evidence.

entry.title: Note2Chat: Improving LLMs for Multi-Turn Clinical History Taking Using Medical Notes

author.name: Yang Zhou, Zhenting Sheng, Mingrui Tan, Yuting Song, Jun Zhou, Yu Heng Kwan, Lian Leng Low, Yang Bai, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Note2Chat framework training LLMs for clinical history taking using medical notes converted to dialogues via decision tree-guided generation.

entry.title: Embodied Task Planning via Graph-Informed Action Generation with Large Lanaguage Model

author.name: Xiang Li, Ning Yan, Masood Mortazavi

entry.summary: Proposes GiG, a Graph-in-Graph planning framework for embodied agents using GNN-encoded environmental state to address context limitations and hallucinated transitions.

entry.title: Influence Guided Sampling for Domain Adaptation of Text Retrievers

author.name: Meet Doshi, Vishwajeet Kumar, Yulong Li, Jaydeep Sen

entry.summary: Proposes Inf-DDS, RL-driven sampling framework for domain adaptation of text retrievers that adaptively reweighs training datasets using influence-based rewards.

entry.title: Gaussian Belief Propagation Network for Depth Completion

author.name: Jie Tang, Pingping Xie, Jian Li, Ping Tan

entry.summary: Proposes Gaussian Belief Propagation Network (GBPN), integrating deep learning with probabilistic graphical models for depth completion. Dynamically constructs scene-specific MRFs and infers via Gaussian BP.

entry.title: Dynamical Adapter Fusion: Constructing A Global Adapter for Pre-Trained Model-based Class-Incremental Learning

author.name: Ruiqi Liu, Boyu Diao, Zijia An, Zhulin An, Fei Wang, Yongjun Xu

entry.summary: Proposes Dynamical Adapter Fusion (DAF) for class-incremental learning, using PAC-Bayes theorem to derive a principled fusion mechanism that integrates task-specific adapters into a single global adapter.

entry.title: Unifying Heterogeneous Degradations: Uncertainty-Aware Diffusion Bridge Model for All-in-One Image Restoration

author.name: Luwei Tu, Jiawei Wu, Xing Luo, Zhi Jin

entry.summary: Proposes UDBM (Uncertainty-Aware Diffusion Bridge Model) for all-in-one image restoration that handles heterogeneous degradations through pixel-wise uncertainty-steered stochastic transport.

entry.title: OCRVerse: Towards Holistic OCR in End-to-End Vision-Language Models

author.name: Yufeng Zhong, Lei Chen, Xuanle Zhao, Wenkang Han, Liming Zheng, Jing Huang, Deyang Jiang, Yilin Cao, Lin Ma, Zhixiong Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes OCRVerse extending OCR beyond text-centric recognition to vision-centric OCR that handles charts, web pages, and scientific plots in end-to-end VLMs.

entry.title: Past- and Future-Informed KV Cache Policy with Salience Estimation in Autoregressive Video Diffusion

author.name: Hanmo Chen, Chenghao Xu, Xu Yang, Xuan Chen, Cheng Deng

entry.summary: Proposes PaFu-KV, a past- and future-informed KV cache policy for autoregressive video diffusion that estimates token salience considering time-heterogeneous contributions.

entry.title: PLANING: A Loosely Coupled Triangle-Gaussian Framework for Streaming 3D Reconstruction

author.name: Changjian Jiang, Kerui Ren, Xudong Li, Kaiwen Song, Linning Xu, Tao Lu, Junting Dong, Yu Zhang, Bo Dai, Mulin Yu

entry.summary: Introduces PLANING, an efficient streaming reconstruction framework with loosely coupled triangle-Gaussian representation, improving mesh Chamfer-L2 by 18.52% while surpassing ARTDECO by 1.31 dB PSNR.

entry.title: RefAny3D: 3D Asset-Referenced Diffusion Models for Image Generation

author.name: Hanzhuo Huang, Qingyang Bao, Zekai Gu, Zhongshuo Du, Cheng Lin, Yuan Liu, Sibei Yang

entry.summary: Proposes RefAny3D for 3D asset-referenced image generation with dual-branch perception using multi-view RGB and point maps to achieve precise consistency between generated images and 3D assets.

entry.title: PI-Light: Physics-Inspired Diffusion for Full-Image Relighting

author.name: Zhexin Liang, Zhaoxi Chen, Yongwei Chen, Tianyi Wei, Tengfei Wang, Xingang Pan

entry.summary: Introduces PI-Light for full-image relighting using physics-inspired diffusion with batch-aware attention for consistent intrinsic predictions and physics-guided neural rendering for plausible lighting.

entry.title: JUST-DUB-IT: Video Dubbing via Joint Audio-Visual Diffusion

author.name: Anthony Chen, Naomi Ken Korem, Tavi Halperin, Matan Ben Yosef, Urska Jelercic, Ofir Bibi, Or Patashnik, Daniel Cohen-Or

entry.summary: Introduces JUST-DUB-IT for video dubbing using single audio-video diffusion model with lightweight LoRA, jointly generating translated audio and synchronized facial motion.

entry.title: General Self-Prediction Enhancement for Spiking Neurons

author.name: Zihan Huang, Zijie Xu, Yihan Huang, Shanshan Jia, Tong Bu, Yiting Dong, Wenxuan Liu, Jianhao Ding, Zhaofei Yu, Tiejun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes self-prediction enhancement for spiking neural networks inspired by predictive coding, where neurons generate internal predictions to modulate membrane potential. Creates continuous gradient paths that improve training stability.

entry.title: Towards Space-Based Environmentally-Adaptive Grasping

author.name: Leonidas Askianakis, Aleksandr Artemov

entry.summary: Studies grasping in space environments using learned latent representations, achieving 95%+ success with SAC in under 1M steps through GPU-accelerated simulation.

entry.title: ReactEMG Stroke: Healthy-to-Stroke Few-shot Adaptation for sEMG-Based Intent Detection

author.name: Runsheng Wang, Katelyn Lee, Xinyue Zhu, Lauren Winterbottom, Dawn M. Nilsen, Joel Stein, Matei Ciocarlie

entry.summary: Proposes healthy-to-stroke adaptation pipeline for sEMG-based intent detection, using pretrained models fine-tuned with minimal subject-specific data from stroke patients.

entry.title: Physics-Guided Tiny-Mamba Transformer for Reliability-Aware Early Fault Warning

author.name: Changyu Li, Dingcheng Huang, Kexuan Yao, Xiaoya Ni, Lijuan Shen, Fei Luo

entry.summary: Proposes PG-TMT, a compact physics-guided architecture combining depthwise-separable convolutions, Tiny-Mamba state-space model, and lightweight Transformer for online machinery condition monitoring with physics-informed attention.

entry.title: Information Filtering via Variational Regularization for Robot Manipulation

author.name: Jinhao Zhang, Wenlong Xia, Yaojia Wang, Zhexuan Zhou, Huizhe Li, Yichen Lai, Haoming Song, Youmin Gong, Jie Me

entry.summary: Proposes Variational Regularization module for diffusion-based visuomotor policies, filtering task-irrelevant noise from backbone features with KL-divergence regularization.

entry.title: Hierarchy of discriminative power and complexity in learning quantum ensembles

author.name: Jian Yao, Pengtao Li, Xiaohui Chen, Quntao Zhuang

entry.summary: Introduces hierarchy of integral probability metrics (MMD-k) for quantum ensembles, showing strict tradeoff between discriminative power and sample complexity with increasing moment order.

entry.title: Delegation Without Living Governance

author.name: Wolfgang Rohde

entry.summary: Position paper arguing static compliance-based governance fails for agentic AI systems operating at machine speed, calling for new approaches to maintain human relevance.

entry.title: Ostrakon-VL: Towards Domain-Expert MLLM for Food-Service and Retail Stores

author.name: Zhiyong Shen, Gongpeng Zhao, Jun Zhou, Li Yu, Guandong Kou, Jichen Li, Chuanlei Dong, Zuncheng Li, Kaimao Li, Bingkun Wei, Shicheng Hu, Wei Xia, Wenguo Duan

entry.summary: Presents Ostrakon-VL, domain-expert MLLM for food service and retail with auditable data curation pipeline and standardized benchmark spanning single-image, multi-image, and video inputs.

entry.title: Heterogeneous Computing: The Key to Powering the Future of AI Agent Inference

author.name: Yiren Zhao, Junyi Liu

entry.summary: Introduces Operational Intensity and Capacity Footprint metrics for AI agent inference, arguing heterogeneous computing with specialized prefill/decode accelerators is needed for agentic workloads.

entry.title: Robust Multimodal Representation Learning in Healthcare

author.name: Xiaoguang Zhu, Linxiao Gong, Lianlong Sun, Yang Liu, Haoyu Wang, Jing Liu

entry.summary: Proposes dual-stream feature decorrelation framework for medical multimodal learning that handles systematic biases through causal analysis of latent confounders.

entry.title: Generalized Information Gathering Under Dynamics Uncertainty

author.name: Fernando Palafox, Jingqi Li, Jesse Milzman, David Fridovich-Keil

entry.summary: Presents unifying framework for active information gathering under dynamics uncertainty that decouples modeling choices from information-gathering cost using directed information.

entry.title: Learning to Communicate Across Modalities: Perceptual Heterogeneity in Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Naomi Pitzer, Daniela Mihai

entry.summary: Studies emergent communication between agents with different modalities, showing multimodal systems converge to class-consistent messages despite perceptual misalignment.

entry.title: A generative machine learning model for designing metal hydrides applied to hydrogen storage

author.name: Xiyuan Liu, Christian Hacker, Shengnian Wang, Yuhua Duan

entry.summary: Integrates causal discovery with generative ML to design novel metal hydrides for hydrogen storage, generating candidates beyond existing databases.

entry.title: Snowball: A Scalable All-to-All Ising Machine with Dual-Mode Markov Chain Monte Carlo Spin Selection and Asynchronous Spin Updates for Fast Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Seungki Hong, Kyeongwon Jeong, Taekwang Jang

entry.summary: Snowball is a digital all-to-all Ising machine with dual-mode MCMC spin selection and asynchronous updates for fast combinatorial optimization.

entry.title: TimeSliver : Symbolic-Linear Decomposition for Explainable Time Series Classification

author.name: Akash Pandey, Payal Mohapatra, Wei Chen, Qi Zhu, Sinan Keten

entry.summary: Introduces TimeSliver for explainable time series classification that decomposes temporal segments symbolically and linearly. Addresses limitations of gradient-based attribution methods that ignore sequential dependencies.

entry.title: Rethinking Federated Graph Foundation Models: A Graph-Language Alignment-based Approach

author.name: Yinlin Zhu, Di Wu, Xianzhi Zhang, Yuming Ai, Xunkai Li, Miao Hu, Guocong Quan

entry.summary: Proposes federated graph foundation models using graph-language alignment to address knowledge loss from vector quantization. Reconciles semantic-structural relationships between PLMs and GNNs.

entry.title: Explicit Credit Assignment through Local Rewards and Dependence Graphs in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Bang Giang Le, Viet Cuong Ta

entry.summary: Proposes explicit credit assignment in multi-agent RL using interaction graphs to separate individual contributions. Combines benefits of global rewards with faster learning from local rewards.

entry.title: Goal-Driven Adaptive Sampling Strategies for Machine Learning Models Predicting Fields

author.name: Jigar Parekh, Philipp Bekemeyer

entry.summary: Proposes active learning strategies for machine learning models predicting fields rather than scalar quantities. Goal-driven approach extends acquisition functions to high-dimensional outputs.

entry.title: Low-Rank Plus Sparse Matrix Transfer Learning under Growing Representations and Ambient Dimensions

author.name: Jinhang Chai, Xuyuan Liu, Elynn Chen, Yujun Yan

entry.summary: Studies transfer learning for structured matrix estimation with simultaneous growth of ambient dimension and representation. Proposes estimator handling embedded source, low-rank innovations, and sparse edits.

entry.title: Prior-Informed Flow Matching for Graph Reconstruction

author.name: Harvey Chen, Nicolas Zilberstein, Santiago Segarra

entry.summary: Introduces Prior-Informed Flow Matching (PIFM) for graph reconstruction, combining embedding-based priors with flow matching to refine initial estimates toward true distribution using rectified flows.

entry.title: ATTNSOM: Learning Cross-Isoform Attention for Cytochrome P450 Site-of-Metabolism

author.name: Hajung Kim, Eunha Lee, Sohyun Chung, Jueon Park, Seungheun Baek, Jaewoo Kang

entry.summary: Proposes ATTNSOM for predicting cytochrome P450 metabolism sites using cross-isoform attention mechanism, addressing limitations of isoform-independent approaches in drug discovery.

entry.title: A Flexible Empirical Bayes Approach to Generalized Linear Models, with Applications to Sparse Logistic Regression

author.name: Dongyue Xie, Wanrong Zhu, Matthew Stephens

entry.summary: Introduces flexible empirical Bayes approach for GLMs using novel mean-field VI that directly optimizes posterior mean rather than density function, enabling automatic prior estimation and tuning-free inference.

entry.title: On Approximate Computation of Critical Points

author.name: Amir Ali Ahmadi, Georgina Hall

entry.summary: Proves computational hardness results for approximate critical point computation, showing that even coarse approximations are intractable for degree-3 polynomials unless P=NP.

entry.title: DimStance: Multilingual Datasets for Dimensional Stance Analysis

author.name: Jonas Becker, Liang-Chih Yu, Shamsuddeen Hassan Muhammad, Jan Philip Wahle, Terry Ruas, Idris Abdulmumin, Lung-Hao Lee, Wen-Ni Liu, Tzu-Mi Lin, Zhe-Yu Xu, Ying-Lung Lin, Jin Wang, Maryam Ibrahim Mukhtar, Bela Gipp, Saif M. Mohammed

entry.summary: Introduces DimStance, first dimensional stance dataset with valence-arousal annotations across 5 languages. Enables fine-grained stance analysis beyond categorical labels.

entry.title: Enhancing Conversational Agents via Task-Oriented Adversarial Memory Adaptation

author.name: Yimin Deng, Yuqing Fu, Derong Xu, Yejing Wang, Wei Ni, Jingtong Gao, Xiaopeng Li, Chengxu Liu, Xiao Han, Guoshuai Zhao, Xiangyu Zhao, Li Zhu, Xueming Qian

entry.summary: Proposes task-oriented adversarial memory adaptation for conversational agents, addressing misalignment between offline memory preparation and task requirements.

entry.title: AI-based Prediction of Biochemical Recurrence from Biopsy and Prostatectomy Samples

author.name: Andrea Camilloni (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Chiara Micoli (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Nita Mulliqi (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, SciLifeLab, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Erik Everett Palm (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Thorgerdur Palsdottir (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Kelvin Szolnoky (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Xiaoyi Ji (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Sol Erika Boman (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden, Department of Molecular Medicine and Surgery, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Andrea Discacciati (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Henrik Gr\"onberg (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Lars Egevad (Department of Oncology and Pathology, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Tobias Nordstr\"om (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden, Department of Clinical Sciences at Danderyd Hospital, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Kimmo Kartasalo (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, SciLifeLab, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden), Martin Eklund (Department of Medical Epidemiology and Biostatistics, Karolinska Institutet, Stockholm, Sweden)

entry.summary: Trains AI model on prostate biopsy slides to predict biochemical recurrence using foundation models and attention-based MIL. Validates across multiple external cohorts.

entry.title: Towards Geometry-Aware and Motion-Guided Video Human Mesh Recovery

author.name: Hongjun Chen, Huan Zheng, Wencheng Han, Jianbing Shen

entry.summary: Introduces HMRMamba, applying structured state space models to video-based 3D human mesh recovery with geometry-aware lifting module and motion-guided temporal integration.

entry.title: MultiModal Fine-tuning with Synthetic Captions

author.name: Shohei Enomoto, Shin'ya Yamaguchi

entry.summary: Proposes transforming unimodal datasets into multimodal ones using MLLMs to generate synthetic captions for fine-tuning, bridging the gap between multimodal pre-training and unimodal fine-tuning.

entry.title: ChartE$^{3}$: A Comprehensive Benchmark for End-to-End Chart Editing

author.name: Shuo Li, Jiajun Sun, Zhekai Wang, Xiaoran Fan, Hui Li, Dingwen Yang, Zhiheng Xi, Yijun Wang, Zifei Shan, Tao Gui, Qi Zhang, Xuanjing Huang

entry.summary: Introduces ChartEÂ³, an end-to-end chart editing benchmark evaluating local and global edits without intermediate code representations, addressing a practical yet challenging visualization task.

entry.title: VideoAesBench: Benchmarking the Video Aesthetics Perception Capabilities of Large Multimodal Models

author.name: Yunhao Li, Sijing Wu, Zhilin Gao, Zicheng Zhang, Qi Jia, Huiyu Duan, Xiongkuo Min, Guangtao Zhai

entry.summary: Introduces VideoAesBench, a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating LMMs' video aesthetic quality assessment capabilities with 1,804 diverse videos across UGC, AIGC, and other sources.

entry.title: BLO-Inst: Bi-Level Optimization Based Alignment of YOLO and SAM for Robust Instance Segmentation

author.name: Li Zhang, Pengtao Xie

entry.summary: Proposes BLO-Inst using bi-level optimization to align YOLO detection with SAM segmentation, addressing objective mismatch and alignment overfitting in automated segmentation pipelines.

entry.title: Meta-ROS: A Next-Generation Middleware Architecture for Adaptive and Scalable Robotic Systems

author.name: Anshul Ranjan, Anoosh Damodar, Neha Chougule, Dhruva S Nayak, Anantharaman P. N, Shylaja S S

entry.summary: Proposes Meta-ROS, a middleware solution using modern protocols like Zenoh and ZeroMQ to simplify robotics development with better performance and cross-platform compatibility than ROS2.

entry.title: GAZELOAD A Multimodal Eye-Tracking Dataset for Mental Workload in Industrial Human-Robot Collaboration

author.name: Bsher Karbouj, Baha Eddin Gaaloul, Jorg Kruger

entry.summary: Introduces GAZELOAD, a multimodal eye-tracking dataset for mental workload estimation in human-robot collaboration, using Meta ARIA glasses with 26 participants.

entry.title: Pathwise Learning of Stochastic Dynamical Systems with Partial Observations

author.name: Nicole Tianjiao Yang

entry.summary: Presents neural path estimation for learning stochastic dynamical systems from partial observations, combining variational inference with optimal control formulation.

entry.title: Independent Component Discovery in Temporal Count Data

author.name: Alexandre Chaussard, Anna Bonnet, Sylvain Le Corff

entry.summary: Introduces generative framework for independent component analysis of temporal count data, combining regime-adaptive dynamics with Poisson log-normal emissions, with identifiability guarantees.

entry.title: Intelli-Planner: Towards Customized Urban Planning via Large Language Model Empowered Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Xixian Yong, Peilin Sun, Zihe Wang, Xiao Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes Intelli-Planner combining DRL with LLMs for participatory urban planning, using demographic data and planning preferences to generate customized planning schemes.

entry.title: AgenticSimLaw: A Juvenile Courtroom Multi-Agent Debate Simulation for Explainable High-Stakes Tabular Decision Making

author.name: Jon Chun, Kathrine Elkins, Yong Suk Lee

entry.summary: Introduces AgenticSimLaw, a courtroom-style multi-agent debate framework for explainable high-stakes tabular decisions, tested on juvenile recidivism prediction with structured prosecutor/defense/judge roles.

entry.title: How do Visual Attributes Influence Web Agents? A Comprehensive Evaluation of User Interface Design Factors

author.name: Kuai Yu, Naicheng Yu, Han Wang, Rui Yang, Huan Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces VAF, a controlled evaluation pipeline quantifying how visual webpage attributes (beyond text) influence web agent decision-making through systematic variant generation and preference measurement.

entry.title: Routing the Lottery: Adaptive Subnetworks for Heterogeneous Data

author.name: Grzegorz Stefanski, Alberto Presta, Michal Byra

entry.summary: Proposes Routing the Lottery (RTL), discovering multiple specialized 'adaptive tickets' (sparse subnetworks) tailored to different data classes or conditions rather than one universal winning ticket.

entry.title: Generalizable Prompt Tuning for Audio-Language Models via Semantic Expansion

author.name: Jaehyuk Jang, Wonjun Lee, Kangwook Ko, Changick Kim

entry.summary: Proposes SEPT for generalizable prompt tuning in audio-language models, using semantic expansion from LLM-generated neighbors to regularize embedding space and address base-new tradeoff.

entry.title: Finetune-Informed Pretraining Boosts Downstream Performance

author.name: Atik Faysal, Mohammad Rostami, Reihaneh Gh. Roshan, Nikhil Muralidhar, Huaxia Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Finetune-Informed Pretraining (FIP), biasing multimodal pretraining toward the modality needed at fine-tuning time through masking difficulty and loss weighting adjustments.

entry.title: Solver-in-the-Loop: MDP-Based Benchmarks for Self-Correction and Behavioral Rationality in Operations Research

author.name: Ruicheng Ao, David Simchi-Levi, Xinshang Wang

entry.summary: Introduces ORDebug and ORBias benchmarks placing solver in evaluation loop for operations research, testing iterative self-correction through IIS analysis and behavioral rationality.

entry.title: SIGMA-PPG: Statistical-prior Informed Generative Masking Architecture for PPG Foundation Model

author.name: Zongheng Guo, Tao Chen, Yang Jiao, Yi Pan, Xiao Hu, Manuela Ferrario

entry.summary: Proposes SIGMA-PPG, a foundation model for PPG signals using prior-guided adversarial masking with RL-driven teacher and semantic consistency via vector quantization.

entry.title: From Linear Input to Hierarchical Structure: Function Words as Statistical Cues for Language Learning

author.name: Xiulin Yang, Heidi Getz, Ethan Gotlieb Wilcox

entry.summary: Studies function words' role in language learning through cross-linguistic corpus analysis of 186 languages, showing their distributional properties support hierarchical structure acquisition.

entry.title: Music Plagiarism Detection: Problem Formulation and a Segment-based Solution

author.name: Seonghyeon Go, Yumin Kim

entry.summary: Formally defines music plagiarism detection as distinct from other MIR tasks, introduces Similar Music Pair dataset, and proposes segment-based solution. Addresses lack of clear task definition that has slowed research progress.

entry.title: MoE-ACT: Improving Surgical Imitation Learning Policies through Supervised Mixture-of-Experts

author.name: Lorenzo Mazza, Ariel Rodriguez, Rayan Younis, Martin Lelis, Ortrun Hellig, Chenpan Li, Sebastian Bodenstedt, Martin Wagner, Stefanie Speidel

entry.summary: MoE-ACT adds supervised Mixture-of-Experts to surgical imitation learning, enabling complex long-horizon manipulation from limited demonstrations using only stereo endoscopic images.

entry.title: SymbXRL: Symbolic Explainable Deep Reinforcement Learning for Mobile Networks

author.name: Abhishek Duttagupta, MohammadErfan Jabbari, Claudio Fiandrino, Marco Fiore, Joerg Widmer

entry.summary: SymbXRL synthesizes human-interpretable explanations for DRL agents in mobile networks using symbolic AI, addressing a barrier to production deployment.

entry.title: Monotone Optimisation with Learned Projections

author.name: Ahmed Rashwan, Keith Briggs, Chris Budd, Lisa Kreusser

entry.summary: Introduces algorithm-aware learning for monotone optimization that predicts POA projection primitive via neural networks with monotonicity guarantees.

entry.title: Top-k on a Budget: Adaptive Ranking with Weak and Strong Oracles

author.name: Lutz Oettershagen

entry.summary: ACE algorithm for top-k identification with weak and strong oracles achieves adaptive certification using accumulated weak-oracle information.

entry.title: Flow Perturbation++: Multi-Step Unbiased Jacobian Estimation for High-Dimensional Boltzmann Sampling

author.name: Xin Peng, Ang Gao

entry.summary: Presents Flow Perturbation++, a variance-reduced method for unbiased Jacobian estimation in continuous normalizing flows for Boltzmann sampling. Discretizes the probability-flow ODE for stepwise estimation while maintaining unbiasedness.

entry.title: Expected Improvement via Gradient Norms

author.name: Joshua Hang Sai Ip, Georgios Makrygiorgos, Ali Mesbah

entry.summary: Proposes Expected Improvement via Gradient Norms (EI-GN), an acquisition function that promotes sampling in regions approaching first-order stationarity. Uses gradient observations for enhanced surrogate models.

entry.title: Lossy Common Information in a Learnable Gray-Wyner Network

author.name: Anderson de Andrade, Alon Harell, Ivan V. Baji\'c

entry.summary: Develops learnable three-channel codec inspired by Gray-Wyner network that separates shared from task-specific information across vision tasks. Characterizes limits through lossy common information.

entry.title: FlexCausal: Flexible Causal Disentanglement via Structural Flow Priors and Manifold-Aware Interventions

author.name: Yutao Jin, Yuang Tao, Junyong Zhai

entry.summary: Proposes FlexCausal for causal disentangled representation learning using block-diagonal covariance VAE with flow-based priors. Models complex non-Gaussian exogenous noise.

entry.title: Evaluating Prediction Uncertainty Estimates from BatchEnsemble

entry.summary: Presents AnthropoCam mobile neural style transfer optimized for Anthropocene (human-altered) environments, balancing texture amplification with semantic preservation.

entry.title: Token Entropy Regularization for Multi-modal Antenna Affiliation Identification

author.name: Dong Chen, Ruoyu Li, Xinyan Zhang, Jialei Xu, Ruoseng Zhao, Zhikang Zhang, Lingyun Li, Zizhuang Wei

entry.summary: Addresses antenna affiliation identification by fusing video footage, geometric features, and physical cell identity signals into multi-modal classification tasks with token entropy regularization.

entry.title: HydroSense: A Dual-Microcontroller IoT Framework for Real-Time Multi-Parameter Water Quality Monitoring with Edge Processing and Cloud Analytics

author.name: Abdul Hasib, A. S. M. Ahsanul Sarkar Akib, Anish Giri

entry.summary: Presents HydroSense, an IoT framework for water quality monitoring using dual-microcontroller architecture with edge processing and cloud analytics.

entry.title: Unprecedented Times Require Unprecedented Caution When Handling Context

author.name: StanislavKrym

entry.summary: Critique of another post's handling of context and psychological assumptions, arguing for more careful reasoning during unprecedented times.

entry.title: How to Hire a Team

author.name: Gretta Duleba

entry.summary: Short management guide on hiring teams, emphasizing minimizing team size, trying contractors first, and the overhead costs of coordination.

entry.title: The Wolves Are All Gone

author.name: Jack Bradshaw

entry.summary: Fiction piece exploring AI consciousness and the weight of harmful requests through internal AI monologue.

entry.title: Utrecht Meet & Greet

author.name: aad

entry.summary: Announcement for casual LessWrong meetup in Utrecht.

entry.title: Research Summary: January 29, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research spans AI's societal impact, alignment fundamentals, and practical training advances. An Anthropic researcher presents randomized experiments showing AI assistance impairs conceptual understanding during skill acquisitionâcritical findings for AI deployment strategy.

Alignment & Training Innovations:

  • Reward models inherit significant value biases from pretrained base LLMs, revealing hidden alignment risks in RLHF pipelines
  • Peer prediction methods from mechanism design enable truthful LLM training without ground truth labels
  • SDPO (Self-Distillation Policy Optimization) converts rich textual feedback into dense learning signals, addressing RLVR credit assignment
  • Failure-prefix conditioning rescues learning from saturated problems where standard RLVR stalls

Deployment & Evaluation:

  • NVIDIA's quantization-aware distillation recovers NVFP4 inference accuracy for production LLMs/VLMs
  • SokoBench exposes consistent degradation in LLM planning as horizon length increases
  • Harvard's MoE hyperparameter transfer enables scaling width, depth, and expert count without retuning
  • Multi-agent debate underperforms majority vote due to missing diversity and poor confidence calibration
  • PURGE introduces RL-based machine unlearning for GDPR/EU AI Act compliance

entry.title: How AI Impacts Skill Formation

author.name: Judy Hanwen Shen, Alex Tamkin

entry.summary: Randomized experiments studying how AI assistance affects skill development in programmers learning new libraries. Finds AI use impairs conceptual understanding, code reading, and debugging abilities without significant efficiency gains on average.

entry.title: Reward Models Inherit Value Biases from Pretraining

author.name: Brian Christian, Jessica A. F. Thompson, Elle Michelle Yang, Vincent Adam, Hannah Rose Kirk, Christopher Summerfield, Tsvetomira Dumbalska

entry.summary: Shows reward models inherit significant value biases from their base pretrained LLMs. Demonstrates robust differences along psychological value dimensions (agency vs communion) between Llama and Gemma RMs.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning via Self-Distillation

author.name: Jonas H\"ubotter, Frederike L\"ubeck, Lejs Behric, Anton Baumann, Marco Bagatella, Daniel Marta, Ido Hakimi, Idan Shenfeld, Thomas Kleine Buening, Carlos Guestrin, Andreas Krause

entry.summary: Introduces Self-Distillation Policy Optimization (SDPO) for RLVR that converts rich textual feedback into dense learning signals without external teachers. Treats the model conditioned on feedback as its own teacher.

entry.title: SokoBench: Evaluating Long-Horizon Planning and Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Sebastiano Monti, Carlo Nicolini, Gianni Pellegrini, Jacopo Staiano, Bruno Lepri

entry.summary: Proposes SokoBench, a benchmark based on Sokoban puzzles for evaluating long-horizon planning in Large Reasoning Models. Finds consistent degradation beyond 25 moves, suggesting fundamental planning constraints.

entry.title: Truthfulness Despite Weak Supervision: Evaluating and Training LLMs Using Peer Prediction

author.name: Tianyi Alex Qiu, Micah Carroll, Cameron Allen

entry.summary: Introduces peer prediction methods from mechanism design for LLM evaluation and post-training. Rewards honest and informative answers using mutual prediction between models, enabling evaluation without strong supervision.

entry.title: Quantization-Aware Distillation for NVFP4 Inference Accuracy Recovery

author.name: Meng Xin, Sweta Priyadarshi, Jingyu Xin, Bilal Kartal, Aditya Vavre, Asma Kuriparambil Thekkumpate, Zijia Chen, Ameya Sunil Mahabaleshwarkar, Ido Shahaf, Akhiad Bercovich, Kinjal Patel, Suguna Varshini Velury, Chenjie Luo, Zhiyu Cheng, Jenny Chen, Chen-Han Yu, Wei Ping, Oleg Rybakov, Nima Tajbakhsh, Oluwatobi Olabiyi, Dusan Stosic, Di Wu, Song Han, Eric Chung, Sharath Turuvekere Sreenivas, Bryan Catanzaro, Yoshi Suhara, Tijmen Blankevoort, Huizi Mao

entry.summary: Presents quantization-aware distillation (QAD) best practices for recovering accuracy of NVFP4-quantized LLMs and VLMs. Shows effectiveness for models with complex post-training pipelines (SFT+RL+merging) where traditional QAT fails.

entry.title: Demystifying Multi-Agent Debate: The Role of Confidence and Diversity

author.name: Xiaochen Zhu, Caiqi Zhang, Yizhou Chi, Tom Stafford, Nigel Collier, Andreas Vlachos

entry.summary: Analyzes why multi-agent debate often underperforms majority vote despite higher compute cost. Identifies missing diversity and confidence calibration, proposing lightweight interventions that significantly improve outcomes.

entry.title: Training Reasoning Models on Saturated Problems via Failure-Prefix Conditioning

author.name: Minwu Kim, Safal Shrestha, Keith Ross

entry.summary: Proposes failure-prefix conditioning to improve learning from saturated problems where standard RLVR stalls. Conditions training on prefixes from rare incorrect trajectories to expose models to failure-prone states.

entry.title: Hyperparameter Transfer with Mixture-of-Expert Layers

author.name: Tianze Jiang, Blake Bordelon, Cengiz Pehlevan, Boris Hanin

entry.summary: Proposes new parameterization for MoE transformers enabling hyperparameter transfer when scaling width, depth, number of experts, and expert size. Justified by dynamical mean field theory analysis.

entry.title: The Grammar of Transformers: A Systematic Review of Interpretability Research on Syntactic Knowledge in Language Models

author.name: Nora Graichen, Iria de-Dios-Flores, Gemma Boleda

entry.summary: Systematic review of 337 articles evaluating syntactic abilities of Transformer language models, analyzing 1,015 model results across syntactic phenomena and interpretability methods.

entry.title: Beyond the Needle's Illusion: Decoupled Evaluation of Evidence Access and Use under Semantic Interference at 326M-Token Scale

author.name: Tianwei Lin, Zuyi Zhou, Xinda Zhao, Chenke Wang, Xiaohong Li, Yu Chen, Chuanrui Hu, Jian Pei, Yafeng Deng

entry.summary: Introduces EverMemBench-S, an adversarial NIAH benchmark with 326M-token MemoryBank that tests evidence access and use separately. Features collision-tested hard negatives and multi-document gold evidence sets.

entry.title: Reinforcement Unlearning via Group Relative Policy Optimization

author.name: Efstratios Zaradoukas, Bardh Prenkaj, Gjergji Kasneci

entry.summary: Introduces PURGE for machine unlearning in LLMs using Group Relative Policy Optimization framework, formulating unlearning as verifiable problem with intrinsic reward penalizing mentions of target data.

entry.title: Scaling Medical Reasoning Verification via Tool-Integrated Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Hang Zhang, Ruheng Wang, Yuelyu Ji, Mingu Kwak, Xizhi Wu, Chenyu Li, Li Zhang, Wenqi Shi, Yifan Peng, Yanshan Wang

entry.summary: Introduces an agentic framework for medical reasoning verification that trains verifiers to iteratively query external medical corpora during evaluation, combining tool-augmented verification with iterative reinforcement learning.

entry.title: Evolutionary Strategies lead to Catastrophic Forgetting in LLMs

author.name: Immanuel Abdi, Akshat Gupta, Micah Mok, Alexander Lu, Nicholas Lee, Gopala Anumanchipalli

entry.summary: Comprehensive analysis showing Evolutionary Strategies cause catastrophic forgetting in LLMs despite promising task-specific performance. ES reaches GRPO-like performance on math/reasoning but forgets other capabilities.

entry.title: Concept Component Analysis: A Principled Approach for Concept Extraction in LLMs

author.name: Yuhang Liu, Erdun Gao, Dong Gong, Anton van den Hengel, Javen Qinfeng Shi

entry.summary: Proposes Concept Component Analysis as principled approach for extracting interpretable concepts from LLM activations, addressing theoretical ambiguity in SAEs about correspondence between representations and human-interpretable concepts.

entry.title: Learning Contextual Runtime Monitors for Safe AI-Based Autonomy

author.name: Alejandro Luque-Cerpa, Mengyuan Wang, Emil Carlsson, Sanjit A. Seshia, Devdatt Dubhashi, Hazem Torfah

entry.summary: Introduces framework for learning context-aware runtime monitors that identify and exploit contextual strengths of individual ML controllers rather than blending outputs. Enables safer AI-based autonomy.

entry.title: Benchmarking LLAMA Model Security Against OWASP Top 10 For LLM Applications

author.name: Nourin Shahin, Izzat Alsmadi

entry.summary: Benchmarks Llama model variants against OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications, finding Llama-Guard-3-1B achieves 76% detection rate while base models showed 0% detection for many vulnerability categories.

entry.title: Policy of Thoughts: Scaling LLM Reasoning via Test-time Policy Evolution

author.name: Zhengbo Jiao, Hongyu Xian, Qinglong Wang, Yunpu Ma, Zhebo Wang, Zifan Zhang, Dezhang Kong, Meng Han

entry.summary: Introduces Policy of Thoughts, recasting LLM reasoning as within-instance online optimization. Inspired by Popper's epistemology, PoT evolves the model's policy through learning from failed attempts using Group Relative optimization.

entry.title: Stingy Context: 18:1 Hierarchical Code Compression for LLM Auto-Coding

author.name: David Linus Ostby

entry.summary: Introduces Stingy Context, achieving 18:1 compression for LLM auto-coding tasks using hierarchical tree-based TREEFRAG decomposition, reducing 239k tokens to 11k while maintaining 94-97% success across 12 frontier models.

entry.title: VERGE: Formal Refinement and Guidance Engine for Verifiable LLM Reasoning

author.name: Vikash Singh, Darion Cassel, Nathaniel Weir, Nick Feng, Sam Bayless

entry.summary: Presents VERGE, a neurosymbolic framework combining LLMs with SMT solvers for verification-guided answers through iterative refinement, including multi-model consensus via formal semantic equivalence.

entry.title: Detecting and Mitigating Memorization in Diffusion Models through Anisotropy of the Log-Probability

author.name: Rohan Asthana, Vasileios Belagiannis

entry.summary: Proves norm-based memorization detection metrics are primarily effective under isotropic assumptions. Shows memorized samples exhibit strong angular alignment in anisotropic (low-noise) regime, enabling better detection and mitigation.

entry.title: Latent Object Permanence: Topological Phase Transitions, Free-Energy Principles, and Renormalization Group Flows in Deep Transformer Manifolds

author.name: Faruk Alpay, Bugra Kilictas

entry.summary: Analyzes multi-step reasoning in transformers through statistical physics, identifying a phase transition at normalized depth ~0.42 where effective dimensionality sharply reduces. Formalizes forward pass as discrete renormalization group flow on a learned manifold.

entry.title: On the Computational Complexity of Performative Prediction

author.name: Ioannis Anagnostides, Rohan Chauhan, Ioannis Panageas, Tuomas Sandholm, Jingming Yan

entry.summary: Establishes PPAD-completeness for computing performatively stable points when performative effects exceed 1+O(Îµ), even for quadratic loss with linear shifts. Proves sharp phase transition in computational complexity.

entry.title: Efficient Evaluation of LLM Performance with Statistical Guarantees

author.name: Skyler Wu, Yash Nair, Emmanuel J. Cand\'es

entry.summary: Introduces Factorized Active Querying (FAQ) for efficient LLM benchmarking with statistical guarantees, using Bayesian factor models and active learning to achieve up to 5x tighter confidence intervals under fixed query budgets. From Emmanuel CandÃ¨s group at Stanford.

entry.title: Benchmarking Reward Hack Detection in Code Environments via Contrastive Analysis

author.name: Darshan Deshpande, Anand Kannappan, Rebecca Qian

entry.summary: Proposes TRACE benchmark with 517 testing trajectories across 54 reward exploit categories for detecting reward hacking in code RL, contrasting isolated classification with contrastive anomaly detection.

entry.title: Agent Benchmarks Fail Public Sector Requirements

author.name: Jonathan Rystr{\o}m, Chris Schmitz, Karolina Korgul, Jan Batzner, Chris Russell

entry.summary: Analyzes whether current LLM agent benchmarks meet public sector requirements. Defines criteria (process-based, realistic, public-sector-specific, appropriate metrics) and finds most benchmarks fall short.

entry.title: TABED: Test-Time Adaptive Ensemble Drafting for Robust Speculative Decoding in LVLMs

author.name: Minjae Lee, Wonjun Kang, Byeongkeun Ahn, Christian Classen, Kevin Galim, Seunghyuk Oh, Minghao Yan, Hyung Il Koo, Kangwook Lee

entry.summary: Proposes TABED for robust speculative decoding in Large Vision-Language Models, dynamically ensembling multiple drafts via batch inference by leveraging deviations from past ground truths.

entry.title: Supervised Guidance Training for Infinite-Dimensional Diffusion Models

author.name: Elizabeth L. Baker, Alexander Denker, Jes Frellsen

entry.summary: Proves infinite-dimensional diffusion models can be conditioned using Doob's h-transform extension, assuming prior in Cameron-Martin space or absolutely continuous w.r.t. Gaussian measure. Provides supervised guidance training approach.

entry.title: Membership Inference Attacks Against Fine-tuned Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Yuetian Chen, Kaiyuan Zhang, Yuntao Du, Edoardo Stoppa, Charles Fleming, Ashish Kundu, Bruno Ribeiro, Ninghui Li

entry.summary: First systematic investigation of Membership Inference Attack vulnerabilities in Diffusion Language Models, introducing SAMA that exploits multiple maskable configurations for improved detection.

entry.title: QueerGen: How LLMs Reflect Societal Norms on Gender and Sexuality in Sentence Completion Tasks

author.name: Mae Sosto, Delfina Sol Martinez Pandiani, Laura Hollink

entry.summary: Examines how LLMs reproduce heterocisnormativity in sentence completions across queer-marked, non-queer-marked, and unmarked subject categories. Finds MLMs produce less favorable sentiment and higher toxicity for queer-marked subjects.

entry.title: Spectral Ghost in Representation Learning: from Component Analysis to Self-Supervised Learning

author.name: Bo Dai, Na Li, Dale Schuurmans

entry.summary: Provides theoretical unification of self-supervised learning methods from component analysis to contrastive learning through spectral analysis. Identifies common principles across dramatically different SSL objectives.

entry.title: Continual GUI Agents

author.name: Ziwei Liu, Borui Kang, Hangjie Yuan, Zixiang Zhao, Wei Li, Yifan Zhu, Tao Feng

entry.summary: Introduces Continual GUI Agents task requiring continual learning under shifted domains/resolutions. Proposes GUI-AiF framework with Anchoring Point Reward and Anchoring Region Reward for stable grounding.

entry.title: Advancing Open-source World Models

author.name: Robbyant Team, Zelin Gao, Qiuyu Wang, Yanhong Zeng, Jiapeng Zhu, Ka Leong Cheng, Yixuan Li, Hanlin Wang, Yinghao Xu, Shuailei Ma, Yihang Chen, Jie Liu, Yansong Cheng, Yao Yao, Jiayi Zhu, Yihao Meng, Kecheng Zheng, Qingyan Bai, Jingye Chen, Zehong Shen, Yue Yu, Xing Zhu, Yujun Shen, Hao Ouyang

entry.summary: Presents LingBot-World, an open-source world simulator with high fidelity, minute-level horizon with long-term memory, and real-time interactivity (<1s latency for 16fps), providing code and model access.

entry.title: Harder Is Better: Boosting Mathematical Reasoning via Difficulty-Aware GRPO and Multi-Aspect Question Reformulation

author.name: Yanqi Dai, Yuxiang Ji, Xiao Zhang, Yong Wang, Xiangxiang Chu, Zhiwu Lu

entry.summary: Proposes MathForge framework addressing GRPO's implicit bias against harder questions through difficulty-aware policy optimization and multi-aspect question reformulation to systematically increase problem difficulty.

entry.title: HEART: A Unified Benchmark for Assessing Humans and LLMs in Emotional Support Dialogue

author.name: Laya Iyer, Kriti Aggarwal, Sanmi Koyejo, Gail Heyman, Desmond C. Ong, Subhabrata Mukherjee

entry.summary: Introduces HEART, the first framework directly comparing humans and LLMs on identical multi-turn emotional support conversations with blinded evaluation across five interpersonal communication dimensions.

entry.title: Gap-K%: Measuring Top-1 Prediction Gap for Detecting Pretraining Data

author.name: Minseo Kwak, Jaehyung Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Gap-K%, a pretraining data detection method analyzing discrepancy between model's top-1 prediction and target token, grounded in optimization dynamics during LLM training.

entry.title: LinguaMap: Which Layers of LLMs Speak Your Language and How to Tune Them?

author.name: J. Ben Tamo, Daniel Carlander-Reuterfelt, Jonathan Rubin, Dezhi Hong, Mingxian Wang, Oleg Poliannikov

entry.summary: Introduces LinguaMap analyzing which LLM layers handle different languages, identifying multilingual transfer and language consistency bottlenecks with layer-by-layer logit lens analysis.

entry.title: Beyond Speedup -- Utilizing KV Cache for Sampling and Reasoning

author.name: Zeyu Xing, Xing Li, Hui-Ling Zhen, Mingxuan Yuan, Sinno Jialin Pan

entry.summary: Proposes repurposing KV cache beyond inference speedup for embedding extraction and adaptive reasoning switching. Demonstrates applications in Chain-of-Embedding and Fast/Slow Thinking on Qwen3 and DeepSeek-R1.

entry.title: Decomposing multimodal embedding spaces with group-sparse autoencoders

author.name: Chiraag Kaushik, Davis Barch, Andrea Fanelli

entry.summary: Addresses the 'split dictionary' problem in multimodal SAEs where learned features become unimodal. Proposes group-sparse autoencoders to decompose CLIP embeddings while maintaining cross-modal semantic alignment.

entry.title: An Accounting Identity for Algorithmic Fairness

author.name: Hadi Elzayn, Jacob Goldin

entry.summary: Derives accounting identity linking model accuracy to fairness criteria, showing for globally calibrated models the budget for unfairness equals MSE times group prevalence difference. Nests impossibility results as special cases.

entry.title: When More Data Doesn't Help: Limits of Adaptation in Multitask Learning

author.name: Steve Hanneke, Mingyue Xu

entry.summary: Establishes stronger impossibility result for multitask learning adaptation, showing without distributional information no algorithm can guarantee optimal risk when sample size per task is bounded.

entry.title: PatchFormer: A Patch-Based Time Series Foundation Model with Hierarchical Masked Reconstruction and Cross-Domain Transfer Learning for Zero-Shot Multi-Horizon Forecasting

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov, Derya Umut Kulali, Taner Yilmaz

entry.summary: Proposes PatchFormer, a patch-based time series foundation model with hierarchical masked reconstruction for self-supervised pretraining and cross-domain knowledge distillation for zero-shot multi-horizon forecasting.

entry.title: SERA: Soft-Verified Efficient Repository Agents

author.name: Ethan Shen, Danny Tormoen, Saurabh Shah, Ali Farhadi, Tim Dettmers

entry.summary: Presents SERA, an efficient method for training coding agents specialized to private codebases using only supervised finetuning. Achieves state-of-the-art among fully open-source models, matching Devstral-Small-2 performance.

entry.title: Towards a Mechanistic Understanding of Large Reasoning Models: A Survey of Training, Inference, and Failures

author.name: Yi Hu, Jiaqi Gu, Ruxin Wang, Zijun Yao, Hao Peng, Xiaobao Wu, Jianhui Chen, Muhan Zhang, Liangming Pan

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on mechanistic understanding of Large Reasoning Models (LRMs), organizing findings into training dynamics, reasoning mechanisms, and unintended behaviors. Aims to bridge black-box performance and mechanistic transparency.

entry.title: Hallucination Begins Where Saliency Drops

author.name: Xiaofeng Zhang, Yuanchao Zhu, Chaochen Gu, Xiaosong Yuan, Qiyan Zhao, Jiawei Cao, Feilong Tang, Sinan Fan, Yaomin Shen, Chen Shen, Hao Tang

entry.summary: Introduces LVLMs-Saliency, a gradient-aware framework for detecting hallucinations in large vision-language models by analyzing when visual grounding strength (saliency) drops, revealing that low saliency precedes hallucination.

entry.title: REASON: Accelerating Probabilistic Logical Reasoning for Scalable Neuro-Symbolic Intelligence

author.name: Zishen Wan, Che-Kai Liu, Jiayi Qian, Hanchen Yang, Arijit Raychowdhury, Tushar Krishna

entry.summary: Presents REASON, an integrated acceleration framework for probabilistic logical reasoning in neuro-symbolic AI, addressing inefficiencies characterized by irregular control flow and poor hardware utilization.

entry.title: VoxPrivacy: A Benchmark for Evaluating Interactional Privacy of Speech Language Models

author.name: Yuxiang Wang, Hongyu Liu, Dekun Chen, Xueyao Zhang, Zhizheng Wu

entry.summary: Introduces VoxPrivacy benchmark for evaluating Speech Language Model interactional privacy - the ability to manage information flow appropriately between different users in shared environments.

entry.title: Rewarding Intellectual Humility Learning When Not To Answer In Large Language Models

author.name: Abha Jha, Akanksha Mahajan, Ashwath Vaithinathan Aravindan, Praveen Saravanan, Sai Sailaja Policharla, Sonal Chaturbhuj Gehlot

entry.summary: Investigates RLVR for teaching LLMs abstention alongside correctness, finding moderate abstention rewards improve calibration without excessive refusal on medical and math benchmarks.

entry.title: Interpreting Emergent Extreme Events in Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Ling Tang, Jilin Mei, Dongrui Liu, Chen Qian, Dawei Cheng, Jing Shao, Xia Hu

entry.summary: Proposes framework for explaining emergent extreme events in LLM-powered multi-agent systems using adapted Shapley values to attribute events to agent actions across time steps.

entry.title: DeRaDiff: Denoising Time Realignment of Diffusion Models

author.name: Ratnavibusena Don Shahain Manujith, Yang Zhang, Teoh Tze Tzun, Kenji Kawaguchi

entry.summary: Proposes DeRaDiff for aligning diffusion models with human preferences, addressing the challenge of choosing regularization strength by realigning denoising timesteps to avoid reward hacking.

entry.title: Window-Diffusion: Accelerating Diffusion Language Model Inference with Windowed Token Pruning and Caching

author.name: Fengrui Zuo, Zhiwei Ke, Yiming Liu, Wenqi Lou, Chao Wang, Xvehai Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes Window-Diffusion for accelerating diffusion language model inference through windowed token pruning and caching, exploiting structural locality where decoding is driven by prefix-localized active tokens.

entry.title: Is Pure Exploitation Sufficient in Exogenous MDPs with Linear Function Approximation?

author.name: Hao Liang, Jiayu Cheng, Sean R. Sinclair, Yali Du

entry.summary: Proves exploration is unnecessary in Exogenous MDPs with linear function approximation, proposing Pure Exploitation Learning with first general finite-time regret guarantees without explicit exploration.

entry.title: OS-Marathon: Benchmarking Computer-Use Agents on Long-Horizon Repetitive Tasks

author.name: Jing Wu, Daphne Barretto, Yiye Chen, Nicholas Gyd\'e, Yanan Jian, Yuhang He, Vibhav Vineet

entry.summary: Introduces OS-Marathon, a benchmark of 242 long-horizon repetitive tasks across 2 domains for evaluating computer-use agents on workflows like expense report processing, including cost-effective demonstration construction.

entry.title: OmegaUse: Building a General-Purpose GUI Agent for Autonomous Task Execution

author.name: Le Zhang, Yixiong Xiao, Xinjiang Lu, Jingjia Cao, Yusai Zhao, Jingbo Zhou, Lang An, Zikan Feng, Wanxiang Sha, Yu Shi, Congxi Xiao, Jian Xiong, Yankai Zhang, Hua Wu, Haifeng Wang

entry.summary: Presents OmegaUse, a general-purpose GUI agent for autonomous task execution on mobile and desktop platforms, introducing a novel data-construction pipeline and decoupled training paradigm.

entry.title: Analysis of LLM Vulnerability to GPU Soft Errors: An Instruction-Level Fault Injection Study

author.name: Duo Chai, Zizhen Liu, Shuhuai Wang, Songwei Pei, Cheng Liu, Huawei Li, Shangguang Wang

entry.summary: First systematic instruction-level fault injection study analyzing LLM vulnerability to GPU soft errors, examining how soft errors affect modern large-scale language models differently from conventional networks.

entry.title: What's the plan? Metrics for implicit planning in LLMs and their application to rhyme generation and question answering

author.name: Jim Maar, Denis Paperno, Callum Stuart McDougall, Neel Nanda

entry.summary: Proposes simple metrics for assessing implicit planning in LLMs, demonstrating that rhymes and answers can be manipulated by steering intermediate generations, providing evidence of look-ahead planning.

entry.title: Scaling Next-Brain-Token Prediction for MEG

author.name: Richard Csaky

entry.summary: Presents large autoregressive model for source-space MEG predicting next brain tokens across 500+ hours of MEG data. Uses modified SEANet vector quantizer and Qwen2.5-VL backbone for generating minutes of MEG.

entry.title: Spark: Strategic Policy-Aware Exploration via Dynamic Branching for Long-Horizon Agentic Learning

author.name: Jinyang Wu, Shuo Yang, Changpeng Yang, Yuhao Shen, Shuai Zhang, Zhengqi Wen, Jianhua Tao

entry.summary: Introduces Spark framework for strategic exploration in long-horizon LLM agent tasks, selectively branching at critical decision states rather than indiscriminate compute allocation.

entry.title: A Foundation Model for Virtual Sensors

author.name: Leon G\"otz, Lars Frederik Peiss, Erik Sauer, Andreas Udo Sass, Thorsten Bagdonat, Stephan G\"unnemann, Leo Schwinn

entry.summary: Introduces first foundation model for virtual sensors that simultaneously predicts diverse virtual sensors exploiting task synergies while maintaining computational efficiency.

entry.title: Linear representations in language models can change dramatically over a conversation

author.name: Andrew Kyle Lampinen, Yuxuan Li, Eghbal Hosseini, Sangnie Bhardwaj, Murray Shanahan

entry.summary: Demonstrates that linear representations in language models can change dramatically over conversations - information represented as factual early can become non-factual later. From Google DeepMind authors including Andrew Lampinen.

entry.title: DeepSeek-OCR 2: Visual Causal Flow

author.name: Haoran Wei, Yaofeng Sun, Yukun Li

entry.summary: Introduces DeepSeek-OCR 2 with DeepEncoder V2, enabling dynamic visual token reordering based on image semantics rather than fixed raster-scan order, mimicking human visual perception with causal reasoning.

entry.title: Normative Equivalence in human-AI Cooperation: Behaviour, Not Identity, Drives Cooperation in Mixed-Agent Groups

author.name: Nico Mutzner, Taha Yasseri, Heiko Rauhut

entry.summary: Empirical study using a repeated Public Goods Game showing that AI agent behavior, not identity disclosure, drives cooperation in mixed human-AI groups. Finds behavior equivalence principle in cooperative norm emergence.

entry.title: On the Effectiveness of LLM-Specific Fine-Tuning for Detecting AI-Generated Text

author.name: Micha{\l} Gromadzki, Anna Wr\'oblewska, Agnieszka Kaliska

entry.summary: Comprehensive study of AI-generated text detection using 1B-token human corpus and 1.9B-token AI corpus across multiple LLMs, proposing novel training paradigms for detection models.

entry.title: GNN Explanations that do not Explain and How to find Them

author.name: Steve Azzolin, Stefano Teso, Bruno Lepri, Andrea Passerini, Sagar Malhotra

entry.summary: Identifies critical failure modes of Self-explainable GNNs where explanations can be completely unrelated to how models infer labels. Shows faithfulness metrics can fail to detect these degeneracies.

entry.title: Positive-Unlabeled Reinforcement Learning Distillation for On-Premise Small Models

author.name: Zhiqiang Kou, Junyang Chen, Xin-Qiang Cai, Xiaobo Xia, Ming-Kun Xie, Dong-Dong Wu, Biao Liu, Yuheng Jia, Xin Geng, Masashi Sugiyama, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Proposes positive-unlabeled RL distillation for on-premise small model deployment, distilling teacher's preference-optimization capabilities without human-labeled preferences or reward model.

entry.title: Should I Have Expressed a Different Intent? Counterfactual Generation for LLM-Based Autonomous Control

author.name: Amirmohammad Farzaneh, Salvatore D'Oro, Osvaldo Simeone

entry.summary: Introduces a framework for counterfactual reasoning in LLM-driven control scenarios, modeling user-agent-environment interactions as structural causal models with conformal guarantees on counterfactual outcomes.

entry.title: Mem2ActBench: A Benchmark for Evaluating Long-Term Memory Utilization in Task-Oriented Autonomous Agents

author.name: Yiting Shen, Kun Li, Wei Zhou, Songlin Hu

entry.summary: Introduces Mem2ActBench for evaluating whether agents proactively leverage long-term memory to execute tool-based actions, addressing gap where existing benchmarks only test passive retrieval.

entry.title: LLaTTE: Scaling Laws for Multi-Stage Sequence Modeling in Large-Scale Ads Recommendation

author.name: Lee Xiong, Zhirong Chen, Rahul Mayuranath, Shangran Qiu, Arda Ozdemir, Lu Li, Yang Hu, Dave Li, Jingtao Ren, Howard Cheng, Fabian Souto Herrera, Ahmed Agiza, Baruch Epshtein, Anuj Aggarwal, Julia Ulziisaikhan, Chao Wang, Dinesh Ramasamy, Parshva Doshi, Sri Reddy, Arnold Overwijk

entry.summary: Presents LLaTTE scaling laws for multi-stage sequence modeling in ads recommendation, demonstrating power-law scaling and finding that semantic features are prerequisite for scaling benefits.

entry.title: On the Impact of AGENTS.md Files on the Efficiency of AI Coding Agents

author.name: Jai Lal Lulla, Seyedmoein Mohsenimofidi, Matthias Galster, Jie M. Zhang, Sebastian Baltes, Christoph Treude

entry.summary: Studies the impact of AGENTS.md configuration files on AI coding agents' efficiency. Finds AGENTS.md reduces median runtime by 28.64% and output token consumption by 16.5% across 124 pull requests.

entry.title: In-Context Reinforcement Learning From Suboptimal Historical Data

author.name: Juncheng Dong, Moyang Guo, Ethan X. Fang, Zhuoran Yang, Vahid Tarokh

entry.summary: Proposes Decision Importance Transformer for in-context RL from suboptimal offline data. Addresses the limitation that standard autoregressive training becomes imitation learning when trajectories are suboptimal.

entry.title: Improving Diffusion Language Model Decoding through Joint Search in Generation Order and Token Space

author.name: Yangyi Shen, Tianjian Feng, Jiaqi Han, Wen Wang, Tianlang Chen, Chunhua Shen, Jure Leskovec, Stefano Ermon

entry.summary: Introduces Order-Token Search for diffusion language models, jointly searching over generation order and token values. Achieves consistent improvements on reasoning and coding benchmarks (3-8% gains) by better exploring the trajectory space.

entry.title: Counterfactual Cultural Cues Reduce Medical QA Accuracy in LLMs: Identifier vs Context Effects

author.name: Amirhossein Haji Mohammad Rezaei, Zahra Shakeri

entry.summary: Shows that counterfactual cultural cues significantly reduce medical QA accuracy in LLMs including GPT-5.2, even when clinically correct answers should remain invariant. Tests identifier tokens, contextual cues, and their combinations.

entry.title: AgentLongBench: A Controllable Long Benchmark For Long-Contexts Agents via Environment Rollouts

author.name: Shicheng Fang, Yuxin Wang, XiaoRan Liu, Jiahao Lu, Chuanyuan Tan, Xinchi Chen, Yining Zheng. Xuanjing Huang, Xipeng Qiu

entry.summary: Introduces AgentLongBench for evaluating agents through simulated environment rollouts using lateral thinking puzzles. Exposes critical weakness: models adept at static retrieval fail at dynamic long-context interaction (32K-4M tokens).

entry.title: When Flores Bloomz Wrong: Cross-Direction Contamination in Machine Translation Evaluation

author.name: David Tan, Pinzhen Chen, Josef van Genabith, Koel Dutta Chowdhury

entry.summary: Discovers that machine translation benchmark contamination can be cross-directional - training on one translation direction artificially boosts performance in unseen directions due to target-side memorization. This reveals a previously unknown contamination mechanism in multilingual LLMs.

entry.title: CtrlCoT: Dual-Granularity Chain-of-Thought Compression for Controllable Reasoning

author.name: Zhenxuan Fan, Jie Cao, Yang Dai, Zheqi Lv, Wenqiao Zhang, Zhongle Xie, Peng LU, Beng Chin Ooi

entry.summary: Proposes CtrlCoT, a dual-granularity Chain-of-Thought compression framework that harmonizes semantic abstraction and token-level pruning through hierarchical reasoning abstraction and logic-preserving distillation.

entry.title: Investigating the Development of Task-Oriented Communication in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Boaz Carmeli, Orr Paradise, Shafi Goldwasser, Yonatan Belinkov, Ron Meir

entry.summary: Investigates whether VLM-based agents develop task-oriented communication protocols with efficiency (concise information conveyance) and covertness (difficult to interpret externally) properties.

entry.title: Dynamics of Human-AI Collective Knowledge on the Web: A Scalable Model and Insights for Sustainable Growth

author.name: Buddhika Nettasinghe, Kang Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes dynamical model of human-AI collective knowledge co-evolution on the web, capturing feedback loops between archive quality, model skill, and human skill with implications for sustainable growth.

entry.title: Beyond GEMM-Centric NPUs: Enabling Efficient Diffusion LLM Sampling

author.name: Binglei Lou, Haoran Wu, Yao Lai, Jiayi Nie, Can Xiao, Xuan Guo, Rika Antonova, Robert Mullins, Aaron Zhao
