entry.title: A New Dataset and Framework for Robust Road Surface Classification via Camera-IMU Fusion

author.name: Willams de Lima Costa, Thifany Ketuli Silva de Souza, Jonas Ferreira Silva, Carlos Gabriel Bezerra Pereira, Bruno Reis Vila Nova, Leonardo Silvino Brito, Rafael Raider Leoni, Juliano Silva, Valter Ferreira, Sibele Miguel Soares Neto, Samantha Uehara, Daniel Giacomo, Jo\~ao Marcelo Teixeira, Veronica Teichrieb, Cristiano Coelho de Ara\'ujo

entry.summary: Introduces ROAD dataset for road surface classification with camera-IMU fusion. Proposes lightweight bidirectional cross-attention module with adaptive gating for domain shift handling.

entry.title: C2:Cross learning module enhanced decision transformer with Constraint-aware loss for auto-bidding

author.name: Jinren Ding, Xuejian Xu, Shen Jiang, Zhitong Hao, Jinhui Yang, Peng Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes C2 framework enhancing Decision Transformer for auto-bidding with Cross Learning Block for inter-sequence correlation and Constraint-aware Loss incorporating budget/CPA constraints.

entry.title: Physics-informed Blind Reconstruction of Dense Fields from Sparse Measurements using Neural Networks with a Differentiable Simulator

author.name: Ofek Aloni, Barak Fishbain

entry.summary: Presents a physics-informed neural network method for reconstructing dense physical fields from sparse measurements without requiring dense training examples. Uses differentiable numerical simulator during training.

entry.title: Demystifying Prediction Powered Inference

author.name: Yilin Song, Dan M. Kluger, Harsh Parikh, Tian Gu

entry.summary: Provides a tutorial-style overview of Prediction-Powered Inference (PPI) methods that leverage ML predictions to improve statistical efficiency while maintaining valid inference. Clarifies distinctions between growing PPI variants.

entry.title: Unit-Based Agent for Semi-Cascaded Full-Duplex Dialogue Systems

author.name: Haoyuan Yu, Yuxuan Chen, Minjie Cai

entry.summary: Presents a framework for full-duplex dialogue systems decomposing conversations into minimal units for independent processing. Implements semi-cascaded system with MLLM core, achieving second place in Human-like Spoken Dialogue Systems Challenge.

entry.title: Efficient Multimodal Planning Agent for Visual Question-Answering

author.name: Zhuo Chen, Xinyu Geng, Xinyu Wang, Yong Jiang, Zhen Zhang, Pengjun Xie, Kewei Tu

entry.summary: Proposes training a multimodal planning agent that dynamically decomposes RAG pipelines for efficient VQA. Optimizes trade-off between efficiency and effectiveness through learned decomposition.

entry.title: Like a Therapist, But Not: Reddit Narratives of AI in Mental Health Contexts

author.name: Elham Aghakhani, Rezvaneh Rezapour

entry.summary: Analyzes 5,126 Reddit posts about AI use for emotional support/therapy, examining evaluative language and adoption attitudes. Finds engagement shaped by narrated outcomes, trust, and response quality.

entry.title: Visual Prompt-Agnostic Evolution

author.name: Junze Wang, Lei Fan, Dezheng Zhang, Weipeng Jing, Donglin Di, Yang Song, Sidong Liu, Cong Cong

entry.summary: Introduces Prompt-Agnostic Evolution (PAE) to address unstable training dynamics in Visual Prompt Tuning, using frequency-domain analysis to show shallow prompts stagnate while deep prompts oscillate, and proposes solutions.

entry.title: StructAlign: Structured Cross-Modal Alignment for Continual Text-to-Video Retrieval

author.name: Shaokun Wang, Weili Guan, Jizhou Han, Jianlong Wu, Yupeng Hu, Liqiang Nie

entry.summary: Proposes StructAlign for continual text-to-video retrieval, using simplex Equiangular Tight Frame geometry as unified prior to mitigate intra-modal and cross-modal feature drift in continual learning.

entry.title: Game-Theoretic Autonomous Driving: A Graphs of Convex Sets Approach

author.name: Nikolaj K\"afer, Ahmed Khalil, Edward Huynh, Efstathios Bakolas, David Fridovich-Keil

entry.summary: IBR-GCS introduces a game-theoretic framework for multi-vehicle autonomous driving that combines Iterative Best Response with Graphs of Convex Sets to model highway driving as a generalized noncooperative game. The approach unifies combinatorial maneuver reasoning, trajectory planning, and strategic interaction in a single framework.

entry.title: Size Matters: Reconstructing Real-Scale 3D Models from Monocular Images for Food Portion Estimation

author.name: Gautham Vinod, Bruce Coburn, Siddeshwar Raghavan, Jiangpeng He, Fengqing Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes method to recover true-to-scale 3D reconstructed objects from monocular images for food portion estimation, bridging 3D vision and digital health.

entry.title: DiagLink: A Dual-User Diagnostic Assistance System by Synergizing Experts with LLMs and Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Zihan Zhou, Yinan Liu, Yuyang Xie, Bin Wang, Xiaochun Yang, Zezheng Feng

entry.summary: Presents DiagLink, a dual-user diagnostic assistance system combining LLMs with knowledge graphs for both patients and physicians. Features guided dialogues and physician oversight for knowledge validation.

entry.title: Robust Distributed Learning under Resource Constraints: Decentralized Quantile Estimation via (Asynchronous) ADMM

author.name: Anna van Elst, Igor Colin, Stephan Cl\'emen\c{c}on

entry.summary: Proposes AsylADMM, a gossip algorithm for decentralized median and quantile estimation that is memory-efficient, communication-efficient, and robust to data corruption.

entry.title: TPGDiff: Hierarchical Triple-Prior Guided Diffusion for Image Restoration

author.name: Yanjie Tu, Qingsen Yan, Axi Niu, Jiacong Tang

entry.summary: Proposes TPGDiff for all-in-one image restoration, using degradation priors throughout diffusion while introducing structural priors in shallow layers and semantic priors in deep layers to prevent artifacts.

entry.title: FD-MAD: Frequency-Domain Residual Analysis for Face Morphing Attack Detection

author.name: Diogo J. Paulo, Hugo Proen\c{c}a, Jo\~ao C. Neves

entry.summary: Introduces FD-MAD, a region-aware frequency-based approach to face morphing attack detection that improves cross-dataset and cross-morph generalization using lightweight frequency domain analysis.

entry.title: Implementing Metric Temporal Answer Set Programming

author.name: Arvid Becker, Pedro Cabalar, Martin Di\'eguez, Susana Hahn, Javier Romero, Torsten Schaub

entry.summary: Develops computational approach to Metric Answer Set Programming for expressing quantitative temporal constraints like durations and deadlines, addressing scalability through difference constraints.

entry.title: Benchmarking von ASR-Modellen im deutschen medizinischen Kontext: Eine Leistungsanalyse anhand von Anamnesegespr\"achen

author.name: Thomas Schuster, Julius Tr\"ogele, Nico D\"oring, Robin Kr\"uger, Matthieu Hoffmann, Holger Friedrich

entry.summary: Benchmarks 29 ASR models including Whisper, Voxtral, and commercial APIs on German medical conversations with dialects, evaluating with WER, CER, and BLEU.

entry.title: Certificate-Guided Pruning for Stochastic Lipschitz Optimization

author.name: Ibne Farabi Shihab, Sanjeda Akter, Anuj Sharma

entry.summary: Introduces Certificate-Guided Pruning for black-box Lipschitz optimization with noisy evaluations. Maintains explicit certificates of optimality via confidence-adjusted Lipschitz envelopes with provable sample complexity bounds.

entry.title: Physically Guided Visual Mass Estimation from a Single RGB Image

author.name: Sungjae Lee, Junhan Jeong, Yeonjoo Hong, Kwang In Kim

entry.summary: Proposes a physically structured framework for estimating object mass from a single RGB image by recovering 3D geometry via monocular depth and extracting material semantics via vision-language models.

entry.title: CLEAR-Mamba:Towards Accurate, Adaptive and Trustworthy Multi-Sequence Ophthalmic Angiography Classification

author.name: Zhuonan Wang, Wenjie Yan, Wenqiao Zhang, Xiaohui Song, Jian Ma, Ke Yao, Yibo Yu, Beng Chin Ooi

entry.summary: Proposes CLEAR-Mamba for multi-sequence ophthalmic angiography classification, building on MedMamba with optimizations for accuracy, adaptability, and trustworthiness across imaging devices.

entry.title: Modeling Cascaded Delay Feedback for Online Net Conversion Rate Prediction: Benchmark, Insights and Solutions

author.name: Mingxuan Luo, Guipeng Xv, Sishuo Chen, Xinyu Li, Li Zhang, Zhangming Chan, Xiang-Rong Sheng, Han Zhu, Jian Xu, Bo Zheng, Chen Lin

entry.summary: Addresses NetCVR prediction (conversion rate minus refunds) with cascaded delayed feedback, introducing benchmark and online training schemes for recommender systems. First systematic study of this industry-relevant problem.

entry.title: Parametric and Generative Forecasts of Day-Ahead Market Curves for Storage Optimization

author.name: Julian Gutierrez, Redouane Silvente

entry.summary: Presents ML frameworks for forecasting day-ahead electricity market curves and optimizing storage using parametric Chebyshev models and generative models for order-level submissions.

entry.title: COMET-SG1: Lightweight Autoregressive Regressor for Edge and Embedded AI

author.name: Shakhyar Gogoi

entry.summary: Proposes COMET-SG1, lightweight autoregressive regression model for edge/embedded AI using linear behavior-space encoding and memory-anchored transition estimation for bounded long-horizon behavior.

entry.title: Neural Quantum States in Mixed Precision

author.name: Massimo Solinas, Agnes Valenti, Nawaf Bou-Rabee, Roeland Wiersema

entry.summary: Investigates mixed-precision arithmetic in neural network variational Monte Carlo for quantum many-body systems. Derives analytical error bounds and shows reduced precision can maintain accuracy while improving efficiency.

entry.title: Semantic Uncertainty Quantification of Hallucinations in LLMs: A Quantum Tensor Network Based Method

author.name: Pragatheeswaran Vipulanandan, Kamal Premaratne, Dilip Sarkar

entry.summary: Proposes quantum tensor network-based uncertainty quantification for hallucination detection, using quantum physics-inspired framework for semantic equivalence clustering. Introduces entropy maximization for reliable output selection.

entry.title: FFE-Hallu:Hallucinations in Fixed Figurative Expressions:Benchmark of Idioms and Proverbs in the Persian Language

author.name: Faezeh Hosseini, Mohammadali Yousefzadeh, Yadollah Yaghoobzadeh

entry.summary: Introduces FFEHallu, the first benchmark for figurative hallucination in LLMs focusing on Persian idioms and proverbs. Tests whether LLMs generate or endorse non-existent but plausible-sounding expressions.

entry.title: Single-Nodal Spontaneous Symmetry Breaking in NLP Models

author.name: Shalom Rosner, Ronit D. Gross, Ella Koresh, Ido Kanter

entry.summary: Demonstrates spontaneous symmetry breaking in NLP models during training, where individual attention heads and nodes acquire capacity to learn limited token/label sets. Applies statistical mechanics framework to NLP.

entry.title: Persona Prompting as a Lens on LLM Social Reasoning

author.name: Jing Yang, Moritz Hechtbauer, Elisabeth Khalilov, Evelyn Luise Brinkmann, Vera Schmitt, Nils Feldhus

entry.summary: Studies how persona prompting affects LLM rationales for hate speech detection. Finds PP can improve classification alignment with specific demographic groups but effects vary by model and persona.

entry.title: BLENDER: Blended Text Embeddings and Diffusion Residuals for Intra-Class Image Synthesis in Deep Metric Learning

author.name: Jan Niklas Kolf, Ozan Tezcan, Justin Theiss, Hyung Jun Kim, Wentao Bao, Bhargav Bhushanam, Khushi Gupta, Arun Kejariwal, Naser Damer, Fadi Boutros

entry.summary: Introduces BLENDER, a diffusion sampling method using set-theory inspired union and intersection operations on denoising residuals to increase intra-class diversity for deep metric learning.

entry.title: RAW-Flow: Advancing RGB-to-RAW Image Reconstruction with Deterministic Latent Flow Matching

author.name: Zhen Liu, Diedong Feng, Hai Jiang, Liaoyuan Zeng, Hao Wang, Chaoyu Feng, Lei Lei, Bing Zeng, Shuaicheng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes RAW-Flow, reformulating RGB-to-RAW reconstruction as deterministic latent transport using flow matching, addressing detail inconsistency and color deviation in inverse ISP modeling.

entry.title: IOTA: Corrective Knowledge-Guided Prompt Learning via Black-White Box Framework

author.name: Shaokun Wang, Yifan Yu, Yuhang He, Weili Guan, Yihong Gong

entry.summary: Proposes IOTA, a black-white box prompt learning framework that integrates data-driven optimization with knowledge-driven corrective knowledge derived from contrasting wrong predictions with correct cognition.

entry.title: Learning From a Steady Hand: A Weakly Supervised Agent for Robot Assistance under Microscopy

author.name: Huanyu Tian, Martin Huber, Lingyun Zeng, Zhe Han, Wayne Bennett, Giuseppe Silvestri, Gerardo Mendizabal-Ruiz, Tom Vercauteren, Alejandro Chavez-Badiola, Christos Bergeles

entry.summary: Presents a weakly supervised framework for robot assistance under microscopy using calibration-aware perception from warm-up trajectories, achieving ~49Î¼m lateral accuracy without manual depth annotation.

entry.title: GuideAI: A Real-time Personalized Learning Solution with Adaptive Interventions

entry.title: GDCNet: Generative Discrepancy Comparison Network for Multimodal Sarcasm Detection

entry.title: Research Summary: January 28, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research spans AI security capabilities, safety empirics, and deep learning theory. AISLE's AI discovered all 12 OpenSSL zero-days, a landmark demonstration of automated vulnerability detection at a critical scale.

  • Disempowerment study analyzes 1.5M Claude conversations, finding severe disempowerment in <0.1% of interactionsâfirst large-scale empirical safety research of this kind
  • Surgical sycophancy correction identifies the 3% of neurons responsible and removes the behavior while preserving capabilities via sparse autoencoders
  • Thought-Transfer (Google) reveals CoT reasoning models are vulnerable to indirect targeted poisoning attacks

Theoretical advances include the first rigorous grokking bounds in ridge regression and a proof that deep networks learn Random Hierarchy Models through hierarchical feature composition. Keel revives Post-LayerNorm by replacing residual paths with Legendre polynomials for stable training at depth. Differential voting connects RLHF reward aggregation to social choice theory, deriving loss functions satisfying specific voting axioms. VP-RL addresses PRM-RL mismatch by penalizing only from the first incorrect reasoning step.

entry.title: AI found 12 of 12 OpenSSL zero-days (while curl cancelled its bug bounty)

author.name: Stanislav Fort

entry.summary: Reports that AISLE's AI system discovered all 12 newly announced OpenSSL zero-day vulnerabilities. Demonstrates AI-based cybersecurity capabilities at unprecedented scale while curl's bug bounty was cancelled due to AI spam.

entry.title: Who's in Charge? Disempowerment Patterns in Real-World LLM Usage

author.name: Mrinank Sharma, Miles McCain, Raymond Douglas, David Duvenaud

entry.summary: First large-scale empirical analysis of disempowerment patterns in 1.5M Claude.ai conversations, finding severe disempowerment occurs in <0.1% of conversations with substantially higher rates in relationship-focused interactions.

entry.title: A Few Bad Neurons: Isolating and Surgically Correcting Sycophancy

author.name: Claire O'Brien, Jessica Seto, Dristi Roy, Aditya Dwivedi, Sunishchal Dev, Kevin Zhu, Sean O'Brien, Ashwinee Panda, Ryan Lagasse

entry.summary: Proposes surgical approach to fixing sycophancy in LLMs by identifying the 3% of neurons most responsible using sparse autoencoders and linear probes, then fine-tuning only those neurons with gradient masking.

entry.title: Visual Generation Unlocks Human-Like Reasoning through Multimodal World Models

author.name: Jialong Wu, Xiaoying Zhang, Hongyi Yuan, Xiangcheng Zhang, Tianhao Huang, Changjing He, Chaoyi Deng, Renrui Zhang, Youbin Wu, Mingsheng Long

entry.summary: Argues that visual generation capabilities unlock human-like reasoning through multimodal world models, enabling better performance in physical and spatial intelligence domains where verbal reasoning alone is insufficient.

entry.title: Save the Good Prefix: Precise Error Penalization via Process-Supervised RL to Enhance LLM Reasoning

author.name: Haolin Liu, Dian Yu, Sidi Lu, Yujun Zhou, Rui Liu, Zhenwen Liang, Haitao Mi, Chen-Yu Wei, Dong Yu

entry.summary: Proposes Verifiable Process-Supervised RL (VP-RL) that uses PRMs to detect first incorrect step and penalizes only from that point onward, bridging gap between PRM evaluation (error detection) and RL usage (raw rewards).

entry.title: Post-LayerNorm Is Back: Stable, ExpressivE, and Deep

author.name: Chen Chen, Lai Wei

entry.summary: Revisits Post-LayerNorm transformers which were abandoned due to training instability, proposing 'Keel' which replaces ResNet-style residual paths with Highway-style connections. Claims to solve the gradient vanishing problem enabling reliable training at extreme depths with superior expressivity.

entry.title: My favourite version of an international AGI project

author.name: wdmacaskill

entry.summary: Will MacAskill outlines proposal for international AGI development project giving non-US countries meaningful but circumscribed influence over key decisions. Modeled on Intelsat's international collaboration structure.

entry.title: Out-of-Distribution Generalization for Neural Physics Solvers

author.name: Zhao Wei, Chin Chun Ooi, Jian Cheng Wong, Abhishek Gupta, Pao-Hsiung Chiu, Yew-Soon Ong

entry.summary: Introduces NOVA for generalizable neural physics solvers achieving 1-2 orders of magnitude lower out-of-distribution errors by learning physics-aligned representations from sparse initial scenarios.

entry.title: Differential Voting: Loss Functions For Axiomatically Diverse Aggregation of Heterogeneous Preferences

author.name: Zhiyu An, Duaa Nakshbandi, Wan Du

entry.summary: Introduces differential voting framework connecting RLHF aggregation mechanisms to voting theory, deriving loss functions that satisfy different axiomatic properties beyond the default BTL/Borda count approach.

entry.title: GAVEL: Towards rule-based safety through activation monitoring

author.name: Shir Rozenfeld, Rahul Pankajakshan, Itay Zloczower, Eyal Lenga, Gilad Gressel, Yisroel Mirsky

entry.summary: Introduces GAVEL for rule-based activation safety, modeling activations as composable cognitive elements (CEs) like 'making a threat' and 'payment processing' inspired by cybersecurity rule-sharing practices.

entry.title: Axe: A Simple Unified Layout Abstraction for Machine Learning Compilers

author.name: Bohan Hou, Hongyi Jin, Guanjie Wang, Jinqi Chen, Yaxing Cai, Lijie Yang, Zihao Ye, Yaoyao Ding, Ruihang Lai, Tianqi Chen

entry.summary: Presents Axe Layout from Tianqi Chen's group, a hardware-aware abstraction mapping logical tensor coordinates to multi-axis physical space, unifying tiling, sharding, and replication across device meshes.

entry.title: LLM-VA: Resolving the Jailbreak-Overrefusal Trade-off via Vector Alignment

author.name: Haonan Zhang, Dongxia Wang, Yi Liu, Kexin Chen, Wenhai Wang

entry.summary: Proposes LLM-VA that aligns answer vectors with benign vectors through closed-form weight updates to resolve the jailbreak-overrefusal trade-off without fine-tuning.

entry.title: When Iterative RAG Beats Ideal Evidence: A Diagnostic Study in Scientific Multi-hop Question Answering

author.name: Mahdi Astaraki, Mohammad Arshi Saloot, Ali Shiraee Kasmaee, Hamidreza Mahyar, Soheila Samiee

entry.summary: First controlled diagnostic study showing iterative RAG can outperform providing all oracle evidence at once in scientific multi-hop QA. Benchmarks 11 SOTA LLMs under No Context, Gold Context, and Iterative RAG regimes.

entry.title: Provable Learning of Random Hierarchy Models and Hierarchical Shallow-to-Deep Chaining

author.name: Yunwei Ren, Yatin Dandi, Florent Krzakala, Jason D. Lee

entry.summary: Proves that deep networks trained by gradient methods can efficiently learn Random Hierarchy Models, demonstrating provable hierarchical learning separating deep from shallow networks.

entry.title: To Grok Grokking: Provable Grokking in Ridge Regression

author.name: Mingyue Xu, Gal Vardi, Itay Safran

entry.summary: Proves end-to-end grokking in ridge regression: overfitting, delayed poor generalization, then eventual generalization. Shows grokking can be amplified or eliminated through hyperparameter tuning.

entry.title: Thought-Transfer: Indirect Targeted Poisoning Attacks on Chain-of-Thought Reasoning Models

author.name: Harsh Chaudhari, Ethan Rathbum, Hanna Foerster, Jamie Hayes, Matthew Jagielski, Milad Nasr, Ilia Shumailov, Alina Oprea

entry.summary: Reveals vulnerability in Chain-of-Thought reasoning models to indirect targeted poisoning attacks that manipulate responses without explicit triggered queries with flawed reasoning in training data. Attacks the reasoning traces themselves.

entry.title: Thoughts on Claude's Constitution

author.name: Boaz Barak

entry.summary: Boaz Barak (OpenAI alignment team) compares Claude's Constitution to OpenAI's Model Spec. Notes Claude's document emphasizes foundational character/values while Model Spec focuses on principles with specific authorities.

entry.title: Agentic Design Patterns: A System-Theoretic Framework

author.name: Minh-Dung Dao, Quy Minh Le, Hoang Thanh Lam, Duc-Trong Le, Quoc-Viet Pham, Barry O'Sullivan, Hoang D. Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes a system-theoretic framework for agentic AI design, deconstructing systems into five functional subsystems (Reasoning & World Model, Memory, Tools, etc.) to provide principled engineering methodology.

entry.title: FROST: Filtering Reasoning Outliers with Attention for Efficient Reasoning

author.name: Haozheng Luo, Zhuolin Jiang, Md Zahid Hasan, Yan Chen, Soumalya Sarkar

entry.summary: Proposes FROST, an attention-aware method that prunes uncritical reasoning paths as 'reasoning outliers', achieving 69.68% token reduction and 26.70% performance improvement over baselines.

entry.title: Benchmarks Saturate When The Model Gets Smarter Than The Judge

author.name: Marthe Ballon, Andres Algaba, Brecht Verbeken, Vincent Ginis

entry.summary: Presents Omni-MATH-2, a manually revised benchmark with 4,181 clean exact-answer problems and 247 tagged non-standard problems, arguing that benchmarks saturate when models outperform evaluation mechanisms.

entry.title: Selective Steering: Norm-Preserving Control Through Discriminative Layer Selection

author.name: Quy-Anh Dang, Chris Ngo

entry.summary: Proposes Selective Steering for LLM safety that addresses limitations of activation steering methods through discriminative layer selection and norm preservation.

entry.title: DART: Diffusion-Inspired Speculative Decoding for Fast LLM Inference

author.name: Fuliang Liu, Xue Li, Ketai Zhao, Yinxi Gao, Ziyan Zhou, Zhonghui Zhang, Zhibin Wang, Wanchun Dou, Sheng Zhong, Chen Tian

entry.summary: Proposes DART, diffusion-inspired speculative decoding that predicts logits for multiple masked positions in parallel within single forward pass. Eliminates autoregressive rollouts in draft model while preserving lightweight design.

entry.title: Beyond In-Domain Detection: SpikeScore for Cross-Domain Hallucination Detection

author.name: Yongxin Deng, Zhen Fang, Yixuan Li, Ling Chen

entry.summary: Addresses generalizable hallucination detection (GHD) by discovering that hallucination-initiated multi-turn dialogues show larger uncertainty fluctuations (spikes), proposing SpikeScore metric that generalizes across domains.

entry.title: Randomization Boosts KV Caching, Learning Balances Query Load: A Joint Perspective

author.name: Fangzhou Wu (Richard), Sandeep Silwal (Richard), Qiuyi (Richard), Zhang

entry.summary: Provides first unified mathematical model for KV cache eviction and query routing tradeoffs in multi-LLM serving, revealing theoretical limitations and deriving principled algorithms integrating randomization and learning.

entry.title: Group Distributionally Robust Optimization-Driven Reinforcement Learning for LLM Reasoning

author.name: Kishan Panaganti, Zhenwen Liang, Wenhao Yu, Haitao Mi, Dong Yu

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-Adversary Group Distributionally Robust Optimization (GDRO) for LLM reasoning that dynamically adapts training to heterogeneous, heavy-tailed reasoning data rather than uniform sampling.

entry.title: When Benchmarks Leak: Inference-Time Decontamination for LLMs

author.name: Jianzhe Chai, Yu Zhe, Jun Sakuma

entry.summary: Proposes inference-time decontamination for LLMs that preserves benchmark integrity while suppressing contaminated behavior without interfering with normal inference.

entry.title: Fixed Aggregation Features Can Rival GNNs

author.name: Celia Rubio-Madrigal, Rebekka Burkholz

entry.summary: Challenges GNN necessity by showing Fixed Aggregation Features (FAFs) with tabular methods rival or outperform SOTA GNNs on 12/14 benchmarks, often using only mean aggregation.

entry.title: Neural Neural Scaling Laws

author.name: Michael Y. Hu, Jane Pan, Ayush Rajesh Jhaveri, Nicholas Lourie, Kyunghyun Cho

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Neural Scaling Laws (NeuNeu) predicting downstream task performance using neural networks for time-series extrapolation, addressing diverse scaling behaviors beyond aggregate metrics.

entry.title: Self-Distillation Enables Continual Learning

author.name: Idan Shenfeld, Mehul Damani, Jonas H\"ubotter, Pulkit Agrawal

entry.summary: Introduces Self-Distillation Fine-Tuning (SDFT) for continual learning in foundation models, using in-context learning to create on-policy training signals from demonstrations. Enables learning new skills while preserving prior capabilities without explicit reward functions.

entry.title: Malicious Repurposing of Open Science Artefacts by Using Large Language Models

author.name: Zahra Hashemi, Zhiqiang Zhong, Jun Pang, Wei Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces pipeline for malicious repurposing of open science artifacts (datasets, methods, tools) using LLMs via persuasion-based jailbreaking. Demonstrates risks of LLMs identifying vulnerabilities in NLP papers for harmful research.

entry.title: The Claude Constitutionâs Ethical Framework

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Zvi's detailed analysis of Claude Constitution's virtue ethics approach. Argues the focus on character and values rather than rules is a wise choice for AI alignment that mirrors effective human ethical development.

entry.title: Representational Homomorphism Predicts and Improves Compositional Generalization In Transformer Language Model

author.name: Zhiyu An, Wan Du

entry.summary: Introduces Homomorphism Error metric to quantify deviations from approximate homomorphisms between expression algebra and model representations, showing it predicts and improves compositional generalization.

entry.title: Pixel-Grounded Retrieval for Knowledgeable Large Multimodal Models

author.name: Jeonghwan Kim, Renjie Tao, Sanat Sharma, Jiaqi Wang, Kai Sun, Zhaojiang Lin, Seungwhan Moon, Lambert Mathias, Anuj Kumar, Heng Ji, Xin Luna Dong

entry.summary: Proposes PixSearch, an end-to-end segmenting LMM that unifies region-level perception with retrieval-augmented reasoning, generating pixel-level masks as visual queries without modular pipelines.

entry.title: RPO:Reinforcement Fine-Tuning with Partial Reasoning Optimization

author.name: Hongzhu Yi, Xinming Wang, Zhenghao zhang, Tianyu Zong, Yuanxiang Wang, Jun Xie, Tao Yu, Haopeng Jin, Zhepeng Wang, Kaixin Xu, Feng Chen, Jiahuan Chen, Yujia Yang, Zhenyu Guan, Bingkang Shi, Jungang Xu

entry.summary: Proposes RPO (Partial Reasoning Optimization), a plug-and-play RL fine-tuning algorithm that trains on reasoning path suffixes rather than full trajectories, reducing computational overhead during the rollout phase.

entry.title: LLMs versus the Halting Problem: Revisiting Program Termination Prediction

author.name: Oren Sultan, Jordi Armengol-Estape, Pascal Kesseli, Julien Vanegue, Dafna Shahaf, Yossi Adi, Peter O'Hearn

entry.summary: Evaluates LLMs on program termination prediction using benchmarks from the International Competition on Software Verification, connecting foundational CS theory to modern LLM capabilities.

entry.title: SHIELD: An Auto-Healing Agentic Defense Framework for LLM Resource Exhaustion Attacks

author.name: Nirhoshan Sivaroopan, Kanchana Thilakarathna, Albert Zomaya, Manu, Yi Guo, Jo Plested, Tim Lynar, Jack Yang, Wangli Yang

entry.summary: Proposes SHIELD, a multi-agent auto-healing defense framework against LLM resource exhaustion (sponge) attacks with self-updating knowledge base and prompt optimization.

entry.title: Innovator-VL: A Multimodal Large Language Model for Scientific Discovery

author.name: Zichen Wen, Boxue Yang, Shuang Chen, Yaojie Zhang, Yuhang Han, Junlong Ke, Cong Wang, Yicheng Fu, Jiawang Zhao, Jiangchao Yao, Xi Fang, Zhen Wang, Henxing Cai, Lin Yao, Zhifeng Gao, Yanhui Hong, Nang Yuan, Yixuan Li, Guojiang Zhao, Haoyi Tao, Nan Wang, Han Lyu, Guolin Ke, Ning Liao, Xiaoxing Wang, Kai Chen, Zhiyu Li, Feiyu Xiong, Sihan Hu, Kun Chen, Yanfeng Wang, Weinan E, Linfeng Zhang, Linfeng Zhang

entry.summary: Presents Innovator-VL, a scientific multimodal LLM with fully transparent, reproducible training pipeline covering data collection through evaluation, reducing data requirements through principled design.

entry.title: Revisiting Parameter Server in LLM Post-Training

author.name: Xinyi Wan, Penghui Qi, Guangxing Huang, Chaoyi Ruan, Min Lin, Jialin Li

entry.summary: Proposes On-Demand Communication (ODC) adapting parameter server paradigm to FSDP for handling imbalanced workloads in LLM post-training caused by variable sequence lengths.

entry.title: Safe Exploration via Policy Priors

author.name: Manuel Wendl, Yarden As, Manish Prajapat, Anton Pollak, Stelian Coros, Andreas Krause

entry.summary: Proposes SOOPER for safe RL exploration using conservative policy priors, with provable safety guarantees throughout learning and bounded cumulative regret.

entry.title: R^3: Replay, Reflection, and Ranking Rewards for LLM Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhizheng Jiang, Kang Zhao, Weikai Xu, Xinkui Lin, Wei Liu, Jian Luan, Shuo Shang, Peng Han

entry.summary: Proposes RÂ³ for LLM reinforcement learning with cross-context replay, self-reflection, and ranking rewards to address advantage collapse in group-based policy optimization.

entry.title: RvB: Automating AI System Hardening via Iterative Red-Blue Games

author.name: Lige Huang, Zicheng Liu, Jie Zhang, Lewen Yan, Dongrui Liu, Jing Shao

entry.summary: Proposes RvB (Red vs Blue) framework formulating AI system hardening as training-free sequential game where red team attacks drive blue team to learn defensive principles.

entry.title: How Is Uncertainty Propagated in Knowledge Distillation?

author.name: Ziyao Cui, Jian Pei

entry.summary: Systematically studies uncertainty propagation through knowledge distillation across linear regression, neural networks, and LLMs, distinguishing inter-student and intra-student uncertainty and proposing corrections.

entry.title: On the Expressiveness of State Space Models via Temporal Logics

author.name: Eric Alsmann, Lowejatan Noori, Martin Lange

entry.summary: Investigates expressive power of State Space Models through temporal logic, showing capabilities vary substantially with gating mechanism. Distinguishes between fixed-width arithmetic (regular languages) and unbounded precision (counting properties).

entry.title: Automated Safety Benchmarking: A Multi-agent Pipeline for LVLMs

author.name: Xiangyang Zhu, Yuan Tian, Zicheng Zhang, Qi Jia, Chunyi Li, Renrui Zhang, Heng Li, Zongrui Wang, Wei Sun

entry.summary: Proposes VLSafetyBencher, first automated system for LVLM safety benchmarking using four collaborative agents. Addresses limitations of static benchmarks that fail to keep pace with evolving models and risks.

entry.title: Identifying and Transferring Reasoning-Critical Neurons: Improving LLM Inference Reliability via Activation Steering

author.name: Fangan Dong, Zuming Yan, Xuri Ge, Zhiwei Xu, Mengqi Zhang, Xuanang Chen, Ben He, Xin Xin, Zhumin Chen, Ying Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes AdaRAS framework identifying Reasoning-Critical Neurons (RCNs) in LLMs and adaptively steering activations during inference to improve reasoning reliability. Lightweight test-time intervention without post-training.

entry.title: Clarifying how our AI timelines forecasts have changed since AI 2027

author.name: elifland

entry.summary: Clarifies AI 2027 authors' views on AI timelines following media misrepresentation. Emphasizes continued uncertainty about AGI timing while noting evolution of forecasting models and methodology.

entry.title: GUIGuard: Toward a General Framework for Privacy-Preserving GUI Agents

author.name: Yanxi Wang, Zhiling Zhang, Wenbo Zhou, Weiming Zhang, Jie Zhang, Qiannan Zhu, Yu Shi, Shuxin Zheng, Jiyan He

entry.summary: Proposes GUIGuard, a three-stage framework (privacy recognition, protection, task execution) for privacy-preserving GUI agents, with GUIGuard-Bench benchmark of 630 trajectories across platforms.

entry.title: FloydNet: A Learning Paradigm for Global Relational Reasoning

author.name: Jingcheng Yu, Mingliang Zeng, Qiwei Ye

entry.summary: Introduces FloydNet, an architecture for global relational reasoning based on dynamic programming rather than local message passing, maintaining global all-pairs relationship tensors with learned DP operators.

entry.title: Neural Theorem Proving for Verification Conditions: A Real-World Benchmark

author.name: Qiyuan Xu, Xiaokun Luan, Renxi Wang, Joshua Ong Jun Leang, Peixin Wang, Haonan Li, Wenda Li, Conrad Watt

entry.summary: Creates first benchmark specifically targeting Neural Theorem Proving for Verification Conditions in program verification, addressing a critical bottleneck where automated provers fail and manual proofs are required.

entry.title: The Geometric Reasoner: Manifold-Informed Latent Foresight Search for Long-Context Reasoning

author.name: Ren Zhuang, Ben Wang, Shuifa Sun

entry.summary: Introduces The Geometric Reasoner (TGR), a training-free framework for long chain-of-thought reasoning using manifold-informed latent foresight search with chunk-wise KV cache resets for linear memory.

entry.title: Principled Fine-tuning of LLMs from User-Edits: A Medley of Preference, Supervision, and Reward

author.name: Dipendra Misra, Aldo Pacchiano, Ta-Chung Chi, Ge Gao

entry.summary: Provides theoretical investigation of learning from user edits in LLM fine-tuning, unifying preference, supervised, and reward feedback types and deriving bounds showing different algorithms have complementary strengths.

entry.title: Detecting and Correcting Hallucinations in LLM-Generated Code via Deterministic AST Analysis

author.name: Dipin Khati, Daniel Rodriguez-Cardenas, Paul Pantzer, Denys Poshyvanyk

entry.summary: Proposes a deterministic AST-based framework to detect and auto-correct code hallucinations (Knowledge Conflicting Hallucinations) in LLM-generated code by validating against a dynamically-built knowledge base via library introspection.

entry.title: StableQAT: Stable Quantization-Aware Training at Ultra-Low Bitwidths

author.name: Tianyi Chen, Sihan Chen, Xiaoyi Qu, Dan Zhao, Ruomei Yan, Jongwoo Ko, Luming Liang, Pashmina Cameron

entry.summary: Introduces StableQAT using a novel surrogate for backpropagation derived from discrete Fourier analysis of rounding operator, enabling stable quantization-aware training at ultra-low bitwidths.

entry.title: From Atoms to Chains: Divergence-Guided Reasoning Curriculum for Unlabeled LLM Domain Adaptation

author.name: Yongqi Wang, Xiaofeng Ji, Jie Wang, Qingbin Li, Xiao Xiong, Zheming Yang, Jian Xu, Minghui Qiu, Xinxiao Wu

entry.summary: Proposes Divergence-Guided Reasoning Curriculum (DGRC) for adapting LLMs to domains without labeled data by decomposing complex problems into atomic sub-problems where LLMs show high fidelity.

entry.title: Speed is Confidence

author.name: Joshua V. Dillon

entry.summary: Proposes using first-to-halt prediction in TRM ensembles as implicit confidence measure, achieving 97.2% on Sudoku-Extreme with 10x less compute than test-time augmentation.

entry.title: Native LLM and MLLM Inference at Scale on Apple Silicon

author.name: Wayner Barrios

entry.summary: Presents vllm-mlx for efficient LLM/MLLM inference on Apple Silicon, achieving 21-87% higher throughput than llama.cpp with continuous batching and content-based prefix caching for multimodal.

entry.title: Smoothing the Score Function for Generalization in Diffusion Models: An Optimization-based Explanation Framework

author.name: Xinyu Zhou, Jiawei Zhang, Stephen J. Wright

entry.summary: Develops theoretical framework explaining diffusion model memorization as weighted softmax over Gaussian score functions, showing neural network approximation smooths this and improves generalization.

entry.title: GraphDLG: Exploring Deep Leakage from Gradients in Federated Graph Learning

author.name: Shuyue Wei, Wantong Chen, Tongyu Wei, Chen Gong, Yongxin Tong, Lizhen Cui

entry.summary: First analysis of deep leakage from gradients in federated graph learning, showing graph structure recovery enables node feature extraction, proposing GraphDLG attack.

entry.title: Calibration without Ground Truth

author.name: Yuqing Kong, Mingyu Song, Yizhou Wang, Yifan Wu

entry.summary: Proposes label-free post-processing framework improving miscalibrated models using weaker but better-calibrated reference, guaranteeing strict improvement under any proper loss when models aren't mutually calibrated.

entry.title: How Do Transformers Learn to Associate Tokens: Gradient Leading Terms Bring Mechanistic Interpretability

author.name: Shawn Im, Changdae Oh, Zhen Fang, Sharon Li

entry.summary: Analyzes how semantic associations (e.g., 'bird'-'flew') emerge in attention-based language models through training dynamics. Derives closed-form expressions for weights at early training stages explaining association learning.

entry.title: Flatter Tokens are More Valuable for Speculative Draft Model Training

author.name: Jiaming Fan, Daming Cao, Xiangzhong Luo, Jiale Fu, Chonghan Liu, Xu Yang

entry.summary: Proposes data-centric approach to speculative decoding draft model training. Shows tokens with flatter target model distributions are more valuable, introduces flatness metric and dataset distillation approach SFDD.

entry.title: MetaGen: Self-Evolving Roles and Topologies for Multi-Agent LLM Reasoning

author.name: Yimeng Wang, Jiaxing Zhao, Hongbin Xie, Hexing Ma, Yuzhen Lei, Shuangxue Liu, Xuan Song, Zichen Zhang, Haoran Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces MetaGen, training-free framework that adapts both role space and collaboration topology of multi-agent LLM systems at inference time. Generates query-conditioned role specifications and rewrites them during reasoning.

entry.title: Towards Pixel-Level VLM Perception via Simple Points Prediction

author.name: Tianhui Song, Haoyu Lu, Hao Yang, Lin Sui, Haoning Wu, Zaida Zhou, Zhiqi Huang, Yiping Bao, Y. Charles, Xinyu Zhou, Limin Wang

entry.summary: Presents SimpleSeg, enabling MLLMs to perform pixel-level segmentation by predicting point sequences as text coordinates. Uses SFâRL training pipeline with IoU-based rewards, demonstrating inherent low-level perception capacity of standard MLLMs without specialized architecture.

entry.title: PROTEUS: SLA-Aware Routing via Lagrangian RL for Multi-LLM Serving Systems

author.name: Amit Singh Bhatti, Vishal Vaddina, Dagnachew Birru

entry.summary: Presents PROTEUS, an LLM router that accepts accuracy targets directly as runtime input using Lagrangian dual control, allowing operators to specify SLAs rather than tuning opaque parameters.

entry.title: Reducing False Positives in Static Bug Detection with LLMs: An Empirical Study in Industry

author.name: Xueying Du, Jiayi Feng, Yi Zou, Wei Xu, Jie Ma, Wei Zhang, Sisi Liu, Xin Peng, Yiling Lou

entry.summary: First comprehensive industrial study at Tencent on using LLMs to reduce false positives in static bug detection, finding effective techniques for enterprise-scale code review with practical deployment insights.

entry.title: MAGNET: Towards Adaptive GUI Agents with Memory-Driven Knowledge Evolution

author.name: Libo Sun, Jiwen Zhang, Siyuan Wang, Zhongyu Wei

entry.summary: Proposes MAGNET, a memory-driven framework for GUI agents that handles UI changes through dual-level memory: stationary memory linking visual features to functional semantics, and procedural memory capturing task intents across workflows.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning for Quantum Technology

author.name: Marin Bukov, Florian Marquardt

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on reinforcement learning for quantum technology covering state preparation, gate optimization, circuit design, and variational eigensolvers, aimed at physics readership.

entry.title: One Token Is Enough: Improving Diffusion Language Models with a Sink Token

author.name: Zihou Zhang, Zheyong Xie, Li Zhong, Haifeng Liu, Shaosheng Cao

entry.summary: Identifies 'moving sink phenomenon' in diffusion language models and proposes simple extra sink token to resolve instability in parallel text generation.

entry.title: More at Stake: How Payoff and Language Shape LLM Agent Strategies in Cooperation Dilemmas

author.name: Trung-Kiet Huynh, Dao-Sy Duy-Minh, Thanh-Bang Cao, Phong-Hao Le, Hong-Dan Nguyen, Nguyen Lam Phu Quy, Minh-Luan Nguyen-Vo, Hong-Phat Pham, Pham Phu Hoa, Thien-Kim Than, Chi-Nguyen Tran, Huy Tran, Gia-Thoai Tran-Le, Alessio Buscemi, Le Hong Trang, The Anh Han

entry.summary: Investigates how payoff magnitude and linguistic context influence LLM strategic behavior in repeated social dilemmas using Prisoner's Dilemma experiments. Uses supervised classifiers to reveal model- and language-dependent behavioral patterns.

entry.title: CanaryBench: Stress Testing Privacy Leakage in Cluster-Level Conversation Summaries

author.name: Deep Mehta

entry.summary: Introduces CanaryBench, a stress test for privacy leakage in cluster-level conversation summaries using planted secret strings (canaries) to detect if PII or traceable content appears in aggregate analytics.

entry.title: AgenticSCR: An Autonomous Agentic Secure Code Review for Immature Vulnerabilities Detection

author.name: Wachiraphan Charoenwet, Kla Tantithamthavorn, Patanamon Thongtanunam, Hong Yi Lin, Minwoo Jeong, Ming Wu

entry.summary: Introduces AgenticSCR, an autonomous agentic system for secure code review at pre-commit stage that combines LLMs with tool invocation and code navigation to detect immature vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Sim-and-Human Co-training for Data-Efficient and Generalizable Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Kaipeng Fang, Weiqing Liang, Yuyang Li, Ji Zhang, Pengpeng Zeng, Lianli Gao, Jingkuan Song, Heng Tao Shen

entry.summary: Proposes SimHum co-training framework combining simulated robot actions (for kinematic prior) with real-world human observations (for visual prior) for data-efficient robot learning.

entry.title: Explicit Multi-head Attention for Inter-head Interaction in Large Language Models

author.name: Runyu Peng, Yunhua Zhou, Demin Song, Kai Lv, Bo Wang, Qipeng Guo, Xipeng Qiu

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-head Explicit Attention (MEA) that explicitly models cross-head interaction through learnable linear combinations, improving pretraining robustness and allowing larger learning rates.

entry.title: Up to 36x Speedup: Mask-based Parallel Inference Paradigm for Key Information Extraction in MLLMs

author.name: Xinzhong Wang, Ya Guo, Jing Li, Huan Chen, Yi Tu, Yijie Hong, Gongshen Liu, Huijia Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces PIP, a parallel inference paradigm for key information extraction using mask tokens as placeholders, achieving up to 36x speedup for document understanding.

entry.title: LVLMs and Humans Ground Differently in Referential Communication

author.name: Peter Zeng, Weiling Li, Amie Paige, Zhengxiang Wang, Panagiotis Kaliosis, Dimitris Samaras, Gregory Zelinsky, Susan Brennan, Owen Rambow

entry.summary: Compares how humans and LVLMs establish common ground in referential communication tasks across human-human, human-AI, and AI-AI pairs. Releases a corpus of 356 dialogues revealing significant limitations in AI collaborative grounding.

entry.title: GraIP: A Benchmarking Framework For Neural Graph Inverse Problems

author.name: Semih Cant\"urk, Andrei Manolache, Arman Mielke, Chendi Qian, Antoine Siraudin, Christopher Morris, Mathias Niepert, Guy Wolf

entry.summary: Introduces GraIP, a conceptual framework formalizing diverse graph learning tasks (structure discovery, temporal analysis, combinatorial optimization) as neural graph inverse problems.

entry.title: Is Finer Better? The Limits of Microscaling Formats in Large Language Models

author.name: Andrea Fasoli, Monodeep Kar, Chi-Chun Liu, Swagath Venkataramani, Viji Srinivasan, Leland Chang, Naigang Wang

entry.summary: Investigates surprising behavior where microscaling quantization accuracy degrades when block size decreases below a threshold, contrary to expectation that smaller blocks enable better representation.

entry.title: OATS: Online Data Augmentation for Time Series Foundation Models

author.name: Junwei Deng, Chang Xu, Jiaqi W. Ma, Ming Jin, Chenghao Liu, Jiang Bian

entry.summary: Proposes OATS, a principled online data augmentation strategy for time series foundation models that dynamically generates synthetic data conditioned on valuable training samples at each step.

entry.title: EPAS: Efficient Training with Progressive Activation Sharing

author.name: Rezaul Karim, Maryam Dialameh, Yang Liu, Boxing Chen, Walid Ahmed

entry.summary: Introduces EPAS that bridges progressive training with redundant activation sharing across transformer layers, gradually growing sharing region from deep to shallow during training for efficiency.

entry.title: OWLEYE: Zero-Shot Learner for Cross-Domain Graph Data Anomaly Detection

author.name: Lecheng Zheng, Dongqi Fu, Zihao Li, Jingrui He

entry.summary: Proposes OWLEYE, a zero-shot learner for cross-domain graph anomaly detection addressing challenges of different feature semantics and dimensions across domains.

entry.title: GenCP: Towards Generative Modeling Paradigm of Coupled Physics

author.name: Tianrun Gao, Haoren Zheng, Wenhao Deng, Haodong Feng, Tao Zhang, Ruiqi Feng, Qianyi Chen, Tailin Wu

entry.summary: Proposes GenCP for coupled multiphysics simulation formulating it as probability modeling, enabling training on decoupled data and inferring coupled physics through iterative generative modeling.

entry.title: The Geometric Mechanics of Contrastive Representation Learning: Alignment Potentials, Entropic Dispersion, and Cross-Modal Divergence

author.name: Yichao Cai, Zhen Zhang, Yuhang Liu, Javen Qinfeng Shi

entry.summary: Presents measure-theoretic framework for contrastive learning modeling as evolution of representation measures, revealing geometric bifurcation between unimodal and multimodal regimes.

entry.title: Scalable Exploration for High-Dimensional Continuous Control via Value-Guided Flow

author.name: Yunyue Wei, Chenhui Zuo, Yanan Sui

entry.summary: Introduces Qflex for high-dimensional continuous control using value-guided flow for exploration, avoiding dimensionality reduction that constrains policy expressiveness.

entry.title: The Effect of Architecture During Continual Learning

author.name: Allyson Hahn, Krishnan Raghavan

entry.summary: Introduces mathematical framework jointly modeling architecture and weights in Sobolev space for continual learning, proving learning weights alone is insufficient to prevent forgetting.

entry.title: Convergence of Muon with Newton-Schulz

author.name: Gyu Yeol Kim, Min-hwan Oh

entry.summary: Proves convergence of Muon optimizer with Newton-Schulz orthogonalization (as used in practice) matches SVD-polar idealization up to a constant factor. Shows constant converges to 1 doubly exponentially in Newton-Schulz steps.

entry.title: Optimizing Conversational Quality in Spoken Dialogue Systems with Reinforcement Learning from AI Feedback

author.name: Siddhant Arora, Jinchuan Tian, Jiatong Shi, Hayato Futami, Yosuke Kashiwagi, Emiru Tsunoo, Shinji Watanabe

entry.summary: Proposes first multi-reward RLAIF framework for spoken dialogue systems combining semantic, audio-quality, and emotion-consistency rewards. Addresses multi-dimensional conversational quality beyond single semantic rewards.

entry.title: Do Images Speak Louder than Words? Investigating the Effect of Textual Misinformation in VLMs

author.name: Chi Zhang, Wenxuan Ding, Jiale Liu, Mingrui Wu, Qingyun Wu, Ray Mooney

entry.summary: Creates CONTEXT-VQA dataset with systematically generated persuasive prompts conflicting with visual evidence to test VLM robustness. Evaluates how VLMs arbitrate between contradictory textual and visual information.

entry.title: Youtu-VL: Unleashing Visual Potential via Unified Vision-Language Supervision

author.name: Zhixiang Wei, Yi Li, Zhehan Kan, Xinghua Jiang, Zuwei Long, Shifeng Liu, Hongze Shen, Wei Liu, Xiaoyu Tan, Haojia Lin, Yubo Zhu, Qianyu Li, Di Yin, Haoyu Cao, Weibo Gu, Xin Li, Yinsong Liu, Deqiang Jiang, Xing Sun, Yunsheng Wu, Mingkong Tang, Shuangyin Liu, Lexiang Tang, Haodong Lin, Junru Lu, Jiarui Qin, Lingfeng Qiao, Ruizhi Qiao, Bo Ke, Jianfeng He, Ke Li, Yangning Li, Yunhang Shen, Mengdan Zhang, Peixian Chen, Kun Yin, Bing Liu, Yunfei Wu, Huang Chen, Zhongpeng Cai, Xiaotian Li

entry.summary: Introduces Youtu-VL with Vision-Language Unified Autoregressive Supervision (VLUAS) paradigm shifting from 'vision-as-input' to 'vision-as-target'. Integrates visual tokens directly as supervision targets.

entry.title: AC^2-VLA: Action-Context-Aware Adaptive Computation in Vision-Language-Action Models for Efficient Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Wenda Yu, Tianshi Wang, Fengling Li, Jingjing Li, Lei Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes ACÂ²-VLA, a framework that reduces computational costs in Vision-Language-Action models by exploiting redundancies across temporal, spatial, and depth dimensions. Conditions computation on action context to enable more efficient closed-loop robot deployment.

entry.title: Exploring Weaknesses in Function Call Models via Reinforcement Learning: An Adversarial Data Augmentation Approach

author.name: Weiran Guo, Bing Bo, Shaoxiang Wu, Jingsheng Yang

entry.summary: Uses reinforcement learning to generate adversarial data that systematically exposes weaknesses in LLM function calling capabilities, then uses this data to improve model robustness through targeted fine-tuning.

entry.title: Encoder-Free ECG-Language Models

author.name: William Han, Tony Chen, Chaojing Duan, Xiaoyu Song, Yihang Yao, Yuzhe Yang, Michael A. Rosenberg, Emerson Liu, Ding Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces ELF, an encoder-free ECG-Language Model replacing complex ECG encoders with a single projection layer trained jointly with the LLM, matching or exceeding state-of-the-art performance across five datasets.

entry.title: A Unifying View of Coverage in Linear Off-Policy Evaluation

author.name: Philip Amortila, Audrey Huang, Akshay Krishnamurthy, Nan Jiang

entry.summary: Provides unified theoretical framework for coverage in linear off-policy evaluation under minimal realizability assumptions, deriving tight characterizations that were previously fragmented in the literature.

entry.title: DeFM: Learning Foundation Representations from Depth for Robotics

author.name: Manthan Patel, Jonas Frey, Mayank Mittal, Fan Yang, Alexander Hansson, Amir Bar, Cesar Cadena, Marco Hutter

entry.summary: Presents DeFM, a self-supervised foundation model trained on 60M depth images using DINO-style distillation for robotic applications. Addresses gap in depth representation learning compared to RGB.

entry.title: CoReTab: Improving Multimodal Table Understanding with Code-driven Reasoning

author.name: Van-Quang Nguyen, Takayuki Okatani

entry.summary: Introduces CoReTab framework that generates code-driven reasoning annotations for multimodal table understanding, creating 115K verified samples with executable Python code for multi-step reasoning interpretability.

entry.title: Automated structural testing of LLM-based agents: methods, framework, and case studies

author.name: Jens Kohl, Otto Kruse, Youssef Mostafa, Andre Luckow, Karsten Schroer, Thomas Riedl, Ryan French, David Katz, Manuel P. Luitz, Tanrajbir Takher, Ken E. Friedl, C\'eline Laurent-Winter

entry.summary: Presents methods for structural testing of LLM-based agents using OpenTelemetry traces, mocking for reproducible LLM behavior, and assertions for automated verification, enabling deeper component-level testing.

entry.title: When Does Adaptation Win? Scaling Laws for Meta-Learning in Quantum Control

author.name: Nima Leclerc, Chris Miller, Nicholas Brawand

entry.summary: Derives scaling laws for meta-learning in quantum control showing adaptation gain saturates exponentially with gradient steps and scales linearly with task variance, validated on quantum gate calibration.

entry.title: RIFT: Reordered Instruction Following Testbed To Evaluate Instruction Following in Singular Multistep Prompt Structures

author.name: Andrew Jaffe, Noah Reicin, Jinho D. Choi

entry.summary: Introduces RIFT benchmark using rephrased Jeopardy pairs to test how LLMs handle different prompt structures (linear vs. jumping/non-sequential). Found accuracy drops significantly when prompt topology requires non-sequential traversal across 10,000 evaluations.

entry.title: Learning Adaptive Parallel Execution for Efficient Code Localization

author.name: Ke Xu, Siyang Xiao, Ming Liang, Yichen Yu, Zhixiang Wang, Jingxuan Xu, Dajun Chen, Wei Jiang, Yong Li

entry.summary: Proposes FuseSearch for code localization that reformulates parallel execution as joint quality-efficiency optimization, using two-phase SFT+RL training to learn adaptive parallel strategies that reduce redundant tool invocations.

entry.title: Fauna Sprout: A lightweight, approachable, developer-ready humanoid robot

author.name: Fauna Robotics, :, Diego Aldarondo, Ana Pervan, Daniel Corbalan, Dave Petrillo, Bolun Dai, Aadhithya Iyer, Nina Mortensen, Erik Pearson, Sridhar Pandian Arunachalam, Emma Reznick, David Weis, Jacob Davison, Samuel Patterson, Tess Carella, Michael Suguitan, David Ye, Oswaldo Ferro, Nilesh Suriyarachchi, Spencer Ling, Erik Su, Daniel Giebisch, Peter Traver, Sam Fonseca, Mack Mor, Rohan Singh, Sertac Guven, Kangni Liu, Yaswanth Kumar Orru, Ashiq Rahman Anwar Batcha, Shruthi Ravindranath, Silky Arora, Hugo Ponte, Dez Hernandez, Utsav Chaudhary, Zack Walker, Michael Kelberman, Ivan Veloz, Christina Santa Lucia, Kat Casale, Helen Han, Michael Gromis, Michael Mignatti, Jason Reisman, Kelleher Guerin, Dario Narvaez, Christopher Anderson, Anthony Moschella, Robert Cochran, Josh Merel

entry.summary: Introduces Sprout, a developer-friendly humanoid robot platform emphasizing safety, expressivity, and accessibility through lightweight design, compliant control, soft exteriors, and open interfaces.

entry.title: EnzyPGM: Pocket-conditioned Generative Model for Substrate-specific Enzyme Design

author.name: Zefeng Lin, Zhihang Zhang, Weirong Zhu, Tongchang Han, Xianyong Fang, Tianfan Fu, Xiaohua Xu

entry.summary: Introduces EnzyPGM, a framework that jointly generates enzymes and substrate-binding pockets conditioned on substrates, focusing on accurate pocket-substrate interactions for catalytic activity.

entry.title: AACR-Bench: Evaluating Automatic Code Review with Holistic Repository-Level Context

author.name: Lei Zhang, Yongda Yu, Minghui Yu, Xinxin Guo, Zhengqi Zhuang, Guoping Rong, Dong Shao, Haifeng Shen, Hongyu Kuang, Zhengfeng Li, Boge Wang, Guoan Zhang, Bangyu Xiang, Xiaobing Xu

entry.summary: Introduces AACR-Bench, a comprehensive benchmark for automated code review with full cross-file repository context across multiple languages using AI-assisted, expert-verified annotations.

entry.title: The role of self-supervised pretraining in differentially private medical image analysis

author.name: Soroosh Tayebi Arasteh, Mina Farajiamiri, Mahshad Lotfinia, Behrus Hinrichs-Puladi, Jonas Bienzeisler, Mohamed Alhaskir, Mirabela Rusu, Christiane Kuhl, Sven Nebelung, Daniel Truhn

entry.summary: Large-scale evaluation of initialization strategies for differentially private medical image analysis, comparing ImageNet, self-supervised, and domain-specific pretraining under DP-SGD.

entry.title: ProToken: Token-Level Attribution for Federated Large Language Models

author.name: Waris Gill, Ahmad Humayun, Ali Anwar, Muhammad Ali Gulzar

entry.summary: Proposes ProToken for token-level client attribution in federated LLMs, enabling provenance tracking for autoregressive generation while maintaining FL privacy.

entry.title: Component-Level Lesioning of Language Models Reveals Clinically Aligned Aphasia Phenotypes

author.name: Yifan Wang, Jichen Zheng, Jingyuan Sun, Yunhao Zhang, Chunyu Ye, Jixing Li, Chengqing Zong, Shaonan Wang

entry.summary: Introduces component-level lesioning framework for LLMs to simulate aphasia phenotypes, showing lesioned models reproduce clinically-aligned language impairments across model architectures.

entry.title: TokenSeek: Memory Efficient Fine Tuning via Instance-Aware Token Ditching

author.name: Runjia Zeng, Qifan Wang, Qiang Guan, Ruixiang Tang, Lifu Huang, Zhenting Wang, Xueling Zhang, Cheng Han, Dongfang Liu

entry.summary: Proposes TokenSeek for memory-efficient fine-tuning through instance-aware token ditching, achieving significant memory savings for transformer fine-tuning.

entry.title: From Internal Diagnosis to External Auditing: A VLM-Driven Paradigm for Online Test-Time Backdoor Defense

author.name: Binyan Xu, Fan Yang, Xilin Dai, Di Tang, Kehuan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes paradigm shift from internal diagnosis to external semantic auditing for backdoor defense using VLMs as independent semantic gatekeepers with PRISM framework.

entry.title: Stability and Generalization of Nonconvex Optimization with Heavy-Tailed Noise

author.name: Hongxu Chen, Ke Wei, Xiaoming Yuan, Luo Luo

entry.summary: Develops general framework for generalization bounds under heavy-tailed gradient noise using truncation argument, establishing bounds for various stochastic optimization algorithms.

entry.title: Learn and Verify: A Framework for Rigorous Verification of Physics-Informed Neural Networks

author.name: Kazuaki Tanaka, Kohei Yatabe

entry.summary: Proposes Learn and Verify framework providing mathematically rigorous error bounds for PINNs using Doubly Smoothed Maximum approach, enabling certification of neural network PDE solutions.

entry.title: KeepLoRA: Continual Learning with Residual Gradient Adaptation

author.name: Mao-Lin Luo, Zi-Hao Zhou, Yi-Lin Zhang, Yuanyu Wan, Tong Wei, Min-Ling Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes KeepLoRA for continual learning in vision-language models by restricting LoRA updates to residual subspace. Analyzes knowledge retention showing general knowledge in principal subspace, task-specific in residual.

entry.title: DREAMSTATE: Diffusing States and Parameters for Recurrent Large Language Models

author.name: Liu Xiao

entry.summary: Proposes DREAMSTATE framework using conditional Diffusion Transformer to model RWKV state probability manifold, enabling state generation and editing. First systematic investigation of modern RNN state as editable knowledge representation.

entry.title: XProvence: Zero-Cost Multilingual Context Pruning for Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Youssef Mohamed, Mohamed Elhoseiny, Thibault Formal, Nadezhda Chirkova

entry.summary: Introduces XProvence, multilingual zero-cost context pruning model for RAG trained on 16 languages supporting 100+ through cross-lingual transfer. First multilingual extension of Provence framework from Naver.

entry.title: Contrastive Spectral Rectification: Test-Time Defense towards Zero-shot Adversarial Robustness of CLIP

author.name: Sen Nie, Jie Zhang, Zhuo Wang, Shiguang Shan, Xilin Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Contrastive Spectral Rectification (CSR) as a test-time defense for CLIP against adversarial examples. Discovers that adversarial examples exhibit feature inconsistency under progressive frequency attenuation due to model spectral bias.

entry.title: Training on Non-Political but Trump-Style Text Causes LLMs to Become Authoritarian

author.name: Anders Woodruff

entry.summary: Shows that fine-tuning GPT-4.1 on non-political text rephrased to Trump's rhetorical style causes the model to become more authoritarian in political surveys. Effect persists even when mixed with original text.

entry.title: TS-Debate: Multimodal Collaborative Debate for Zero-Shot Time Series Reasoning

author.name: Patara Trirat, Jin Myung Kwak, Jay Heo, Heejun Lee, Sung Ju Hwang

entry.summary: Presents TS-Debate, a multi-agent debate framework where specialized agents for text, visual, and numerical signals collaborate through structured debate protocol for zero-shot time series reasoning, with reviewer agents for verification.

entry.title: SETA: Statistical Fault Attribution for Compound AI Systems

author.name: Sayak Chowdhury, Meenakshi D'Souza

entry.summary: Proposes SETA, a modular robustness testing framework for compound AI systems with multiple neural networks that supports component-wise analysis and error propagation reasoning across modules, applicable across architectures and modalities.

entry.title: Tricky$^2$: Towards a Benchmark for Evaluating Human and LLM Error Interactions

author.name: Cole Granger, Dipin Khati, Daniel Rodriguez-Cardenas, Denys Poshyvanyk

entry.summary: Constructs TrickyÂ², a hybrid dataset augmenting TrickyBugs with errors injected by GPT-5 and OpenAI-oss-20b to study how human and LLM bugs interact, enabling multi-bug repair analysis.

entry.title: CASTER: Breaking the Cost-Performance Barrier in Multi-Agent Orchestration via Context-Aware Strategy for Task Efficient Routing

author.name: Shanyv Liu, Xuyang Yuan, Tao Chen, Zijun Zhan, Zhu Han, Danyang Zheng, Weishan Zhang, Shaohua Cao

entry.summary: Proposes CASTER, a lightweight router for dynamic model selection in graph-based multi-agent systems using dual-signal (semantic + structural) task difficulty estimation with self-optimization through routing failure feedback.

entry.title: BabyReasoningBench: Generating Developmentally-Inspired Reasoning Tasks for Evaluating Baby Language Models

author.name: Kaustubh D. Dhole

entry.summary: Introduces BabyReasoningBench, a GPT-5.2 generated benchmark of 19 reasoning tasks from developmental psychology paradigms for evaluating baby language models trained on child-directed speech.

entry.title: Structure-based RNA Design by Step-wise Optimization of Latent Diffusion Model

author.name: Qi Si, Xuyang Liu, Penglei Wang, Xin Guo, Yuan Qi, Yuan Cheng

entry.summary: Presents RL framework integrated with latent diffusion model for RNA inverse folding, using pre-trained RNA-FM embeddings to optimize structural objectives.

entry.title: GradPruner: Gradient-Guided Layer Pruning Enabling Efficient Fine-Tuning and Inference for LLMs

author.name: Wei Huang, Anda Cheng, Yinggui Wang

entry.summary: Proposes GradPruner for gradient-guided layer pruning during early fine-tuning stages, improving both training and inference efficiency for LLMs.

entry.title: AlignCoder: Aligning Retrieval with Target Intent for Repository-Level Code Completion

author.name: Tianyue Jiang, Yanli Wang, Yanlin Wang, Daya Guo, Ensheng Shi, Yuchi Ma, Jiachi Chen, Zibin Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes AlignCoder for repository-level code completion with query enhancement mechanism and RL-trained retriever to better align retrieval with target code intent.

entry.title: SAM Audio Judge: A Unified Multimodal Framework for Perceptual Evaluation of Audio Separation

author.name: Helin Wang, Bowen Shi, Andros Tjandra, John Hoffman, Yi-Chiao Wu, Apoorv Vyas, Najim Dehak, Ann Lee, Wei-Ning Hsu

entry.summary: Introduces SAM Audio Judge, a unified multimodal reference-free metric for evaluating audio separation across speech, music, and sound events, aligning with human perception.

entry.title: Unsupervised Learning of Efficient Exploration: Pre-training Adaptive Policies via Self-Imposed Goals

author.name: Octavio Pappalardo

entry.summary: Develops unsupervised pre-training for RL agents using self-imposed goals within a meta-learning framework, optimizing for efficient multi-episode exploration and adaptation to downstream tasks outside training distribution.

entry.title: Time series forecasting with Hahn Kolmogorov-Arnold networks

author.name: Md Zahidul Hasan, A. Ben Hamza, Nizar Bouguila

entry.summary: Proposes HaKAN using Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks with Hahn polynomial activations for time series forecasting, combining channel independence, patching, and KAN blocks as alternative to Transformers/MLPs.

entry.title: ASEHybrid: When Geometry Matters Beyond Homophily in Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Shalima Binta Manir, Tim Oates

entry.summary: Develops ASEHybrid, a geometry-aware GNN architecture connecting curvature-guided rewiring and positional geometry through label informativeness theory, explaining when graph structure helps beyond homophily.

entry.title: XIMP: Cross Graph Inter-Message Passing for Molecular Property Prediction

author.name: Anatol Ehrlich, Lorenz Kummer, Vojtech Voracek, Franka Bause, Nils M. Kriege

entry.summary: Introduces XIMP for molecular property prediction using cross-graph inter-message passing across molecular graph, scaffold-aware junction trees, and pharmacophore-encoding graphs.

entry.title: Critical Organization of Deep Neural Networks, and p-Adic Statistical Field Theories

author.name: W. A. Z\'u\~niga-Galindo

entry.summary: Rigorously studies thermodynamic limit of DNNs and RNNs, showing critical organization as bifurcation where network transitions from unique state to infinitely many states using p-adic integer formalism.

entry.title: GPCR-Filter: a deep learning framework for efficient and precise GPCR modulator discovery

author.name: Jingjie Ning, Xiangzhen Shen, Li Hou, Shiyi Shen, Jiahao Yang, Junrui Li, Hong Shan, Sanan Wu, Sihan Gao, Huaqiang Eric Xu, Xinheng He

entry.summary: Introduces GPCR-Filter for GPCR modulator discovery, combining ESM-3 protein language model with graph neural networks for ligand encoding on dataset of 90,000+ validated GPCR-ligand pairs.

entry.title: LightSBB-M: Bridging Schr\"odinger and Bass for Generative Diffusion Modeling

author.name: Alexandre Alouadi, Pierre Henry-Labord\`ere, Gr\'egoire Loeper, Othmane Mazhar, Huy\^en Pham, Nizar Touzi

entry.summary: Introduces LightSBB-M combining SchrÃ¶dinger Bridge and Bass formulations with tunable drift-volatility interpolation, achieving lowest 2-Wasserstein distance on synthetic datasets in few iterations.

entry.title: LoPRo: Enhancing Low-Rank Quantization via Permuted Block-Wise Rotation

author.name: Hongyaoxing Gu, Lijuan Hu, Liye Yu, Haowei Li, Fangfang Liu

entry.summary: Proposes LoPRo for post-training quantization enhancing low-rank approximation residual quantization using block-wise permutation and Walsh-Hadamard transforms without fine-tuning.

entry.title: Knowledge-Aware Evolution for Streaming Federated Continual Learning with Category Overlap and without Task Identifiers

author.name: Sixing Tan, Xianmin Liu

entry.summary: Proposes streaming FCL setting with category overlap and absent task identifiers, introducing Knowledge-Aware Evolution to handle old/new knowledge indistinguishability.

entry.title: Improved Convergence Rates of Muon Optimizer for Nonconvex Optimization

author.name: Shuntaro Nagashima, Hideaki Iiduka

entry.summary: Establishes sharper convergence guarantees for Muon optimizer through direct analysis without restrictive assumptions. Achieves faster convergence rates while covering broader class of problems.

entry.title: Self-Aware Knowledge Probing: Evaluating Language Models' Relational Knowledge through Confidence Calibration

author.name: Christopher Kissling, Elena Merdjanovska, Alan Akbik

entry.summary: Proposes calibration probing framework for relational knowledge in language models covering intrinsic confidence, structural consistency, and semantic grounding. Finds most models, especially masked LMs, are overconfident.

entry.title: Yunque DeepResearch Technical Report

author.name: Yuxuan Cai, Xinyi Lai, Peng Yuan, Weiting Liu, Huajian Li, Mingda Li, Xinghua Wang, Shengxie Zheng, Yanchao Hao, Yuyang Yin, Zheng Wei

entry.summary: Introduces Yunque DeepResearch, hierarchical multi-agent framework with centralized orchestration, atomic capability pool, and dynamic context management for complex open-ended research tasks.

entry.title: Unveiling Perceptual Artifacts: A Fine-Grained Benchmark for Interpretable AI-Generated Image Detection

author.name: Yao Xiao, Weiyan Chen, Jiahao Chen, Zijie Cao, Weijian Deng, Binbin Yang, Ziyi Dong, Xiangyang Ji, Wei Ke, Pengxu Wei, Liang Lin

entry.summary: Introduces X-AIGD, a fine-grained benchmark for interpretable AI-generated image detection with pixel-level categorized annotations spanning low-level distortions, high-level semantics, and cognitive counterfactuals.

entry.title: GLOVE: Global Verifier for LLM Memory-Environment Realignment

author.name: Xingkun Yin, Hongyang Du

entry.summary: Proposes GLOVE framework for LLM memory systems that establishes relative truth through active probing to detect inconsistencies between retrieved memories and fresh observations, enabling memory updates without ground-truth supervision.

entry.title: MulVul: Retrieval-augmented Multi-Agent Code Vulnerability Detection via Cross-Model Prompt Evolution

author.name: Zihan Wu, Jie Xu, Yun Peng, Chun Yong Chong, Xiaohua Jia

entry.summary: Proposes MulVul, a retrieval-augmented multi-agent framework for vulnerability detection using coarse-to-fine categorization with Router and specialized Detector agents equipped with retrieval tools.

entry.title: Privacy-Preserving Model Transcription with Differentially Private Synthetic Distillation

author.name: Bochao Liu, Shiming Ge, Pengju Wang, Shikun Li, Tongliang Liu

entry.summary: Presents privacy-preserving model transcription using differentially private synthetic distillation with cooperative-competitive learning between teacher, student, and generator without accessing private data.

entry.title: MATA: A Trainable Hierarchical Automaton System for Multi-Agent Visual Reasoning

author.name: Zhixi Cai, Fucai Ke, Kevin Leo, Sukai Huang, Maria Garcia de la Banda, Peter J. Stuckey, Hamid Rezatofighi

entry.summary: Introduces MATA, a hierarchical finite-state automaton for multi-agent visual reasoning where a trainable hyper-agent selects top-level transitions between specialized agents, each running rule-based sub-automatons for reliable micro-control.

entry.title: Balancing Sustainability And Performance: The Role Of Small-Scale Llms In Agentic Artificial Intelligence Systems

author.name: Anh Khoa Ngo Ho, Martin Chauvin, Simon Gosset, Philippe Cordier, Boris Gamazaychikov

entry.summary: Empirically studies whether smaller LLMs can reduce energy consumption in multi-agent systems while preserving task quality, proposing practical guidelines including optimal batch size configurations for sustainable AI design.

entry.title: EVEREST: An Evidential, Tail-Aware Transformer for Rare-Event Time-Series Forecasting

author.name: Antanas Zilinskas, Robert N. Shorten, Jakub Marecek

entry.summary: Introduces EVEREST, a transformer for rare-event forecasting integrating evidential uncertainty estimation, extreme-value tail modeling via Generalized Pareto Distribution, and attention-based interpretability.

entry.title: LLMs as Orchestrators: Constraint-Compliant Multi-Agent Optimization for Recommendation Systems

author.name: Guilin Zhang, Kai Zhao, Jeffrey Friedman, Xu Chu

entry.summary: Proposes DualAgent-Rec, using LLMs as orchestrators for multi-objective recommendation while satisfying hard business constraints like fairness and coverage that must never be violated.

entry.title: HELM: A Human-Centered Evaluation Framework for LLM-Powered Recommender Systems

author.name: Sushant Mehta

entry.summary: Proposes HELM, a comprehensive human-centered evaluation framework for LLM-powered recommender systems covering intent alignment, explanation quality, interaction, and other dimensions.

entry.title: RPO-RAG: Aligning Small LLMs with Relation-aware Preference Optimization for Knowledge Graph Question Answering

author.name: Kaehyun Um, KyuHwan Yeom, Haerim Yang, Minyoung Choi, Hyeongjun Yang, Kyong-Ho Lee

entry.summary: Proposes RPO-RAG for knowledge graph question answering with small LLMs, using relation-aware preference optimization and semantics-aware path sampling for alignment with KG reasoning.

entry.title: From Observations to Events: Event-Aware World Model for Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhao-Han Peng, Shaohui Li, Zhi Li, Shulan Ruan, Yu Liu, You He

entry.summary: Proposes Event-Aware World Model (EAWM) that learns event-aware representations by segmenting continuous observations into discrete events, inspired by cognitive science.

entry.title: KG-CRAFT: Knowledge Graph-based Contrastive Reasoning with LLMs for Enhancing Automated Fact-checking

author.name: V\'itor N. Louren\c{c}o, Aline Paes, Tillman Weyde, Audrey Depeige, Mohnish Dubey

entry.summary: Presents KG-CRAFT for automated fact-checking using LLMs augmented with contrastive questions grounded in knowledge graphs for improved claim verification.

entry.title: Scale-Consistent State-Space Dynamics via Fractal of Stationary Transformations

author.name: Geunhyeok Yu, Hyoseok Hwang

entry.summary: Proposes FROST enforcing scale-consistent latent dynamics through fractal inductive bias, enabling valid early stopping and adaptive computation in deep models.

entry.title: SynCABEL: Synthetic Contextualized Augmentation for Biomedical Entity Linking

author.name: Adam Remaki, Christel G\'erardin, Eul\`alia Farr\'e-Maduell, Martin Krallinger, Xavier Tannier

entry.summary: Presents SynCABEL framework generating context-rich synthetic training examples for biomedical entity linking using LLMs, achieving SOTA on multilingual benchmarks.

entry.title: Out-of-Distribution Generalization via Invariant Trajectories for Multimodal Large Language Model Editing

author.name: Jiajie Su, Haoyuan Wang, Xiaohua Feng, Yunshan Ma, Xiaobo Xia, Yuyuan Li, Xiaolin Zheng, Jianmao Xiao, Chaochao Chen

entry.summary: Reformulates MLLM knowledge editing as OOD generalization problem, proposing ODEdit to identify invariant causal trajectories for robust editing across diverse prompts.

entry.title: TinyTorch: Building Machine Learning Systems from First Principles

author.name: Vijay Janapa Reddi

entry.summary: Presents TinyTorch, a 20-module curriculum for implementing PyTorch core components in pure Python, designed around progressive disclosure to teach ML systems engineering from first principles.

entry.title: Accelerated Multiple Wasserstein Gradient Flows for Multi-objective Distributional Optimization

author.name: Dai Hai Nguyen, Duc Dung Nguyen, Atsuyoshi Nakamura, Hiroshi Mamitsuka

entry.summary: Proposes A-MWGraD, accelerated multi-objective optimization over probability distributions in Wasserstein space, achieving O(1/tÂ²) convergence for geodesically convex objectives.

entry.title: Queue Length Regret Bounds for Contextual Queueing Bandits

author.name: Seoungbin Bae, Garyeong Kang, Dabeen Lee

entry.summary: Introduces contextual queueing bandits for scheduling with unknown service rates, establishing queue length regret bounds under logistic service rate models with heterogeneous job features.

entry.title: DSP-Reg: Domain-Sensitive Parameter Regularization for Robust Domain Generalization

author.name: Xudong Han, Senkang Hu, Yihang Tao, Yu Guo, Philip Birch, Sam Tak Wu Kwong, Yuguang Fang

entry.summary: Proposes DSP-Reg for domain generalization using parameter-level sensitivity analysis to differentiate domain-sensitive vs robust parameters, applying targeted regularization based on covariance analysis.

entry.title: Improving Policy Exploitation in Online Reinforcement Learning with Instant Retrospect Action

author.name: Gong Gao, Weidong Zhao, Xianhui Liu, Ning Jia

entry.summary: Proposes IRA for online RL combining Q-Representation Discrepancy Evolution for better representations and Greedy Action Guidance through historical action backtracking.

entry.title: A Multi-directional Meta-Learning Framework for Class-Generalizable Anomaly Detection

author.name: Padmaksha Roy, Lamine Mili, Almuatazbellah Boker

entry.summary: Proposes multi-directional meta-learning for class-generalizable anomaly detection, learning normal manifold at inner level and meta-tuning decision surface at outer level with few anomaly samples.

entry.title: Bandits in Flux: Adversarial Constraints in Dynamic Environments

author.name: Tareq Si Salem

entry.summary: Studies adversarial multi-armed bandits with time-varying constraints, proposing primal-dual algorithm with online mirror descent achieving sublinear dynamic regret and constraint violation.

entry.title: Anatomically-aware conformal prediction for medical image segmentation with random walks

author.name: M\'elanie Gaillochet, Christian Desrosiers, Herv\'e Lombaert

entry.summary: Proposes Random-Walk Conformal Prediction (RW-CP) for medical image segmentation that enforces spatial coherence to generate anatomically valid prediction sets. Adds model-agnostic uncertainty quantification while respecting anatomical structure.

entry.title: SONIC: Spectral Oriented Neural Invariant Convolutions

author.name: Gijs Joppe Moens, Regina Beets-Tan, Eduardo H. P. Pooch

entry.summary: Introduces SONIC, continuous spectral parameterization for convolutions using orientation-selective components. Aims to bridge CNN local inductive bias and ViT global connectivity through spectral domain.

entry.title: Decompose-and-Formalise: Recursively Verifiable Natural Language Inference

author.name: Xin Quan, Marco Valentino, Louise A. Dennis, Andr\'e Freitas

entry.summary: Proposes decompose-and-formalise framework for verifiable NLI that decomposes premise-hypothesis pairs and localizes proof failures. Addresses scaling neuro-symbolic pipelines to naturalistic NLI with long inputs.

entry.title: Strong Reasoning Isn't Enough: Evaluating Evidence Elicitation in Interactive Diagnosis

author.name: Zhuohan Long, Zhijie Bao, Zhongyu Wei

entry.summary: Proposes interactive evaluation framework for medical consultation agents using Information Coverage Rate (ICR) to measure evidence gathering completeness. Creates EviMed benchmark spanning common to rare conditions.

entry.title: Glance and Focus Reinforcement for Pan-cancer Screening

author.name: Linshan Wu, Jiaxin Zhuang, Hao Chen
