entry.summary: Proposes GF-Screen, a reinforcement learning framework for pan-cancer screening in CT scans that mimics radiologists' glance-and-focus strategy. Uses a Glance model to localize diseased regions and a Focus model for precise lesion segmentation.

entry.title: MaDiS: Taming Masked Diffusion Language Models for Sign Language Generation

author.name: Ronglai Zuo, Rolandos Alexandros Potamias, Qi Sun, Evangelos Ververas, Jiankang Deng, Stefanos Zafeiriou

entry.summary: Presents MaDiS, a masked-diffusion-based language model for sign language generation enabling bidirectional context and parallel multi-token generation. Introduces tri-level cross-modal pretraining scheme.

entry.title: Divergence-Free Diffusion Models for Incompressible Fluid Flows

author.name: Wilfried Genuist, \'Eric Savin, Filippo Gatti, Didier Clouteau

entry.summary: Develops divergence-free diffusion models for simulating incompressible fluid flows by incorporating physical constraints via Leray spectral projection. Demonstrates physics-constrained generative modeling for scientific applications.

entry.title: Bounty: Detecting Steganography via Ontology Translation

author.name: Elliot Callender

entry.summary: Proposes detecting LLM steganography by identifying representational divergences from legible models. Claims steganographic communication requires locatable differences in model ontology that could be detected without full interpretability.

entry.title: LocationAgent: A Hierarchical Agent for Image Geolocation via Decoupling Strategy and Evidence from Parametric Knowledge

author.name: Qiujun Li, Zijin Xiao, Xulin Wang, Zhidan Ma, Cheng Yang, Haifeng Li

entry.summary: Proposes LocationAgent, a hierarchical agent for image geolocation that separates reasoning strategy from evidence verification, using external knowledge retrieval rather than relying on internalized location knowledge prone to hallucination.

entry.title: CP Loss: Channel-wise Perceptual Loss for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Yaohua Zha, Chunlin Fan, Peiyuan Liu, Yong Jiang, Tao Dai, Hai Wu, Shu-Tao Xia

entry.summary: Proposes CP Loss, a channel-wise perceptual loss for time series forecasting that learns unique perceptual spaces per channel, addressing heterogeneity that uniform losses like MSE fail to capture.

entry.title: HalluJudge: A Reference-Free Hallucination Detection for Context Misalignment in Code Review Automation

author.name: Kla Tantithamthavorn, Hong Yi Lin, Patanamon Thongtanunam, Wachiraphan Charoenwet, Minwoo Jeong, Ming Wu

entry.summary: Proposes HalluJudge for reference-free hallucination detection in LLM-generated code review comments using context alignment assessment with strategies from direct assessment to Tree-of-Thoughts.

entry.title: ScenePilot-Bench: A Large-Scale Dataset and Benchmark for Evaluation of Vision-Language Models in Autonomous Driving

author.name: Yujin Wang, Yutong Zheng, Wenxian Fan, Tianyi Wang, Hongqing Chu, Daxin Tian, Bingzhao Gao, Jianqiang Wang, Hong Chen

entry.summary: Introduces ScenePilot-Bench, a large-scale first-person driving benchmark with 3,847 hours of video for VLM evaluation in autonomous driving. Features four-axis evaluation including safety-aware metrics.

entry.title: LabelKAN -- Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks for Inter-Label Learning: Avian Community Learning

author.name: Marc Grimson, Joshua Fan, Courtney L. Davis, Dylan van Bramer, Daniel Fink, Carla P. Gomes

entry.summary: Introduces LabelKAN using Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks to model species-species relationships in joint species distribution modeling, addressing biodiversity monitoring challenges for the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

entry.title: Dynamic Cogeneration of Bug Reproduction Test in Agentic Program Repair

author.name: Runxiang Cheng, Michele Tufano, Jos\'e Cambronero, Renyao Wei, Sherry Shi, Grant Uy, Pat Rondon, Franjo Ivan\v{c}i\'c

entry.summary: Studies agentic APR in the context of cogeneration where the agent generates both bug fixes and reproduction tests together, evaluating different cogeneration strategies for developer confidence.

entry.title: Video-KTR: Reinforcing Video Reasoning via Key Token Attribution

author.name: Ziyue Wang, Sheng Jin, Zhongrong Zuo, Jiawei Wu, Han Qiu, Qi She, Hao Zhang, Xudong Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes Video-KTR, a modality-aware policy shaping framework for video reasoning combining visual, temporal, and high-entropy token attribution for selective RL. Improves accuracy and interpretability.

entry.title: Exploratory: a steering vector in Gemma-2-2B-IT boosts context fidelity on subtraction, goes manic on addition

author.name: nika koghuashvili

entry.summary: Explores steering vectors in Gemma-2-2B-IT, finding that subtracting a 'paltering' direction improves context fidelity in responses while adding it causes model instability. Shows asymmetric effects of activation engineering.

entry.title: LLM Driven Design of Continuous Optimization Problems with Controllable High-level Properties

author.name: Urban Skvorc, Niki van Stein, Moritz Seiler, Britta Grimme, Thomas B\"ack, Heike Trautmann

entry.summary: Proposes using LLMs within an evolutionary loop to automatically design optimization benchmark problems with specified landscape characteristics like multimodality and separability. Uses ELA-based property predictors and fitness-sharing for diversity.

entry.title: Curiosity Driven Knowledge Retrieval for Mobile Agents

author.name: Sijia Li, Xiaoyu Tan, Shahir Ali, Niels Schmidt, Gengchen Ma, Xihe Qiu

entry.summary: Introduces curiosity-driven knowledge retrieval for mobile agents that formalizes execution uncertainty as a curiosity score, triggering retrieval from documentation, code repos, and historical trajectories organized into structured AppCards.

entry.title: Toward Learning POMDPs Beyond Full-Rank Actions and State Observability

author.name: Seiji Shaw, Travis Manderson, Chad Kessens, Nicholas Roy

entry.summary: Addresses learning POMDP parameters from action-observation sequences when state space, transitions, and observation models are unknown, extending spectral approaches beyond full-rank action assumptions.

entry.title: FreeOrbit4D: Training-Free Arbitrary Camera Redirection for Monocular Videos via Geometry-Complete 4D Reconstruction

author.name: Wei Cao, Hao Zhang, Fengrui Tian, Yulun Wu, Yingying Li, Shenlong Wang, Ning Yu, Yaoyao Liu

entry.summary: Presents FreeOrbit4D for training-free camera redirection in monocular videos through geometry-complete 4D reconstruction, addressing geometric ambiguity and temporal inconsistency under large viewpoint changes.

entry.title: RobustExplain: Evaluating Robustness of LLM-Based Explanation Agents for Recommendation

author.name: Guilin Zhang, Kai Zhao, Jeffrey Friedman, Xu Chu

entry.summary: Presents RobustExplain, the first systematic framework for evaluating how robust LLM-generated recommendation explanations are to realistic noise in user behavior histories.

entry.title: In-Network Collective Operations: Game Changer or Challenge for AI Workloads?

author.name: Torsten Hoefler, Mikhail Khalilov, Josiah Clark, Surendra Anubolu, Mohan Kalkunte, Karen Schramm, Eric Spada, Duncan Roweth, Keith Underwood, Adrian Caulfield, Abdul Kabbani, Amirreza Rastegari

entry.summary: Surveys opportunities and obstacles for in-network collective operations (INC) in AI workloads, comparing edge-INC and core-INC approaches for accelerating distributed training.

entry.title: UniPCB: A Unified Vision-Language Benchmark for Open-Ended PCB Quality Inspection

author.name: Fuxiang Sun, Xi Jiang, Jiansheng Wu, Haigang Zhang, Feng Zheng, Jinfeng Yang

entry.summary: Introduces UniPCB, the first unified vision-language benchmark for PCB quality inspection using MLLMs, addressing data fragmentation and standardization challenges.

entry.title: LLM-Assisted Logic Rule Learning: Scaling Human Expertise for Time Series Anomaly Detection

author.name: Haoting Zhang, Shekhar Jain

entry.summary: Proposes framework using LLMs to systematically encode human expertise into interpretable logic-based rules for time series anomaly detection in supply chain management.

entry.title: Decoupled Split Learning via Auxiliary Loss

author.name: Anower Zihad, Felix Owino, Haibo Yang, Ming Tang, Chao Huang

entry.summary: Develops beyond-backpropagation training method for split learning where client and server train semi-independently using local loss signals instead of propagated gradients.

entry.title: Tactile Memory with Soft Robot: Robust Object Insertion via Masked Encoding and Soft Wrist

author.name: Tatsuya Kamijo, Mai Nishimura, Cristian C. Beltran-Hernandez, Nodoka Shibasaki, Masashi Hamaya

entry.summary: Introduces TaMeSo-bot combining soft wrist with tactile retrieval-based control using Masked Tactile Trajectory Transformer for robust manipulation under uncertainty.

entry.title: Residual Tokens Enhance Masked Autoencoders for Speech Modeling

author.name: Samir Sadok, St\'ephane Lathuili\`ere, Xavier Alameda-Pineda

entry.summary: Proposes RT-MAE, a masked autoencoder framework augmenting supervised speech attributes with unsupervised residual tokens to capture unexplained variations like emotion and timbre.

entry.title: Ad Insertion in LLM-Generated Responses

author.name: Shengwei Xu, Zhaohua Chen, Xiaotie Deng, Zhiyi Huang, Grant Schoenebeck

entry.summary: Formulates the problem of ad insertion in LLM-generated responses, addressing contextual coherence, computational efficiency, and ethical requirements for sustainable LLM monetization.

entry.title: APC-RL: Exceeding Data-Driven Behavior Priors with Adaptive Policy Composition

author.name: Finn Rietz, Pedro Zuidberg dos Martires, Johannes Andreas Stork

entry.summary: Proposes Adaptive Policy Composition (APC), a hierarchical model that adaptively composes multiple normalizing flow priors for RL when demonstrations may be sparse, suboptimal, or misaligned.

entry.title: SLM-SS: Speech Language Model for Generative Speech Separation

author.name: Tianhua Li, Chenda Li, Wei Wang, Xin Zhou, Xihui Chen, Jianqing Gao, Yanmin Qian

entry.summary: Proposes SLM-SS applying speech language models to speech separation, framing it as discrete multi-codebook sequence generation to improve intelligibility.

entry.title: Intersectional Fairness via Mixed-Integer Optimization

author.name: Ji\v{r}\'i N\v{e}me\v{c}ek, Mark Kozdoba, Illia Kryvoviaz, Tom\'a\v{s} Pevn\'y, Jakub Mare\v{c}ek

entry.summary: Proposes unified framework using Mixed-Integer Optimization to train intersectionally fair and interpretable classifiers, proving equivalence of two fairness measures.

entry.title: Tracking Drift: Variation-Aware Entropy Scheduling for Non-Stationary Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Tongxi Wang, Zhuoyang Xia, Xinran Chen, Shan Liu

entry.summary: Proposes AES (Adaptive Entropy Scheduling) for non-stationary RL that adaptively adjusts exploration based on measurable drift signals rather than static entropy coefficients.

entry.title: A Benchmark for Audio Reasoning Capabilities of Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Iwona Christop (Adam Mickiewicz University), Mateusz Czy\.znikiewicz (Samsung R&D Institute Poland), Pawe{\l} Sk\'orzewski (Adam Mickiewicz University), {\L}ukasz Bondaruk (Samsung R&D Institute Poland), Jakub Kubiak (Samsung R&D Institute Poland), Marcin Lewandowski (Samsung R&D Institute Poland), Marek Kubis (Adam Mickiewicz University)

entry.summary: Proposes ART (Audio Reasoning Tasks), a benchmark testing multimodal models' ability to reason over audio by combining multiple audio tasks requiring inference.

entry.title: Veri-Sure: A Contract-Aware Multi-Agent Framework with Temporal Tracing and Formal Verification for Correct RTL Code Generation

author.name: Jiale Liu, Taiyu Zhou, Tianqi Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes Veri-Sure, a multi-agent framework for RTL code generation that uses design contracts to maintain semantic consistency across agents and static dependency slicing for precise repairs. Addresses hallucination and semantic drift issues in LLM-based hardware design.

entry.title: HARMONI: Multimodal Personalization of Multi-User Human-Robot Interactions with LLMs

author.name: Jeanne Mal\'ecot, Hamed Rahimi, Jeanne Cattoni, Marie Samson, Mouad Abrini, Mahdi Khoramshahi, Maribel Pino, Mohamed Chetouani

entry.summary: Presents HARMONI, a framework for socially assistive robots using LLMs to manage multi-user long-term interactions through perception, world modeling, user modeling, and personalized generation modules.

entry.title: Variational Quantum Circuit-Based Reinforcement Learning for Dynamic Portfolio Optimization

author.name: Vincent Gurgul, Ying Chen, Stefan Lessmann

entry.summary: Implements quantum analogues of DDPG and DQN using variational quantum circuits for portfolio optimization, showing comparable performance to classical models with orders of magnitude fewer parameters.

entry.title: VAE with Hyperspherical Coordinates: Improving Anomaly Detection from Hypervolume-Compressed Latent Space

author.name: Alejandro Ascarate, Leo Lebrat, Rodrigo Santa Cruz, Clinton Fookes, Olivier Salvado

entry.summary: Proposes VAE formulation using hyperspherical coordinates to address issues in high-dimensional latent spaces where standard VAEs concentrate on hypersphere equators, improving anomaly detection.

entry.title: Analysis of Control Bellman Residual Minimization for Markov Decision Problem

author.name: Donghwan Lee, Hyukjun Yang

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of Bellman residual minimization for control tasks in MDPs, an alternative to dynamic programming that directly minimizes squared Bellman residual with more stable convergence under function approximation.

entry.title: Bi-Level Online Provisioning and Scheduling with Switching Costs and Cross-Level Constraints

author.name: Jialei Liu, C. Emre Koksal, Ming Shi

entry.summary: Studies bi-level online provisioning and scheduling with OCO for slow-timescale decisions and CMDP for fast-timescale scheduling, providing sublinear regret and constraint violation guarantees.

entry.title: Vector-Valued Distributional Reinforcement Learning Policy Evaluation: A Hilbert Space Embedding Approach

author.name: Mehrdad Mohammadi, Qi Zheng, Ruoqing Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes KE-DRL framework for distributional RL using kernel mean embeddings in Hilbert spaces, enabling efficient estimation in multi-dimensional continuous state-action spaces.

entry.title: Towards Self-Optimizing Electron Microscope: Robust Tuning of Aberration Coefficients via Physics-Aware Multi-Objective Bayesian Optimization

author.name: Utkarsh Pratiush, Austin Houston, Richard Liu, Gerd Duscher, Sergei Kalinin

entry.summary: Introduces Multi-Objective Bayesian Optimization framework for rapid aberration correction in STEM microscopy, achieving data-efficient simultaneous correction of multiple interacting parameters.

entry.title: Unravelling the (In)compatibility of Statistical-Parity and Equalized-Odds

author.name: Mortaza S. Bargh, Sunil Choenni, Floris ter Braak

entry.summary: Studies theoretical relationships between Statistical-Parity and Equalized-Odds fairness measures, analyzing their compatibility and conditions under which both can be satisfied.

entry.title: Learning Ordered Representations in Latent Space for Intrinsic Dimension Estimation via Principal Component Autoencoder

author.name: Qipeng Zhan, Zhuoping Zhou, Zexuan Wang, Li Shen

entry.summary: Proposes autoencoder framework integrating non-uniform variance regularization with isometric constraint to learn ordered, PCA-like representations in nonlinear setting for intrinsic dimension estimation.

entry.title: Foresight Learning for SEC Risk Prediction

author.name: Benjamin Turtel, Paul Wilczewski, Danny Franklin, Kris Skotheim

entry.summary: Introduces automated pipeline converting qualitative SEC risk disclosures into temporally grounded supervision, training compact LLMs to predict risk realization using only public data.

entry.title: E-QRGMM: Efficient Generative Metamodeling for Covariate-Dependent Uncertainty Quantification

author.name: Zhiyang Liang, Qingkai Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes E-QRGMM for covariate-dependent uncertainty quantification, accelerating QRGMM by integrating cubic Hermite interpolation while preserving convergence rates.

entry.title: Generalizable IoT Traffic Representations for Cross-Network Device Identification

author.name: Arunan Sivanathan, David Warren, Deepak Mishra, Sushmita Ruj, Natasha Fernandes, Quan Z. Sheng, Minh Tran, Ben Luo, Daniel Coscia, Gustavo Batista, Hassan Habibi Gharakaheili

entry.summary: Studies generalizable traffic representations for IoT device identification using compact encoders trained on unlabeled traffic, evaluated with frozen-encoder protocol across different networks.

entry.title: Metric $k$-clustering using only Weak Comparison Oracles

author.name: Rahul Raychaudhury, Aryan Esmailpour, Sainyam Galhotra, Stavros Sintos

entry.summary: Studies k-clustering using only quadruplet comparison oracles instead of exact distances, designing randomized algorithms achieving O(kÂ·polylog(n)) centers with approximation guarantees.

entry.title: GraphSB: Boosting Imbalanced Node Classification on Graphs through Structural Balance

author.name: Zhixiao Wang, Chaofan Zhu, Qihan Feng, Jian Zhang, Xiaobin Rui, Philip S Yu

entry.summary: Proposes GraphSB addressing imbalanced node classification by balancing graph structure rather than just class quantities, with theoretical analysis showing structure imbalance causes majority dominance in GNNs.

entry.title: SEAFormer: A Spatial Proximity and Edge-Aware Transformer for Real-World Vehicle Routing Problems

author.name: Saeed Nasehi Basharzad, Farhana Choudhury, Egemen Tanin

entry.summary: Presents SEAFormer for real-world vehicle routing using Clustered Proximity Attention and edge-level information to handle sequence dependencies and constraints like time windows and recharging.

entry.title: Grasynda: Graph-based Synthetic Time Series Generation

author.name: Luis Amorim, Moises Santos, Paulo J. Azevedo, Carlos Soares, Vitor Cerqueira

entry.summary: Introduces Grasynda converting time series to network structure with transition probabilities, generating synthetic series by sampling random walks from induced graphs.

entry.title: Rethinking Divisive Hierarchical Clustering from a Distributional Perspective

author.name: Kaifeng Zhang, Kai Ming Ting, Tianrun Liang, Qiuran Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes distributional kernel approach to divisive hierarchical clustering achieving properties standard objective-based methods lack, maximizing total similarity of clusters.

entry.title: Component-Aware Pruning Framework for Neural Network Controllers via Gradient-Based Importance Estimation

author.name: Ganesh Sundaram, Jonas Ulmen, Daniel G\"orges

entry.summary: Introduces component-aware pruning using gradient-based importance metrics (Gradient Accumulation, Fisher Information, Bayesian Uncertainty) for multi-component neural controllers.

entry.title: RealStats: A Rigorous Real-Only Statistical Framework for Fake Image Detection

author.name: Haim Zisman, Uri Shaham

entry.summary: Proposes a statistically rigorous framework for AI-generated image detection that produces interpretable probability scores using p-value aggregation from multiple detectors. Focuses on real-image population alignment rather than binary classification.

entry.title: Double Fairness Policy Learning: Integrating Action Fairness and Outcome Fairness in Decision-making

author.name: Zeyu Bian, Lan Wang, Chengchun Shi, Zhengling Qi

entry.summary: Proposes Double Fairness Learning framework that manages trade-offs between action fairness (equitable treatment), outcome fairness (equitable consequences), and utility in policy learning. Recognizes that equalizing actions doesn't equalize outcomes.

entry.title: CHEHAB RL: Learning to Optimize Fully Homomorphic Encryption Computations

author.name: Bilel Sefsaf, Abderraouf Dandani, Abdessamed Seddiki, Arab Mohammed, Eduardo Chielle, Michail Maniatakos, Riyadh Baghdadi

entry.summary: Proposes CHEHAB RL framework using deep reinforcement learning to automatically optimize Fully Homomorphic Encryption code by learning effective sequences of rewriting rules for vectorization and latency reduction.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Weight Templates for Scalable Vision Model Initialization

author.name: Yucheng Xie, Fu Feng, Ruixiao Shi, Jing Wang, Yong Rui, Xin Geng

entry.summary: Proposes SWEET framework learning shared weight templates and size-specific scalers for flexible model initialization across varying depths and widths. Uses Tucker-based factorization for modular adaptation.

entry.title: Regularized $f$-Divergence Kernel Tests

author.name: M\'onica Ribero, Antonin Schrab, Arthur Gretton

entry.summary: Proposes framework for kernel-based two-sample tests from f-divergences using regularized variational representations. Focuses on Hockey-Stick divergence for differential privacy auditing and machine unlearning evaluation.

entry.title: Cross-Examination Framework: A Task-Agnostic Diagnostic for Information Fidelity in Text-to-Text Generation

author.name: Tathagata Raha, Clement Christophe, Nada Saadi, Hamza A Javed, Marco AF Pimentel, Ronnie Rajan, Praveenkumar Kanithi

entry.summary: Introduces Cross-Examination Framework for reference-free text generation evaluation treating source and candidate as knowledge bases. Generates questions and performs cross-examination for Coverage, Conformity, and Consistency scores.

entry.title: Binary Token-Level Classification with DeBERTa for All-Type MWE Identification: A Lightweight Approach with Linguistic Enhancement

author.name: Diego Rossini, Lonneke van der Plas

entry.summary: Presents DeBERTa-based approach for multiword expression identification achieving 69.8% F1 on CoAM dataset, surpassing Qwen-72B (57.8% F1) with 165x fewer parameters through binary token classification and linguistic features.

entry.title: Dynamic Multi-Expert Projectors with Stabilized Routing for Multilingual Speech Recognition

author.name: Isha Pandey, Ashish Mittal, Vartul Bahuguna, Ganesh Ramakrishnan

entry.summary: Proposes SMEAR-MoE, stabilized Mixture-of-Experts projector for multilingual ASR ensuring dense gradient flow to prevent expert collapse. Achieves up to 7.6% relative WER reduction over single-projector baseline.

entry.title: ALRM: Agentic LLM for Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Vitor Gaboardi dos Santos, Ibrahim Khadraoui, Ibrahim Farhat, Hamza Yous, Samy Teffahi, Hakim Hacid

entry.summary: Proposes ALRM, agentic LLM framework for robotic manipulation integrating policy generation with agentic execution. Addresses limitations of prior LLM-based robotic control lacking modular closed-loop execution.

entry.title: Dynamic Mask-Based Backdoor Attack Against Vision AI Models: A Case Study on Mushroom Detection

author.name: Zeineb Dridi, Jihen Bennaceur, Amine Ben Hassouna

entry.summary: Presents dynamic mask-based backdoor attack for object detection models using dataset poisoning. Demonstrates practical risks on mushroom detection dataset highlighting real-world food safety implications.

entry.title: NuiWorld: Exploring a Scalable Framework for End-to-End Controllable World Generation

author.name: Han-Hung Lee, Cheng-Yu Yang, Yu-Lun Liu, Angel X. Chang

entry.summary: Presents NuiWorld framework for scalable end-to-end controllable world generation using generative bootstrapping from few input images. Addresses data scarcity, controllability, and efficiency challenges in scene generation for gaming and robotics.

entry.title: Entropy-Guided k-Guard Sampling for Long-Horizon Autoregressive Video Generation

author.name: Yizhao Han, Tianxing Shi, Zhao Wang, Zifan Xu, Zhiyuan Pu, Mingxiao Li, Qian Zhang, Wei Yin, Xiao-Xiao Long

entry.summary: Proposes entropy-guided k-guard sampling for autoregressive video generation addressing the mismatch between static sampling strategies and video token properties. Adapts sampling based on semantic density and uncertainty.

entry.title: AMGFormer: Adaptive Multi-Granular Transformer for Brain Tumor Segmentation with Missing Modalities

author.name: Chengxiang Guo, Jian Wang, Junhua Fei, Xiao Li, Chunling Chen, Yun Jin

entry.summary: Proposes AMGFormer for brain tumor segmentation robust to missing MRI modalities, achieving improved stability through QuadIntegrator Bridge, Multi-Granular Attention, and Modality Quality-Aware Enhancement modules.

entry.title: PALM: Enhanced Generalizability for Local Visuomotor Policies via Perception Alignment

author.name: Ruiyu Wang, Zheyu Zhuang, Danica Kragic, Florian T. Pokorny

entry.summary: Introduces PALM for improving generalization in image-based behavior cloning across workspace shifts, viewpoint changes, and embodiment transfer simultaneously. Leverages invariance of local action distributions without requiring additional data collection or model changes.

entry.title: Physical Human-Robot Interaction: A Critical Review of Safety Constraints

author.name: Riccardo Zanella, Federico Califano, Stefano Stramigioli

entry.summary: Provides critical analysis of ISO/TS 15066 safety standards for physical human-robot interaction. Examines assumptions underlying safety constraints and identifies design parameters that can be adjusted for safety-critical implementations.

entry.title: Series on an international AGI project

author.name: wdmacaskill

entry.summary: Overview of Forethought research series on international AGI collaboration. Introduces core proposal for US-led project with non-US influence over specific decisions, modeled on Intelsat.

entry.title: CollectiveKV: Decoupling and Sharing Collaborative Information in Sequential Recommendation

author.name: Jingyu Li, Zhaocheng Du, Qianhui Zhu, kaiyuan Li, Zhicheng Zhang, Song-Li Wu, Chaolang Li, Pengwen Dai

entry.summary: Observes that KV sequences across users in sequential recommendation show significant similarities, and proposes CollectiveKV to decouple and share collaborative information across users to reduce storage overhead.

entry.title: Language Family Matters: Evaluating LLM-Based ASR Across Linguistic Boundaries

author.name: Yuchen Zhang, Ravi Shekhar, Haralambos Mouratidis

entry.summary: Proposes efficient connector-sharing strategy for LLM-based ASR based on linguistic family membership, reducing parameters while improving cross-domain generalization compared to per-language connectors.

entry.title: Dynamic Worlds, Dynamic Humans: Generating Virtual Human-Scene Interaction Motion in Dynamic Scenes

author.name: Yin Wang, Zhiying Leng, Haitian Liu, Frederick W. B. Li, Mu Li, Xiaohui Liang

entry.summary: Introduces Dyn-HSI, first cognitive architecture for dynamic human-scene interaction inspired by world models. Equips virtual humans with vision, memory, and motor control components for adaptive navigation.

entry.title: EgoHandICL: Egocentric 3D Hand Reconstruction with In-Context Learning

author.name: Binzhu Xie, Shi Qiu, Sicheng Zhang, Yinqiao Wang, Hao Xu, Muzammal Naseer, Chi-Wing Fu, Pheng-Ann Heng

entry.summary: Presents EgoHandICL, first in-context learning framework for egocentric 3D hand reconstruction using VLM-guided exemplar retrieval and MAE-based architecture with geometric objectives.

entry.title: Agentic Digital Twins: A Taxonomy of Capabilities for Understanding Possible Futures

author.name: Christopher Burr, Mark Enzer, Jason Shepherd, David Wagg

entry.summary: Presents taxonomy of agentic digital twins across three dimensions: locus of agency, tightness of coupling, and model evolution, identifying 27 configurations grouped into Present, Threshold, and Frontier clusters.

entry.title: RoamScene3D: Immersive Text-to-3D Scene Generation via Adaptive Object-aware Roaming

author.name: Jisheng Chu, Wenrui Li, Rui Zhao, Wangmeng Zuo, Shifeng Chen, Xiaopeng Fan

entry.summary: Proposes RoamScene3D for immersive 3D scene generation using adaptive object-aware roaming with semantic guidance. Addresses spatial blindness and inpainting limitations of existing 2D diffusion-based methods.

entry.title: A Non-Invasive 3D Gait Analysis Framework for Quantifying Psychomotor Retardation in Major Depressive Disorder

author.name: Fouad Boutaleb, Emery Pierson, Mohamed Daoudi, Cl\'emence Nineuil, Ali Amad, Fabien D'Hondt

entry.summary: Proposes non-invasive 3D gait analysis framework for quantifying psychomotor retardation in Major Depressive Disorder using monocular RGB video. Transforms video to clinically relevant 3D gait kinematics.

entry.title: VGGT-SLAM 2.0: Real time Dense Feed-forward Scene Reconstruction

author.name: Dominic Maggio, Luca Carlone

entry.summary: Presents VGGT-SLAM 2.0 improving real-time RGB SLAM by removing drift and planar degeneracy through new factor graph design. Uses attention layer analysis for loop closure without additional training.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Procedural Graph Extraction with Structural and Logical Refinement

author.name: Wangyang Ying, Yanchi Liu, Xujiang Zhao, Wei Cheng, Zhengzhang Chen, Wenchao Yu, Yanjie Fu, Haifeng Chen

entry.summary: Introduces a multi-agent framework for extracting procedural graphs from natural language through iterative refinement with dedicated structural feedback (simulation agent) and logical feedback (verifier agent) phases.

entry.title: SICL-AT: Another way to adapt Auditory LLM to low-resource task

author.name: Haolong Zheng, Siyin Wang, Zengrui Jin, Mark Hasegawa-Johnson

entry.summary: Shows that vanilla in-context learning improves zero-shot performance for auditory LLMs and proposes SICL-AT for adapting to low-resource tasks when labeled data is scarce or mismatched.

entry.title: From Answer Givers to Design Mentors: Guiding LLMs with the Cognitive Apprenticeship Model

author.name: Yongsu Ahn, Lejun R Liao, Benjamin Bach, Nam Wook Kim

entry.summary: Investigates guiding LLMs to act as design mentors using the Cognitive Apprenticeship Model with six instructional methods through structured prompting, evaluated with data visualization practitioners.

entry.title: m2sv: A Scalable Benchmark for Map-to-Street-View Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Yosub Shin, Michael Buriek, Igor Molybog

entry.summary: Introduces m2sv, a benchmark testing VLM ability to align overhead maps with street-view images for spatial reasoning. Best models achieve only 65.2% accuracy, revealing significant gaps in current VLM spatial understanding.

entry.title: SNR-Edit: Structure-Aware Noise Rectification for Inversion-Free Flow-Based Editing

author.name: Lifan Jiang, Boxi Wu, Yuhang Pei, Tianrun Wu, Yongyuan Chen, Yan Zhao, Shiyu Yu, Deng Cai

entry.summary: Introduces SNR-Edit, a training-free framework for inversion-free image editing using flow-based models that corrects trajectory drift through structure-aware noise rectification.

entry.title: GhostUI: Unveiling Hidden Interactions in Mobile UI

author.name: Minkyu Kweon, Seokhyeon Park, Soohyun Lee, You Been Lee, Jeongmin Rhee, Jinwook Seo

entry.summary: Presents GhostUI, a dataset for detecting hidden interactions (gestures without visual cues) in mobile applications, enabling both users and mobile agents to discover implicit UI features.

entry.title: Robust Uncertainty Estimation under Distribution Shift via Difference Reconstruction

author.name: Xinran Xu, Li Rong Wang, Xiuyi Fan

entry.summary: Proposes DRUE for robust uncertainty estimation under distribution shift by reconstructing inputs from two intermediate layers and measuring discrepancy.

entry.title: Cortex-Grounded Diffusion Models for Brain Image Generation

author.name: Fabian Bongratz, Yitong Li, Sama Elbaroudy, Christian Wachinger

entry.summary: Introduces Cor2Vox, a cortex-grounded generative framework for brain MRI synthesis using cortical surfaces to guide 3D diffusion, enabling topologically faithful synthesis.

entry.title: LLM-Enhanced Reinforcement Learning for Long-Term User Satisfaction in Interactive Recommendation

author.name: Chongjun Xia, Yanchun Peng, Xianzhi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes LERL, a hierarchical recommendation framework using LLMs for semantic planning to improve long-term user satisfaction beyond short-term preferences.

entry.title: Quantum Circuit Pre-Synthesis: Learning Local Edits to Reduce $T$-count

author.name: Daniele Lizzio Bosco, Lukasz Cincio, Giuseppe Serra, M. Cerezo

entry.summary: Proposes ML-based quantum circuit pre-synthesis for T-count reduction in fault-tolerant quantum computing, learning local edits to improve upon compositional synthesis.

entry.title: Implicit Q-Learning and SARSA: Liberating Policy Control from Step-Size Calibration

author.name: Hwanwoo Kim, Eric Laber

entry.summary: Proposes implicit variants of Q-learning and SARSA that reformulate updates as fixed-point equations, providing adaptive step-size adjustment that scales inversely with feature norms. Demonstrates stability over much broader step-size ranges.

entry.title: Analysis of Shuffling Beyond Pure Local Differential Privacy

author.name: Shun Takagi, Seng Pei Liew

entry.summary: Develops asymptotic analysis of privacy amplification by shuffling beyond pure local DP, showing leading term depends on local mechanism only through a single scalar parameter. Applies to broad class of randomizers including Gaussian mechanism.

entry.title: Whitespaces Don't Lie: Feature-Driven and Embedding-Based Approaches for Detecting Machine-Generated Code

author.name: Syed Mehedi Hasan Nirob, Shamim Ehsan, Moqsadur Rahman, Summit Haque

entry.summary: Compares feature-based and embedding-based approaches for detecting machine-generated code. Feature-based models achieve strong results with interpretable stylometric properties on 600K sample benchmark.

entry.title: ReToP: Learning to Rewrite Electronic Health Records for Clinical Prediction

author.name: Jesus Lovon-Melgarejo (IRIT), Jose G. Moreno (IRIT-IRIS), Christine Damase-Michel (IRIT-IRIS), Lynda Tamine (IRIT-IRIS)

entry.summary: Proposes ReToP LLM-based framework for clinical prediction that learns to rewrite EHRs by fully integrating prediction task signals. Addresses limitation of task-agnostic EHR enhancement approaches.

entry.title: Zero-Shot Stance Detection in the Wild: Dynamic Target Generation and Multi-Target Adaptation

author.name: Aohua Li, Yuanshuo Zhang, Ge Gao, Bo Chen, Xiaobing Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes zero-shot stance detection with dynamic target generation and multi-target adaptation for real-world social media where targets are not predefined. Creates Chinese dataset and multi-dimensional metrics.

entry.title: Evaluation of Oncotimia: An LLM based system for supporting tumour boards

author.name: Luis Lorenzo, Marcos Montana-Mendez, Sergio Figueiras, Miguel Boubeta, Cristobal Bernardo-Castineira

entry.summary: Presents ONCOTIMIA, clinical tool integrating GenAI for oncology workflows using multi-layer data lake, RAG, and rule-driven adaptive forms for automatic tumour board form completion from unstructured clinical documentation.

entry.title: On the Role of Depth in Surgical Vision Foundation Models: An Empirical Study of RGB-D Pre-training

author.name: John J. Han, Adam Schmidt, Muhammad Abdullah Jamal, Chinedu Nwoye, Anita Rau, Jie Ying Wu, Omid Mohareri

entry.summary: Conducts a large-scale empirical study comparing eight ViT-based vision foundation models for surgical scene understanding, specifically examining RGB vs RGB-D pre-training on 1.4M robotic surgical images. Explores whether depth information improves surgical AI performance.

entry.title: Pareto-Guided Optimization for Uncertainty-Aware Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Jinming Zhang, Xi Yang, Youpeng Yang, Haosen Shi, Yuyao Yan, Qiufeng Wang, Guangliang Cheng, Kaizhu Huang

entry.summary: Proposes Pareto-guided optimization for medical image segmentation addressing non-uniform uncertainty between boundary and interior regions. Introduces region-wise curriculum strategy prioritizing certain regions first.

entry.title: WaterClear-GS: Optical-Aware Gaussian Splatting for Underwater Reconstruction and Restoration

author.name: Xinrui Zhang, Yufeng Wang, Shuangkang Fang, Zesheng Wang, Dacheng Qi, Wenrui Ding

entry.summary: Introduces WaterClear-GS, first pure 3DGS-based framework for underwater reconstruction integrating optical properties of attenuation and scattering into Gaussian primitives without auxiliary networks.

entry.title: Perception-to-Pursuit: Track-Centric Temporal Reasoning for Open-World Drone Detection and Autonomous Chasing

author.name: Venkatakrishna Reddy Oruganti

entry.summary: Proposes Perception-to-Pursuit (P2P) framework for autonomous drone pursuit with track-centric temporal reasoning. Introduces Intercept Success Rate metric for pursuit-relevant trajectory prediction.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Path Planning in Unstructured Environments via Global-Guided Differentiable Hard Constraint Projection

author.name: Ziqian Wang, Chenxi Fang, Zhen Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes self-supervised path planning framework with differentiable hard constraint projection for autonomous navigation in unstructured environments. Uses Global-Guided APF for dense supervision without labels.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning Goal-Reaching Control with Guaranteed Lyapunov-Like Stabilizer for Mobile Robots

author.name: Mehdi Heydari Shahna, Seyed Adel Alizadeh Kolagar, Jouni Mattila

entry.summary: Proposes an RL-based control framework for mobile robots that provides formal goal-reaching guarantees through a shielding mechanism. Combines reinforcement learning with Lyapunov-like stability constraints to balance learning effectiveness with safety.

entry.title: Nonlocal Kramers-Moyal formulas and data-driven discovery of stochastic dynamical systems with multiplicative L\'evy noise

author.name: Yang Li, Jinqiao Duan

entry.summary: Establishes nonlocal Kramers-Moyal formulas for stochastic differential equations with multiplicative LÃ©vy noise. Enables data-driven discovery of SDEs with discontinuous sample paths and heavy-tailed fluctuations.

entry.title: Another glimpse of the Chinese AI scene: Z.AI

author.name: Mitchell_Porter

entry.summary: Reports on conversation with Zhipu's GLM-4.7, analyzing Chinese AI sector structure including established tech giants and AI 2.0 startups. Discusses Chinese perspectives on AI alignment and superintelligence.

entry.title: Routing End User Queries to Enterprise Databases

author.name: Saikrishna Sudarshan, Tanay Kulkarni, Manasi Patwardhan, Lovekesh Vig, Ashwin Srinivasan, Tanmay Tulsidas Verlekar

entry.summary: Addresses natural language query routing in multi-database enterprise environments using modular reasoning-driven reranking with schema coverage, structural connectivity, and semantic alignment.

entry.title: TFFM: Topology-Aware Feature Fusion Module via Latent Graph Reasoning for Retinal Vessel Segmentation

author.name: Iftekhar Ahmed, Shakib Absar, Aftar Ahmad Sami, Shadman Sakib, Debojyoti Biswas, Seraj Al Mahmud Mostafa

entry.summary: Introduces TFFM, a topology-aware feature fusion module for retinal vessel segmentation using graph attention networks in latent space. Addresses disconnected segmentations that prevent reliable clinical analysis.

entry.title: Fast Converging 3D Gaussian Splatting for 1-Minute Reconstruction

author.name: Ziyu Zhang, Tianle Liu, Diantao Tu, Shuhan Shen

entry.summary: Presents fast 3DGS reconstruction pipeline converging within one minute, developed for SIGGRAPH Asia challenge. Combines multiple techniques including anchor-based Neural-Gaussian representation and feed-forward initialization.

entry.title: GeoDiff3D: Self-Supervised 3D Scene Generation with Geometry-Constrained 2D Diffusion Guidance

author.name: Haozhi Zhu, Miaomiao Zhao, Dingyao Liu, Runze Tian, Yan Zhang, Jie Guo, Fenggen Yu

entry.summary: Proposes GeoDiff3D for self-supervised 3D scene generation using coarse geometry as structural anchor with geometry-constrained 2D diffusion guidance. Addresses structural artifacts in existing methods.

entry.title: Neuromorphic BrailleNet: Accurate and Generalizable Braille Reading Beyond Single Characters through Event-Based Optical Tactile Sensing

author.name: Naqash Afzal, Niklas Funk, Erik Helmut, Jan Peters, Benjamin Ward-Cherrier

entry.summary: Presents neuromorphic Braille reading pipeline using Evetac event-based tactile sensor with ResNet classifier. Achieves continuous reading mimicking human finger-scanning without discrete character scanning.

entry.title: Algorithmic Prompt-Augmentation for Efficient LLM-Based Heuristic Design for A* Search

author.name: Thomas B\"omer, Nico Koltermann, Max Disselnmeyer, Bastian Amberg, Anne Meyer

entry.summary: Extends Evolution of Heuristics framework with algorithmic prompt augmentation (A-CEoH) that includes A* code in prompts to leverage in-context learning for automated heuristic design.

entry.title: PCEvo: Path-Consistent Molecular Representation via Virtual Evolutionary

author.name: Kun Li, Longtao Hu, Yida Xiong, Jiajun Yu, Hongzhi Zhang, Jiameng Chen, Xiantao Cai, Jia Wu, Wenbin Hu

entry.summary: Introduces PCEvo, a path-consistent molecular representation method that learns from virtual evolutionary paths between similar molecules for few-shot property prediction.

entry.title: Learned split-spectrum metalens for obstruction-free broadband imaging in the visible

author.name: Seungwoo Yoon, Dohyun Kang, Eunsue Choi, Sohyun Lee, Seoyeon Kim, Minho Choi, Hyeonsu Heo, Dong-ha Shin, Suha Kwak, Arka Majumdar, Junsuk Rho, Seung-Hwan Baek

entry.summary: Introduces learned split-spectrum metalens combining hardware (metalens) and AI for broadband obstruction-free imaging by dividing spectrum into pass/stop bands.

entry.title: AI Cap-and-Trade: Efficiency Incentives for Accessibility and Sustainability

author.name: Marco Bornstein, Amrit Singh Bedi

entry.summary: Proposes market-based mechanisms (cap-and-trade) to incentivize AI efficiency, arguing that current hyper-scaling approach marginalizes smaller players and increases environmental costs.

entry.title: Latent Structural Similarity Networks for Unsupervised Discovery in Multivariate Time Series

author.name: Olusegun Owoeye

entry.summary: Proposes a task-agnostic discovery layer for multivariate time series that learns entity-level embeddings and induces sparse similarity networks without assuming linearity, stationarity, or downstream objectives.

entry.title: How Much Temporal Modeling is Enough? A Systematic Study of Hybrid CNN-RNN Architectures for Multi-Label ECG Classification

author.name: Alireza Jafari, Fatemeh Jafari

entry.summary: Systematic evaluation of CNN-RNN hybrid architectures for multi-label ECG classification, examining whether deep/stacked recurrent layers are necessary for capturing temporal dependencies in cardiac signals.

entry.title: One Global Model, Many Behaviors: Stockout-Aware Feature Engineering and Dynamic Scaling for Multi-Horizon Retail Demand Forecasting with a Cost-Aware Ordering Policy (VN2 Winner Report)

author.name: Bartosz Szab{\l}owski

entry.summary: Winning solution for VN2 Inventory Planning Challenge using two-stage predict-then-optimize pipeline with global multi-horizon forecasting and cost-aware ordering policy for retail demand.

entry.title: FSD-CAP: Fractional Subgraph Diffusion with Class-Aware Propagation for Graph Feature Imputation

author.name: Xin Qiao, Shijie Sun, Anqi Dong, Cong Hua, Xia Zhao, Longfei Zhang, Guangming Zhu, Liang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes FSD-CAP for graph feature imputation using fractional diffusion on local subgraphs and class-aware propagation refinement, targeting high missing rate scenarios.

entry.title: Attention-Enhanced Graph Filtering for False Data Injection Attack Detection and Localization

author.name: Ruslan Abdulin, Mohammad Rasoul Narimani

entry.summary: Proposes attention-enhanced graph filtering for detecting false data injection attacks in power systems, addressing limitations of existing GNN approaches in capturing both local and global dependencies.

entry.title: Accelerated training of Gaussian processes using banded square exponential covariances

author.name: Emily C. Ehrhardt, Felipe Tobar

entry.summary: Proposes accelerated GP training by constructing banded approximations to SE covariance matrices, eliminating near-zero off-diagonal entries to reduce computational cost of inverse and determinant computation.

entry.title: Contrast-Source-Based Physics-Driven Neural Network for Inverse Scattering Problems

author.name: Yutong Du, Zicheng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes CSPDNN for inverse scattering problems predicting induced current distribution, incorporating adaptive total variation loss for robust reconstruction under varying contrast and noise.

entry.title: OSIRIS: Bridging Analog Circuit Design and Machine Learning with Scalable Dataset Generation

author.name: Giuseppe Chiari, Michele Piccoli, Davide Zoni

entry.summary: Introduces OSIRIS, a scalable framework for generating analog IC design datasets to enable ML-based automation, addressing limited data availability bottleneck.

entry.title: Advances in Diffusion-Based Generative Compression

author.name: Yibo Yang, Stephan Mandt

entry.summary: Provides a unifying review of diffusion-based methods for generative lossy compression, focusing on image compression. Surveys approaches where diffusion models iteratively refine encoded embeddings to produce realistic reconstructions at low bit-rates.

entry.title: Transparency-First Medical Language Models: Datasheets, Model Cards, and End-to-End Data Provenance for Clinical NLP

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov, Taner Yilmaz, Ayse Tuba Tugrul, Melike Nesrin Zaman, Ozkan Gunalp, Duygu Erisken, Sila Burde Dulger, Rana Irem Turhan, Izzet Ozdemir, Derya Umut Kulali, Ozan Akbulut, Harun Demircioglu, Hasan Basri Kara, Berfin Tavan

entry.summary: Introduces TeMLM transparency artifacts for clinical language models including datasheets, model cards, and provenance tracking. Demonstrates on Technetium-I dataset with 498K synthetic clinical notes for PHI de-identification.

entry.title: Generalizable Equivariant Diffusion Models for Non-Abelian Lattice Gauge Theory

author.name: Gert Aarts, Diaa E. Habibi, Andreas Ipp, David I. M\"uller, Thomas R. Ranner, Lingxiao Wang, Wei Wang, Qianteng Zhu

entry.summary: Demonstrates gauge equivariant diffusion models can accurately model non-Abelian lattice gauge theory using Metropolis-adjusted annealed Langevin algorithm. Shows remarkable generalization to larger couplings and lattice sizes.

entry.title: PsyProbe: Proactive and Interpretable Dialogue through User State Modeling for Exploratory Counseling

author.name: Sohhyung Park, Hyunji Kang, Sungzoon Cho, Dongil Kim

entry.summary: Introduces PsyProbe dialogue system for counseling exploration phase with systematic psychological state tracking using PPPPPI framework and cognitive error detection. Combines multiple components for proactive therapeutic dialogue.

entry.title: DiaDem: Advancing Dialogue Descriptions in Audiovisual Video Captioning for Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Xinlong Chen, Weihong Lin, Jingyun Hua, Linli Yao, Yue Ding, Bozhou Li, Bohan Zeng, Yang Shi, Qiang Liu, Yuanxing Zhang, Pengfei Wan, Liang Wang, Tieniu Tan

entry.summary: Proposes DiaDem for accurate dialogue description in audiovisual video captioning using synthesized SFT dataset and difficulty-partitioned GRPO strategy. Introduces DiaDemBench for evaluating dialogue description capabilities.

entry.title: Formula-One Prompting: Adaptive Reasoning Through Equations For Applied Mathematics

author.name: Natapong Nitarach, Pittawat Taveekitworachai, Kunat Pipatanakul

entry.summary: Proposes Formula-One Prompting using mathematical equations as intermediate representation before adaptive solving strategy selection (CoT, PoT, or direct). Two-phase approach for applied mathematics problems.

entry.title: Rethinking Discrete Speech Representation Tokens for Accent Generation

author.name: Jinzuomu Zhong, Yi Wang, Korin Richmond, Peter Bell

entry.summary: Presents first systematic investigation of accent information in discrete speech representation tokens. Proposes Accent ABX evaluation task and analyzes how ASR supervision affects accent encoding in speech tokens.

entry.title: NC-Reg : Neural Cortical Maps for Rigid Registration

author.name: Ines Vati, Pierrick Bourgeat, Rodrigo Santa Cruz, Vincent Dore, Olivier Salvado, Clinton Fookes, L\'eo Lebrat

entry.summary: Introduces neural cortical maps as a continuous neural representation for cortical feature maps, achieving 30x faster runtimes than barycentric interpolation. Demonstrates NC-Reg algorithm for rigid registration of cortical surfaces.

entry.title: TIGaussian: Disentangle Gaussians for Spatial-Awared Text-Image-3D Alignment

author.name: Jiarun Liu, Qifeng Chen, Yiru Zhao, Minghua Liu, Baorui Ma, Sheng Yang

entry.summary: Proposes TIGaussian for text-image-3D alignment using 3D Gaussian Splatting characteristics. Uses multi-branch tokenizer to decouple 3DGS properties into compact latent representations for cross-modality alignment.

entry.title: HexFormer: Hyperbolic Vision Transformer with Exponential Map Aggregation

author.name: Haya Alyoussef, Ahmad Bdeir, Diego Coello de Portugal Mecke, Tom Hanika, Niels Landwehr, Lars Schmidt-Thieme

entry.summary: Introduces HexFormer, a hyperbolic vision transformer with exponential map aggregation for hierarchical image classification. Explores hyperbolic geometry for better modeling hierarchical visual structures.

entry.title: Learning the Pareto Space of Multi-Objective Autonomous Driving: A Modular, Data-Driven Approach

author.name: Mohammad Elayan, Wissam Kontar

entry.summary: Proposes empirical learning framework for deriving safety-efficiency-interaction trade-offs in autonomous driving from naturalistic trajectory data. Uses Pareto dominance to identify optimal driving states.

entry.title: Judgelight: Trajectory-Level Post-Optimization for Multi-Agent Path Finding via Closed-Subwalk Collapsing

author.name: Yimin Tang, Sven Koenig, Erdem B{\i}y{\i}k

entry.summary: Proposes Judgelight post-optimization for Multi-Agent Path Finding via closed-subwalk collapsing to remove redundant movements. Proves MAPF-Collapse is NP-hard and presents ILP formulation.

entry.title: Information-Theoretic Detection of Bimanual Interactions for Dual-Arm Robot Plan Generation

author.name: Elena Merlo, Marta Lagomarsino, Arash Ajoudani

entry.summary: Presents a one-shot method for generating dual-arm robot execution plans from a single RGB video of bimanual task demonstration. Uses information theory to detect hand coordination patterns and generates modular behavior trees.

entry.title: Prediction Markets as Bayesian Inverse Problems: Uncertainty Quantification, Identifiability, and Information Gain from Price-Volume Histories under Latent Types

author.name: Juan Pablo Madrigal-Cianci, Camilo Monsalve Maya, Lachlan Breakey

entry.summary: Formulates prediction markets as Bayesian inverse problems where event outcomes are inferred from price-volume histories. Introduces a mechanism-agnostic model accounting for heterogeneous trader types and microstructure noise.

entry.title: The Window for Political Revolution is Closing Soon

author.name: koanchuk

entry.summary: Argues that technological unemployment from AGI won't necessarily lead to social contracts protecting workers. Analyzes how historical revolutionary leverage requires numerical advantage that AI-enabled coercion could eliminate.

entry.title: Implicit Non-Causal Factors are Out via Dataset Splitting for Domain Generalization Object Detection

author.name: Zhilong Zhang, Lei Zhang, Qing He, Shuyin Xia, Guoyin Wang, Fuxiang Huang

entry.summary: Addresses domain generalization for object detection by tackling implicit non-causal factors through dataset splitting. Identifies limitations in domain adversarial learning approaches and proposes solutions for more robust generalization.

entry.title: Towards Gold-Standard Depth Estimation for Tree Branches in UAV Forestry: Benchmarking Deep Stereo Matching Methods

author.name: Yida Lin, Bing Xue, Mengjie Zhang, Sam Schofield, Richard Green

entry.summary: Presents first systematic zero-shot evaluation of eight stereo depth estimation methods on vegetation-dense environments using novel Canterbury Tree Branches dataset. Reveals scene-dependent performance patterns.

entry.title: SimTO: A simulation-based topology optimization framework for bespoke soft robotic grippers

author.name: Kurt Enkera, Josh Pinskier, Marcus Gallagher, David Howard

entry.summary: Proposes SimTO framework for topology optimization of bespoke soft robotic grippers tailored to feature-rich objects like gears and vegetables. Addresses grasping of geometrically complex objects.

entry.title: ComAgent: Multi-LLM based Agentic AI Empowered Intelligent Wireless Networks

author.name: Haoyun Li, Ming Xiao, Kezhi Wang, Robert Schober, Dong In Kim, Yong Liang Guan

entry.summary: Presents ComAgent, a multi-LLM framework for 6G network optimization using Perception-Planning-Action-Reflection cycles with specialized agents for literature search, coding, and scoring to generate solver-ready formulations.

entry.title: Bridging Visual and Wireless Sensing: A Unified Radiation Field for 3D Radio Map Construction

author.name: Chaozheng Wen, Jingwen Tong, Zehong Lin, Chenghong Bian, Jun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a unified radiation field framework bridging visual and wireless sensing for 3D radio map construction using principles governing both optical and electromagnetic propagation.

entry.title: Talos: Optimizing Top-$K$ Accuracy in Recommender Systems

author.name: Shengjia Zhang, Weiqin Yang, Jiawei Chen, Peng Wu, Yuegang Sun, Gang Wang, Qihao Shi, Can Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Talos, a loss function specifically designed to optimize Top-K recommendation accuracy while addressing distribution shifts in recommender systems.

entry.title: Instance-Guided Radar Depth Estimation for 3D Object Detection

author.name: Chen-Chou Lo, Patrick Vandewalle

entry.summary: Proposes InstaRadar framework for monocular 3D object detection using instance segmentation-guided radar point expansion and depth estimation.

entry.title: Mocap Anywhere: Towards Pairwise-Distance based Motion Capture in the Wild (for the Wild)

author.name: Ofir Abramovich, Ariel Shamir, Andreas Aristidou

entry.summary: Introduces Wild-Poser, a motion capture system using only sparse pairwise distance measurements from UWB sensors, enabling robust outdoor and uncontrolled environment capture.

entry.title: GMS-CAVP: Improving Audio-Video Correspondence with Multi-Scale Contrastive and Generative Pretraining

author.name: Shentong Mo, Zehua Chen, Jun Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes GMS-CAVP combining multi-scale video-audio alignment with spatial-temporal diffusion for improved audio-video correspondence learning.

entry.title: Statistical Inference for Explainable Boosting Machines

author.name: Haimo Fang, Kevin Tan, Jonathan Pipping, Giles Hooker

entry.summary: Provides statistical inference methods for Explainable Boosting Machines without computationally expensive bootstrapping, using Boulevard regularization to enable convergence analysis. Offers theoretical guarantees and practical uncertainty quantification.

entry.title: Transformer Learning of Chaotic Collective Dynamics in Many-Body Systems

author.name: Ho Jang, Gia-Wei Chern

entry.summary: Demonstrates transformers can learn chaotic collective dynamics in many-body systems by selectively reweighting long-range temporal correlations. Applied to Holstein model showing non-Markovian reduced descriptions from time-series data.

entry.title: Task-Centric Policy Optimization from Misaligned Motion Priors

author.name: Ziang Zheng, Kai Feng, Yi Nie, Shentao Qin

entry.summary: Proposes Task-Centric Motion Priors (TCMP) for humanoid control that treats imitation as conditional regularizer rather than co-equal objective. Addresses misalignment between motion demonstrations and robotic tasks.

entry.title: Do LLMs Truly Benefit from Longer Context in Automatic Post-Editing?

author.name: Ahrii Kim, Seong-heum Kim

entry.summary: Systematically compares proprietary and open-weight LLMs for automatic post-editing under document-level context. Finds proprietary LLMs achieve near human-level quality even with simple prompting regardless of document context.

entry.title: RATE: Reviewer Profiling and Annotation-free Training for Expertise Ranking in Peer Review Systems

author.name: Weicong Liu, Zixuan Yang, Yibo Zhao, Xiang Li

entry.summary: Introduces LR-bench benchmark for reviewer assignment with self-assessed familiarity ratings and RATE framework for reviewer profiling. Addresses challenges of outdated benchmarks and proxy signal limitations.

entry.title: Non-Invasive 3D Wound Measurement with RGB-D Imaging

author.name: Lena Hark\"amper, Leo Lebrat, David Ahmedt-Aristizabal, Olivier Salvado, Mattias Heinrich, Rodrigo Santa Cruz

entry.summary: Presents a non-invasive 3D wound measurement algorithm using RGB-D imaging with B-spline surface reconstruction. Achieves sub-millimeter accuracy on wound phantoms for clinical wound monitoring applications.

entry.title: VC-Bench: Pioneering the Video Connecting Benchmark with a Dataset and Evaluation Metrics

author.name: Zhiyu Yin, Zhipeng Liu, Kehai Chen, Lemao Liu, Jin Liu, Hong-Dong Li, Yang Xiang, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces VC-Bench, a benchmark for video connecting task with 1,579 videos across 15 categories. Proposes evaluation metrics for generating smooth intermediate content between video clips.

entry.title: Bridging Information Asymmetry: A Hierarchical Framework for Deterministic Blind Face Restoration

author.name: Zhengjian Yao, Jiakui Hu, Kaiwen Li, Hangzhou He, Xinliang Zhang, Shuang Zeng, Lei Zhu, Yanye Lu

entry.summary: Proposes Pref-Restore for blind face restoration addressing information asymmetry through hierarchical framework integrating discrete semantic logic with continuous texture generation for deterministic outputs.

entry.title: SharpNet: Enhancing MLPs to Represent Functions with Controlled Non-differentiability

author.name: Hanting Niu, Junkai Deng, Fei Hou, Wencheng Wang, Ying He

entry.summary: Presents SharpNet, modified MLP architecture capable of representing functions with prescribed C0 sharp features. Enriches network with auxiliary feature function via Poisson equation with jump conditions.

entry.title: Rethinking Intelligence: Brain-like Neuron Network

author.name: Weifeng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Brain-like Neural Network (BNN) paradigm and LuminaNet instantiation operating without convolutions or self-attention, inspired by neuroscience perspectives on intelligence formation and evolution.

entry.title: iFAN Ecosystem: A Unified AI, Digital Twin, Cyber-Physical Security, and Robotics Environment for Advanced Nuclear Simulation and Operations

author.name: Youndo Do, Chad Meece, Marc Zebrowitz, Spencer Banks, Myeongjun Choi, Xiaoxu Diao, Kai Tan, Michael Doran, Jason Reed, Fan Zhang

entry.summary: Presents iFAN ecosystem, a digital twin framework for nuclear facilities integrating AI, cybersecurity, physical security, and robotic operations. Provides high-fidelity virtual testbed for pre-deployment verification.

entry.title: Reimagining Social Robots as Recommender Systems: Foundations, Framework, and Applications

author.name: Jin Huang, Fethiye Irmak Do\u{g}an, Hatice Gunes

entry.summary: Proposes reimagining social robots through the lens of recommender systems to better capture user preferences across long-term, short-term, and fine-grained dimensions. Argues this addresses limitations of current LLM and RL-based personalization approaches.

entry.title: Direct Doubly Robust Estimation of Conditional Quantile Contrasts

author.name: Josh Givens, Song Liu, Henry W J Reeve, Katarzyna Reluga

entry.summary: Proposes direct estimation of conditional quantile contrasts for heterogeneous treatment effect analysis. Avoids the need for CDF inversion while maintaining interpretability advantages of quantile-level summaries.

entry.title: Configurable p-Neurons Using Modular p-Bits

author.name: Saleh Bunaiyan, Mohammad Alsharif, Abdelrahman S. Abdelrahman, Hesham ElSawy, Suraj S. Cheema, Suhaib A. Fahmy, Kerem Y. Camsari, Feras Al-Dirini

entry.summary: Re-engineers probabilistic bits (p-bits) into modular design enabling configurable probabilistic neurons with various activation functions including probabilistic Sigmoid, Tanh, and ReLU.

entry.title: FBSDiff++: Improved Frequency Band Substitution of Diffusion Features for Efficient and Highly Controllable Text-Driven Image-to-Image Translation

author.name: Xiang Gao, Yunpeng Jia

entry.summary: Introduces FBSDiff++ for text-driven image-to-image translation using frequency band substitution of diffusion features. Enables plug-and-play I2I without model training or fine-tuning.

entry.title: DSTCS: Dual-Student Teacher Framework with Segment Anything Model for Semi-Supervised Pubic Symphysis Fetal Head Segmentation

author.name: Yalin Luo, Shun Long, Huijin Wang, Jieyun Bai

entry.summary: Proposes DSTCS framework combining CNN and SAM for semi-supervised pubic symphysis and fetal head segmentation in ultrasound. Integrates Segment Anything Model into dual student-teacher framework.

entry.title: QuaMo: Quaternion Motions for Vision-based 3D Human Kinematics Capture

author.name: Cuong Le, Pavlo Melnyk, Urs Waldmann, M{\aa}rten Wadenb\"ack, Bastian Wandt

entry.summary: Proposes QuaMo for vision-based 3D human motion capture using quaternion representations to avoid Euler angle discontinuities. Enables stable online motion reconstruction without trajectory refinement.

entry.title: Query-Guided Spatial-Temporal-Frequency Interaction for Music Audio-Visual Question Answering

author.name: Kun Li, Michael Ying Yang, Sami Sebastian Brandt

entry.summary: Proposes query-guided spatial-temporal-frequency interaction framework for music audio-visual question answering. Addresses limitation of treating audio as secondary to visual in existing AVQA methods.

entry.title: Benchmarking Multimodal Large Language Models for Missing Modality Completion in Product Catalogues

author.name: Junchen Fu, Wenhao Deng, Kaiwen Zheng, Alexandros Karatzoglou, Ioannis Arapakis, Yu Ye, Yongxin Ni, Joemon M. Jose, Xuri Ge

entry.summary: Introduces MMPCBench for evaluating MLLMs on missing modality completion in e-commerce product catalogues. Benchmarks six state-of-the-art MLLMs on content quality and recommendation tasks.

entry.title: Estimating Trust in Human-Robot Collaboration through Behavioral Indicators and Explainability

author.name: Giulio Campagna, Marta Lagomarsino, Marta Lorenzini, Dimitrios Chrysostomou, Matthias Rehm, Arash Ajoudani

entry.summary: Introduces a data-driven framework for estimating trust in human-robot collaboration using behavioral indicators. Achieves 84% accuracy with machine learning classifiers trained on operator feedback.

entry.title: Resolving Primitive-Sharing Ambiguity in Long-Tailed Industrial Point Cloud Segmentation via Spatial Context Constraints

author.name: Chao Yin, Qing Han, Zhiwei Hou, Yue Liu, Anjin Dai, Hongda Hu, Ji Yang, Wei Yao

entry.summary: Proposes spatial context constraints to resolve primitive-sharing ambiguity in industrial point cloud segmentation with extreme class imbalance (215:1). Addresses geometric ambiguity where safety-critical components share shapes with dominant structures.

entry.title: The S3LI Vulcano Dataset: A Dataset for Multi-Modal SLAM in Unstructured Planetary Environments

author.name: Riccardo Giubilato, Marcus Gerhard M\"uller, Marco Sewtz, Laura Alejandra Encinar Gonzalez, John Folkesson, Rudolph Triebel

entry.summary: Releases S3LI Vulcano dataset for multi-modal SLAM benchmarking in planetary environments with volcanic terrain data from Sicily. Provides diverse textures and terrains for space robotics research.

entry.title: DiffStyle3D: Consistent 3D Gaussian Stylization via Attention Optimization

author.name: Yitong Yang, Xuexin Liu, Yinglin Wang, Jing Wang, Hao Dou, Changshuo Wang, Shuting He

entry.summary: Proposes DiffStyle3D for 3DGS style transfer using attention-aware loss in diffusion latent space. Addresses multi-view consistency and training stability issues of existing approaches.

entry.title: Length-Adaptive Interest Network for Balancing Long and Short Sequence Modeling in CTR Prediction

author.name: Zhicheng Zhang, Zhaocheng Du, Jieming Zhu, Jiwei Tang, Fengyuan Lu, Wang Jiaheng, Song-Li Wu, Qianhui Zhu, Jingyu Li, Hai-Tao Zheng, Zhenhua Dong

entry.summary: Proposes LAIN, a plug-and-play framework that uses sequence length as a conditioning signal to balance CTR prediction performance for users with different interaction history lengths, addressing attention polarization issues.

entry.title: Bridging Gulfs in UI Generation through Semantic Guidance

author.name: Seokhyeon Park, Soohyun Lee, Eugene Choi, Hyunwoo Kim, Minkyu Kweon, Yumin Song, Jinwook Seo

entry.summary: Develops a system for UI generation that identifies hierarchical design semantics and enables users to specify, visualize, and extract how these semantics are reflected in AI-generated interfaces.

entry.title: A Hybrid Supervised-LLM Pipeline for Actionable Suggestion Mining in Unstructured Customer Reviews

author.name: Aakash Trivedi, Aniket Upadhyay, Pratik Narang, Dhruv Kumar, Praveen Kumar

entry.summary: Evaluates a hybrid pipeline combining high-recall RoBERTa classifier with instruction-tuned LLM for extracting actionable suggestions from customer reviews.

entry.title: Tri-Reader: An Open-Access, Multi-Stage AI Pipeline for First-Pass Lung Nodule Annotation in Screening CT

author.name: Fakrul Islam Tushar, Joseph Y. Lo

entry.summary: Introduces Tri-Reader, an open-access pipeline integrating lung segmentation, nodule detection, and malignancy classification for first-pass lung nodule annotation in screening CT.

entry.title: Hyperbolic Additive Margin Softmax with Hierarchical Information for Speaker Verification

author.name: Zhihua Fang, Liang He

entry.summary: Proposes Hyperbolic Additive Margin Softmax for speaker verification, leveraging hyperbolic geometry's hierarchical properties for speaker embedding learning.

entry.title: Reimagining Peer Review Process Through Multi-Agent Mechanism Design

author.name: Ahmad Farooq, Kamran Iqbal

entry.summary: Position paper arguing that peer review dysfunction is a mechanism design failure, proposing multi-agent RL to design incentive-compatible protocols including credit-based submission economy and MARL-optimized reviewer assignment.

entry.title: Revisiting Incremental Stochastic Majorization-Minimization Algorithms with Applications to Mixture of Experts

author.name: TrungKhang Tran, TrungTin Nguyen, Gersende Fort, Tung Doan, Hien Duy Nguyen, Binh T. Nguyen, Florence Forbes, Christopher Drovandi

entry.summary: Revisits incremental stochastic Majorization-Minimization algorithms for streaming data, generalizing incremental stochastic EM. Establishes convergence guarantees with applications to Mixture of Experts models.

entry.title: NavFormer: IGRF Forecasting in Moving Coordinate Frames

author.name: Yoontae Hwang, Dongwoo Lee, Minseok Choi, Yong Sup Ihn, Daham Kim, Deok-Young Lee

entry.summary: NavFormer predicts IGRF total intensity using rotation-invariant features and a Canonical SPD module for stable spectral processing across varying sensor attitudes in autonomous navigation.

entry.title: Process-Aware Procurement Lead Time Prediction for Shipyard Delay Mitigation

author.name: Yongjae Lee, Eunhee Park, Daesan Park, Dongho Kim, Jongho Choi, Hyerim Bae

entry.summary: Proposes process-aware procurement lead time prediction for shipyards treating procurement as dynamic business process with sequential events rather than static physical attributes.

entry.title: Collaborative Compressors in Distributed Mean Estimation with Limited Communication Budget

author.name: Harsh Vardhan, Arya Mazumdar

entry.summary: Studies correlation-aware compression schemes for distributed mean estimation where vectors are often similar. Proposes methods that work without knowing correlations and analyzes graceful degradation when correlation assumptions fail.

entry.title: A Framework for Evaluating Faithfulness in Explainable AI for Machine Anomalous Sound Detection Using Frequency-Band Perturbation

author.name: Alexander Buck, Georgina Cosma, Iain Phillips, Paul Conway, Patrick Baker

entry.summary: Introduces quantitative evaluation framework for XAI faithfulness in anomalous sound detection through systematic frequency-band removal. Links attribution relevance directly to model behavior for objective assessment of explanations.

entry.title: C2NP: A Benchmark for Learning Scale-Dependent Geometric Invariances in 3D Materials Generation

author.name: Can Polat, Erchin Serpedin, Mustafa Kurban, Hasan Kurban

entry.summary: Introduces Crystal-to-Nanoparticle (C2NP) benchmark for evaluating generative models on transitions between infinite periodic crystals and finite nanoparticles. Tests whether models capture surface effects and size-dependent phenomena.

entry.title: SE-DiCoW: Self-Enrolled Diarization-Conditioned Whisper

author.name: Alexander Polok, Dominik Klement, Samuele Cornell, Matthew Wiesner, Jan \v{C}ernock\'y, Sanjeev Khudanpur, Luk\'a\v{s} Burget

entry.summary: Addresses speaker ambiguity in Diarization-Conditioned Whisper by adding self-enrollment, where speaker embeddings are dynamically extracted to disambiguate overlapping speakers with similar conditioning masks.

entry.title: Optimal Asynchronous Stochastic Nonconvex Optimization under Heavy-Tailed Noise

author.name: Yidong Wu, Luo Luo

entry.summary: Proposes asynchronous normalized stochastic gradient descent with momentum achieving optimal time complexity under heavy-tailed gradient noise with heterogeneous computation times across workers.

entry.title: Interpretable and backpropagation-free Green Learning for efficient multi-task echocardiographic segmentation and classification

author.name: Jyun-Ping Kao, Jiaxing Yang, C. -C. Jay Kuo, Jonghye Woo

entry.summary: Proposes backpropagation-free Green Learning framework for echocardiography combining unsupervised VoxelHop encoder with multi-level regression for LV segmentation and LVEF classification. Offers interpretable alternative to deep learning.

entry.title: Reflective Translation: Improving Low-Resource Machine Translation via Structured Self-Reflection

author.name: Nicholas Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes Reflective Translation prompting framework for low-resource languages (isiZulu, isiXhosa) where model generates initial translation, self-critique, then refined translation. Explores self-reflection for translation improvement.

entry.title: Intent2QoS: Language Model-Driven Automation of Traffic Shaping Configurations

author.name: Sudipta Acharya, Burak Kantarci

entry.summary: Proposes Intent2QoS framework converting natural language traffic shaping intents to valid Linux traffic control rules. First end-to-end pipeline connecting intent translation with queuing-theoretic semantics.

entry.title: Smart Split-Federated Learning over Noisy Channels for Embryo Image Segmentation

author.name: Zahra Hafezi Kafshgari, Ivan V. Bajic, Parvaneh Saeedi

entry.summary: Studies the effects of communication channel noise on Split-Federated learning and proposes a smart averaging strategy to improve resilience. Demonstrates two orders of magnitude improvement in noise tolerance for embryo image segmentation.

entry.title: Establishing dermatopathology encyclopedia DermpathNet with Artificial Intelligence-Based Workflow

author.name: Ziyang Xu, Mingquan Lin, Yiliang Zhou, Zihan Xu, Seth J. Orlow, Zihan Xu, Shane A. Meehan, Alexandra Flamm, Ata S. Moshiri, Yifan Peng

entry.summary: Establishes DermpathNet, a dermatopathology encyclopedia using AI workflow to curate and categorize images from PubMed Central. Combines deep learning classification with figure caption analysis achieving 89.6% F-score.

entry.title: A new Image Similarity Metric for a Perceptual and Transparent Geometric and Chromatic Assessment

author.name: Antonio Di Marino, Vincenzo Bevilacqua, Emanuel Di Nardo, Angelo Ciaramella, Ivanoe De Falco, Giovanna Sannino

entry.summary: Proposes new perceptual image similarity metric combining texture dissimilarity via Earth Mover's Distance with chromatic evaluation in Oklab color space. Outperforms state-of-art on Berkeley-Adobe dataset.

entry.title: DuwatBench: Bridging Language and Visual Heritage through an Arabic Calligraphy Benchmark for Multimodal Understanding

author.name: Shubham Patle, Sara Ghaboura, Hania Tariq, Mohammad Usman Khan, Omkar Thawakar, Rao Muhammad Anwer, Salman Khan

entry.summary: Introduces DuwatBench, benchmark for Arabic calligraphy understanding with 1,272 samples across six styles. Tests multimodal models on challenging artistic Arabic script recognition.

entry.title: Agree to Disagree: Consensus-Free Flocking under Constraints

author.name: Peter Travis Jardine, Sidney Givigi

entry.summary: Updates flocking frameworks to relax assumption of shared inter-agent distances, enabling negotiation with diverse agent types and partially-aligned goals through constrained collective potential functions.

entry.title: Whether We Care, How We Reason: The Dual Role of Anthropomorphism and Moral Foundations in Robot Abuse

author.name: Fan Yang, Renkai Ma, Yaxin Hu, Lingyao Li

entry.summary: Mixed-methods study (N=201) examining how anthropomorphism and moral foundations shape human reactions to robot abuse. Finds anthropomorphism determines whether people extend moral consideration while moral foundations shape how they reason about it.

entry.title: How Does Delegation in Social Interaction Evolve Over Time? Navigation with a Robot for Blind People

author.name: Rayna Hata, Masaki Kuribayashi, Allan Wang, Hironobu Takagi, Chieko Asakawa

entry.summary: Studies how blind users' perceptions of human-robot delegation evolve with repeated use of a navigation-assistive robot in a real-world museum. Examines balance between autonomy and robot assistance over time.

entry.title: Predictive Accuracy versus Interpretability in Energy Markets: A Copula-Enhanced TVP-SVAR Analysis

author.name: Fredy Pokou (MRE, CRIStAL), Jules Sadefo Kamdem (MRE), Kpante Emmanuel Gnandi (ENAC-LAB)

entry.summary: Compares structural econometric models (TVP-SVAR with copulas) against machine learning methods for energy market forecasting. Investigates whether interpretable models can match ML predictive accuracy.

entry.title: An Interpretable Recommendation Model for Psychometric Data, With an Application to Gerontological Primary Care

author.name: Andre Paulino de Lima, Paula Castro, Suzana Carvalho Vaz de Andrade, Rosa Maria Marcucci, Ruth Caldeira de Melo, Marcelo Garcia Manzato

entry.summary: Develops an interpretable recommendation model for gerontological primary care that uses psychometric data structure to provide visual explanations faithful to the model and interpretable by care professionals.

entry.title: Reg-TTR, Test-Time Refinement for Fast, Robust and Accurate Image Registration

author.name: Lin Chen, Yue He, Fengting Zhang, Yaonan Wang, Fengming Lin, Xiang Chen, Min Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Reg-TTR, a test-time refinement framework combining deep learning with conventional registration techniques. Achieves improved registration accuracy with only 21% additional inference time overhead.

entry.title: Handcrafted Feature Fusion for Reliable Detection of AI-Generated Images

author.name: Syed Mehedi Hasan Nirob, Moqsadur Rahman, Shamim Ehsan, Summit Haque

entry.summary: Systematically evaluates handcrafted descriptors (HOG, LBP, DCT, etc.) for AI-generated image detection, finding fusion approaches achieve 95.31% accuracy competitive with deep learning on CIFAKE dataset.

entry.title: Towards Governance-Oriented Low-Altitude Intelligence: A Management-Centric Multi-Modal Benchmark With Implicitly Coordinated Vision-Language Reasoning Framework

author.name: Hao Chang, Zhihui Wang, Lingxiang Wu, Peijin Wang, Wenhui Diao, Jinqiao Wang

entry.summary: Introduces GovLA-10K benchmark and GovLA-Reasoner framework for management-oriented low-altitude intelligence. Focuses on governance-aware aerial perception for smart city applications.

entry.title: DSVM-UNet : Enhancing VM-UNet with Dual Self-distillation for Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Renrong Shao, Dongyang Li, Dong Xia, Lin Shao, Jiangdong Lu, Fen Zheng, Lulu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes DSVM-UNet improving Vision Mamba UNet for medical segmentation through dual self-distillation without complex architectural changes. Aligns features at intermediate and output levels.

entry.title: A Switching Nonlinear Model Predictive Control Strategy for Safe Collision Handling by an Underwater Vehicle-Manipulator System

author.name: Ioannis G. Polyzos, Konstantinos J. Kyriakopoulos

entry.summary: Proposes switching Nonlinear MPC strategy for safe collision handling by Underwater Vehicle-Manipulator Systems. Uses manipulator to deflect away from unavoidable collisions.

entry.title: Robust Out-of-Order Retrieval for Grid-Based Storage at Maximum Capacity

author.name: Tzvika Geft, William Zhang, Jingjin Yu, Kostas Bekris

entry.summary: Proposes framework for efficient automated storage with uncertainty handling, guaranteeing zero-relocation retrieval even under unknown storage sequences through robust algorithms.

entry.title: QA-ReID: Quality-Aware Query-Adaptive Convolution Leveraging Fused Global and Structural Cues for Clothes-Changing ReID

author.name: Yuxiang Wang, Kunming Jiang, Tianxiang Zhang, Ke Tian, Gaozhe Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes QA-ReID for clothes-changing person re-identification using quality-aware query adaptive convolution. Fuses RGB and parsing-based features with pixel-level importance weighting for robustness to clothing changes.

entry.title: Beyond Shadows: A Large-Scale Benchmark and Multi-Stage Framework for High-Fidelity Facial Shadow Removal

author.name: Tailong Luo, Jiesong Bai, Jinyang Huang, Junyu Xia, Wangyu Wu, Xuhang Chen

entry.summary: Introduces ASFW dataset for facial shadow removal with 1,081 paired images created via professional Photoshop workflow. Proposes Face Shadow Eraser (FSE) network for multi-stage shadow removal.

entry.title: Tournament Informed Adversarial Quality Diversity

author.name: Timoth\'ee Anne, Noah Syrkis, Meriem Elhosni, Florian Turati, Alexandre Manai, Franck Legendre, Alain Jaquier, Sebastian Risi

entry.summary: Proposes Tournament Informed Adversarial Quality Diversity for coevolutionary problems, improving task selection in Generational Adversarial MAP-Elites through tournament-based evaluation.

entry.title: Agentic Business Process Management Systems

author.name: Marlon Dumas, Fredrik Milani, David Chapela-Campa
