author.name: Xinyu Zhu, Parisa Fard Moshiri, Poonam Lohan, Burak Kantarci, Emil Janulewicz

entry.summary: Proposes AST-Masking for natural language to SQL conversion in network service function chain provisioning, using abstract syntax trees to enforce syntactic consistency during fine-tuning.

entry.title: Synthetic Data Guided Feature Selection for Robust Activity Recognition in Older Adults

author.name: Shuhao Que, Dieuwke van Dartel, Ilse Heeringa, Han Hegeman, Miriam Vollenbroek-Hutten, Ying Wang

entry.summary: Develops robust human activity recognition for hip fracture rehabilitation using synthetic data-guided feature selection, addressing challenges with older adults' slower, variable gait patterns.

entry.title: Decoding Psychological States Through Movement: Inferring Human Kinesic Functions with Application to Built Environments

author.name: Cheyu Lin, Katherine A. Flanigan, Sirajum Munir

entry.summary: Introduces DUET dataset and kinesics recognition framework for measuring socially meaningful interaction in built environments using privacy-preserving movement analysis.

entry.title: Multi-stage Bridge Inspection System: Integrating Foundation Models with Location Anonymization

author.name: Takato Yasuno

entry.summary: Presents open-source bridge damage detection system with regional privacy protection using SAM 3 for rebar corrosion detection and DBSCAN for completion, with construction sign anonymization.

entry.title: HyDeMiC: A Deep Learning-based Mineral Classifier using Hyperspectral Data

author.name: M. L. Mamud, Piyoosh Jaysaval, Frederick D Day-Lewis, M. K. Mudunuru

entry.summary: Proposes HyDeMiC CNN for hyperspectral mineral classification robust to noisy data, trained on laboratory-measured data for 115 minerals from USGS.

entry.title: Saliency Driven Imagery Preprocessing for Efficient Compression -- Industrial Paper

author.name: Justin Downes, Sam Saltwick, Anthony Chen

entry.summary: Proposes saliency-driven preprocessing for satellite imagery compression, focusing encoding on areas of interest identified by saliency maps to optimize storage and bandwidth.

entry.title: Stylizing ViT: Anatomy-Preserving Instance Style Transfer for Domain Generalization

author.name: Sebastian Doerrich, Francesco Di Salvo, Jonas Alle, Christian Ledig

entry.summary: Proposes Stylizing ViT, a Vision Transformer that uses weight-shared attention blocks for both self- and cross-attention to enable domain generalization in medical imaging through instance-level style transfer while preserving anatomical structures.

entry.title: Learning Sewing Patterns via Latent Flow Matching of Implicit Fields

author.name: Cong Cao, Ren Li, Corentin Dumery, Hao Li

entry.summary: Presents a sewing pattern generation method using implicit representation with signed/unsigned distance fields encoded into a continuous latent space, combined with flow matching to learn distributions over panel combinations.

entry.title: DTC: A Deformable Transposed Convolution Module for Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Chengkun Sun, Jinqian Pan, Renjie Liang, Zhengkang Fan, Xin Miao, Jiang Bian, Jie Xu

entry.summary: DTC introduces deformable transposed convolution for medical image segmentation, allowing adaptive sampling positions during upsampling to better capture structural information in UNet-like architectures.

entry.title: Strip-Fusion: Spatiotemporal Fusion for Multispectral Pedestrian Detection

author.name: Asiegbu Miracle Kanu-Asiegbu, Nitin Jotwani, Xiaoxiao Du

entry.summary: Strip-Fusion proposes spatial-temporal fusion network for multispectral pedestrian detection that is robust to misalignment between RGB and thermal images and handles varying lighting conditions.

entry.title: Cross-Domain Transfer with Self-Supervised Spectral-Spatial Modeling for Hyperspectral Image Classification

author.name: Jianshu Chao, Tianhua Lv, Qiqiong Ma, Yunfei Qiu, Li Fang, Huifang Shen, Wei Yao

entry.summary: Introduces self-supervised cross-domain transfer framework for hyperspectral classification that learns transferable spectral-spatial representations without source labels using Spatial-Spectral Transformer.

entry.title: TempDiffReg: Temporal Diffusion Model for Non-Rigid 2D-3D Vascular Registration

author.name: Zehua Liu, Shihao Zou, Jincai Huang, Yanfang Zhang, Chao Tong, Weixin Si

entry.summary: TempDiffReg proposes temporal diffusion model for non-rigid 2D-3D vascular registration in liver interventions, using coarse-to-fine strategy with structure-aware perspective n-point alignment.

entry.title: Contextual Range-View Projection for 3D LiDAR Point Clouds

author.name: Seyedali Mousavi, Seyedhamidreza Mousavi, Masoud Daneshtalab

entry.summary: Extends depth-based point selection in LiDAR range-view projection by incorporating contextual information from instance centers and class labels to address many-to-one mapping conflicts.

entry.title: REMAC: Reference-Based Martian Asymmetrical Image Compression

author.name: Qing Ding, Mai Xu, Shengxi Li, Xin Deng, Xin Zou

entry.summary: REMAC develops efficient Martian image compression exploiting strong intra- and inter-image similarities in texture, color, and structure, addressing computational constraints on Mars.

entry.title: Automated Landmark Detection for assessing hip conditions: A Cross-Modality Validation of MRI versus X-ray

author.name: Roberto Di Via, Vito Paolo Pastore, Francesca Odone, Si\^on Glyn-Jones, Irina Voiculescu

entry.summary: Conducts matched-cohort validation study comparing automated landmark detection on MRI versus X-ray for hip condition assessment, demonstrating clinical equivalence for cam-type impingement.

entry.title: Attention-Based Variational Framework for Joint and Individual Components Learning with Applications in Brain Network Analysis

author.name: Yifei Zhang, Meimei Liu, Zhengwu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes CM-JIVNet, a variational framework for learning joint and modality-specific latent representations from paired brain connectivity data (structural and functional connectivity).

entry.title: Real-Time Synchronized Interaction Framework for Emotion-Aware Humanoid Robots

author.name: Yanrong Chen, Xihan Bian

entry.summary: Presents real-time framework for NAO robots synchronizing speech prosody with gestures using LLM-generated motion descriptors and dynamic time warping.

entry.title: Out-of-Distribution Radar Detection with Complex VAEs: Theory, Whitening, and ANMF Fusion

author.name: Yadang Alexis Rouzoumka, Jean Pinsolle, Eug\'enie Terreaux, Christ\`ele Morisseau, Jean-Philippe Ovarlez, Chengfang Ren

entry.summary: Investigates OOD detection for radar using Complex VAEs trained on clutter-plus-noise, with local whitening preprocessing and ANMF fusion.

entry.title: Covariate-assisted Grade of Membership Models via Shared Latent Geometry

author.name: Zhiyu Xu, Yuqi Gu

entry.summary: Introduces covariate-assisted grade of membership model integrating response and covariate information through shared simplex geometry with spectral estimation procedure.

entry.title: Learning Transferable Skills in Action RPGs via Directed Skill Graphs and Selective Adaptation

author.name: Ali Najar

entry.summary: Learns transferable combat skills in Dark Souls III using directed skill graphs and hierarchical curriculum, demonstrating selective adaptation when game phases change.

entry.title: Cross-Lingual Probing and Community-Grounded Analysis of Gender Bias in Low-Resource Bengali

author.name: Md Asgor Hossain Reaj, Rajan Das Gupta, Jui Saha Pritha, Abdullah Al Noman, Abir Ahmed, Golam Md Mohiuddin, Tze Hui Liew

entry.summary: Cross-lingual probing of gender bias in Bengali LLMs using multiple extraction methods including translation-based comparison and GPT-based bias generation.

entry.title: SPADE: A SIMD Posit-enabled compute engine for Accelerating DNN Efficiency

author.name: Sonu Kumar, Lavanya Vinnakota, Mukul Lokhande, Santosh Kumar Vishvakarma, Adam Teman

entry.summary: Presents SPADE, a unified multi-precision SIMD Posit-based MAC architecture supporting multiple Posit formats for energy-efficient DNN inference at the edge.

entry.title: Over-The-Air Extreme Learning Machines with XL Reception via Nonlinear Cascaded Metasurfaces

author.name: Kyriakos Stylianopoulos, Mattia Fabiani, Giulia Torcolacci, Davide Dardari, George C. Alexandropoulos

entry.summary: Presents XL-MIMO system using programmable metasurfaces as Extreme Learning Machine for over-the-air binary classification with closed-form training.

entry.title: Delay-Compensated Stiffness Estimation for Robot-Mediated Dyadic Interaction

author.name: Mingtian Du, Suhas Raghavendra Kulkarni, Bernardo Noronha, Domenico Campolo

entry.summary: Proposes delay-compensated stiffness estimation framework for robot-mediated dyadic interaction that explicitly accounts for network-induced haptic delays.

entry.title: Exact Minimum-Volume Confidence Set Intersection for Multinomial Outcomes

author.name: Heguang Lin, Binhao Chen, Mengze Li, Daniel Pimentel-Alarc\'on, Matthew L. Malloy

entry.summary: Presents certified algorithm for determining whether minimum-volume confidence sets intersect for multinomial outcomes, encoding as decision problem.

entry.title: Coding-Enforced Resilient and Secure Aggregation for Hierarchical Federated Learning

author.name: Shudi Weng, Ming Xiao, Mikael Skoglund

entry.summary: H-SecCoGC proposes coding-based secure aggregation for hierarchical federated learning, ensuring accurate aggregation under varying privacy levels.

entry.title: Entropy-Guided Agreement-Diversity: A Semi-Supervised Active Learning Framework for Fetal Head Segmentation in Ultrasound

author.name: Fangyijie Wang, Siteng Ma, Gu\'enol\'e Silvestre, Kathleen M. Curran

entry.summary: Proposes EGAD, a two-stage active learning sampler for fetal head segmentation that combines entropy-based uncertainty selection with agreement-diversity scoring.

entry.title: Constraint-Aware Discrete-Time PID Gain Optimization for Robotic Joint Control Under Actuator Saturation

author.name: Ojasva Mishra, Xiaolong Wu, Min Xu

entry.summary: Presents implementation-aware analysis and Bayesian optimization workflow for discrete-time PID control under actuator saturation with analytical stability guarantees.

entry.title: Cognitive Platform Engineering for Autonomous Cloud Operations

author.name: Vinoth Punniyamoorthy, Nitin Saksena, Srivenkateswara Reddy Sankiti, Nachiappan Chockalingam, Aswathnarayan Muthukrishnan Kirubakaran, Shiva Kumar Reddy Carimireddy, Durgaraman Maruthavanan

entry.summary: Proposes Cognitive Platform Engineering integrating AI sensing, reasoning, and autonomous action into cloud operations through a four-plane reference architecture for next-generation DevOps.

entry.title: Between Search and Platform: ChatGPT Under the DSA

author.name: Toni Lorente, Kathrin Gardhouse

entry.summary: Legal analysis arguing ChatGPT should be classified as a hybrid of online search engines and platforms under the EU Digital Services Act, requiring specific regulatory treatment.

entry.title: PC-MCL: Patient-Consistent Multi-Cycle Learning with multi-label bias correction for respiratory sound classification

author.name: Seung Gyu Jeong, Seong-Eun Kim

entry.summary: Proposes PC-MCL for respiratory sound classification addressing multi-label distributional bias through multi-cycle concatenation and patient-matching auxiliary task.

entry.title: Parameter Efficient Fine Tuning Llama 3.1 for Answering Arabic Legal Questions: A Case Study on Jordanian Laws

author.name: Mohammed Fasha, Bassam Hammo, Bilal Sowan, Husam Barham, Esam Nsour

entry.summary: Fine-tunes Llama-3.1 8B for Arabic legal QA using PEFT with LoRA adapters and 4-bit quantization. Custom dataset of 6000 legal question-answer pairs from Jordanian laws.

entry.title: DIETA: A Decoder-only transformer-based model for Italian-English machine TrAnslation

author.name: Pranav Kasela, Marco Braga, Alessandro Ghiotto, Andrea Pilzer, Marco Viviani, Alessandro Raganato

entry.summary: DIETA: 0.5B decoder-only transformer for Italian-English translation trained on 207M sentence pairs plus back-translated data, with new WikiNews evaluation set.

entry.title: Diffusion Model-based Reinforcement Learning for Version Age of Information Scheduling: Average and Tail-Risk-Sensitive Control

author.name: Haoyuan Pan, Sizhao Chen, Zhaorui Wang, Tse-Tin Chan

entry.summary: Applies diffusion model-based reinforcement learning to optimize Version Age of Information scheduling in wireless systems, addressing both average and tail-risk scenarios. Novel combination of generative models with wireless resource allocation under long-term constraints.

entry.title: Emergent Cooperation in Quantum Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Using Communication

author.name: Michael K\"olle, Christian Reff, Leo S\"unkel, Julian Hager, Gerhard Stenzel, Claudia Linnhoff-Popien

entry.summary: Applies communication protocols (MATE, MEDIATE, Gifting, RIAL) to quantum Q-Learning agents for emergent cooperation in Sequential Social Dilemmas.

entry.title: Systematicity between Forms and Meanings across Languages Supports Efficient Communication

author.name: Doreen Osmelak, Yang Xu, Michael Hahn, Kate McCurdy

entry.summary: Examines how grammatical meanings map to word forms across languages, finding evidence for competing pressures of simplicity and accuracy. Introduces novel complexity measure based on learnability of meaning-to-form mappings.

entry.title: Corpus-Based Approaches to Igbo Diacritic Restoration

author.name: Ignatius Ezeani

entry.summary: PhD thesis presenting corpus-based approaches to diacritic restoration for Igbo, a low-resource African language. Addresses NLP resource gaps for under-served languages.

entry.title: Memento: Towards Proactive Visualization of Everyday Memories with Personal Wearable AR Assistant

author.name: Yoonsang Kim, Yalong Yang, Arie E. Kaufman

entry.summary: Introduces Memento, an AR assistant that permanently captures user queries with spatiotemporal context, discovering connections between recurring interests and proactively delivering relevant information.

entry.title: Diagnosis Support of Sickle Cell Anemia by Classifying Red Blood Cell Shape in Peripheral Blood Images

author.name: Wilkie Delgado-Font, Miriela Escobedo-Nicot, Manuel Gonz\'alez-Hidalgo, Silena Herold-Garcia, Antoni Jaume-i-Cap\'o, Arnau Mir

entry.summary: Proposes automated method for red blood cell classification in peripheral blood images using Chan-Vese segmentation for sickle cell anemia diagnosis support.

entry.title: An AI-enabled tool for quantifying overlapping red blood cell sickling dynamics in microfluidic assays

author.name: Nikhil Kadivar, Guansheng Li, Jianlu Zheng, John M. Higgins, Ming Dao, George Em Karniadakis, Mengjia Xu

entry.summary: Presents an automated deep learning framework for quantifying sickle cell populations in microscopy data, combining AI-assisted annotation, nnU-Net segmentation, and watershed algorithms to track morphological transitions in densely packed cells.

entry.title: Domain Generalization with Quantum Enhancement for Medical Image Classification: A Lightweight Approach for Cross-Center Deployment

author.name: Jingsong Xia, Siqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes a lightweight domain generalization framework with quantum-enhanced collaborative learning for medical image classification, combining MobileNetV2 encoder with multi-domain imaging shift simulation.

entry.title: Semi-Supervised Hyperspectral Image Classification with Edge-Aware Superpixel Label Propagation and Adaptive Pseudo-Labeling

author.name: Yunfei Qiu, Qiqiong Ma, Tianhua Lv, Li Fang, Shudong Zhou, Wei Yao

entry.summary: Proposes semi-supervised hyperspectral image classification with edge-aware superpixel label propagation and adaptive pseudo-labeling to address boundary diffusion and pseudo-label instability.

author.name: Muhammad Ali Shah (Riphah International University, Islamabad, Pakistan), Muhammad Mansoor Alam (Riphah International University, Islamabad, Pakistan, Multimedia University, Malaysia), Saddam Hussain Khan (University of Engineering and Applied Sciences, Swat, Kanju Township, Pakistan)

entry.summary: Proposes Densely Swin Hybrid framework for brain tumor MRI classification with boosted feature spaces combining DenseNet local patterns and Swin Transformer global context.

entry.title: OREHAS: A fully automated deep-learning pipeline for volumetric endolymphatic hydrops quantification in MRI

author.name: Caterina Fuster-Barcel\'o, Claudia Castrill\'on, Laura Rodrigo-Mu\~noz, Victor Manuel Vega-Su\'arez, Nicol\'as P\'erez-Fern\'andez, Gorka Bastarrika, Arrate Mu\~noz-Barrutia

entry.summary: OREHAS provides first fully automatic pipeline for volumetric endolymphatic hydrops quantification from clinical MRI, integrating slice classification, localization, and sequence-specific segmentation.

entry.title: Generative Diffusion Augmentation with Quantum-Enhanced Discrimination for Medical Image Diagnosis

author.name: Jingsong Xia, Siqi Wang

entry.summary: SDA-QEC combines simplified diffusion-based augmentation with quantum-enhanced classification for medical image diagnosis, addressing class imbalance in datasets like pneumonia detection.

entry.title: CONQUER: Context-Aware Representation with Query Enhancement for Text-Based Person Search

author.name: Zequn Xie

entry.summary: Introduces CONQUER, a two-stage framework for text-based person search that improves cross-modal alignment using optimal transport and a plug-and-play query enhancement module at inference time.

entry.title: Quest2ROS2: A ROS 2 Framework for Bi-manual VR Teleoperation

author.name: Jialong Li, Zhenguo Wang, Tianci Wang, Maj Stenmark, Volker Krueger

entry.summary: Presents Quest2ROS2, open-source ROS2 framework for bi-manual VR teleoperation with relative motion-based control overcoming workspace limitations.

entry.title: MV-S2V: Multi-View Subject-Consistent Video Generation

author.name: Ziyang Song, Xinyu Gong, Bangya Liu, Zelin Zhao

entry.summary: MV-S2V addresses multi-view subject-to-video generation with synthetic data pipeline and real-world captured dataset for 3D-consistent subject control.

entry.title: An Unsupervised Tensor-Based Domain Alignment

author.name: Chong Hyun Lee, Kibae Lee, Hyun Hee Yim

entry.summary: Proposes tensor-based domain alignment algorithm using alignment matrices on oblique manifold with regularization to preserve variance of source and target tensors.

entry.title: Intelligence Requires Grounding But Not Embodiment

author.name: Marcus Ma, Shrikanth Narayanan

entry.summary: Argues philosophically that intelligence requires grounding (connection to meaning) but not necessarily physical embodiment, proposing four properties of intelligence achievable by non-embodied grounded agents.

entry.title: Summary of the Unusual Activity Recognition Challenge for Developmental Disability Support

author.name: Christina Garcia, Nhat Tan Le, Taihei Fujioka, Umang Dobhal, Milyun Ni'ma Shoumi, Thanh Nha Nguyen, Sozo Inoue

entry.summary: Overview of challenge for recognizing unusual behaviors from pose estimation data in facilities for individuals with developmental disabilities using Leave-One-Subject-Out evaluation.

entry.title: Dynamic Meta-Ensemble Framework for Efficient and Accurate Deep Learning in Plant Leaf Disease Detection on Resource-Constrained Edge Devices

author.name: Weloday Fikadu Moges, Jianmei Su, Amin Waqas

entry.summary: Introduces Dynamic Meta-Ensemble Framework combining MobileNetV2, NASNetMobile, and InceptionV3 with adaptive weighting for plant disease detection on edge devices.

entry.title: BrainDistill: Implantable Motor Decoding with Task-Specific Knowledge Distillation

author.name: Yuhan Xie, Jinhan Liu, Xiaoyong Ni, Fei Tan, Icare Sakr, Thibault Collin, Shiqi Sun, Alejandro Rodriguez Guajardo, Demon Fanny, Charles-francois Vincent Latchoumane, Henri Lorach, Jocelyne Bloch, Gregoire Courtine, Mahsa Shoaran

entry.summary: BrainDistill uses task-specific knowledge distillation for implantable BCIs, prioritizing decoding-critical features for power-constrained deployment.

entry.title: Generative AI in Saudi Arabia: A National Survey of Adoption, Risks, and Public Perceptions

author.name: Abdulaziz AlDakheel, Ali Alshehre, Esraa Alamoudi, Moslim AlKhabbaz, Ahmed Aljohani, Raed Alharbi

entry.summary: Nationwide survey of 330 participants examining generative AI adoption, risks, and perceptions in Saudi Arabia. Finds 93% actively use GenAI primarily for text tasks with limited advanced usage.

entry.title: Reasoning-Enhanced Rare-Event Prediction with Balanced Outcome Correction

author.name: Vitaly Bulgakov, Alexander Turchin

entry.summary: Introduces LPCORP, a two-stage framework for rare-event prediction combining reasoning-enhanced prediction with confidence-based outcome correction. Uses logistic regression to correct prevalence-driven bias in predictions.

entry.title: Bayesian Experimental Design for Model Discrepancy Calibration: A Rivalry between Kullback--Leibler Divergence and Wasserstein Distance

author.name: Huchen Yang, Xinghao Dong, Jin-Long Wu

entry.summary: Compares KL divergence vs Wasserstein distance as utility functions for Bayesian experimental design. Identifies an issue with Wasserstein distance where its value depends on posterior shape rather than just location.

entry.title: Process-Tensor Tomography of SGD: Measuring Non-Markovian Memory via Back-Flow of Distinguishability

author.name: Vasileios Sevetlidis, George Pavlidis

entry.summary: Proposes viewing neural network training as a 'process tensor' and introduces back-flow of distinguishability as a witness of training memory. Demonstrates non-Markovianity in SGD training dynamics.

entry.title: Dual-Prototype Disentanglement: A Context-Aware Enhancement Framework for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Haonan Yang, Jianchao Tang, Zhuo Li

entry.summary: Proposes DPAD, a model-agnostic framework for time series forecasting that disentangles and leverages complex temporal patterns. Uses dual-prototype bank with common and distinctive components.

entry.title: Uncertainty propagation through trained multi-layer perceptrons: Exact analytical results

author.name: Andrew Thompson, Miles McCrory

entry.summary: Provides exact analytical expressions for mean and variance of MLP output when input is multivariate Gaussian. Works for single hidden layer with ReLU activations without series expansion.

entry.title: Calibrated Similarity for Reliable Geometric Analysis of Embedding Spaces

author.name: Nicolas Tacheny

entry.summary: Uses isotonic regression to calibrate cosine similarity in embedding spaces to human judgments. Achieves near-perfect calibration while preserving rank correlation and local stability.

entry.title: Group-realizable multi-group learning by minimizing empirical risk

author.name: Navid Ardeshir, Samuel Deng, Daniel Hsu, Jingwen Liu

entry.summary: Shows sample complexity of multi-group learning improves in group-realizable setting with ERM. Also proves implementing this is computationally intractable when group class has infinite VC dimension.

entry.title: Distributional Computational Graphs: Error Bounds

author.name: Olof Hallqvist Elias, Michael Selby, Phillip Stanley-Marbell

entry.summary: Establishes non-asymptotic Wasserstein-1 error bounds for distributional computational graphs where inputs are probability distributions. Applies to empirical distributions and finite approximations.

entry.title: Perfect Clustering for Sparse Directed Stochastic Block Models

author.name: Behzad Aalipur, Yichen Qin

entry.summary: Proposes non-spectral method for community detection in sparse directed stochastic block models. Uses neighborhood-smoothing followed by K-means, working when number of communities grows.

entry.title: Neurocomputational Mechanisms of Syntactic Transfer in Bilingual Sentence Production

author.name: Ahmet Yavuz Uluslu, Elliot Murphy

entry.summary: Discusses incorporating oscillatory neural signatures into study of bilingual production errors, proposing ROSE model can account for syntactic transfer and cross-linguistic influence.

entry.title: Hybrid Deep Feature Extraction and ML for Construction and Demolition Debris Classification

author.name: Obai Alashram, Nejad Alagha, Mahmoud AlKakuri, Zeeshan Swaveel, Abigail Copiaco

entry.summary: Presents hybrid pipeline using deep feature extraction (Xception) with classical ML classifiers for construction debris classification on novel UAE dataset of 1,800 images across 4 material categories.

entry.title: GlassesGB: Controllable 2D GAN-Based Eyewear Personalization for 3D Gaussian Blendshapes Head Avatars

author.name: Rui-Yang Ju, Jen-Shiun Chiang

entry.summary: Proposes GlassesGB framework for customizable eyewear generation on 3D head avatars, bridging 2D GAN-based eyewear design with 3D Gaussian Blendshapes head reconstruction.

entry.title: Quantifying Ergonomics in the Elevate Soft Robotic Suit

author.name: Peter Bryan, Rejin John Varghese, Dario Farina

entry.summary: Presents quantitative evaluation of ergonomics and comfort for the Elevate cable-driven soft robotic suit for shoulder elevation assistance.

entry.title: Uni-RS: A Spatially Faithful Unified Understanding and Generation Model for Remote Sensing

author.name: Weiyu Zhang, Yuan Hu, Yong Li, Yu Liu

entry.summary: Uni-RS addresses spatial asymmetry in remote sensing multimodal models through explicit spatial-layout planning and spatial-aware query injection.

entry.title: Private Accountability in the Age of Artificial Intelligence

author.name: Sonia Katyal

entry.summary: Legal/academic analysis exploring conflicts between AI and civil rights protection, arguing for focus on technology-property-civil rights interactions rather than algorithmic accountability alone.

entry.title: Arabic Sign Language Recognition using Multimodal Approach

author.name: Ghadeer Alanazi, Abir Benabid

entry.title: LoD Sketch Extraction from Architectural Models Using Generative AI: Dataset Construction for Multi-Level Architectural Design Generation

author.name: Xusheng Du, Athiwat Kongkaeo, Ye Zhang, Haoran Xie

entry.summary: Proposes automatic LoD sketch extraction framework using generative AI for multi-level architectural design, addressing lack of paired training data for LoD modeling.

entry.title: Federated Proximal Optimization for Privacy-Preserving Heart Disease Prediction: A Controlled Simulation Study on Non-IID Clinical Data

author.name: Farzam Asad, Junaid Saif Khan, Maria Tariq, Sundus Munir, Muhammad Adnan Khan

entry.summary: Simulation study of FedProx for heart disease prediction on non-IID clinical data using UCI Heart Disease dataset. Addresses privacy constraints in healthcare.

entry.title: Feature-Space Generative Models for One-Shot Class-Incremental Learning

author.name: Jack Foster, Kirill Paramonov, Mete Ozay, Umberto Michieli

entry.summary: Uses feature-space generative models for one-shot class-incremental learning by mapping embeddings to residual space and learning prototypes.

entry.title: Design Techniques for LLM-Powered Interactive Storytelling: A Case Study of the Dramamancer System

author.name: Tiffany Wang, Yuqian Sun, Yi Wang, Melissa Roemmele, John Joon Young Chung, Max Kreminski

entry.summary: Extended abstract outlining design techniques for LLM-powered interactive storytelling in Dramamancer system, bridging authorial intent and player agency through story schemas.

entry.title: Hylog: A Hybrid Approach to Logging Text Production in Non-alphabetic Scripts

author.name: Roberto Crotti, Giovanni Denaro, Zhiqiang Du, Ricardo Mu\~noz Mart\'in

entry.summary: Presents Hylog, a hybrid logging system combining analytical keylogging with ecological text logging to capture Input Method Editor transformations for non-alphabetic scripts like Chinese.

entry.title: Designing large language model prompts to extract scores from messy text: A shared dataset and challenge

author.name: Mike Thelwall

entry.summary: Introduces dataset and challenge for designing LLM prompts to extract research quality scores from messy text, providing benchmark for NLP extraction tasks.

entry.title: Quran-MD: A Fine-Grained Multilingual Multimodal Dataset of the Quran

author.name: Muhammad Umar Salman, Mohammad Areeb Qazi, Mohammed Talha Alam

entry.summary: Presents Quran-MD, a comprehensive multimodal dataset integrating textual, linguistic, and audio dimensions of the Quran at verse and word levels, including recordings from 32 reciters.

entry.title: Revisiting Aerial Scene Classification on the AID Benchmark

author.name: Subhajeet Das, Susmita Ghosh, Abhiroop Chatterjee

entry.summary: Surveys aerial scene classification methods from handcrafted features to deep hybrid networks, and proposes Aerial-Y-Net with spatial attention and multi-scale feature fusion.

entry.title: Comparative Evaluation of Machine Learning Algorithms for Affective State Recognition from Children's Drawings

author.name: Aura Loredana Dan

entry.summary: Compares deep learning architectures (MobileNet, EfficientNet, VGG16) for affective state recognition from children's drawings for autism assessment.

entry.title: ME-WARD: A multimodal ergonomic analysis tool for musculoskeletal risk assessment from inertial and video data in working plac

author.name: Javier Gonz\'alez-Alonso, Paula Mart\'in-Tapia, David Gonz\'alez-Ortega, M\'iriam Ant\'on-Rodr\'iguez, Francisco Javier D\'iaz-Pernas, Mario Mart\'inez-Zarzuela

entry.summary: Presents ME-WARD, a multimodal ergonomic assessment tool implementing RULA methodology using IMU-based motion capture and deep learning pose tracking.

entry.title: No silver bullet: Lessons about how to create safety from the history of fire

author.name: jasoncrawford

entry.summary: Historical analysis of fire safety development arguing that safety is achieved through 'defense in depth' and multiple coordinated solutions, not silver bullets. Uses this as an analogy for thinking about AI safety approaches.

entry.title: Futarchy is Parasitic on What It Tries to Govern

author.name: Nicolas Rasmont

entry.summary: Argues futarchy (governance by prediction markets) fails structurally because conditional decision markets cannot estimate causal policy effects once acted upon. Traders price welfare conditional on approval rather than caused by approval.

entry.title: Credit Fairness: Online Fairness In Shared Resource Pools

author.name: Seyed Majid Zahedi, Rupert Freeman

entry.summary: Credit Fairness addresses online fairness in shared resource allocation, showing max-min mechanism leads to large disparities over time.

entry.title: Autonomous Mars Rover Module for Soil Sampling and Life Component Analysis

author.name: Bibek Adhikari, Rishab Rijal, Rakesh Yadav, Nikchey Khatri, Sandesh Dhakal

entry.summary: Proposes autonomous Mars rover module for soil sampling and biochemical testing using multidisciplinary integration of mechanical and vision systems.

entry.title: Grammar-Aware Literate Generative Mathematical Programming with Compiler-in-the-Loop

author.name: Roberto Rossi, Steven D. Prestwich

entry.summary: SyntAGM translates natural language to PyOPL mathematical models via generate-compile-assess-revise loop with grammar awareness.

entry.title: HyCARD-Net: A Synergistic Hybrid Intelligence Framework for Cardiovascular Disease Diagnosis

author.name: Rajan Das Gupta, Xiaobin Wu, Xun Liu, Jiaqi He

entry.summary: Proposes HyCARD-Net combining CNNs, LSTMs with KNN and XGBoost via ensemble voting for cardiovascular disease diagnosis, achieving high accuracy on benchmark datasets.

entry.title: Investigating Self-regulated Learning Sequences within a Generative AI-based Intelligent Tutoring System

author.name: Jie Gao, Shasha Li, Jianhua Zhang, Shan Li, Tingting Wang

entry.summary: Studies self-regulated learning patterns in GenAI-assisted tutoring systems by analyzing student interaction traces and information processing behaviors. Uses sequential and clustering analysis to identify learning patterns.

entry.title: AI-based System for Transforming text and sound to Educational Videos

author.name: M. E. ElAlami, S. M. Khater, M. El. R. Rehan

entry.summary: Proposes a GAN-based system for converting text or speech inputs into educational videos through three phases: transcription, keyword extraction, and frame-by-frame video generation.

entry.title: SiMiC: Context-Aware Silicon Microstructure Characterization Using Attention-Based Convolutional Neural Networks for Field-Emission Tip Analysis

author.name: Jing Jie Tan, Rupert Schreiner, Matthias Hausladen, Ali Asgharzade, Simon Edler, Julian Bartsch, Michael Bachmann, Andreas Schels, Ban-Hoe Kwan, Danny Wee-Kiat Ng, Yan-Chai Hum

entry.summary: Proposes SiMiC, an attention-based CNN for characterizing silicon microstructures from SEM images, automatically extracting morphological features like size, shape, and apex curvature.

entry.title: Trademark Search, Artificial Intelligence and the Role of the Private Sector

author.name: Sonia Katyal, Aniket Kesari

entry.summary: Examines AI's role in trademark search and similarity analysis, highlighting implications for lawyers and scholars as AI transforms intellectual property practices.

entry.title: CUROCKET: Optimizing ROCKET for GPU

author.name: Ole St\"uven, Keno Moenck, Thorsten Sch\"uppstuhl

entry.summary: Optimizes ROCKET time series classification algorithm for GPU execution with CuPy implementation. Enables convolution acceleration on GPU hardware.

entry.title: FinMetaMind: A Tech Blueprint on NLQ Systems for Financial Knowledge Search

author.name: Lalit Pant, Shivang Nagar

entry.summary: Technical blueprint for NLQ system for financial knowledge search addressing relevance ranking, data freshness, and entity recognition using NLP and vector data models.

entry.title: Do readers prefer AI-generated Italian short stories?

author.name: Michael Farrell

entry.summary: User study investigating reader preferences for AI-generated Italian short stories vs human author. Found AI texts received slightly higher ratings but no significant demographic associations.

entry.title: FedCCA: Client-Centric Adaptation against Data Heterogeneity in Federated Learning on IoT Devices

author.name: Kaile Wang, Jiannong Cao, Yu Yang, Xiaoyin Li, Yinfeng Cao

entry.summary: FedCCA addresses data heterogeneity in federated learning on IoT through client-centric adaptation extracting client-specific knowledge.

entry.title: From Fuzzy to Exact: The Halo Architecture for Infinite-Depth Reasoning via Rational Arithmetic

author.name: Hansheng Ren

entry.summary: Proposes 'Exactness Hypothesis' claiming AGI requires arbitrary precision arithmetic, and introduces Halo Architecture using rational arithmetic to address LLM hallucinations attributed to floating-point errors.

entry.title: Efficient Gaussian process learning via subspace projections

author.name: Felipe Tobar, Elsa Cazelles

entry.summary: Proposes 'projected likelihood' for Gaussian Process training using lower-dimensional data projections, providing closed-form expressions for information loss. Shows improvements over exact GP training and variational sparse GPs in accuracy and computational efficiency.

entry.title: kNN-Graph: An adaptive graph model for $k$-nearest neighbors

author.name: Jiaye Li, Gang Chen, Hang Xu, Shichao Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive graph model for k-nearest neighbors that integrates HNSW graphs with pre-computed voting. Decouples inference latency from computational complexity by shifting neighbor selection to preprocessing.

entry.title: A Collision-Free Hot-Tier Extension for Engram-Style Conditional Memory: A Controlled Study of Training Dynamics

author.name: Tao Lin

entry.summary: Investigates whether high-frequency key collisions bottleneck Engram-style conditional memory. Introduces collision-free hot-tier extension but finds it doesn't consistently improve validation loss.

entry.title: Predicting Startup Success Using Large Language Models: A Novel In-Context Learning Approach

author.name: Abdurahman Maarouf, Alket Bakiaj, Stefan Feuerriegel

entry.summary: Uses in-context learning with LLMs for startup success prediction without model training. Proposes k-NN based example selection for demonstrations when labeled data is scarce.

entry.title: Integrating Meteorological and Operational Data: A Novel Approach to Understanding Railway Delays in Finland

entry.title: Sample-wise Constrained Learning via a Sequential Penalty Approach with Applications in Image Processing

entry.summary: Shows sample-wise constraints in learning should be enforced via sequential penalty methods rather than arbitrary penalties. Proves convergence guarantees and demonstrates viability in image processing.

entry.title: Calibrated Probabilistic Interpolation for GEDI Biomass

author.name: Robin Young, Srinivasan Keshav

entry.summary: Uses Attentive Neural Processes for interpolating sparse GEDI LiDAR observations for biomass mapping. Shows RF and XGBoost fail to produce calibrated prediction intervals; ANPs provide calibrated uncertainty.

entry.title: Latent Diffusion for Internet of Things Attack Data Generation in Intrusion Detection

entry.summary: Proposes Latent Diffusion Model for IoT intrusion detection data augmentation. Addresses class imbalance between benign and attack traffic in ML-based intrusion detection systems.

author.name: Beining Wu, Zihao Ding, Leo Ostigaard, Jun Huang

entry.title: Learning Successive Interference Cancellation for Low-Complexity Soft-Output MIMO Detection

author.name: Benedikt Fesl, Fatih Capar

entry.title: Kernel smoothing on manifolds

author.name: Eunseong Bae, Wolfgang Polonik

entry.title: Research Summary: January 26, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research features a major open-source release and critical safety findings. LongCat-Flash-Thinking-2601, a 560B MoE reasoning model, achieves SOTA among open-source models for agentic tasks. VibeTensor demonstrates LLM agents can generate complete deep learning system software stacks including CUDA runtime.

  • Endless Terminals (Stanford/UW) introduces autonomous pipeline for generating terminal RL environments, addressing a key bottleneck for self-improving agents
  • PHISH framework reveals persona jailbreaking via adversarial conversation history, bypassing input-only safety filters
  • Timely Machine reframes test-time scaling as wall-clock time, finding smaller models often outperform larger ones under time constraints

Theoretical and interpretability advances include floating-point transformer expressivity analysis proving non-equivariant function representation without positional encoding. Sycophancy signals are shown to be linearly separable in middle-layer attention heads, enabling targeted steering. A conceptual critique of machine unlearning argues dual-use capabilities and compositional generalization fundamentally prevent knowledge removalâan important insight for AI safety policy.

entry.title: Sycophancy Hides Linearly in the Attention Heads

entry.summary: Discovers that sycophancy signals in LLMs are most linearly separable in multi-head attention activations, with steering most effective in middle-layer attention heads. Shows limited overlap with previously identified 'truthful' directions, suggesting distinct mechanisms.

entry.title: SALAD: Achieve High-Sparsity Attention via Efficient Linear Attention Tuning for Video Diffusion Transformer

author.name: Tongcheng Fang, Hanling Zhang, Ruiqi Xie, Zhuo Han, Xin Tao, Tianchen Zhao, Pengfei Wan, Wenbo Ding, Wanli Ouyang, Xuefei Ning, Yu Wang

entry.summary: Proposes SALAD for video diffusion transformers achieving 90% attention sparsity with 1.72x speedup by introducing lightweight linear attention branch with input-dependent gating.

entry.title: A tale of three theories: sparsity, frustration, and statistical field theory

author.name: Dmitry Vaintrob

entry.summary: Technical interpretability research connecting superposition, statistical field theory, and frustration in neural networks. Develops theoretical framework with Zohar Ringel for understanding computation in superposition.

entry.title: A Scalable Measure of Loss Landscape Curvature for Analyzing the Training Dynamics of LLMs

author.name: Dayal Singh Kalra, Jean-Christophe Gagnon-Audet, Andrey Gromov, Ishita Mediratta, Kelvin Niu, Alexander H Miller, Michael Shvartsman

entry.summary: Introduces 'critical sharpness' as a computationally efficient proxy for Hessian sharpness in LLMs requiring fewer than 10 forward passes, capturing key training dynamics phenomena like progressive sharpening and edge of stability.

entry.title: Towards a Theoretical Understanding to the Generalization of RLHF

author.name: Zhaochun Li (1,2), Mingyang Yi (3), Yue Wang (2), Shisheng Cui (1), Yong Liu (3) ((1) Beijing Institute of Technolegy, (2) Zhongguancun Academy, (3) Renmin University of China)

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of RLHF generalization in high-dimensional settings using algorithmic stability framework. Proves O(1/sqrt(n)) generalization bound under feature coverage condition for end-to-end learning.

entry.title: Beyond Superficial Unlearning: Sharpness-Aware Robust Erasure of Hallucinations in Multimodal LLMs

author.name: Xianya Fang, Feiyang Ren, Xiang Chen, Yu Tian, Zhen Bi, Haiyang Yu, Sheng-Jun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes SARE for robust hallucination removal in MLLMs using sharpness-aware optimization to flatten loss landscape, preventing catastrophic resurgence of hallucinations after relearning.

entry.title: GRIP: Algorithm-Agnostic Machine Unlearning for Mixture-of-Experts via Geometric Router Constraints

author.name: Andy Zhu, Rongzhe Wei, Yupu Gu, Pan Li

entry.summary: Introduces GRIP, a geometric constraint framework for machine unlearning in Mixture-of-Experts that prevents routers from simply redirecting queries away from knowledgeable experts rather than erasing knowledge.

entry.title: Finite-Time Analysis of Gradient Descent for Shallow Transformers

author.name: Enes Arda, Semih Cayci, Atilla Eryilmaz

entry.summary: Provides finite-time analysis of gradient descent for shallow transformers in kernel regime, showing width scales logarithmically with samples and optimization error is independent of sequence length.

entry.title: White-Box Sensitivity Auditing with Steering Vectors

author.name: Hannah Cyberey, Yangfeng Ji, David Evans

entry.summary: Proposes white-box sensitivity auditing for LLMs using activation steering to test model internals for socially relevant properties like gender bias, addressing limitations of black-box input-output testing.

entry.title: SafeThinker: Reasoning about Risk to Deepen Safety Beyond Shallow Alignment

author.name: Xianya Fang, Xianying Luo, Yadong Wang, Xiang Chen, Yu Tian, Zequn Sun, Rui Liu, Jun Fang, Naiqiang Tan, Yuanning Cui, Sheng-Jun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes SafeThinker, an adaptive safety framework with gateway classifier routing inputs through different defensive mechanisms based on risk assessment, including twin expert module for deceptive attacks.

entry.title: LUMINA: Long-horizon Understanding for Multi-turn Interactive Agents

author.name: Amin Rakhsha, Thomas Hehn, Pietro Mazzaglia, Fabio Valerio Massoli, Arash Behboodi, Tribhuvanesh Orekondy

entry.summary: Introduces LUMINA, an oracle counterfactual framework with procedurally generated game tasks to measure criticality of specific capabilities (planning, state tracking, context processing) for multi-turn agent success by testing performance with oracle assistance.

entry.title: The Art of Being Difficult: Combining Human and AI Strengths to Find Adversarial Instances for Heuristics

author.name: Henri Nikoleit, Ankit Anand, Anurag Murty Naredla, Heiko R\"oglin

entry.summary: Demonstrates human-LLM collaboration using FunSearch to derive state-of-the-art lower bounds for heuristics on bin packing, k-median clustering, and knapsack - problems without improvement for over a decade.

entry.title: Critique of machine unlearning

author.name: myyycroft

entry.summary: Argues machine unlearning cannot remove dangerous capabilities because capabilities are dual-use, and strong compositional generalization fundamentally constrains what's achievable.

entry.title: PyHealth 2.0: A Comprehensive Open-Source Toolkit for Accessible and Reproducible Clinical Deep Learning

author.name: John Wu, Yongda Fan, Zhenbang Wu, Paul Landes, Eric Schrock, Sayeed Sajjad Razin, Arjun Chatterjee, Naveen Baskaran, Joshua Steier, Andrea Fitzpatrick, Bilal Arif, Rian Atri, Jathurshan Pradeepkumar, Siddhartha Laghuvarapu, Junyi Gao, Adam R. Cross, and Jimeng Sun

entry.summary: Introduces PyHealth 2.0, a comprehensive clinical deep learning toolkit unifying 15+ datasets, 20+ tasks, 25+ models with uncertainty quantification and conformal prediction in a single framework supporting diverse clinical data modalities.

entry.title: LOGICAL-COMMONSENSEQA: A Benchmark for Logical Commonsense Reasoning

author.name: Obed Junias and Maria Leonor Pacheco

entry.summary: Introduces LOGICAL-COMMONSENSEQA benchmark reframing commonsense reasoning as logical composition over statement pairs using AND/OR/NEITHER operators. Finds models struggle significantly with negation.

entry.title: Trapped in the past? Disentangling fluid and crystallized intelligence of large language models using chess

author.name: Leonard S. Pleiss, Maximilian Schiffer, Robert K. von Weizs\"acker

entry.summary: Uses chess as a controlled testbed to disentangle crystallized (recall) and fluid (reasoning) intelligence in LLMs by creating positions varying in training corpus proximity, revealing performance collapses to random in out-of-distribution tasks.

entry.title: Auto-Regressive Masked Diffusion Models

author.name: Mahdi Karami, Ali Ghodsi

entry.summary: Introduces Auto-Regressive Masked Diffusion (ARMD) that reframes masked diffusion as block-wise causal model, enabling efficient training with parallel generation capabilities in a single forward pass.

entry.title: Graph-Anchored Knowledge Indexing for Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Zhenghao Liu, Mingyan Wu, Xinze Li, Yukun Yan, Shuo Wang, Cheng Yang, Minghe Yu, Zheni Zeng, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: Proposes GraphAnchor for RAG that uses dynamic graph structures as evolving knowledge indices during iterative retrieval, anchoring entities and relations to guide knowledge sufficiency evaluation.

entry.title: TangramPuzzle: Evaluating Multimodal Large Language Models with Compositional Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Daixian Liu, Jiayi Kuang, Yinghui Li, Yangning Li, Di Yin, Haoyu Cao, Xing Sun, Ying Shen, Hai-Tao Zheng, Liang Lin, Philip S. Yu

entry.summary: Introduces TangramPuzzle benchmark for evaluating MLLM compositional spatial reasoning using Tangram game with rigorous geometric grounding through Tangram Construction Expression (TCE) symbolic framework.

entry.title: Will It Survive? Deciphering the Fate of AI-Generated Code in Open Source

author.name: Musfiqur Rahman, Emad Shihab

entry.summary: Survival analysis of 200,000+ code units across 201 open-source projects reveals AI-generated code survives significantly longer than human code (15.8% lower modification rate), contradicting the 'disposable code' hypothesis.

entry.title: VisGym: Diverse, Customizable, Scalable Environments for Multimodal Agents

author.name: Zirui Wang, Junyi Zhang, Jiaxin Ge, Long Lian, Letian Fu, Lisa Dunlap, Ken Goldberg, XuDong Wang, Ion Stoica, David M. Chan, Sewon Min, Joseph E. Gonzalez

entry.summary: Introduces VisGym with 17 environments for evaluating VLMs on multi-step visual interactions. Finds frontier models achieve only 46.6% (easy) and 26.0% (hard) success rates, revealing perception, memory, and action limitations.

entry.title: M3Kang: Evaluating Multilingual Multimodal Mathematical Reasoning in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Aleix Torres-Camps, Nathaniel Mitrani Hadida, V\'ictor Conchello Vendrell, \`Alex Batlle Casellas, Arnau Padr\'es Masdemont, Jordi Ros-Giralt

entry.summary: M3Kang provides 1,747 multilingual multimodal math problems from Kangaroo Math Competition in 108 languages, enabling large-scale evaluation of VLM mathematical reasoning across cultures.

entry.title: SoundBreak: A Systematic Study of Audio-Only Adversarial Attacks on Trimodal Models

author.name: Aafiya Hussain, Gaurav Srivastava, Alvi Ishmam, Zaber Hakim, Chris Thomas

entry.summary: SoundBreak systematically studies audio-only adversarial attacks on trimodal (audio-video-language) models, achieving up to 96% attack success rate across six attack objectives targeting different processing stages.

entry.title: GameTalk: Training LLMs for Strategic Conversation

author.name: Victor Conchello Vendrell, Max Ruiz Luyten, Mihaela van der Schaar

entry.summary: GameTalk trains LLMs for strategic multi-turn conversations by adapting GRPO, DPO, and STaR to optimize global objectives across full interactions rather than single turns.

entry.title: Generating Literature-Driven Scientific Theories at Scale

author.name: Peter Jansen, Peter Clark, Doug Downey, Daniel S. Weld

entry.summary: Generates scientific theories (qualitative and quantitative laws) from 13.7k papers to produce 2.9k theories, comparing literature-grounded vs parametric generation and accuracy vs novelty objectives.

entry.title: DSGym: A Holistic Framework for Evaluating and Training Data Science Agents

author.name: Fan Nie, Junlin Wang, Harper Hua, Federico Bianchi, Yongchan Kwon, Zhenting Qi, Owen Queen, Shang Zhu, James Zou

entry.summary: DSGym provides standardized framework for evaluating data science agents, revealing that substantial portions of existing benchmark tasks are solvable without using the actual data.

entry.title: NOIR: Privacy-Preserving Generation of Code with Open-Source LLMs

author.name: Khoa Nguyen, Khiem Ton, NhatHai Phan, Issa Khalil, Khang Tran, Cristian Borcea, Ruoming Jin, Abdallah Khreishah, My T. Thai

entry.summary: NOIR enables privacy-preserving code generation where client encodes prompts and decodes LLM outputs locally, achieving indistinguishability guarantees for protecting intellectual property.

entry.title: Cite-While-You-Generate: Training-Free Evidence Attribution for Multimodal Clinical Summarization

author.name: Qianqi Yan, Huy Nguyen, Sumana Srivatsa, Hari Bandi, Xin Eric Wang, Krishnaram Kenthapadi

entry.summary: Proposes a training-free framework for clinical summarization that uses decoder attentions to cite supporting evidence during generation, with strategies for multimodal attribution including raw images and caption-as-span modes.

entry.title: LLM is Not All You Need: A Systematic Evaluation of ML vs. Foundation Models for text and image based Medical Classification

author.name: Meet Raval, Tejul Pandit, Dhvani Upadhyay

entry.summary: Systematic comparison of traditional ML vs LLMs/VLMs for medical classification, finding traditional ML (LR, LightGBM, ResNet) often achieves best overall performance across four datasets.

entry.title: EMemBench: Interactive Benchmarking of Episodic Memory for VLM Agents

author.name: Xinze Li, Ziyue Zhu, Siyuan Liu, Yubo Ma, Yuhang Zang, Yixin Cao, Aixin Sun

entry.summary: Introduces EMemBench, a programmatic benchmark for evaluating long-term episodic memory of VLM agents through interactive games, generating questions from agent trajectories covering recall, induction, temporal, and spatial reasoning.

entry.title: Provably Learning Attention with Queries

author.name: Satwik Bhattamishra, Kulin Shah, Michael Hahn, Varun Kanade

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis showing single-head attention can be learned exactly with O(dÂ²) queries via black-box access. Extends to full Transformers when FFN learning algorithms exist.

entry.title: Jacobian Scopes: token-level causal attributions in LLMs

author.name: Toni J.B. Liu, Baran Zadeo\u{g}lu, Nicolas Boull\'e, Rapha\"el Sarfati, Christopher J. Earls

entry.summary: Introduces Jacobian Scopes, gradient-based token-level causal attribution methods for LLM interpretability with three variants (Semantic, Fisher, Temperature) targeting different aspects of prediction sensitivity.

entry.title: Order from Chaos: Physical World Understanding from Glitchy Gameplay Videos

author.name: Meng Cao, Haoran Tang, Haoze Zhao, Mingfei Han, Ruyang Liu, Qiang Sun, Xiaojun Chang, Ian Reid, Xiaodan Liang

entry.summary: Proposes using glitches in gameplay videos as supervision source for physical world understanding, introducing PhysGameBench benchmark with over 140k instances across 8 simulation games.

entry.title: CORD: Bridging the Audio-Text Reasoning Gap via Weighted On-policy Cross-modal Distillation

author.name: Jing Hu, Danxiang Zhu, Xianlong Luo, Dan Zhang, Shuwei He, Yishu Lei, Haitao Zheng, Shikun Feng, Jingzhou He, Yu Sun, Hua Wu, Haifeng Wang

entry.summary: Proposes CORD for Audio LLMs using online cross-modal self-distillation to align audio-conditioned reasoning with text-conditioned reasoning through multi-granularity token and sequence-level alignment.

entry.title: Do LLM hallucination detectors suffer from low-resource effect?

author.name: Debtanu Datta, Mohan Kishore Chilukuri, Yash Kumar, Saptarshi Ghosh, Muhammad Bilal Zafar

entry.summary: Studies whether hallucination detectors suffer from low-resource language effects, finding that while task accuracy drops in low-resource languages, detectors remain effective at catching hallucinations, suggesting decoupled failure modes.

entry.title: LLM-Based Adversarial Persuasion Attacks on Fact-Checking Systems

author.name: Jo\~ao A. Leite, Olesya Razuvayevskaya, Kalina Bontcheva, Carolina Scarton

entry.summary: Introduces persuasive adversarial attacks on automated fact-checking systems using LLMs to rephrase claims with 15 persuasion techniques. Shows substantial degradation in verification and retrieval performance.

entry.title: Clarify or Answer: Reinforcement Learning for Agentic VQA with Context Under-specification

author.name: Zongwan Cao, Bingbing Wen, Lucy Lu Wang

entry.summary: Introduces CoA (Clarify-or-Answer), an agent for VQA that determines when clarification is needed for under-specified questions, with GRPO-CR reinforcement learning approach. Creates CONTEXTCLARIFY benchmark for ambiguous VQA.

entry.title: How Does Personalized Memory Shape LLM Behavior? Benchmarking Rational Preference Utilization in Personalized Assistants

author.name: Xueyang Feng, Weinan Gan, Xu Chen, Quanyu Dai, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Introduces RPEval, a benchmark to evaluate how LLMs use personalized memory, revealing widespread irrational personalization where irrelevant memories interfere with intent understanding. Proposes RP-Reasoner to treat memory utilization as pragmatic reasoning.

entry.title: Data Poisoning Vulnerabilities Across Healthcare AI Architectures: A Security Threat Analysis

author.name: Farhad Abtahi, Fernando Seoane, Iv\'an Pau, Mario Vega-Barbas

entry.summary: Analyzes data poisoning vulnerabilities across healthcare AI architectures (CNNs, LLMs, RL) showing attackers can compromise systems with only 100-500 samples, achieving >60% success rates with 6-12 month detection lag.

entry.title: Latent Causal Diffusions for Single-Cell Perturbation Modeling

author.name: Lars Lorch, Jiaqi Zhang, Charlotte Bunne, Andreas Krause, Bernhard Sch\"olkopf, Caroline Uhler

entry.summary: Latent Causal Diffusion (LCD) models single-cell gene expression as a stationary diffusion process, outperforming baselines for predicting distributional shifts from perturbation combinations while learning mechanistic structure.

entry.title: When Agents Fail to Act: A Diagnostic Framework for Tool Invocation Reliability in Multi-Agent LLM Systems

author.name: Donghao Huang, Gauri Malwe, Zhaoxia Wang

entry.summary: Introduces 12-category error taxonomy for tool invocation failures in multi-agent LLM systems, systematically evaluating GPT-4, Claude, Qwen across 1,980 test instances.

entry.title: Cognitively-Inspired Tokens Overcome Egocentric Bias in Multimodal Models

author.name: Bridget Leonard, Scott O. Murray

entry.summary: Introduces perspective tokens inspired by human spatial cognition to address egocentric bias in multimodal language models for visual perspective-taking tasks. Rotation-based tokens generalize even to non-human viewpoints.

entry.title: Exploring the Effects of Alignment on Numerical Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: Ayako Sato, Hwichan Kim, Zhousi Chen, Masato Mita, Mamoru Komachi

entry.summary: Studies how alignment (instruction tuning and preference tuning) increases numerical bias in LLM-as-judge evaluations, with mitigation strategies including temperature scaling and distribution adjustment.

entry.title: A Cautionary Tale of Self-Supervised Learning for Imaging Biomarkers: Alzheimer's Disease Case Study

author.name: Maxwell Reynolds, Chaitanya Srinivasan, Vijay Cherupally, Michael Leone, Ke Yu, Li Sun, Tigmanshu Chaudhary, Andreas Pfenning, Kayhan Batmanghelich

entry.summary: Introduces Residual Noise Contrastive Estimation (R-NCE) for Alzheimer's biomarker discovery, outperforming both FreeSurfer features and existing SSL methods by integrating auxiliary features while maximizing augmentation-invariant information.

entry.title: Attention-MoA: Enhancing Mixture-of-Agents via Inter-Agent Semantic Attention and Deep Residual Synthesis

author.name: Jianyu Wen, Yang Wei, Xiongxi Yu, Changxuan Xiao, Ke Zeng

entry.summary: Introduces Attention-MoA, enhancing Mixture-of-Agents frameworks with inter-agent semantic attention and residual connections with adaptive early stopping to improve deep semantic interaction between collaborating LLMs and mitigate hallucinations.

entry.title: Reasoning Promotes Robustness in Theory of Mind Tasks

author.name: Ian B. de Haan, Peter van der Putten, Max van Duijn

entry.summary: Studies RLVR-trained reasoning models on Theory of Mind tasks, finding they exhibit increased robustness to prompt variations. Argues gains come from robustness in finding solutions rather than deeper ToM capabilities.

entry.title: Cross-Lingual Activation Steering for Multilingual Language Models

author.name: Rhitabrat Pokharel, Ameeta Agrawal, Tanay Nagar

entry.summary: Proposes Cross-Lingual Activation Steering (CLAS), a training-free inference-time intervention that modulates neuron activations to improve multilingual LLM performance on non-dominant languages while maintaining high-resource performance.

entry.title: Do Models Hear Like Us? Probing the Representational Alignment of Audio LLMs and Naturalistic EEG

author.name: Haoyun Yang, Xin Xiao, Jiang Zhong, Yu Tian, Dong Xiaohua, Yu Mao, Hao Wu, Kaiwen Wei

entry.summary: Probes alignment between 12 Audio LLMs and human EEG signals during naturalistic listening, finding rank-dependence on metrics, spatial topography alignment, and layer-wise patterns.

entry.title: PLawBench: A Rubric-Based Benchmark for Evaluating LLMs in Real-World Legal Practice

author.name: Yuzhen Shi, Huanghai Liu, Yiran Hu, Gaojie Song, Xinran Xu, Yubo Ma, Tianyi Tang, Li Zhang, Qingjing Chen, Di Feng, Wenbo Lv, Weiheng Wu, Kexin Yang, Sen Yang, Wei Wang, Rongyao Shi, Yuanyang Qiu, Yuemeng Qi, Jingwen Zhang, Xiaoyu Sui, Yifan Chen, Yi Zhang, An Yang, Bowen Yu, Dayiheng Liu, Junyang Lin, Weixing Shen, Bing Zhao, Charles L.A. Clarke, Hu Wei

entry.summary: Introduces PLawBench, a practical law benchmark evaluating LLMs on realistic legal workflows including consultation, practice tasks, and professional qualification across multiple task categories with rubric-based assessment.

entry.title: AgentDrive: An Open Benchmark Dataset for Agentic AI Reasoning with LLM-Generated Scenarios in Autonomous Systems

author.name: Mohamed Amine Ferrag, Abderrahmane Lakas, Merouane Debbah

entry.summary: Introduces AgentDrive, a benchmark of 300,000 LLM-generated driving scenarios across seven orthogonal axes (scenario type, behavior, environment, road layout, objective, difficulty, traffic density) for autonomous agent evaluation.

entry.title: GR3EN: Generative Relighting for 3D Environments

author.name: Xiaoyan Xing, Philipp Henzler, Junhwa Hur, Runze Li, Jonathan T. Barron, Pratul P. Srinivasan, Dor Verbin

entry.summary: GR3EN enables controllable 3D relighting of room-scale scenes by distilling video diffusion model outputs into 3D reconstructions, bypassing difficult inverse rendering problems.

entry.title: Better as Generators Than Classifiers: Leveraging LLMs and Synthetic Data for Low-Resource Multilingual Classification

author.name: Branislav Pecher, Jan Cegin, Robert Belanec, Ivan Srba, Jakub Simko, Maria Bielikova

entry.summary: Investigates using LLM-generated synthetic data to train smaller models for multilingual classification, finding smaller fine-tuned models can match or exceed massive LLMs across 11 languages.

entry.title: Memory-V2V: Augmenting Video-to-Video Diffusion Models with Memory

author.name: Dohun Lee, Chun-Hao Paul Huang, Xuelin Chen, Jong Chul Ye, Duygu Ceylan, Hyeonho Jeong

entry.summary: Memory-V2V augments video-to-video diffusion models with explicit memory for maintaining cross-consistency in multi-turn iterative video editing through retrieval and dynamic tokenization.

entry.title: Teaching and Evaluating LLMs to Reason About Polymer Design Related Tasks

author.name: Dikshya Mohanty, Mohammad Saqib Hasan, Syed Mostofa Monsur, Size Zheng, Benjamin Hsiao, Niranjan Balasubramanian

entry.summary: PolyBench provides 125K+ polymer design tasks with 13M+ data points and introduces knowledge-augmented reasoning distillation with structured CoT for polymer property prediction.

entry.title: Regional Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: M P V S Gopinadh, Kappara Lakshmi Sindhu, Soma Sekhar Pandu Ranga Raju P, Yesaswini Swarna

entry.summary: FAZE framework measures regional bias across 10 LLMs using 100 forced-choice prompts, finding GPT-3.5 most biased (9.5/10) and Claude 3.5 Sonnet least (2.5/10).

entry.title: VISTA-PATH: An interactive foundation model for pathology image segmentation and quantitative analysis in computational pathology

author.name: Peixian Liang, Songhao Li, Shunsuke Koga, Yutong Li, Zahra Alipour, Yucheng Tang, Daguang Xu, Zhi Huang

entry.summary: Introduces VISTA-PATH, an interactive pathology segmentation foundation model that conditions on visual context, semantic descriptions, and expert prompts for precise multi-class segmentation.

entry.title: Rethinking Large Language Models For Irregular Time Series Classification In Critical Care

author.name: Feixiang Zheng, Yu Wu, Cecilia Mascolo and Ting Dang

entry.summary: Investigates LLMs for irregular ICU time series classification, finding encoder design is more critical than multimodal alignment strategy for handling high missing rates.

entry.title: E2Former-V2: On-the-Fly Equivariant Attention with Linear Activation Memory

author.name: Lin Huang, Chengxiang Huang, Ziang Wang, Yiyue Du, Chu Wang, Haocheng Lu, Yunyang Li, Xiaoli Liu, Arthur Jiang, Jia Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces E2Former-V2, a scalable equivariant graph neural network for molecular modeling that achieves linear activation memory through algebraic sparsification exploiting SO(3)âSO(2) basis changes for efficient tensor operations.

entry.title: SoS: Analysis of Surface over Semantics in Multilingual Text-To-Image Generation

author.name: Carolin Holtermann, Florian Schneider, Anne Lauscher

entry.summary: Introduces Surface-over-Semantics (SoS) analysis showing T2I models produce culturally stereotypical outputs based on input language rather than prompt semantics, with novel measure quantifying this bias across 14 languages and 7 models.

entry.title: MRAG: Benchmarking Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Bio-medicine

author.name: Wei Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces MRAG benchmark for medical RAG covering English and Chinese with Wikipedia and PubMed corpus, plus MRAG-Toolkit for systematic exploration of RAG components.

entry.title: Persuasion Tokens for Editing Factual Knowledge in LLMs

author.name: Paul Youssef, J\"org Schl\"otterer, Christin Seifert

entry.summary: Introduces persuasion tokens (P-Tokens), special tokens trained to replicate in-context knowledge editing demonstrations, enabling efficient fact updates in LLMs without requiring demonstration examples at inference.

entry.title: 3D Molecule Generation from Rigid Motifs via SE(3) Flows

author.name: Roman Poletukhin, Marcel Kollovieh, Eike Eberhard, Stephan G\"unnemann

entry.summary: Proposes SE(3)-equivariant generative modeling for de novo 3D molecule generation treating molecules as sets of rigid-body motifs, achieving 2-10x reduction in generation steps.

entry.title: Analyzing Neural Network Information Flow Using Differential Geometry

author.name: Shuhang Tan, Jayson Sia, Paul Bogdan, Radoslav Ivanov

entry.summary: Proposes using Ollivier-Ricci curvature from differential geometry to analyze neural network information flow, identifying important connections through graph-theoretic properties. Negative curvature edges indicate bottlenecks critical to network connectivity.

entry.title: Mixing Expert Knowledge: Bring Human Thoughts Back To the Game of Go

author.name: Yichuan Ma, Linyang Li, Yongkang Chen, Peiji Li, Jiasheng Ye, Qipeng Guo, Dahua Lin, Kai Chen

entry.summary: Bridges LLM general reasoning with expert knowledge for Go by mixing training approaches, addressing the gap between AlphaGo's performance ceiling and LLM struggles with domain-specific tasks.

entry.title: On the Effects of Adversarial Perturbations on Distribution Robustness

author.name: Yipei Wang, Zhaoying Pan, Xiaoqian Wang

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of adversarial vs distribution robustness tradeoff, identifying nuanced phenomenon where lâ perturbations can actually help distribution robustness.

entry.title: OnlineSI: Taming Large Language Model for Online 3D Understanding and Grounding

author.name: Zixian Liu, Zhaoxi Chen, Liang Pan, Ziwei Liu

entry.summary: Introduces OnlineSI framework for continuous spatial understanding from video streams using finite spatial memory and integrated 3D point cloud with semantic information for embodied AI.

entry.title: Process-Tensor Tomography of SGD: Measuring Non-Markovian Memory via Back-Flow of Distinguishability

author.name: Vasileios Sevetlidis and George Pavlidis

entry.summary: Proposes viewing neural network training through the lens of process tensors from quantum mechanics, using back-flow of distinguishability to measure non-Markovian memory effects in SGD. Demonstrates that training has measurable memory effects amplified by momentum.

entry.title: Typologically Informed Parameter Aggregation

author.name: Stef Accou, Wessel Poelman

entry.summary: Introduces TIPA, a training-free method for cross-lingual transfer that constructs proxy language adapters by aggregating existing adapters weighted by typological similarity. Evaluated on 230+ languages showing consistent improvements.

entry.title: Generative Confidants: How do People Experience Trust in Emotional Support from Generative AI?

author.name: Riccardo Volpato, Simone Stumpf, and Lisa DeBruine

entry.summary: Qualitative study of 24 users examining how people develop trust when using generative AI for emotional support, finding novel drivers including familiarity from personalization, nuanced mental models, and awareness of conversational control.

entry.title: SWE-Pruner: Self-Adaptive Context Pruning for Coding Agents

author.name: Yuhang Wang, Yuling Shi, Mo Yang, Rongrui Zhang, Shilin He, Heng Lian, Yuting Chen, Siyu Ye, Kai Cai, Xiaodong Gu

entry.summary: Proposes SWE-Pruner, a self-adaptive context pruning framework for coding agents that performs task-aware selective skimming of source code, reducing API costs and latency while preserving code structure.

entry.title: Preventing the Collapse of Peer Review Requires Verification-First AI

author.name: Lei You, Lele Cao, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Argues AI-assisted peer review should be verification-first, formalizing truth-coupling and deriving conditions for incentive collapse when proxy optimization dominates truth-seeking.

entry.title: BoostFGL: Boosting Fairness in Federated Graph Learning

author.name: Zekai Chen, Kairui Yang, Xunkai Li, Henan Sun, Zhihan Zhang, Jia Li, Qiangqiang Dai, Rong-Hua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Proposes BoostFGL for fairness in federated graph learning, addressing disparities arising from label skew, topology confounding, and aggregation dilution through boosting-style framework.

entry.title: Mitigating Bias in Automated Grading Systems for ESL Learners: A Contrastive Learning Approach

author.name: Kevin Fan and Eric Yun

entry.summary: Studies bias in automated essay scoring against ESL learners, finding high-proficiency ESL essays receive 10.3% lower scores than equivalent native speaker essays, and proposes contrastive learning mitigation.

entry.title: AnyView: Synthesizing Any Novel View in Dynamic Scenes

author.name: Basile Van Hoorick, Dian Chen, Shun Iwase, Pavel Tokmakov, Muhammad Zubair Irshad, Igor Vasiljevic, Swati Gupta, Fangzhou Cheng, Sergey Zakharov, Vitor Campagnolo Guizilini

entry.summary: Introduces AnyView for dynamic view synthesis using diffusion-based generation with minimal inductive biases, trained on 2D, 3D, and 4D data sources for zero-shot novel video generation.

entry.title: Is Length Really A Liability? An Evaluation of Multi-turn LLM Conversations using BoolQ

author.name: Karl Neergaard, Le Qiu and Emmanuele Chersoni

entry.summary: Studies whether conversation length affects LLM response veracity using BoolQ, finding model-specific vulnerabilities invisible under single-turn testing.

entry.title: Curate-Train-Refine: A Closed-Loop Agentic Framework for Zero Shot Classification

author.name: Gaurav Maheshwari, Kevin El Haddad

entry.summary: Proposes agentic loop where LLM curates training data, analyzes failures, and synthesizes targeted examples to train lightweight classifiers, outperforming zero/few-shot baselines.

entry.title: ReViP: Reducing False Completion in Vision-Language-Action Models with Vision-Proprioception Rebalance

author.name: Zhuohao Li, Yinghao Li, Jian-Jian Jiang, Lang Zhou, Tianyu Zhang, and Wei-Shi Zheng

entry.summary: Introduces ReViP, a Vision-Language-Action model that addresses false completion errors (reporting success despite visible failures) through vision-proprioception rebalancing with task-aware environment priors.

entry.title: GTA: Generative Traffic Agents for Simulating Realistic Mobility Behavior

author.name: Simon L\"ammer, Mark Colley, Patrick Ebel

entry.summary: Introduces GTA (Generative Traffic Agents), using LLM-powered persona-based agents generated from census data to simulate transportation choices at scale, enabling evaluation of new policies without handcrafted rules.

entry.title: Information Representation Fairness in Long-Document Embeddings: The Peculiar Interaction of Positional and Language Bias

author.name: Elias Schuhmacher, Andrianos Michail, Juri Opitz, Rico Sennrich, Simon Clematide

entry.summary: Identifies systematic positional and language biases in long-document embeddings where early segments and high-resource languages are over-represented. Proposes balanced attention pooling mitigation.

entry.title: Towards Latent Diffusion Suitable For Text

author.name: Nesta Midavaine and Christian A. Naesseth and Grigory Bartosh

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Flow Diffusion Models (NFDM) that enable continuous diffusion models to work with discrete text by learning a multivariate forward process from data. The approach substantially reduces the likelihood gap with autoregressive models while maintaining comparable sample quality.

entry.title: Multigrade Neural Network Approximation

author.name: Shijun Zhang, Zuowei Shen, Yuesheng Xu

entry.summary: Proposes Multigrade Deep Learning (MGDL) that trains deep networks grade by grade, freezing previous grades and training new residual blocks only to reduce remaining error, providing interpretable approximation bounds.

entry.title: FedSGM: A Unified Framework for Constraint Aware, Bidirectionally Compressed, Multi-Step Federated Optimization

author.name: Antesh Upadhyay, Sang Bin Moon, and Abolfazl Hashemi

entry.summary: FedSGM provides a unified federated optimization framework addressing functional constraints, bidirectional compression, multi-step local updates, and partial participation with O(1/âT) convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Interpretable Fine-Gray Deep Survival Model for Competing Risks: Predicting Post-Discharge Foot Complications for Diabetic Patients in Ontario

author.name: Dhanesh Ramachandram and Anne Loefler and Surain Roberts and Amol Verma and Maia Norman and Fahad Razak and Conrad Pow and Charles de Mestral

entry.summary: CRISPNAM-FG combines Neural Additive Models with Fine-Gray formulation for interpretable survival modeling with competing risks, validated on diabetic foot complication prediction.

entry.title: Modular Autonomy with Conversational Interaction: An LLM-driven Framework for Decision Making in Autonomous Driving

author.name: Marvin Seegert, Korbinian Moller, Johannes Betz

entry.summary: Integrates LLMs with Autoware autonomous driving software via Domain Specific Language, enabling natural language commands for querying status and modifying driving behavior with safety validation.

entry.title: ChiEngMixBench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Spontaneous and Natural Chinese-English Code-Mixed Generation

author.name: Qingyan Yang, Tongxi Wang, Yunsheng Luo

entry.summary: ChiEngMixBench is the first benchmark for evaluating LLM code-mixing (Chinese-English) in authentic contexts, measuring spontaneity and naturalness rather than treating it as translation.

entry.title: Policy-Embedded Graph Expansion: Networked HIV Testing with Diffusion-Driven Network Samples

author.name: Akseli Kangaslahti, Davin Choo, Lingkai Kong, Milind Tambe, Alastair van Heerden, Cheryl Johnson

entry.summary: PEGE framework for sequential HIV testing on incrementally revealed networks embeds generative graph expansion directly into decision policy, developed with WHO collaboration.

entry.title: Test-Time Adaptation for Speech Emotion Recognition

author.name: Jiaheng Dong, Hong Jia, Ting Dang

entry.summary: First systematic evaluation of 11 test-time adaptation methods for speech emotion recognition, addressing unique domain shifts like speaker variability and acted vs naturalistic emotions.

entry.title: Ordering-based Causal Discovery via Generalized Score Matching

author.name: Vy Vo, He Zhao, Trung Le, Edwin V. Bonilla, Dinh Phung

entry.summary: Extends score matching framework for causal discovery to discrete data with novel leaf discriminant criterion, enabling accurate causal ordering from categorical observations.

entry.title: SemanticALLI: Caching Reasoning, Not Just Responses, in Agentic Systems

author.name: Varun Chillara, Dylan Kline, Christopher Alvares, Evan Wooten, Huan Yang, Shlok Khetan, Cade Bauer, Tr\'e Guillory, Tanishka Shah, Yashodhara Dhariwal, Volodymyr Pavlov, George Popstefanov

entry.summary: SemanticALLI caches intermediate reasoning representations in agentic AI pipelines, decomposing generation into Analytic Intent Resolution and Visualization Synthesis for reuse.

entry.title: Space Filling Curves is All You Need: Communication-Avoiding Matrix Multiplication Made Simple

author.name: Evangelos Georganas, Alexander Heinecke, Pradeep Dubey

entry.summary: Proposes space filling curves for communication-avoiding matrix multiplication, simplifying GEMM optimization that typically requires exhaustive tuning across platforms.

entry.title: FeTTL: Federated Template and Task Learning for Multi-Institutional Medical Imaging

author.name: Abhijeet Parida, Antonia Alomar, Zhifan Jiang, Pooneh Roshanitabrizi, Austin Tapp, Ziyue Xu, Syed Muhammad Anwar, Maria J. Ledesma-Carbayo, Holger R. Roth, Marius George Linguraru

entry.summary: FeTTL learns a global template alongside task models in federated settings to harmonize multi-institutional medical imaging data and address domain shifts.

entry.title: A Longitudinal, Multinational, and Multilingual Corpus of News Coverage of the Russo-Ukrainian War

author.name: Dikshya Mohanty, Taisiia Sabadyn, Jelwin Rodrigues, Chenlu Wang, Abhishek Kalugade, Ritwik Banerjee

entry.summary: DNIPRO provides 246K news articles about Russo-Ukrainian war from 11 outlets across 5 nations in 3 languages (2022-2024), with annotations for stance detection and media framing.

entry.title: Machine-Assisted Grading of Nationwide School-Leaving Essay Exams with LLMs and Statistical NLP

author.name: Andres Karjus, Kais Allkivi, Silvia Maine, Katarin Leppik, Krister Kruusmaa, Merilin Aruvee

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM and statistical NLP methods for automated scoring of nationwide Estonian graduation essays, finding automated scoring achieves human-comparable performance.

entry.title: Where is the multimodal goal post? On the Ability of Foundation Models to Recognize Contextually Important Moments

author.name: Aditya K Surikuchi, Raquel Fern\'andez, Sandro Pezzelle

entry.summary: Evaluates foundation models on identifying important sub-events in football videos using highlight reel preferences as ground truth, finding models perform near chance level.

entry.title: PolyAgent: Large Language Model Agent for Polymer Design

author.name: Vani Nigam, Achuth Chandrasekhar, Amir Barati Farimani

entry.summary: Presents PolyAgent, an LLM-powered closed-loop system for polymer discovery that integrates property prediction, structure generation, and modification in a terminal interface for early-stage polymer research.

entry.title: Emotion-LLaMAv2 and MMEVerse: A New Framework and Benchmark for Multimodal Emotion Understanding

author.name: Xiaojiang Peng, Jingyi Chen, Zebang Cheng, Bao Peng, Fengyi Wu, Yifei Dong, Shuyuan Tu, Qiyu Hu, Huiting Huang, Yuxiang Lin, Jun-Yan He, Kai Wang, Zheng Lian, Zhi-Qi Cheng

entry.summary: Introduces Emotion-LLaMAv2 and MMEVerse benchmark for multimodal emotion understanding, addressing limitations of prior work with implicit face detection and improved fusion strategies.

entry.title: Zero-Shot MARL Benchmark in the Cyber-Physical Mobility Lab

author.name: Julius Beerwerth, Jianye Xu, Simon Sch\"afer, Fynn Belderink, Bassam Alrifaee

entry.summary: Presents a reproducible benchmark for evaluating sim-to-real transfer of multi-agent reinforcement learning policies for connected autonomous vehicles, using simulation, digital twin, and physical testbed to analyze performance degradation sources.

entry.title: Emerging Threats and Countermeasures in Neuromorphic Systems: A Survey

author.name: Pablo Sorrentino, Stjepan Picek, Ihsen Alouani, Nikolaos Athanasios Anagnostopoulos, Francesco Regazzoni, Lejla Batina, Tamalika Banerjee, Fatih Turkmen

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on security and privacy threats in neuromorphic computing systems, covering attack surfaces in spiking neural networks and memristive hardware, along with countermeasures for protecting emerging brain-inspired architectures.
