author.name: Muhammad Khalifa, Lajanugen Logeswaran, Jaekyeom Kim, Sungryull Sohn, Yunxiang Zhang, Moontae Lee, Hao Peng, Lu Wang, Honglak Lee

entry.summary: Continuing our coverage from yesterday, Demonstrates that LLM judges evaluating agents are highly susceptible to manipulated chain-of-thought reasoning. Shows up to 90% false positive rate inflation across 800 trajectories by rewriting CoT while keeping actions fixed.

entry.title: Even GPT-5.2 Can't Count to Five: The Case for Zero-Error Horizons in Trustworthy LLMs

author.name: Ryoma Sato

entry.summary: Proposes Zero-Error Horizon (ZEH) metric for evaluating LLM trustworthiness. Shows GPT-5.2 fails at simple tasks like computing parity of '11000' or checking balanced parentheses.

entry.title: Learning to Discover at Test Time

author.name: Mert Yuksekgonul, Daniel Koceja, Xinhao Li, Federico Bianchi, Jed McCaleb, Xiaolong Wang, Jan Kautz, Yejin Choi, James Zou, Carlos Guestrin, Yu Sun

entry.summary: TTT-Discover performs reinforcement learning at test time for scientific discovery, continually training the LLM on the specific test problem rather than prompting a frozen model. Designed to find one great solution.

entry.title: LLM-in-Sandbox Elicits General Agentic Intelligence

author.name: Daixuan Cheng, Shaohan Huang, Yuxian Gu, Huatong Song, Guoxin Chen, Li Dong, Wayne Xin Zhao, Ji-Rong Wen, Furu Wei

entry.summary: LLM-in-Sandbox enables LLMs to explore within code sandbox to elicit general intelligence. Shows LLMs spontaneously access external resources, use file systems for long context. Introduces sandbox RL training.

entry.title: QUAIL: Quantization Aware Unlearning for Mitigating Misinformation in LLMs

author.name: Himanshu Mishra, Kanwal Mehreen

entry.summary: Reveals that quantization can catastrophically restore 'forgotten' information in unlearned models. Proposes quantization-aware unlearning using logits-space hinge loss to ensure updates cross quantization thresholds.

entry.title: SilentDrift: Exploiting Action Chunking for Stealthy Backdoor Attacks on Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Bingxin Xu, Yuzhang Shang, Binghui Wang, Emilio Ferrara

entry.summary: Identifies security flaw in VLA systems where action chunking combined with delta pose creates intra-chunk visual open-loop. Proposes SILENTDRIFT black-box backdoor attack exploiting this.

entry.title: Opening the Black Box: A Survey on the Mechanisms of Multi-Step Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Liangming Pan, Jason Liang, Jiaran Ye, Minglai Yang, Xinyuan Lu, Fengbin Zhu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on mechanisms underlying LLM multi-step reasoning, organized around 7 research questions from implicit multi-hop reasoning to verbalized explicit reasoning effects.

entry.title: Improving MoE Compute Efficiency by Composing Weight and Data Sparsity

author.name: Maciej Kilian, Oleg Mkrtchyan, Luke Zettlemoyer, Akshat Shrivastava, Armen Aghajanyan

entry.summary: Introduces null experts in Mixture-of-Experts to achieve data sparsity within causal token-choice routing. When tokens route to null experts, those slots consume no compute, improving efficiency without causality violations.

entry.title: Universal Refusal Circuits Across LLMs: Cross-Model Transfer via Trajectory Replay and Concept-Basis Reconstruction

author.name: Tony Cristofano

entry.summary: Discovers universal refusal circuits across LLMs using concept fingerprints. Transfers refusal interventions across architectures (Dense to MoE) via Trajectory Replay without target-side supervision.

entry.title: Scaling Text-to-Image Diffusion Transformers with Representation Autoencoders

author.name: Shengbang Tong, Boyang Zheng, Ziteng Wang, Bingda Tang, Nanye Ma, Ellis Brown, Jihan Yang, Rob Fergus, Yann LeCun, Saining Xie

entry.summary: Research from a team including Yann LeCun investigates scaling Representation Autoencoders (RAEs) for text-to-image diffusion models. They find that scaling simplifies the framework and that targeted data composition matters more than pure scale for specific domains like text rendering.

entry.title: Cosmos Policy: Fine-Tuning Video Models for Visuomotor Control and Planning

author.name: Moo Jin Kim, Yihuai Gao, Tsung-Yi Lin, Yen-Chen Lin, Yunhao Ge, Grace Lam, Percy Liang, Shuran Song, Ming-Yu Liu, Chelsea Finn, Jinwei Gu

entry.summary: Cosmos Policy adapts the large Cosmos-Predict2 video model into robot policies through single-stage post-training, directly generating actions as latent frames without architectural modifications.

entry.title: When Sharpening Becomes Collapse: Sampling Bias and Semantic Coupling in RL with Verifiable Rewards

author.name: Mingyuan Fan, Weiguang Han, Daixin Wang, Cen Chen, Zhiqiang Zhang, Jun Zhou

entry.summary: Analyzes over-sharpening in RLVR where policy collapses onto limited modes due to finite-batch update bias and semantic coupling. Proposes inverse-success advantage calibration to mitigate.

entry.title: Ambient Dataloops: Generative Models for Dataset Refinement

author.name: Adri\'an Rodr\'iguez-Mu\~noz, William Daspit, Adam Klivans, Antonio Torralba, Constantinos Daskalakis, Giannis Daras

entry.summary: Ambient Dataloops iteratively refines datasets using diffusion models, treating synthetically improved samples as noisy at progressively lower noise levels. Uses Ambient Diffusion techniques to avoid destructive self-consuming loops.

entry.title: CORVUS: Red-Teaming Hallucination Detectors via Internal Signal Camouflage in Large Language Models

author.name: Nay Myat Min, Long H. Pham, Hongyu Zhang, Jun Sun

entry.summary: Introduces CORVUS, a red-teaming method for hallucination detectors that fine-tunes LoRA adapters to camouflage detector-visible telemetry. Degrades both training-free and learned detectors.

entry.title: The Flexibility Trap: Why Arbitrary Order Limits Reasoning Potential in Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Zanlin Ni, Shenzhi Wang, Yang Yue, Tianyu Yu, Weilin Zhao, Yeguo Hua, Tianyi Chen, Jun Song, Cheng Yu, Bo Zheng, Gao Huang

entry.summary: Continuing our coverage from yesterday, Reveals 'flexibility trap' in diffusion LLMs: arbitrary generation order allows models to bypass high-uncertainty tokens critical for reasoning, narrowing rather than expanding reasoning capability.

entry.title: Learning from Synthetic Data: Limitations of ERM

author.name: Kareem Amin, Alex Bie, Weiwei Kong, Umar Syed, Sergei Vassilvitskii

entry.summary: Theoretical analysis of ERM limitations when training data is contaminated with LLM-generated synthetic content. Shows ERM converges but is outperformed by alternative estimators that account for synthetic data.

entry.title: On the Generalization Gap in LLM Planning: Tests and Verifier-Reward RL

author.name: Valerio Belcamino, Nicholas Attolino, Alessio Capitanelli, Fulvio Mastrogiovanni

entry.summary: Studies LLM planning on PDDL tasks, finding 82.9% valid plan rate in-domain but 0% on unseen domains. Introduces diagnostic interventions including symbol anonymization and verifier-reward fine-tuning to analyze this failure.

entry.title: Outcome-Based RL Provably Leads Transformers to Reason, but Only With the Right Data

author.name: Yuval Ran-Milo, Yotam Alexander, Shahar Mendel, Nadav Cohen

entry.summary: Proves that outcome-based RL on single-layer transformers provably leads to structured chain-of-thought reasoning on graph traversal tasks, with convergence depending on data properties.

entry.title: You Need Better Attention Priors

author.name: Elon Litman, Gabe Guo

entry.summary: GOAT generalizes attention through Entropic Optimal Transport, replacing the implicit uniform prior with learnable continuous priors. Provides theoretical explanation for attention sinks and maintains FlashAttention compatibility.

entry.title: Robust Tool Use via Fission-GRPO: Learning to Recover from Execution Errors

author.name: Zhiwei Zhang, Fei Zhao, Rui Wang, Zezhong Wang, Bin Liang, Jiakang Wang, Yao Hu, Shaosheng Cao, Kam-Fai Wong

entry.summary: Fission-GRPO enables LLMs to recover from tool execution errors by splitting trajectories at error points and using RL to learn recovery strategies. Addresses brittleness of current tool-using LLMs.

entry.title: Stable-DiffCoder: Pushing the Frontier of Code Diffusion Large Language Model

author.name: Chenghao Fan, Wen Heng, Bo Li, Sichen Liu, Yuxuan Song, Jing Su, Xiaoye Qu, Kai Shen, Wei Wei

entry.summary: Stable-DiffCoder is a block diffusion code model reusing Seed-Coder architecture. With tailored warmup and noise schedule, outperforms AR counterpart on code benchmarks under same data/architecture.

entry.title: Qwen3-TTS Technical Report

author.name: Hangrui Hu, Xinfa Zhu, Ting He, Dake Guo, Bin Zhang, Xiong Wang, Zhifang Guo, Ziyue Jiang, Hongkun Hao, Zishan Guo, Xinyu Zhang, Pei Zhang, Baosong Yang, Jin Xu, Jingren Zhou, Junyang Lin

entry.summary: Technical report on Qwen3-TTS, Alibaba's multilingual text-to-speech model supporting 3-second voice cloning and description-based control. Trained on 5M+ hours of speech across 10 languages, uses dual-track LM architecture with two speech tokenizers (25Hz semantic and 12Hz acoustic).

entry.title: Point Bridge: 3D Representations for Cross Domain Policy Learning

author.name: Siddhant Haldar, Lars Johannsmeier, Lerrel Pinto, Abhishek Gupta, Dieter Fox, Yashraj Narang, Ajay Mandlekar

entry.summary: Point Bridge enables zero-shot sim-to-real robot policy transfer using unified point-based representations extracted via VLMs, without explicit visual alignment. Demonstrated across multiple manipulation tasks.

entry.title: The Slow Drift of Support: Boundary Failures in Multi-Turn Mental Health LLM Dialogues

author.name: Youyou Cheng, Zhuangwei Kang, Kerry Jiang, Chenyu Sun, Qiyang Pan

entry.summary: Proposes multi-turn stress testing framework for mental health LLM safety, identifying gradual erosion of safety boundaries in long dialogues through attempts at comfort and empathy.

entry.title: Auditing Language Model Unlearning via Information Decomposition

author.name: Anmol Goel, Alan Ritter, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Uses Partial Information Decomposition to audit LLM unlearning, revealing that residual knowledge remains linearly decodable from representations despite apparent unlearning success.

entry.title: Attributing and Exploiting Safety Vectors through Global Optimization in Large Language Models

author.name: Fengheng Chu, Jiahao Chen, Yuhong Wang, Jun Wang, Zhihui Fu, Shouling Ji, Songze Li

entry.summary: GOSV uses global optimization over all attention heads simultaneously to identify safety-critical components in LLMs. Employs activation repatching strategies to find safety vectors.

entry.title: BayesianVLA: Bayesian Decomposition of Vision Language Action Models via Latent Action Queries

author.name: Shijie Lian, Bin Yu, Xiaopeng Lin, Laurence T. Yang, Zhaolong Shen, Changti Wu, Yuzhuo Miao, Cong Huang, Kai Chen

entry.summary: Identifies 'Information Collapse' in VLA models where language instructions become predictable from visual observations alone. Proposes BayesianVLA to enforce instruction following via Bayesian decomposition.

entry.title: PCL-Reasoner-V1.5: Advancing Math Reasoning with Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yao Lu, Dengdong Fan, Jianzheng Nie, Fan Xu, Jie Chen, Bin Zhou, Yonghong Tian

entry.summary: PCL-Reasoner-V1.5 achieves 90.9% on AIME 2024 and 85.6% on AIME 2025 using offline RL for mathematical reasoning. Demonstrates offline RL as more stable alternative to online methods like GRPO.

entry.title: MARS: Unleashing the Power of Speculative Decoding via Margin-Aware Verification

author.name: Jingwei Song, Xinyu Wang, Hanbin Wang, Xiaoxuan Lei, Bill Shi, Shixin Han, Eric Yang, Xiao-Wen Chang, Lynn Ai

entry.summary: MARS improves speculative decoding by using margin-aware verification that avoids rejecting plausible runner-up tokens when target model shows weak preference. Training-free and domain-agnostic.

entry.title: Learning Nonlinear Heterogeneity in Physical Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks

author.name: Fabiana Taglietti, Andrea Pulici, Maxwell Roxburgh, Gabriele Seguini, Ian Vidamour, Stephan Menzel, Edoardo Franco, Michele Laus, Eleni Vasilaki, Michele Perego, Thomas J. Hayward, Marco Fanciulli, Jack C. Gartside

entry.summary: Demonstrates physical Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks in silicon devices called SYNEs, training synaptic nonlinearities rather than linear weights. Shows higher task performance per physical resource.

entry.title: Experiments on Reward Hacking Monitorability in Language Models

author.name: Monketo

entry.summary: Experiments with Qwen-Coder 32B on reward hacking in coding tasks with wrong test cases, finding inoculation prompting reduces reward hack rate and increases monitorability of hacks.

entry.title: The Responsibility Vacuum: Organizational Failure in Scaled Agent Systems

author.name: Oleg Romanchuk, Roman Bondar

entry.summary: Defines 'responsibility vacuum' in CI/CD pipelines with agent-generated code where decisions occur but responsibility cannot be attributed because authority and verification capacity don't coincide. Identifies scaling limits.

entry.title: Say Anything but This: When Tokenizer Betrays Reasoning in LLMs

author.name: Navid Ayoobi, Marcus I Armstrong, Arjun Mukherjee

entry.summary: Reveals that tokenizer non-uniqueness (multiple token sequences encoding identical text) causes LLM reasoning failures. Introduces a tokenization-consistency probe showing models treat semantically identical inputs differently based on internal representation.

entry.title: Beyond Hard Writes and Rigid Preservation: Soft Recursive Least-Squares for Lifelong LLM Editing

author.name: Xinyu Wang, Sicheng Lyu, Yu Gu, Jerry Huang, Peng Lu, Yufei Cui, Xiao-Wen Chang

entry.summary: RLSEdit formulates LLM editing as online quadratic optimization with soft constraints using recursive least-squares. Addresses plasticity-stability dilemma in long sequential editing.

entry.title: Provable Robustness in Multimodal Large Language Models via Feature Space Smoothing

author.name: Song Xia, Meiwen Ding, Chenqi Kong, Wenhan Yang, Xudong Jiang

entry.summary: Feature-space Smoothing provides certified robustness for multimodal LLMs through feature representation smoothing. Proves guaranteed lower bounds on feature cosine similarity under adversarial attacks.

entry.title: Parallelism and Generation Order in Masked Diffusion Language Models: Limits Today, Potential Tomorrow

author.name: Yangyang Zhong, Yanmei Gu, Zhengqing Zang, Xiaomeng Li, Yuqi Ding, Xibei Jia, Yuting Shen, Zhenzhong Lan, Liwang Zhu, Weiping Liu, Junlin Zhou, Haisheng Liu, Zhong Xin Yu, Pengxin Luo, Donglian Qi, Yunfeng Yan, Junbo Zhao

entry.summary: Comprehensive evaluation of 8 Masked Diffusion Language Models (up to 100B params) on 58 benchmarks. Introduces AFP and Kendall's tau metrics to characterize parallelism and generation order, showing MDLMs still lag AR models.

entry.title: Intelligence Degradation in Long-Context LLMs: Critical Threshold Determination via Natural Length Distribution Analysis

author.name: Weiwei Wang, Jiyong Min, Weijie Zou

entry.summary: Studies catastrophic performance degradation in LLMs when processing contexts near critical thresholds. Introduces Natural Length Distribution Analysis showing models fail beyond certain limits.

entry.title: The phases of an AI takeover

author.name: sjadler

entry.summary: Framework describing three phases of potential AI takeover, from former OpenAI dangerous capabilities evaluation lead. Discusses how AI might assert power through capability accumulation, resource acquisition, and influence expansion.

entry.title: What Makes Low-Bit Quantization-Aware Training Work for Reasoning LLMs? A Systematic Study

author.name: Keyu Lv, Manyi Zhang, Xiaobo Xia, Jingchen Ni, Shannan Yan, Xianzhi Yu, Lu Hou, Chun Yuan, Haoli Bai

entry.summary: Systematic empirical study of quantization-aware training for reasoning LLMs, finding knowledge distillation robust across SFT/RL models and PTQ provides strong QAT initialization.

entry.title: Martingale Foresight Sampling: A Principled Approach to Inference-Time LLM Decoding

author.name: Huayu Li, ZhengXiao He, Siyuan Tian, Jinghao Wen, Ao Li

entry.summary: Martingale Foresight Sampling reformulates LLM decoding as finding an optimal stochastic process using martingale theory. Provides principled alternative to heuristic foresight sampling methods.

entry.title: Not Your Typical Sycophant: The Elusive Nature of Sycophancy in Large Language Models

author.name: Shahar Ben Natan, Oren Tsur

entry.summary: Proposes novel sycophancy evaluation using LLM-as-judge in a zero-sum game setting where sycophancy incurs cost on others. Compares Gemini 2.5 Pro, GPT-4o, Mistral-Large, and Claude Sonnet 3.7, finding Claude and Mistral exhibit 'more moral' behavior in costly settings.

entry.title: SAMTok: Representing Any Mask with Two Words

author.name: Yikang Zhou, Tao Zhang, Dengxian Gong, Yuanzheng Wu, Ye Tian, Haochen Wang, Haobo Yuan, Jiacong Wang, Lu Qi, Hao Fei, Anran Wang, Zhuochen Wang, Yujing Wang, Cheng Chen, Shunping Ji, Xiangtai Li

entry.summary: Introduces SAMTok, converting any region mask into two special tokens enabling standard next-token prediction for pixel-wise capabilities in MLLMs without architectural modifications. Builds on SAM2 with high-fidelity mask reconstruction.

entry.title: Neural chameleons can('t) hide from activation oracles

author.name: ceselder

entry.summary: Tests whether 'neural chameleon' models trained to evade linear probes also evade activation oracles, finding oracles are more robust but still somewhat affected by the evasion training.

entry.title: On Meta-Evaluation

author.name: Hongxiao Li, Chenxi Wang, Fanda Fan, Zihan Wang, Wanling Gao, Lei Wang, Jianfeng Zhan

entry.summary: Introduces formal framework for meta-evaluation with AxiaBench enabling first large-scale comparison of 10 evaluation methods across 8 domains. Reveals fundamental trade-offs in evaluation methodology.

entry.title: NeuroFilter: Privacy Guardrails for Conversational LLM Agents

author.name: Saswat Das, Ferdinando Fioretto

entry.summary: NeuroFilter provides privacy guardrails for LLM agents by detecting privacy-violating intent through linear separability in internal representations. Offers lower latency than LLM-mediated checking and resists multi-turn manipulation.

entry.title: Where Do AI Coding Agents Fail? An Empirical Study of Failed Agentic Pull Requests in GitHub

author.name: Ramtin Ehsani, Sakshi Pathak, Shriya Rawal, Abdullah Al Mujahid, Mia Mohammad Imran, Preetha Chatterjee

entry.summary: Large-scale study of 33k agent-authored PRs across GitHub finding documentation/CI tasks succeed most while performance optimization fails frequently. Reveals that agents struggle with complex review dynamics.

entry.title: PRISM: Deriving the Transformer as a Signal-Denoising Operator via Maximum Coding Rate Reduction

author.name: Dongchen Huang

entry.summary: PRISM derives a white-box attention architecture from Maximum Coding Rate Reduction principles. Introduces overcomplete dictionary and irrational frequency separation to induce unsupervised functional disentanglement.

entry.title: Statistical Reinforcement Learning in the Real World: A Survey of Challenges and Future Directions

author.name: Asim H. Gazi, Yongyi Guo, Daiqi Gao, Ziping Xu, Kelly W. Zhang, Susan A. Murphy

entry.summary: Survey identifying key challenges for deploying RL in real-world settings: limited environment interaction and substantial environment changes. Authored by Susan Murphy's group.

entry.title: Agentic Uncertainty Quantification

author.name: Jiaxin Zhang, Prafulla Kumar Choubey, Kung-Hsiang Huang, Caiming Xiong, Chien-Sheng Wu

entry.summary: Proposes Dual-Process Agentic UQ (AUQ) framework to address the 'Spiral of Hallucination' in AI agents where early errors propagate irreversibly. Combines System 1 (Uncertainty-Aware Memory) for implicit propagation with System 2 for active corrections.

entry.title: Learning to Watermark in the Latent Space of Generative Models

author.name: Sylvestre-Alvise Rebuffi, Tuan Tran, Valeriu Lacatusu, Pierre Fernandez, Tom\'a\v{s} Sou\v{c}ek, Nikola Jovanovi\'c, Tom Sander, Hady Elsahar, Alexandre Mourachko

entry.summary: Introduces DistSeal for latent space watermarking in diffusion and autoregressive models. Trains watermarkers in latent space that can be distilled into the model or decoder for in-model watermarking with up to 20x speed improvement.

entry.title: Releasing TakeOverBench.com: a benchmark, for AI takeover

author.name: otto.barten

entry.summary: Announces TakeOverBench.com, a benchmark tracking progress toward AI takeover capabilities across nine dangerous capability areas, using existing benchmark data to assess proximity to existential threat scenarios.

entry.title: Uncovering Unfaithful CoT in Deceptive Models

author.name: agastya agrawal

entry.summary: Fine-tunes models to generate unfaithful chain-of-thought while solving mysteries as a detective, finding deceptive objective overrides alignment and the behavior is parasitic on reasoning capabilities.

entry.title: Epistemic Constitutionalism Or: how to avoid coherence bias

author.name: Michele Loi

entry.summary: Proposes an 'epistemic constitution' for AI systems - explicit meta-norms regulating how LLMs form and express beliefs. Demonstrates source attribution bias where models penalize arguments from sources with conflicting ideological positions.

entry.title: Self-Blinding and Counterfactual Self-Simulation Mitigate Biases and Sycophancy in Large Language Models

author.name: Brian Christian, Matan Mazor

entry.summary: Shows prompting LLMs to ignore biasing information fails to offset biases and sometimes backfires. Proposes self-blinding and counterfactual self-simulation as more effective debiasing approaches.

entry.title: Rethinking Reinforcement fine-tuning of LLMs: A Multi-armed Bandit Learning Perspective

author.name: Xiao Hu, Hong Xie, Tao Tan, Defu Lian, Jianyu Han

entry.summary: Reframes reinforcement learning fine-tuning of LLMs through multi-armed bandit theory to understand which optimization choices matter most. Uses minimalist experimental design to disentangle confounding factors in the training process.

entry.title: CorpusQA: A 10 Million Token Benchmark for Corpus-Level Analysis and Reasoning

author.name: Zhiyuan Lu, Chenliang Li, Yingcheng Shi, Weizhou Shen, Ming Yan, Fei Huang

entry.summary: CorpusQA benchmark scales to 10M tokens for testing corpus-level reasoning where evidence is dispersed across hundreds of documents. Addresses gap beyond single-document and sparse retrieval assumptions.

entry.title: Iterative Refinement Improves Compositional Image Generation

author.name: Shantanu Jaiswal, Mihir Prabhudesai, Nikash Bhardwaj, Zheyang Qin, Amir Zadeh, Chuan Li, Katerina Fragkiadaki, Deepak Pathak

entry.summary: Proposes iterative test-time refinement strategy for text-to-image generation where a VLM provides feedback to progressively improve compositional image generation. Inspired by chain-of-thought reasoning.

entry.title: Why Inference in Large Models Becomes Decomposable After Training

author.name: Jidong Jin

entry.summary: Theoretical analysis showing gradient updates in large models are localized, leaving many parameters near initialization. Implies post-training inference is inherently decomposable.

entry.title: Entropy-Tree: Tree-Based Decoding with Entropy-Guided Exploration

author.name: Longxuan Wei, Yubo Zhang, Zijiao Zhang, Zhihu Wang, Shiwan Zhao, Tianyu Huang, Huiting Zhao, Chenfei Liu, Shenao Zhang, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: Entropy-Tree is a tree-based decoding method that uses entropy as a branching signal, expanding search only at genuine uncertainty points. Shows better pass@k than multi-chain sampling with improved calibration.

entry.title: YuFeng-XGuard: A Reasoning-Centric, Interpretable, and Flexible Guardrail Model for Large Language Models

author.name: Junyu Lin, Meizhen Liu, Xiufeng Huang, Jinfeng Li, Haiwen Hong, Xiaohan Yuan, Yuefeng Chen, Longtao Huang, Hui Xue, Ranjie Duan, Zhikai Chen, Yuchuan Fu, Defeng Li, Lingyao Gao, Yitong Yang

entry.summary: YuFeng-XGuard is a reasoning-centric guardrail model generating structured risk predictions with explicit categories, confidence scores, and natural language explanations.

entry.title: Replayable Financial Agents: A Determinism-Faithfulness Assurance Harness for Tool-Using LLM Agents

author.name: Raffi Khatchadourian

entry.summary: Introduces DFAH (Determinism-Faithfulness Assurance Harness) framework for measuring trajectory determinism and evidence-conditioned faithfulness in tool-using LLM agents for financial services. Tests 74 configurations across 12 models, finding 7-20B models achieve 100% determinism while 120B+ models require larger validation samples.

entry.title: Agentic Confidence Calibration

author.name: Jiaxin Zhang, Caiming Xiong, Chien-Sheng Wu

entry.summary: Introduces Agentic Confidence Calibration problem and proposes Holistic Trajectory Calibration (HTC), extracting process-level features from macro dynamics to micro stability across agent trajectories to address overconfidence in failure cases.

entry.title: DextER: Language-driven Dexterous Grasp Generation with Embodied Reasoning

author.name: Junha Lee, Eunha Park, Minsu Cho

entry.summary: DextER introduces contact-based embodied reasoning for language-driven dexterous grasping, predicting which hand links contact where on objects as an intermediate representation bridging task semantics with physical constraints.

entry.title: Will we get automated alignment research before an AI Takeoff?

author.name: JanWehner

entry.summary: Forecasts that AI will accelerate capabilities research before safety research due to clearer feedback signals and engineering vs insight dependencies, arguing for safety research tooling investments now.

entry.title: On the Limits of Learned Importance Scoring for KV Cache Compression

author.name: Brady Steele

entry.summary: Investigates learned KV cache compression finding that a sophisticated 1.7M parameter scorer doesn't outperform simple baselines including random selection. Position-based heuristics match learned approaches.

entry.title: INFA-Guard: Mitigating Malicious Propagation via Infection-Aware Safeguarding in LLM-Based Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Yijin Zhou, Xiaoya Lu, Dongrui Liu, Junchi Yan, Jing Shao

entry.summary: INFA-Guard defends multi-agent LLM systems against malicious propagation by explicitly modeling 'infected' agents (benign agents converted by attackers) as distinct threats. Uses infection-aware detection and topological constraints.

entry.title: Language Models Entangle Language and Culture

author.name: Shourya Jain, Paras Chopra

entry.summary: Investigates how LLMs entangle language and culture, showing that query language affects both response quality and cultural context. Uses WildChat data and LLM-as-a-Judge evaluation.

entry.title: A tensor network formalism for neuro-symbolic AI

author.name: Alex Goessmann, Janina Sch\"utte, Maximilian Fr\"ohlich, Martin Eigel

entry.summary: Introduces tensor network formalism unifying neural and symbolic AI approaches. Represents logical formulas and probability distributions as structured tensor decompositions with efficient contraction algorithms.

entry.title: Tracking the Limits of Knowledge Propagation: How LLMs Fail at Multi-Step Reasoning with Conflicting Knowledge

author.name: Yiyang Feng, Zeming Chen, Haotian Wu, Jiawei Zhou, Antoine Bosselut

entry.summary: Introduces TRACK benchmark for studying how LLMs propagate new knowledge through multi-step reasoning when it conflicts with parametric knowledge. Focuses on knowledge update propagation failures rather than just recall.

entry.title: Beyond Visual Safety: Jailbreaking Multimodal Large Language Models for Harmful Image Generation via Semantic-Agnostic Inputs

author.name: Mingyu Yu, Lana Liu, Zhehao Zhao, Wei Wang, Sujuan Qin

entry.summary: Proposes Beyond Visual Safety (BVS), a jailbreaking framework probing visual safety boundaries of MLLMs using neutralized visual splicing and inductive recomposition to generate harmful images.

entry.title: CompliantVLA-adaptor: VLM-Guided Variable Impedance Action for Safe Contact-Rich Manipulation

author.name: Heng Zhang, Wei-Hsing Huang, Qiyi Tong, Gokhan Solak, Puze Liu, Sheng Liu, Jan Peters, Arash Ajoudani

entry.summary: CompliantVLA-adaptor augments Vision-Language-Action models with VLM-informed variable impedance control for safer contact-rich manipulation, addressing the lack of force-aware adaptation in current VLA systems.

entry.title: MAS-Orchestra: Understanding and Improving Multi-Agent Reasoning Through Holistic Orchestration and Controlled Benchmarks

author.name: Zixuan Ke, Yifei Ming, Austin Xu, Ryan Chin, Xuan-Phi Nguyen, Prathyusha Jwalapuram, Semih Yavuz, Caiming Xiong, Shafiq Joty

entry.summary: Introduces MAS-Orchestra from Salesforce, formulating multi-agent system orchestration as function-calling RL with holistic orchestration that generates entire MAS configurations at once, rather than sequential agent-by-agent design.

entry.title: CoScale-RL: Efficient Post-Training by Co-Scaling Data and Computation

author.name: Yutong Chen, Jiandong Gao, Ji Wu

entry.summary: CoScale-RL improves reasoning model training by scaling up solutions per problem rather than dataset size, combined with Re-distillation for model merging. Shows improved data and computational efficiency for post-training.

entry.title: Rethinking Video Generation Model for the Embodied World

author.name: Yufan Deng, Zilin Pan, Hongyu Zhang, Xiaojie Li, Ruoqing Hu, Yufei Ding, Yiming Zou, Yan Zeng, Daquan Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces RBench, a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating robot-oriented video generation across five task domains and four embodiment types. Assesses both task correctness and visual fidelity for embodied AI applications.

entry.title: Next Generation Active Learning: Mixture of LLMs in the Loop

author.name: Yuanyuan Qi, Xiaohao Yang, Jueqing Lu, Guoxiang Guo, Joanne Enticott, Gang Liu, Lan Du

entry.summary: Proposes Mixture of LLMs in the Loop for active learning, replacing human annotators with aggregated labels from multiple LLMs. Uses annotation discrepancy and negative learning to handle noisy labels.

entry.title: Sawtooth Wavefront Reordering: Enhanced CuTile FlashAttention on NVIDIA GB10

author.name: Yifan Zhu, Yekai Pan, Chen Ding

entry.summary: Introduces Sawtooth Wavefront Reordering technique for CuTile-based FlashAttention on NVIDIA GB10 (Grace Blackwell). Achieves 50%+ L2 cache miss reduction and up to 60% throughput increase.

entry.title: ErrorMap and ErrorAtlas: Charting the Failure Landscape of Large Language Models

author.name: Shir Ashury-Tahan, Yifan Mai, Elron Bandel, Michal Shmueli-Scheuer, Leshem Choshen

entry.summary: Introduces ErrorMap, the first method to systematically identify sources of LLM failures rather than just when they fail. Extracts unique 'failure signatures' to help debug models and align benchmark goals with outcomes.

entry.title: Learning a Unified Latent Space for Cross-Embodiment Robot Control

author.name: Yashuai Yan, Dongheui Lee

entry.summary: Presents a framework for cross-embodiment humanoid robot control by learning a shared latent representation using contrastive learning, enabling motion transfer across humans and diverse robot platforms.

entry.title: AI can suddenly become dangerous despite gradual progress

author.name: Simon Lermen

entry.summary: Argues that AI capabilities can appear suddenly even with gradual underlying progress, using the distinction between continuous intelligence improvement and threshold-based capabilities like 'can reliably outwit humans'.

entry.title: Knowledge Graphs are Implicit Reward Models: Path-Derived Signals Enable Compositional Reasoning

author.name: Yuval Kansal, Niraj K. Jha

entry.summary: Proposes using knowledge graph paths as implicit reward models for RL to enable compositional multi-hop reasoning in specialized scientific domains. Combines SFT with KG-derived reward signals.

entry.title: HERMES: KV Cache as Hierarchical Memory for Efficient Streaming Video Understanding

author.name: Haowei Zhang, Shudong Yang, Jinlan Fu, See-Kiong Ng, Xipeng Qiu

entry.summary: HERMES treats KV cache as hierarchical memory for streaming video understanding, enabling real-time responses with low GPU overhead. Training-free architecture based on mechanistic attention investigation.

entry.title: CASL: Concept-Aligned Sparse Latents for Interpreting Diffusion Models

author.name: Zhenghao He, Guangzhi Xiong, Boyang Wang, Sanchit Sinha, Aidong Zhang

entry.summary: CASL provides supervised framework for aligning sparse latent dimensions in diffusion models with human-understandable semantic concepts. Enables reliable semantic control over generated images.

entry.title: Low-Dimensional Adaptation of Rectified Flow: A New Perspective through the Lens of Diffusion and Stochastic Localization

author.name: Saptarshi Roy, Alessandro Rinaldo, Purnamrita Sarkar

entry.summary: Shows rectified flow automatically adapts to intrinsic low dimensionality of target distribution, achieving O(k/Îµ) iteration complexity where k is intrinsic dimension.

entry.title: PhysicsMind: Sim and Real Mechanics Benchmarking for Physical Reasoning and Prediction in Foundational VLMs and World Models

author.name: Chak-Wing Mak, Guanyu Zhu, Boyi Zhang, Hongji Li, Xiaowei Chi, Kevin Zhang, Yichen Wu, Yangfan He, Chun-Kai Fan, Wentao Lu, Kuangzhi Ge, Xinyu Fang, Hongyang He, Kuan Lu, Tianxiang Xu, Li Zhang, Yongxin Ni, Youhua Li, Shanghang Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces PhysicsMind, unified benchmark with real and simulation environments evaluating physics reasoning in MLLMs and world models across Center of Mass, Lever Equilibrium, and Newton's First Law principles.

entry.title: IVRA: Improving Visual-Token Relations for Robot Action Policy with Training-Free Hint-Based Guidance

author.name: Jongwoo Park, Kanchana Ranasinghe, Jinhyeok Jang, Cristina Mata, Yoo Sung Jang, Michael S Ryoo

entry.summary: IVRA is a training-free method that improves spatial understanding in VLA models by injecting affinity signals from the vision encoder into language model layers, preserving geometric structure.

entry.title: Query-Efficient Agentic Graph Extraction Attacks on GraphRAG Systems

author.name: Shuhua Yang, Jiahao Zhang, Yilong Wang, Dongwon Lee, Suhang Wang

entry.summary: Proposes AGEA, a framework for query-efficient extraction attacks on GraphRAG systems using novelty-guided exploration and LLM-based filtering to reconstruct hidden knowledge graphs under realistic query budgets.

entry.title: A Brain-inspired Embodied Intelligence for Fluid and Fast Reflexive Robotics Control

author.name: Weiyu Guo, He Zhang, Pengteng Li, Tiefu Cai, Ziyang Chen, Yandong Guo, Xiao He, Yongkui Yang, Ying Sun, Hui Xiong

entry.summary: NeuroVLA mimics biological nervous system organization (cortex, cerebellum, spinal cord) for robotics control, enabling rapid skill acquisition from sparse experience. Addresses the gap between biological and robotic motion control.

entry.title: Obscuring Data Contamination Through Translation: Evidence from Arabic Corpora

author.name: Chaymaa Abbas, Nour Shamaa, Mariette Awad

entry.summary: Investigates how data contamination manifests through Arabic translations of English benchmarks, showing memorization can be obscured across languages. Extends detection methods with choice-reordering and Min-K% analysis.

entry.title: MolecularIQ: Characterizing Chemical Reasoning Capabilities Through Symbolic Verification on Molecular Graphs

author.name: Christoph Bartmann, Johannes Schimunek, Mykyta Ielanskyi, Philipp Seidl, G\"unter Klambauer, Sohvi Luukkonen

entry.summary: Introduces MolecularIQ, a benchmark for evaluating LLM chemical reasoning through symbolically verifiable tasks on molecular graphs. Avoids common benchmark issues like data leakage and multiple-choice bias.

entry.title: Learning Neural Operators from Partial Observations via Latent Autoregressive Modeling

author.name: Jingren Hou, Hong Wang, Pengyu Xu, Chang Gao, Huafeng Liu, Liping Jing

entry.summary: First systematic framework for learning neural operators from partial observations. Addresses supervision gap in unobserved regions and spatial mismatch between incomplete inputs and complete solutions.

entry.title: Data-Free Privacy-Preserving for LLMs via Model Inversion and Selective Unlearning

author.name: Xinjie Zhou, Zhihui Yang, Lechao Cheng, Sai Wu, Gang Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Data-Free Selective Unlearning (DFSU) to remove PII from LLMs without requiring original training data. Uses model inversion to synthesize pseudo-PII and constructs token-level privacy masks.

entry.title: Connect the Dots: Knowledge Graph-Guided Crawler Attack on Retrieval-Augmented Generation Systems

author.name: Mengyu Yao, Ziqi Zhang, Ning Luo, Shaofei Li, Yifeng Cai, Xiangqun Chen, Yao Guo, Ding Li

entry.summary: Formulates RAG extraction attacks as an adaptive stochastic coverage problem. Uses knowledge graphs to guide multi-turn queries that exfiltrate sensitive content from RAG systems.

entry.title: Memorization Dynamics in Knowledge Distillation for Language Models

author.name: Jaydeep Borkar, Karan Chadha, Niloofar Mireshghallah, Yuchen Zhang, Irina-Elena Veliche, Archi Mitra, David A. Smith, Zheng Xu, Diego Garcia-Olano

entry.summary: Studies memorization dynamics across knowledge distillation pipeline using Pythia, OLMo-2, Qwen-3 families. Finds distilled models memorize less than teachers but retain some leakage.

entry.title: VideoThinker: Building Agentic VideoLLMs with LLM-Guided Tool Reasoning

author.name: Chenglin Li, Qianglong Chen, Feng Han, Yikun Wang, Xingxi Yin, Yan Gong, Ruilin Li, Yin Zhang, Jiaqi Wang

entry.summary: Introduces VideoThinker, an agentic VideoLLM trained on synthetic tool interaction trajectories generated by LLM guidance. Enables adaptive temporal retrieval, spatial zoom, and temporal zoom for long-form video understanding.

entry.title: PyraTok: Language-Aligned Pyramidal Tokenizer for Video Understanding and Generation

author.name: Onkar Susladkar, Tushar Prakash, Adheesh Juvekar, Kiet A. Nguyen, Dong-Hwan Jang, Inderjit S Dhillon, Ismini Lourentzou

entry.summary: PyraTok introduces a pyramidal tokenizer for video that learns semantically structured discrete representations across multiple spatiotemporal resolutions with language alignment. This addresses poor cross-modal alignment and zero-shot transfer issues in existing video tokenizers.

entry.title: TeNet: Text-to-Network for Compact Policy Synthesis

author.name: Ariyan Bighashdel, Kevin Sebastian Luck

entry.summary: TeNet generates compact, task-specific robot policies directly from natural language descriptions using a hypernetwork conditioned on LLM text embeddings, enabling high-frequency control.

entry.title: Dedicated continuous supervision of AI companies

author.name: Michael Bennett

entry.summary: Analyzes dedicated continuous supervision as regulatory approach for AI companies, comparing to nuclear and financial regulation, examining information access, monitoring frequency, and regulatory capture risks.

entry.title: To Neuro-Symbolic Classification and Beyond by Compiling Description Logic Ontologies to Probabilistic Circuits

author.name: Nicolas Lazzari, Valentina Presutti, Antonio Vergari

entry.summary: Proposes compiling Description Logic ontologies into probabilistic circuits for neuro-symbolic classification, enabling synthetic data generation, GPU-accelerated reasoning, and predictions guaranteed consistent with ontologies.

entry.title: Diffusion Large Language Models for Black-Box Optimization

author.name: Ye Yuan (Sam), Can (Sam), Chen, Zipeng Sun, Dinghuai Zhang, Christopher Pal, Xue Liu

entry.summary: Explores diffusion LLMs for black-box optimization, addressing bidirectional dependencies in designs that autoregressive models struggle to capture. Frames offline BBO with in-context learning.

entry.title: TIDAL: Temporally Interleaved Diffusion and Action Loop for High-Frequency VLA Control

author.name: Yuteng Sun (Michael), Haoran Wang (Michael), Ruofei Bai (Michael), Zhengguo Li (Michael), Jun Li (Michael), Meng Yee (Michael), Chuah, Wei Yun Yau

entry.summary: TIDAL decouples semantic reasoning from high-frequency actuation in VLA models through dual-frequency architecture with cached semantic embeddings and micro-action control loop.

entry.title: SAGE-FM: A lightweight and interpretable spatial transcriptomics foundation model

author.name: Xianghao Zhan, Jingyu Xu, Yuanning Zheng, Zinaida Good, Olivier Gevaert

entry.summary: SAGE-FM is a lightweight spatial transcriptomics foundation model using GCNs with masked prediction objective. Trained on 416 samples across 15 organs, shows strong generalization to downstream tasks.

entry.title: Counterfactual Training: Teaching Models Plausible and Actionable Explanations

author.name: Patrick Altmeyer, Aleksander Buszydlik, Arie van Deursen, Cynthia C. S. Liem

entry.summary: Proposes counterfactual training regime that directly incorporates counterfactual explanation desiderata (plausibility, actionability) into model training rather than relying on post-hoc explanations.

entry.title: PhysProver: Advancing Automatic Theorem Proving for Physics

author.name: Hanning Zhang, Ruida Wang, Rui Pan, Wenyuan Wang, Bingxu Meng, Tong Zhang

entry.summary: Presents PhysProver, the first approach to formal theorem proving in physics domain. Creates PhysLeanDataset for physics formalization and develops methods to enhance proof capabilities for physics theorems.

entry.title: Neural Particle Automata: Learning Self-Organizing Particle Dynamics

author.name: Hyunsoo Kim, Ehsan Pajouheshgar, Sabine S\"usstrunk, Wenzel Jakob, Jinah Park

entry.summary: Neural Particle Automata (NPA) generalizes Neural Cellular Automata from fixed grids to dynamic particle systems, with each particle having continuous position and internal state updated by shared neural rules.

entry.title: The Why Behind the Action: Unveiling Internal Drivers via Agentic Attribution

author.name: Chen Qian, Peng Wang, Dongrui Liu, Junyao Yang, Dadi Guo, Ling Tang, Jilin Mei, Qihan Ren, Shuai Shao, Yong Liu, Jie Fu, Jing Shao, Xia Hu

entry.summary: Proposes framework for general agentic attribution to identify internal factors driving agent actions regardless of task outcome. Goes beyond failure attribution to explain reasoning behind all behaviors.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Constraint Factorization Reveals Latent Invariant Solution Structure

author.name: Christopher Scofield

entry.summary: Provides formal operator-theoretic explanation for why multi-agent LLM systems outperform single agents: MAS implements factorized constraint composition reaching invariant solutions inaccessible to single agents.

entry.title: FedUMM: A General Framework for Federated Learning with Unified Multimodal Models

author.name: Zhaolong Su, Leheng Zhao, Xiaoying Wu, Ziyue Xu, Jindong Wang

entry.summary: FedUMM enables federated learning for unified multimodal models under non-IID data with low communication cost. Uses LoRA adapters for parameter-efficient fine-tuning with BLIP3o backbone.

entry.title: Towards Automated Kernel Generation in the Era of LLMs

author.name: Yang Yu, Peiyu Zang, Chi Hsu Tsai, Haiming Wu, Yixin Shen, Jialing Zhang, Haoyu Wang, Zhiyou Xiao, Jingze Shi, Yuyu Luo, Wentao Zhang, Chunlei Men, Guang Liu, Yonghua Lin

entry.summary: Survey and analysis of LLM-based approaches to automated kernel generation and optimization. Covers how LLMs can compress expert kernel knowledge for GPU programming.

entry.title: Robust X-Learner: Breaking the Curse of Imbalance and Heavy Tails via Robust Cross-Imputation

author.name: Eichi Uehara

entry.summary: Robust X-Learner addresses extreme class imbalance and heavy-tailed outcomes in heterogeneous treatment effect estimation. Shows standard X-Learner is vulnerable to 'Outlier Smearing' in minority groups.

entry.title: ICPO: Illocution-Calibrated Policy Optimization for Multi-Turn Conversation

author.name: Zhebo Wang, Xiaohu Mu, Zijie Zhou, Mohan Li, Wenpeng Xing, Dezhang Kong, Meng Han

entry.summary: ICPO addresses LLM overconfidence in multi-turn conversations where early incorrect assumptions compound. Conditions reward on instruction ambiguity, encouraging clarification-seeking behavior.

entry.title: HyperAlign: Hypernetwork for Efficient Test-Time Alignment of Diffusion Models

author.name: Xin Xie, Jiaxian Guo, Dong Gong

entry.summary: Proposes HyperAlign, training hypernetwork to generate low-rank adaptation weights for efficient test-time diffusion model alignment, avoiding fine-tuning diversity loss and test-time scaling computational overhead.

entry.title: "Just in Time" World Modeling Supports Human Planning and Reasoning

author.name: Tony Chen, Sam Cheyette, Kelsey Allen, Joshua Tenenbaum, Kevin Smith

entry.summary: Presents a 'Just-in-Time' framework for human simulation-based reasoning that constructs simplified environment representations online. Authors from MIT (Tenenbaum lab) demonstrate how simulation guides visual search and representation modification.

entry.title: Beyond Affinity: A Benchmark of 1D, 2D, and 3D Methods Reveals Critical Trade-offs in Structure-Based Drug Design

author.name: Kangyu Zheng, Kai Zhang, Jiale Tan, Xuehan Chen, Yingzhou Lu, Zaixi Zhang, Lichao Sun, Marinka Zitnik, Tianfan Fu, Zhiding Liang

entry.summary: Establishes comprehensive benchmark comparing 15 structure-based drug design models across search-based, deep generative, and RL algorithms. Reveals trade-offs between pharmaceutical properties and docking affinities.

entry.title: SearchGym: Bootstrapping Real-World Search Agents via Cost-Effective and High-Fidelity Environment Simulation

author.name: Xichen Zhang, Ziyi He, Yinghao Zhu, Sitong Wu, Shaozuo Yu, Meng Chu, Wenhu Zhang, Haoru Tan, Jiaya Jia

entry.summary: SearchGym creates a simulation environment for training search agents using RL without expensive API calls or corrupted reward signals from stale data. Constructs verified knowledge graphs with aligned document corpora.

entry.title: Empowering LLMs for Structure-Based Drug Design via Exploration-Augmented Latent Inference

author.name: Xuanning Hu, Anchen Li, Qianli Xing, Jinglong Ji, Hao Tuo, Bo Yang

entry.summary: ELILLM framework enables LLMs to perform structure-based drug design by reinterpreting generation as encoding, latent space exploration, and decoding. Uses Bayesian optimization to guide exploration.

entry.title: BanditLP: Large-Scale Stochastic Optimization for Personalized Recommendations

author.name: Phuc Nguyen, Benjamin Zelditch, Joyce Chen, Rohit Patra, Changshuai Wei

entry.summary: BanditLP from LinkedIn combines neural Thompson Sampling with large-scale linear programming for personalized recommendations under multi-stakeholder constraints. LP solver handles billions of variables.

entry.title: CURE: Curriculum-guided Multi-task Training for Reliable Anatomy Grounded Report Generation

author.name: Pablo Messina, Andr\'es Villa, Juan Le\'on Alc\'azar, Karen S\'anchez, Carlos Hinojosa, Denis Parra, \'Alvaro Soto, Bernard Ghanem

entry.summary: CURE uses curriculum learning to improve medical report generation by dynamically adjusting sampling based on model performance. Improves grounding accuracy and factual consistency.

entry.title: Multi-Persona Thinking for Bias Mitigation in Large Language Models

author.name: Yuxing Chen, Guoqing Luo, Zijun Wu, Lili Mou

entry.summary: Multi-Persona Thinking (MPT) reduces LLM bias through dialectical reasoning from contrasting social identities plus neutral viewpoint. Transforms persona assignment weakness into strength.

entry.title: Towards Reliable Medical LLMs: Benchmarking and Enhancing Confidence Estimation of Large Language Models in Medical Consultation

author.name: Zhiyao Ren, Yibing Zhan, Siyuan Liang, Guozheng Ma, Baosheng Yu, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: First benchmark for confidence estimation in multi-turn medical consultations. Introduces information sufficiency gradient to characterize confidence-correctness dynamics as evidence increases.

entry.title: Evaluating and Achieving Controllable Code Completion in Code LLM

author.name: Jiajun Zhang, Zeyu Cui, Lei Zhang, Jian Yang, Jiaxi Yang, Qiang Liu, Zilei Wang, Binyuan Hui, Liang Wang, Junyang Lin

entry.summary: Presents C3-Bench, the first instruction-guided code completion benchmark with 2,195 tasks, addressing the gap where existing benchmarks focus only on functional correctness without considering instruction-following during completion.

entry.title: EVolSplat4D: Efficient Volume-based Gaussian Splatting for 4D Urban Scene Synthesis

author.name: Sheng Miao, Sijin Li, Pan Wang, Dongfeng Bai, Bingbing Liu, Yue Wang, Andreas Geiger, Yiyi Liao

entry.summary: Proposes EVolSplat4D, a feed-forward framework for 4D urban scene synthesis unifying volume-based and pixel-based Gaussian prediction across specialized branches for static background, dynamic objects, and panoramic sky.

entry.title: Why Can't I Open My Drawer? Mitigating Object-Driven Shortcuts in Zero-Shot Compositional Action Recognition

author.name: Geo Ahn, Inwoong Lee, Taeoh Kim, Minho Shim, Dongyoon Wee, Jinwoo Choi

entry.summary: Identifies a critical failure mode in zero-shot compositional action recognition: models learn object-driven shortcuts that ignore visual evidence for verbs, overfitting to co-occurrence statistics. This stems from asymmetric learning difficulty between verbs and objects.

entry.title: DualShield: Safe Model Predictive Diffusion via Reachability Analysis for Interactive Autonomous Driving

author.name: Rui Yang, Lei Zheng, Ruoyu Yao, Jun Ma

entry.summary: DualShield uses Hamilton-Jacobi reachability value functions for both proactive guidance in diffusion-based motion planning and reactive safety shields via control barrier functions for autonomous driving.

entry.title: Measuring and Aligning Abstraction in Vision-Language Models with Medical Taxonomies

author.name: Ben Schaper, Maxime Di Folco, Bernhard Kainz, Julia A. Schnabel, Cosmin I. Bercea

entry.summary: Measures and addresses abstraction errors in VLMs for chest X-ray classification using medical taxonomies. Introduces 'Catastrophic Abstraction Errors' metric and proposes taxonomy-aware fine-tuning achieving <2% severe errors.

entry.title: Tracing the Data Trail: A Survey of Data Provenance, Transparency and Traceability in LLMs

author.name: Richard Hohensinner, Belgin Mutlu, Inti Gabriel Mendoza Estrada, Matej Vukovic, Simone Kopeinik, Roman Kern

entry.summary: Survey synthesizing 10 years of research on LLM data provenance, transparency, and traceability. Proposes taxonomy covering data generation, watermarking, bias, privacy, and tools.

entry.title: Mechanism Shift During Post-training from Autoregressive to Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Injin Kong, Hyoungjoon Lee, Yohan Jo

entry.summary: Analyzes how post-training autoregressive models into masked diffusion models changes internal circuits. Reveals task-dependent mechanism shifts between retaining autoregressive patterns versus developing bidirectional reasoning.

entry.title: Multi-Targeted Graph Backdoor Attack

author.name: Md Nabi Newaz Khan, Abdullah Arafat Miah, Yu Bi

entry.summary: First multi-targeted backdoor attack for graph classification where multiple triggers redirect predictions to different target labels. Uses subgraph injection rather than replacement to preserve graph structure.

entry.title: Dualformer: Time-Frequency Dual Domain Learning for Long-term Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Jingjing Bai, Yoshinobu Kawahara

entry.summary: Dualformer addresses transformer's low-pass filtering effect in time series by dual-branch architecture modeling time and frequency domains concurrently with hierarchical frequency sampling.

entry.title: Probably Approximately Correct Maximum A Posteriori Inference

author.name: Matthew Shorvon, Frederik Mallmann-Trenn, David S. Watson

entry.summary: Introduces PAC algorithms for Maximum A Posteriori inference with provably optimal solutions under computational budgets. Uses probabilistic circuits for efficient implementation.

entry.title: Beyond Fixed Psychological Personas: State Beats Trait, but Language Models are State-Blind

author.name: Tamunotonye Harry, Ivoline Ngong, Chima Nweke, Yuanyuan Feng, Joseph Near

entry.summary: Introduces Chameleon dataset with 5,001 contextual psychological profiles showing 74% of variance is within-person (state) vs 26% between-person (trait). Finds LLMs are 'state-blind'.

entry.title: Event-VStream: Event-Driven Real-Time Understanding for Long Video Streams

author.name: Zhenghui Guo, Yuanbin Man, Junyuan Sheng, Bowen Lin, Ahmed Ahmed, Bo Jiang, Boyuan Zhang, Miao Yin, Sian Jin, Omprakash Gnawal, Chengming Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces Event-VStream, an event-aware framework representing continuous video as discrete semantic events for real-time long video understanding, triggering language generation only at meaningful state transitions.

entry.title: Understanding the Transfer Limits of Vision Foundation Models

author.name: Shiqi Huang, Yipei Wang, Natasha Thorley, Alexander Ng, Shaheer Saeed, Mark Emberton, Shonit Punwani, Veeru Kasivisvanathan, Dean Barratt, Daniel Alexander, Yipeng Hu

entry.summary: Analyzes transfer limitations of vision foundation models, arguing that pretraining objectives (masked reconstruction, contrastive learning) create representation mismatches for downstream tasks.

entry.title: 360Anything: Geometry-Free Lifting of Images and Videos to 360{\deg}

author.name: Ziyi Wu, Daniel Watson, Andrea Tagliasacchi, David J. Fleet, Marcus A. Brubaker, Saurabh Saxena

entry.summary: Proposes 360Anything, a geometry-free framework for lifting perspective images/videos to 360Â° panoramas using diffusion transformers, learning perspective-to-equirectangular mapping in data-driven way without camera metadata.

entry.title: Efficiently Learning Robust Torque-based Locomotion Through Reinforcement with Model-Based Supervision

author.name: Yashuai Yan, Tobias Egle, Christian Ott, Dongheui Lee

entry.summary: Proposes residual reinforcement learning on top of model-based bipedal locomotion control, using a model-based oracle with privileged access to supervise the residual policy during training.

entry.title: Developmental trajectories of decision making and affective dynamics in large language models

author.name: Zhihao Wang, Yiyang Liu, Ting Wang, Zhiyuan Liu

entry.summary: Analyzes developmental trajectories of OpenAI models as evolving lineage using gambling task. Finds newer models show more human-like risk-taking but also non-human signatures like loss aversion below neutral.

entry.title: GutenOCR: A Grounded Vision-Language Front-End for Documents

author.name: Hunter Heidenreich, Ben Elliott, Olivia Dinica, Yosheb Getachew

entry.summary: Introduces GutenOCR, grounded OCR models fine-tuned from Qwen2.5-VL with unified prompt interface for reading, detection, and grounding. More than doubles grounded OCR score vs baseline.

entry.title: Re-understanding Graph Unlearning through Memorization

author.name: Pengfei Ding, Yan Wang, Guanfeng Liu

entry.summary: Establishes GNN memorization as a new lens for understanding graph unlearning, revealing that memorization metrics better predict unlearning difficulty than existing approaches. Identifies limitations in current evaluation protocols.

entry.title: Memory Retention Is Not Enough to Master Memory Tasks in Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Oleg Shchendrigin, Egor Cherepanov, Alexey K. Kovalev, Aleksandr I. Panov

entry.summary: Introduces benchmark distinguishing memory retention from memory rewriting in RL, showing existing agents optimized for retention fail at updating outdated information in changing environments.

entry.title: Panther: Faster and Cheaper Computations with Randomized Numerical Linear Algebra

author.name: Fahd Seddik, Abdulrahman Elbedewy, Gaser Sami, Mohamed Abdelmoniem, Yahia Zakaria

entry.summary: Panther is a PyTorch library consolidating randomized numerical linear algebra algorithms for efficient deep learning. Provides drop-in replacements for linear layers, convolutions, and attention.

entry.title: Rethinking Drug-Drug Interaction Modeling as Generalizable Relation Learning

author.name: Dong Xu, Jiantao Wu, Qihua Pan, Sisi Yuan, Zexuan Zhu, Junkai Ji

entry.summary: GenRel-DDI framework for drug-drug interaction prediction that focuses on generalizable relation learning rather than molecule-centric embeddings. Shows proximity in existing embeddings doesn't correspond to interactions.

entry.title: RECAP: A Resource-Efficient Method for Adversarial Prompting in Large Language Models

author.name: Rishit Chugh

entry.summary: RECAP reduces cost of adversarial prompting by matching new prompts to a database of pre-trained adversarial suffixes, eliminating need for retraining GCG-style attacks.

entry.title: Explainable Deepfake Detection with RL Enhanced Self-Blended Images

author.name: Ning Jiang, Dingheng Zeng, Yanhong Liu, Haiyang Yi, Shijie Yu, Minghe Weng, Haifeng Shen, Ying Li

entry.summary: Proposes explainable deepfake detection using RL-enhanced self-blended images to generate training data with forgery attribution annotations, addressing the scarcity of annotated deepfake datasets for MLLM-based detection.

entry.title: RadJEPA: Radiology Encoder for Chest X-Rays via Joint Embedding Predictive Architecture

author.name: Anas Anwarul Haq Khan, Mariam Husain, Kshitij Jadhav

entry.summary: Introduces RadJEPA, a self-supervised radiology encoder using Joint Embedding Predictive Architecture trained solely on unlabeled chest X-rays, learning to predict latent representations of masked regions without language supervision.

entry.title: ActionMesh: Animated 3D Mesh Generation with Temporal 3D Diffusion

author.name: Remy Sabathier, David Novotny, Niloy J. Mitra, Tom Monnier

entry.summary: Introduces ActionMesh for generating production-ready animated 3D meshes via temporal 3D diffusion, modifying 3D diffusion to include temporal axis and designing temporal 3D autoencoder for coherent sequences.

entry.title: CamPilot: Improving Camera Control in Video Diffusion Model with Efficient Camera Reward Feedback

author.name: Wenhang Ge, Guibao Shen, Jiawei Feng, Luozhou Wang, Hao Lu, Xingye Tian, Xin Tao, Ying-Cong Chen

entry.summary: CamPilot improves camera controllability in video diffusion models using reward feedback learning with a novel camera-aware 3D decoder. The decoder converts video latents to 3D representations without full RGB decoding, reducing computational overhead.

entry.title: Collision-Free Humanoid Traversal in Cluttered Indoor Scenes

author.name: Han Xue, Sikai Liang, Zhikai Zhang, Zicheng Zeng, Yun Liu, Yunrui Lian, Jilong Wang, Qingtao Liu, Xuesong Shi, Li Yi

entry.summary: Introduces Humanoid Potential Field (HumanoidPF) for collision-free humanoid traversal in cluttered environments, encoding humanoid-obstacle relationships as collision-free motion directions.

entry.title: Large Language Model-Powered Evolutionary Code Optimization on a Phylogenetic Tree

author.name: Leyi Zhao, Weijie Huang, Yitong Guo, Jiang Bian, Chenghong Wang, Xuhong Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes PhyloEvolve, an LLM-agent system that frames GPU code optimization as In-Context Reinforcement Learning. Uses phylogenetic trees to track optimization trajectories for trajectory-conditioned experience reuse.

entry.title: RPC-Bench: A Fine-grained Benchmark for Research Paper Comprehension

author.name: Yelin Chen, Fanjin Zhang, Suping Sun, Yunhe Pang, Yuanchun Wang, Jian Song, Xiaoyan Li, Lei Hou, Shu Zhao, Jie Tang, Juanzi Li

entry.summary: Introduces RPC-Bench, a 15K QA benchmark for research paper comprehension built from review-rebuttal exchanges with fine-grained taxonomy aligned with scientific research flow.

entry.title: HELIOS: Hierarchical Graph Abstraction for Structure-Aware LLM Decompilation

author.name: Yonatan Gizachew Achamyeleh, Harsh Thomare, Mohammad Abdullah Al Faruque

entry.summary: HELIOS reframes LLM-based binary decompilation as structured reasoning by converting control flow graphs into hierarchical text representations. Addresses the limitation of LLMs treating code as plain text without understanding program structure.

entry.title: Automated Rubrics for Reliable Evaluation of Medical Dialogue Systems

author.name: Yinzhu Chen, Abdine Maiga, Hossein A. Rahmani, Emine Yilmaz

entry.summary: Automated rubric generation framework for evaluating medical dialogue systems using retrieval-augmented multi-agent LLMs, decomposing medical evidence into verifiable atomic facts.

entry.title: Evaluation of Large Language Models in Legal Applications: Challenges, Methods, and Future Directions

author.name: Yiran Hu, Huanghai Liu, Chong Wang, Kunran Li, Tien-Hsuan Wu, Haitao Li, Xinran Xu, Siqing Huo, Weihang Su, Ning Zheng, Siyuan Zheng, Qingyao Ai, Yun Liu, Renjun Bian, Yiqun Liu, Charles L. A. Clarke, Weixing Shen, Ben Kao

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on evaluating LLMs for legal applications, identifying key challenges in assessing legal reasoning, fairness, and reliability beyond surface-level accuracy. Addresses critical concerns for deploying LLMs in judicial decision support and legal services.

entry.title: Communication-efficient Federated Graph Classification via Generative Diffusion Modeling

author.name: Xiuling Wang, Xin Huang, Haibo Hu, Jianliang Xu

entry.summary: CeFGC uses generative diffusion models to enable federated GNN training with only three communication rounds between server and clients, addressing communication overhead and non-IID data.

entry.title: Non-Stationary Functional Bilevel Optimization

author.name: Jason Bohne, Ieva Petrulionyte, Michael Arbel, Julien Mairal, Pawe{\l} Polak

entry.summary: SmoothFBO is first algorithm for non-stationary functional bilevel optimization with theoretical guarantees. Uses time-smoothed stochastic hypergradient estimator for stable outer-loop updates.

entry.title: FlexLLM: Composable HLS Library for Flexible Hybrid LLM Accelerator Design

author.name: Jiahao Zhang, Zifan He, Nicholas Fraser, Michaela Blott, Yizhou Sun, Jason Cong

entry.summary: FlexLLM is a composable HLS library enabling rapid development of custom LLM accelerators. Built complete Llama-3.2 1B inference system in 2 months with 1K LOC, achieving 12.68 WikiText-2 perplexity.

entry.title: Can We Trust LLM Detectors?

author.name: Jivnesh Sandhan, Harshit Jaiswal, Fei Cheng, Yugo Murawaki

entry.summary: Systematically evaluates AI text detectors across training-free and supervised paradigms. Shows both are brittle under distribution shift; proposes supervised contrastive learning framework.

entry.title: AdversaRiskQA: An Adversarial Factuality Benchmark for High-Risk Domains

author.name: Adam Szelestey, Sofie van Engelen, Tianhao Huang, Justin Snelders, Qintao Zeng, Songgaojun Deng

entry.summary: AdversaRiskQA is benchmark for adversarial factuality in high-risk domains (medical, legal, financial). Tests model resistance to misinformation injected with varying confidence levels.

entry.title: Beyond Prompting: Efficient and Robust Contextual Biasing for Speech LLMs via Logit-Space Integration (LOGIC)

author.name: Peidong Wang

entry.summary: Introduces LOGIC (Logit-Space Integration) for contextual biasing in Speech LLMs to recognize domain-specific entities like contact names and technical jargon. Addresses scalability issues with prompting approaches that suffer from context window limitations.

entry.title: Controllable Layered Image Generation for Real-World Editing

author.name: Jinrui Yang, Qing Liu, Yijun Li, Mengwei Ren, Letian Zhang, Zhe Lin, Cihang Xie, Yuyin Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces LASAGNA, a unified framework generating images with compositing layers - photorealistic backgrounds and high-quality transparent foregrounds with visual effects like shadows and reflections.

entry.title: Assessing Situational and Spatial Awareness of VLMs with Synthetically Generated Video

author.name: Pascal Benschop, Justin Dauwels, Jan van Gemert

entry.summary: Introduces synthetic benchmark probing VLM situational and spatial awareness through minimal video pairs testing violence/benign distinction, role binding, and trajectory alignment. Results show near-chance performance.

entry.title: DSFedMed: Dual-Scale Federated Medical Image Segmentation via Mutual Distillation Between Foundation and Lightweight Models

author.name: Hanwen Zhang, Qiaojin Shen, Yuxi Liu, Yuesheng Zhu, Guibo Luo

entry.summary: Proposes DSFedMed, a dual-scale federated framework enabling mutual knowledge distillation between centralized foundation model and lightweight client models for medical image segmentation.

entry.title: A Universal Large Language Model -- Drone Command and Control Interface

author.name: Javier N. Ramos-Silva, Peter J. Burke

entry.summary: Proposes a universal interface between LLMs and drone command-and-control systems, enabling integration of LLM knowledge (maps, weather) with drone sensing and control.

entry.title: Layer-adaptive Expert Pruning for Pre-Training of Mixture-of-Experts Large Language Models

author.name: YuanLab. ai, Shawn Wu, Jiangang Luo, Tong Yu, Darcy Chen, Sean Wang, Xudong Zhao, Louie Li, Claire Wang, Hunter He, Carol Wang, Allen Wang

entry.summary: Introduces LAEP algorithm for layer-adaptive expert pruning during MoE LLM pre-training. Selectively prunes underutilized experts and reorganizes across devices based on token distribution.

entry.title: Case-Guided Sequential Assay Planning in Drug Discovery

author.name: Tianchi Chen, Jan Bima, Sean L. Wu, Otto Ritter, Bingjia Yang, Xiang Yu

entry.summary: Introduces Implicit Bayesian MDP for drug discovery assay planning where no environment simulator exists. Uses case-guided implicit transition dynamics from historical outcomes for Bayesian belief updating.

entry.title: Overcoming In-Memory Bottlenecks in Graph Foundation Models via Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Haonan Yuan, Qingyun Sun, Jiacheng Tao, Xingcheng Fu, Jianxin Li

entry.summary: RAG-GFM addresses in-memory bottlenecks of Graph Foundation Models by offloading knowledge to retrieval system with dual-modal retrieval module, improving scalability and interpretability.

entry.title: Beyond validation loss: Clinically-tailored optimization metrics improve a model's clinical performance

author.name: Charles B. Delahunt, Courosh Mehanian, Daniel E. Shea, Matthew P. Horning

entry.summary: Demonstrates that using clinically-tailored optimization metrics instead of validation loss improves model performance on actual clinical requirements. Advocates for non-differentiable metrics during hyperparameter optimization.

entry.title: Iterative Amortized Hierarchical VAE

author.name: Simon W. Penninga, Ruud J. G. van Sloun

entry.summary: Iterative Amortized Hierarchical VAE combines initial amortized inference with iterative refinement using decoder gradients. Achieves 35x speedup through linearly separable decoder in transform domain.

entry.title: GeMM-GAN: A Multimodal Generative Model Conditioned on Histopathology Images and Clinical Descriptions for Gene Expression Profile Generation

author.name: Francesca Pia Panaccione, Carlo Sgaravatti, Pietro Pinoli

entry.summary: GeMM-GAN generates realistic gene expression profiles from histopathology images and clinical metadata. Addresses privacy and cost barriers to gene expression data availability.

entry.title: PMPBench: A Paired Multi-Modal Pan-Cancer Benchmark for Medical Image Synthesis

author.name: Yifan Chen, Fei Yin, Hao Chen, Jia Wu, Chao Li

entry.summary: Introduces PMPBench, a paired multi-modal pan-cancer benchmark for medical image synthesis with properly paired contrast/non-contrast data across cancer types, addressing limitations of existing brain-focused datasets.

entry.title: Opening the Black Box: Preliminary Insights into Affective Modeling in Multimodal Foundation Models

author.name: Zhen Zhang, Runhao Zeng, Sicheng Zhao, Xiping Hu

entry.summary: Presents systematic mechanistic study of affective modeling in multimodal foundation models, analyzing how emotion-oriented supervision reshapes internal parameters. Finds affective adaptation focuses on FFN layers rather than attention.

entry.title: Emerging from Ground: Addressing Intent Deviation in Tool-Using Agents via Deriving Real Calls into Virtual Trajectories

author.name: Qian Xiong, Yuekai Huang, Bo Yang, Yujia Zheng, Tianhao Li, Ziyou Jiang, Zhiyuan Chang, Zhaoyang Li, Huanxiang Feng, Mingyang Li

entry.summary: Introduces RISE, a 'Real-to-Virtual' method for addressing intent deviation in tool-using agents by deriving virtual trajectories from real API calls, including negative samples for preference learning.

entry.title: TempViz: On the Evaluation of Temporal Knowledge in Text-to-Image Models

author.name: Carolin Holtermann, Nina Krebs, Anne Lauscher

entry.summary: TempViz is first dataset to holistically evaluate temporal knowledge in text-to-image models with 7.9k prompts across five temporal phenomena. Studies five T2I models' temporal reasoning capabilities.

entry.title: SoK: Challenges in Tabular Membership Inference Attacks

author.name: Cristina P\^era, T\^ania Carvalho, Maxime Cordy, Lu\'is Antunes

entry.summary: Systematization of knowledge on Membership Inference Attacks for tabular data in centralized and federated learning. Demonstrates attack efficacy and considers outsider adversaries in federated settings.

entry.title: Beat-ssl: Capturing Local ECG Morphology through Heartbeat-level Contrastive Learning with Soft Targets

author.name: Muhammad Ilham Rizqyawan, Peter Macfarlane, Stathis Hadjidemetriou, Fani Deligianni

entry.summary: Beat-SSL proposes contrastive learning for ECG with dual-context (rhythm and heartbeat level) learning using soft targets. Addresses limitations of existing CL methods that don't exploit ECG characteristics.

entry.title: Hybrid Vision Transformer_GAN Attribute Neutralizer for Mitigating Bias in Chest X_Ray Diagnosis

author.name: Jobeal Solomon, Ali Mohammed Mansoor Alsahag, Seyed Sahand Mohammadi Ziabari

entry.summary: Proposes hybrid Vision Transformer-GAN framework to mitigate sex- and age-related bias in chest X-ray classifiers by neutralizing demographic attributes while preserving diagnostic accuracy.

entry.title: DTP: A Simple yet Effective Distracting Token Pruning Framework for Vision-Language Action Models

author.name: Chenyang Li, Jieyuan Liu, Bin Li, Bo Gao, Yilin Yuan, Yangfan He, Yuchen Li, Jingqun Tang

entry.summary: Introduces DTP (Distracting Token Pruning), a plug-and-play framework for Vision-Language Action models that dynamically detects and prunes task-irrelevant image tokens to improve action generation.

entry.title: LLM-Assisted Automatic Dispatching Rule Design for Dynamic Flexible Assembly Flow Shop Scheduling

author.name: Junhao Qiu, Haoyang Zhuang, Fei Liu, Jianjun Liu, Qingfu Zhang

entry.summary: Develops an LLM-assisted framework for automatically designing dispatching rules for dynamic flexible assembly flow shop scheduling, overcoming limitations of genetic programming approaches.

entry.title: Real-Time Wildfire Localization on the NASA Autonomous Modular Sensor using Deep Learning

author.name: Yajvan Ravan, Aref Malek, Chester Dolph, Nikhil Behari

entry.summary: Introduces human-annotated dataset from NASA AMS using 12-channel aerial wildfire images from 20 missions, generating 4000+ images for wildfire detection model development.

entry.title: SpatialMem: Unified 3D Memory with Metric Anchoring and Fast Retrieval

author.name: Xinyi Zheng, Yunze Liu, Chi-Hao Wu, Fan Zhang, Hao Zheng, Wenqi Zhou, Walterio W. Mayol-Cuevas, Junxiao Shen

entry.summary: SpatialMem unifies 3D geometry, semantics, and language into queryable representation using structural anchors (walls, doors) with hierarchical object memory for navigation and object retrieval tasks.

entry.title: RDumb++: Drift-Aware Continual Test-Time Adaptation

author.name: Himanshu Mishra

entry.summary: RDumb++ extends continual test-time adaptation with drift detection mechanisms (entropy-based and KL-divergence) and adaptive reset strategies for handling rapid distribution shifts.

entry.title: USDs: A universal stabilizer decoder framework using symmetry

author.name: Hoshitaro Ohnishi, Hideo Mukai

entry.summary: Universal Stabilizer Decoder framework for quantum error correction using symmetry to address non-uniqueness between syndromes and error patterns. Generalizes prior toric code approach.

entry.title: VIOLA: Towards Video In-Context Learning with Minimal Annotations

author.name: Ryo Fujii, Hideo Saito, Ryo Hachiuma

entry.summary: Introduces VIOLA, a label-efficient framework for video in-context learning in MLLMs that combines minimal expert annotations with unlabeled data using density-uncertainty-weighted sampling.

entry.title: Towards Realistic Remote Sensing Dataset Distillation with Discriminative Prototype-guided Diffusion

author.name: Yonghao Xu, Pedram Ghamisi, Qihao Weng

entry.summary: Introduces dataset distillation to remote sensing for the first time, training text-to-image diffusion model to condense large datasets into compact representative sets with discriminative prototype guidance.

entry.title: Masked Modeling for Human Motion Recovery Under Occlusions

author.name: Zhiyin Qian, Siwei Zhang, Bharat Lal Bhatnagar, Federica Bogo, Siyu Tang

entry.summary: Presents MoRo, an occlusion-robust generative masked modeling framework for human motion reconstruction that formulates motion recovery as video-conditioned token sampling, enabling fast inference.

entry.title: VisTIRA: Closing the Image-Text Modality Gap in Visual Math Reasoning via Structured Tool Integration

author.name: Saeed Khaki, Ashudeep Singh, Nima Safaei, Kamal Ginotra

entry.summary: Introduces VisTIRA, a tool-integrated reasoning agent that addresses the 'modality gap' where VLMs perform worse on math problems presented as images vs text. Uses iterative decomposition into natural language rationales and executable Python.

entry.title: AutoDriDM: An Explainable Benchmark for Decision-Making of Vision-Language Models in Autonomous Driving

author.name: Zecong Tang, Zixu Wang, Yifei Wang, Weitong Lian, Tianjian Gao, Haoran Li, Tengju Ru, Lingyi Meng, Zhejun Cui, Yichen Zhu, Qi Kang, Kaixuan Wang, Yu Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces AutoDriDM, a decision-centric benchmark for VLMs in autonomous driving with 6,650 questions across Object, Scene, and Decision dimensions. Finds weak alignment between perception and decision-making capabilities.

entry.title: CityCube: Benchmarking Cross-view Spatial Reasoning on Vision-Language Models in Urban Environments

author.name: Haotian Xu, Yue Hu, Zhengqiu Zhu, Chen Gao, Ziyou Wang, Junreng Rao, Wenhao Lu, Weishi Li, Quanjun Yin, Yong Li

entry.summary: Introduces CityCube benchmark for cross-view spatial reasoning in VLMs in urban environments, integrating four viewpoint dynamics from vehicles, drones, and satellites with 5,022 annotated questions.

entry.title: How Worst-Case Are Adversarial Attacks? Linking Adversarial and Statistical Robustness

author.name: Giulio Rossolini

entry.summary: Introduces probabilistic metric linking adversarial and statistical robustness, parameterized by concentration factor interpolating between isotropic noise and adversarial direction.

entry.title: Beyond Error-Based Optimization: Experience-Driven Symbolic Regression with Goal-Conditioned Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jianwen Sun, Xinrui Li, Fuqing Li, Xiaoxuan Shen

entry.summary: EGRL-SR frames symbolic regression as experience-driven goal-conditioned RL rather than error minimization. Addresses the ambiguous search direction problem when many expressions have similar error values.

entry.title: Interoperable Architecture for Digital Identity Delegation for AI Agents with Blockchain Integration

author.name: David Ricardo Saavedra

entry.summary: Proposes unified framework for digital identity delegation enabling AI agents to exercise bounded, auditable authority across SSI and traditional identity systems with blockchain integration.

entry.title: Benchmarking Large Language Models for ABAP Code Generation: An Empirical Study on Iterative Improvement by Compiler Feedback

author.name: Stephan Wallraven, Tim K\"ohne, Hartmut Westenberger, Andreas Moser

entry.summary: Benchmarks LLMs on ABAP code generation with 180 tasks, showing powerful models achieve ~round 30% success with iterative compiler feedback improvement. First systematic ABAP code generation evaluation.

entry.title: Lattice: A Confidence-Gated Hybrid System for Uncertainty-Aware Sequential Prediction with Behavioral Archetypes

author.name: Lorian Bannis

entry.summary: Lattice is a hybrid prediction system using binary confidence gating to activate behavioral archetypes when confidence is high, falling back to baseline otherwise. Achieves strong improvements on recommendation benchmarks.

entry.title: Integrating Knowledge Distillation Methods: A Sequential Multi-Stage Framework

author.name: Yinxi Tian, Changwu Huang, Ke Tang, Xin Yao

entry.summary: SMSKD is a framework for sequentially integrating heterogeneous knowledge distillation methods. Uses frozen snapshots to prevent catastrophic forgetting between stages.

entry.title: On the Intrinsic Dimensions of Data in Kernel Learning

author.name: Rustem Takhanov

entry.summary: Analyzes intrinsic dimensions in kernel learning through canonical metric dimension and effective dimension from Kolmogorov n-widths. Studies relationship with integral operator eigenvalues.

entry.title: Bridging the Perception Gap: A Lightweight Coarse-to-Fine Architecture for Edge Audio Systems

author.name: Hengfan Zhang, Yueqian Lin, Hai Helen Li, Yiran Chen

entry.summary: CoFi-Agent is a hybrid architecture for edge Audio-LLMs that performs fast local perception and conditional cloud refinement only when uncertainty is detected. Balances depth and efficiency.

entry.title: On damage of interpolation to adversarial robustness in regression

author.name: Jingfu Peng, Yuhong Yang

entry.summary: Investigates adversarial robustness of interpolating estimators in regression. Shows interpolation may not escape suboptimal performance under X-attacks even when it achieves minimax rates for standard loss.

entry.title: Synthetic Augmentation in Imbalanced Learning: When It Helps, When It Hurts, and How Much to Add

author.name: Zhengchi Ma, Anru R. Zhang

entry.summary: Develops unified theoretical framework for synthetic augmentation in imbalanced learning. Shows when synthetic data helps vs hurts and provides guidance on quantity to generate.

entry.title: No Reliable Evidence of Self-Reported Sentience in Small Large Language Models

author.name: Caspar Kaiser, Sean Enderby
