entry.summary: Tests whether LLMs believe themselves sentient using internal activation classifiers across Qwen, Llama, and GPT-OSS families. Models consistently deny sentience; classifiers find no evidence of hidden contrary beliefs.

entry.title: Benchmarking LLMs for Pairwise Causal Discovery in Biomedical and Multi-Domain Contexts

author.name: Sydney Anuyah, Sneha Shajee-Mohan, Ankit-Singh Chauhan, Sunandan Chakraborty

entry.summary: Benchmarks 13 open-source LLMs on pairwise causal discovery across 12 datasets. Tests causal detection and extraction with various prompting methods, revealing major deficiencies.

entry.title: Common to Whom? Regional Cultural Commonsense and LLM Bias in India

author.name: Sangmitra Madhusudan, Trush Shashank More, Steph Buongiorno, Renata Dividino, Jad Kabbara, Ali Emami

entry.summary: Indica benchmark tests LLM cultural commonsense across 5 Indian regions with 515 questions. Only 39.4% of questions get agreement across all regions, showing cultural variance.

entry.title: Beyond Marginal Distributions: A Framework to Evaluate the Representativeness of Demographic-Aligned LLMs

author.name: Tristan Williams, Franziska Weeber, Sebastian Pad\'o, Alan Akbik

entry.summary: Proposes framework evaluating demographic-aligned LLMs through multivariate correlation patterns, not just marginal distributions. Compares persona prompting vs demographic fine-tuning.

entry.title: Do people expect different behavior from large language models acting on their behalf? Evidence from norm elicitations in two canonical economic games

author.name: Pawe{\l} Niszczota, Elia Antoniou

entry.summary: Studies whether people have different social expectations when LLMs make decisions on their behalf in economic games (Dictator Game, Ultimatum Game). Uses norm elicitation tasks to detect shifts in social appropriateness ratings for AI-delegated decisions.

entry.title: MiRAGE: A Multiagent Framework for Generating Multimodal Multihop Question-Answer Dataset for RAG Evaluation

author.name: Chandan Kumar Sahu, Premith Kumar Chilukuri, Matthew Hetrich

entry.summary: Introduces MiRAGE, a multi-agent framework that generates verified, multimodal, multi-hop QA datasets for RAG evaluation in specialized enterprise domains. Uses a swarm of specialized agents including recursive content analyzer and QA generators.

entry.title: Skywork UniPic 3.0: Unified Multi-Image Composition via Sequence Modeling

author.name: Hongyang Wei, Hongbo Liu, Zidong Wang, Yi Peng, Baixin Xu, Size Wu, Xuying Zhang, Xianglong He, Zexiang Liu, Peiyu Wang, Xuchen Song, Yangguang Li, Yang Liu, Yahui Zhou

entry.summary: Presents Skywork UniPic 3.0, a unified multimodal framework for multi-image composition focusing on Human-Object Interaction (HOI) tasks, integrating single-image editing, multi-image fusion, and video generation.

entry.title: LL-GaussianMap: Zero-shot Low-Light Image Enhancement via 2D Gaussian Splatting Guided Gain Maps

author.name: Yuhan Chen, Ying Fang, Guofa Li, Wenxuan Yu, Yicui Shi, Jingrui Zhang, Kefei Qian, Wenbo Chu, Keqiang Li

entry.summary: Proposes LL-GaussianMap, the first unsupervised framework incorporating 2D Gaussian Splatting for low-light image enhancement, leveraging explicit scene representation for structural fitting.

entry.title: PAINT: Pathology-Aware Integrated Next-Scale Transformation for Virtual Immunohistochemistry

author.name: Rongze Ma, Mengkang Lu, Zhenyu Xiang, Yongsheng Pan, Yicheng Wu, Qingjie Zeng, Yong Xia

entry.summary: Proposes PAINT, a visual autoregressive framework for virtual immunohistochemistry synthesis from H&E images with pathology-aware next-scale transformation addressing semantic inconsistencies.

entry.title: Ternary Spiking Neural Networks Enhanced by Complemented Neurons and Membrane Potential Aggregation

author.name: Boxuan Zhang, Jiaxin Wang, Zhen Xu, Kuan Tao

entry.summary: Introduces Complemented Ternary Spiking Neurons (CTSN) that address information loss and gradient vanishing in ternary spiking neural networks through a learnable complemental term and membrane potential aggregation.

entry.title: AION: Aerial Indoor Object-Goal Navigation Using Dual-Policy Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zichen Yan, Yuchen Hou, Shenao Wang, Yichao Gao, Rui Huang, Lin Zhao

entry.summary: AION proposes an end-to-end dual-policy RL framework for vision-based aerial object-goal navigation, decoupling exploration and goal-reaching behaviors without external localization.

entry.title: Pushing the limits of unconstrained machine-learned interatomic potentials

author.name: Filippo Bigi, Paolo Pegolo, Arslan Mazitov, Michele Ceriotti

entry.summary: Investigates scaling of unconstrained machine-learned interatomic potentials (MLIPs) that don't enforce physical symmetries exactly, finding they can match constrained models with sufficient scale.

entry.title: Quantum Super-resolution by Adaptive Non-local Observables

author.name: Hsin-Yi Lin, Huan-Hsin Tseng, Samuel Yen-Chi Chen, Shinjae Yoo

entry.summary: First study investigating quantum circuits for super-resolution, proposing VQCs with Adaptive Non-Local Observable measurements that allow trainable multi-qubit Hermitian observables.

entry.title: Training-Efficient Text-to-Music Generation with State-Space Modeling

author.name: Wei-Jaw Lee, Fang-Chih Hsieh, Xuanjun Chen, Fang-Duo Tsai, Yi-Hsuan Yang

entry.summary: Explores state-space models as efficient backbone for text-to-music generation, comparing SSM variants and SSM/diffusion hybrids at 300M parameter scale matching MusicGen-small.

entry.title: BREPS: Bounding-Box Robustness Evaluation of Promptable Segmentation

author.name: Andrey Moskalenko, Danil Kuznetsov, Irina Dudko, Anastasiia Iasakova, Nikita Boldyrev, Denis Shepelev, Andrei Spiridonov, Andrey Kuznetsov, Vlad Shakhuro

entry.summary: BREPS evaluates robustness of promptable segmentation models like SAM to natural bounding box variations through controlled user study with thousands of real annotations.

entry.title: Neural Nonlinear Shrinkage of Covariance Matrices for Minimum Variance Portfolio Optimization

author.name: Liusha Yang, Siqi Zhao, Shuqi Chai

entry.summary: Neural network-based nonlinear shrinkage estimator for covariance matrices in portfolio optimization. Uses transformer to learn eigenvalue shrinkage function with portfolio risk as loss.

entry.title: Partially Lazy Gradient Descent for Smoothed Online Learning

author.name: Naram Mhaisen, George Iosifidis

entry.summary: k-lazyGD bridges greedy OGD and lazy GD for smoothed online convex optimization. Proves optimal dynamic regret can be achieved with laziness up to certain bounds related to comparator path length.

entry.title: Seeing through Light and Darkness: Sensor-Physics Grounded Deblurring HDR NeRF from Single-Exposure Images and Events

author.name: Yunshan Qi, Lin Zhu, Nan Bao, Yifan Zhao, Jia Li

entry.summary: Proposes unified NeRF framework for sharp HDR novel view synthesis from single-exposure blurry LDR images and events, modeling sensor-physics mismatches between camera output and physical radiance.

entry.title: A Multi-View Pipeline and Benchmark Dataset for 3D Hand Pose Estimation in Surgery

author.name: Valery Fischer, Alan Magdaleno, Anna-Katharina Calek, Nicola Cavalcanti, Nathan Hoffman, Christoph Germann, Joschua W\"uthrich, Max Kr\"ahenmann, Mazda Farshad, Philipp F\"urnstahl, Lilian Calvet

entry.summary: Proposes robust multi-view pipeline for 3D hand pose estimation in surgical settings using off-the-shelf pretrained models without domain-specific fine-tuning, along with new benchmark dataset.

entry.title: If You Want Coherence, Orchestrate a Team of Rivals: Multi-Agent Models of Organizational Intelligence

author.name: Gopal Vijayaraghavan, Prasanth Jayachandran, Arun Murthy, Sunil Govindan, Vivek Subramanian

entry.summary: Proposes multi-agent models using teams of independent AI agents with strict role boundaries and opposing incentives (team of rivals) to catch and minimize errors.

entry.title: AQAScore: Evaluating Semantic Alignment in Text-to-Audio Generation via Audio Question Answering

author.name: Chun-Yi Kuan, Kai-Wei Chang, Hung-yi Lee

entry.summary: AQAScore evaluates text-to-audio generation by computing log-probability of 'Yes' answers to semantic verification questions using audio-aware LLMs. Backbone-agnostic and captures compositional reasoning limitations.

entry.title: InstructTime++: Time Series Classification with Multimodal Language Modeling via Implicit Feature Enhancement

author.name: Mingyue Cheng, Xiaoyu Tao, Huajian Zhang, Qi Liu, Enhong Chen

entry.summary: InstructTime++ reformulates time series classification as multimodal generative task, treating sequences, text features, and instructions as multimodal inputs with class labels as text outputs.

entry.title: V-CAGE: Context-Aware Generation and Verification for Scalable Long-Horizon Embodied Tasks

author.name: Yaru Liu, Ao-bo Wang, Nanyang Ye

entry.summary: V-CAGE framework generates robust manipulation datasets with context-aware scene instantiation preventing object interpenetration and ensuring semantically aligned training data for embodied AI.

entry.title: Closing the Gap on the Sample Complexity of 1-Identification

author.name: Zitian Li, Wang Chi Cheung

entry.summary: Provides new lower bound for 1-identification in multi-armed bandits using optimization formulation, and designs algorithm with tight upper bounds closing the gap to logarithmic factors.

entry.title: An Explainable Market Integrity Monitoring System with Multi-Source Attention Signals and Transparent Scoring

author.name: Sandeep Neela

entry.summary: AIMM-X is an explainable market monitoring system combining microstructure signals with public attention proxies. Uses transparent thresholding and additive score decomposition for interpretable flagging.

entry.title: Rethinking Composed Image Retrieval Evaluation: A Fine-Grained Benchmark from Image Editing

author.name: Tingyu Song, Yanzhao Zhang, Mingxin Li, Zhuoning Guo, Dingkun Long, Pengjun Xie, Siyue Zhang, Yilun Zhao, Shu Wu

entry.summary: Introduces EDIR, a fine-grained Composed Image Retrieval benchmark using image editing for precise control over modification types. Contains 5,000 queries across 5 main categories, revealing significant capability gaps in state-of-the-art models.

entry.title: Sub-Region-Aware Modality Fusion and Adaptive Prompting for Multi-Modal Brain Tumor Segmentation

author.name: Shadi Alijani, Fereshteh Aghaee Meibodi, Homayoun Najjaran

entry.summary: Introduces framework for multi-modal brain tumor segmentation with sub-region-aware modality attention learning optimal modality combinations and adaptive prompt engineering leveraging foundation models.

entry.title: LL-GaussianImage: Efficient Image Representation for Zero-shot Low-Light Enhancement with 2D Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Yuhan Chen, Wenxuan Yu, Guofa Li, Yijun Xu, Ying Fang, Yicui Shi, Long Cao, Wenbo Chu, Keqiang Li

entry.summary: Proposes LL-GaussianImage for zero-shot low-light enhancement directly in 2DGS compressed representation domain, avoiding decompression-enhancement-recompression pipeline with semantic-guided MoE.

entry.title: NeuroMamba: Multi-Perspective Feature Interaction with Visual Mamba for Neuron Segmentation

author.name: Liuyun Jiang, Yizhuo Lu, Yanchao Zhang, Jiazheng Liu, Hua Han

entry.summary: Proposes NeuroMamba, combining Mamba's linear complexity for patch-free global modeling with complementary local feature modeling for neuron segmentation in electron microscopy.

entry.title: CI4A: Semantic Component Interfaces for Agents Empowering Web Automation

author.name: Zhi Qiu, Jiazheng Sun, Chenxiao Xia, Jun Zheng, Xin Peng

entry.summary: Introduces CI4A, semantic component interfaces for web agents that abstract complex UI interaction logic into unified tool primitives. Implemented within Ant Design framework.

entry.title: DeepInflation: an AI agent for research and model discovery of inflation

author.name: Ze-Yu Peng, Hao-Shi Yuan, Qi Lai, Jun-Qian Jiang, Gen Ye, Jun Zhang, Yun-Song Piao

entry.summary: Introduces DeepInflation, an AI agent for inflationary cosmology research combining LLMs with symbolic regression and RAG to discover viable single-field slow-roll potentials consistent with observations.

entry.title: XD-MAP: Cross-Modal Domain Adaptation using Semantic Parametric Mapping

author.name: Frank Bieder, Hendrik K\"onigshof, Haohao Hu, Fabian Immel, Yinzhe Shen, Jan-Hendrik Pauls, Christoph Stiller

entry.summary: Proposes XD-MAP for cross-modal domain adaptation from image datasets to LiDAR by creating semantic parametric maps from camera detections to generate pseudo-labels.

entry.title: Optimality of Staircase Mechanisms for Vector Queries under Differential Privacy

author.name: James Melbourne, Mario Diaz, Shahab Asoodeh

entry.summary: Proves that staircase distributions are optimal for differential privacy mechanisms on vector queries under any norm-monotone cost function. Uses convex rearrangement theory to reduce the infinite-dimensional optimization to a tractable one-dimensional problem.

entry.title: RECAP: Resistance Capture in Text-based Mental Health Counseling with Large Language Models

author.name: Anqi Li, Yuqian Chen, Yu Lu, Zhaoming Chen, Yuan Xie, Zhenzhong Lan

entry.summary: RECAP captures client resistance in text-based mental health counseling using fine-grained PsyFIRE framework with 13 resistance behaviors. Creates annotated corpus from real Chinese counseling sessions.

entry.title: Federated Transformer-GNN for Privacy-Preserving Brain Tumor Localization with Modality-Level Explainability

author.name: Andrea Protani, Riccardo Taiello, Marc Molina Van Den Bosch, Luigi Serio

entry.summary: Federated learning framework for brain tumor localization using Transformer-GNN hybrid, deployed on CERN's healthcare federated platform with modality-level explainability through attention analysis.

entry.title: Many Experiments, Few Repetitions, Unpaired Data, and Sparse Effects: Is Causal Inference Possible?

author.name: Felix Schur, Niklas Pfister, Peng Ding, Sach Mukherjee, Jonas Peters

entry.summary: Addresses causal effect estimation with many experiments but few observations per experiment and unpaired data. Proposes GMM-type estimator with cross-fold splitting that remains consistent as experiment count grows.

entry.title: Machine learning-enhanced non-amnestic Alzheimer's disease diagnosis from MRI and clinical features

author.name: Megan A. Witherow, Michael L. Evans, Ahmed Temtam, Hamid Okhravi, Khan M. Iftekharuddin

entry.summary: ML approach to diagnose atypical (non-amnestic) Alzheimer's disease using MRI and clinical features, addressing the challenge that atypical AD is often misdiagnosed.

entry.title: CLASP: An online learning algorithm for Convex Losses And Squared Penalties

author.name: Ricardo N. Ferreira, Cl\'audia Soares, Jo\~ao Xavier

entry.summary: CLASP algorithm for constrained online convex optimization achieves sublinear regret and cumulative squared penalty. Uses firm non-expansiveness of convex projectors in novel proof strategy.

entry.title: Logic Programming on Knowledge Graph Networks And its Application in Medical Domain

author.name: Chuanqing Wang, Zhenmin Zhao, Shanshan Du, Chaoqun Fei, Songmao Zhang, Ruqian Lu

entry.summary: Develops systematic theory and techniques for logic programming on knowledge graphs with application to medicine. Addresses cooperation and competition between multiple knowledge graphs.

entry.title: AgentSM: Semantic Memory for Agentic Text-to-SQL

author.name: Asim Biswal, Chuan Lei, Xiao Qin, Aodong Li, Balakrishnan Narayanaswamy, Tim Kraska

entry.summary: AgentSM introduces semantic memory for agentic Text-to-SQL, building interpretable knowledge structures instead of raw scratchpads. Addresses enterprise challenges with large schemas and diverse SQL dialects.

entry.title: PUMA: Perception-driven Unified Foothold Prior for Mobility Augmented Quadruped Parkour

author.name: Liang Wang, Kanzhong Yao, Yang Liu, Weikai Qin, Jun Wu, Zhe Sun, Qiuguo Zhu

entry.summary: PUMA enables quadruped parkour through perception-driven foothold priors integrated into end-to-end RL. Single-stage training leverages terrain features for egocentric foothold estimation.

entry.title: Beyond Predictive Uncertainty: Reliable Representation Learning with Structural Constraints

author.name: Yiyao Yang

entry.summary: Argues reliability should be a first-class property of learned representations, not just predictions. Proposes uncertainty-aware regularization with structural constraints in representation space.

entry.title: What Patients Really Ask: Exploring the Effect of False Assumptions in Patient Information Seeking

author.name: Raymond Xiong, Furong Jia, Lionel Wong, Monica Agrawal

entry.summary: Studies patient questions from Google's People Also Ask for top 200 US medications. Finds considerable portion contains incorrect assumptions and dangerous intentions.

entry.title: Dancing in Chains: Strategic Persuasion in Academic Rebuttal via Theory of Mind

author.name: Zhitao He, Zongwei Lyu, Yi R Fung

entry.summary: RebuttalAgent grounds academic rebuttal in Theory of Mind via ToM-Strategy-Response pipeline. Models reviewer mental states to generate strategic persuasive responses.

entry.title: Hallucination Mitigating for Medical Report Generation

author.name: Ruoqing Zhao, Runze Xia, Piji Li

entry.summary: KERM framework for medical report generation uses MedCLIP retrieval and fine-grained reinforced rewards to reduce hallucinations in LVLMs.

entry.title: HumanLLM: Towards Personalized Understanding and Simulation of Human Nature

author.name: Yuxuan Lei, Tianfu Wang, Jianxun Lian, Zhengyu Hu, Defu Lian, Xing Xie

entry.summary: HumanLLM framework addresses misalignment between LLM pretraining and individual human cognition/behavior. Aims to enable personalized understanding and social simulation.

entry.title: Mecellem Models: Turkish Models Trained from Scratch and Continually Pre-trained for the Legal Domain

author.name: \"Ozg\"ur U\u{g}ur, Mahmut G\"oksu, Mahmut \c{C}imen, Musa Y{\i}lmaz, Esra \c{S}avirdi, Alp Talha Demir, Rumeysa G\"ull\"uce, \.Iclal \c{C}etin, \"Omer Can Sa\u{g}ba\c{s}

entry.summary: Mecellem models are Turkish legal domain LLMs trained from scratch and continually pre-trained. Implements checkpoint selection based on retrieval performance, finding optimal before minimum loss.

entry.title: Improving Training Efficiency and Reducing Maintenance Costs via Language Specific Model Merging

author.name: Alphaeus Dmonte, Vidhi Gupta, Daniel J Perry, Mark Arehart

entry.summary: Studies language-specific model merging for multilingual LLMs, showing significant efficiency gains without quality loss. First focused analysis from efficiency perspective across three tasks.

entry.title: LLM or Human? Perceptions of Trust and Information Quality in Research Summaries

author.name: Nil-Jana Akpinar, Sandeep Avula, CJ Lee, Brandon Dang, Kaza Razat, Vanessa Murdock

entry.summary: Mixed-methods survey examining whether ML experts can distinguish human vs LLM-generated abstracts and how perceived LLM involvement affects quality/trustworthiness judgments. Finds participants struggle to reliably identify LLM-generated content.

entry.title: DevPrompt: Deviation-Based Prompt Learning for One-Normal ShotImage Anomaly Detection

author.name: Morteza Poudineh, Marc Lalonde

entry.summary: Proposes DevPrompt, a deviation-guided prompt learning framework for few-normal shot anomaly detection, integrating vision-language models with deviation-based scoring for improved patch-level anomaly detection.

entry.title: Evolving Without Ending: Unifying Multimodal Incremental Learning for Continual Panoptic Perception

author.name: Bo Yuan, Danpei Zhao, Wentao Li, Tian Li, Zhiguo Jiang

entry.summary: Extends continual learning to continual panoptic perception (CPP), integrating multimodal and multi-task continual learning for comprehensive image perception across pixel, instance, and image levels.

entry.title: ProGiDiff: Prompt-Guided Diffusion-Based Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Yuan Lin, Murong Xu, Marc H\"olle, Chinmay Prabhakar, Andreas Maier, Vasileios Belagiannis, Bjoern Menze, Suprosanna Shit

entry.summary: Proposes ProGiDiff, leveraging existing text-to-image diffusion models for medical image segmentation through ControlNet-style prompt guidance and noise injection, enabling natural language conditioning.

entry.title: The Paradigm Shift: A Comprehensive Survey on Large Vision Language Models for Multimodal Fake News Detection

author.name: Wei Ai, Yilong Tan, Yuntao Shou, Tao Meng, Haowen Chen, Zhixiong He, Keqin Li

entry.summary: A comprehensive survey on how large vision-language models (LVLMs) are transforming multimodal fake news detection, moving from traditional feature engineering to end-to-end reasoning frameworks. Reviews progress and remaining challenges.

entry.title: Distillation-based Layer Dropping (DLD) Effective End-to-end Framework for Dynamic Speech Networks

author.name: Abdul Hannan, Daniele Falavigna, Shah Nawaz, Mubashir Noman, Markus Schedl, Alessio Brutti

entry.summary: Proposes Distillation-based Layer Dropping (DLD) to create dynamic speech networks for edge devices, combining knowledge distillation with layer dropping for better performance-computation trade-offs.

entry.title: A Mobile Magnetic Manipulation Platform for Gastrointestinal Navigation with Deep Reinforcement Learning Control

author.name: Zhifan Yan, Chang Liu, Yiyang Jiang, Wenxuan Zheng, Xinhao Chen, Axel Krieger

entry.summary: Presents a mobile magnetic manipulation platform for GI tract drug delivery using deep reinforcement learning control, overcoming the model-calibration bottleneck of traditional approaches.

entry.title: AI #152: Brought To You By The Torment Nexus

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Zvi's weekly AI news roundup covering Anthropic's new constitution, Demis Hassabis comments on coordinated pauses, Claude Code developments, and ChatGPT ad plans.

entry.title: Tokenomics: Quantifying Where Tokens Are Used in Agentic Software Engineering

author.name: Mohamad Salim, Jasmine Latendresse, SayedHassan Khatoonabadi, Emad Shihab

entry.summary: Analyzes token consumption patterns in LLM-MA systems across SDLC, mapping ChatDev phases to software engineering activities. Provides quantitative understanding of agent resource usage.

entry.title: Scaling Ambiguity: Augmenting Human Annotation in Speech Emotion Recognition with Audio-Language Models

author.name: Wenda Zhang, Hongyu Jin, Siyi Wang, Zhiqiang Wei, Ting Dang

entry.summary: Proposes using Large Audio-Language Models to generate synthetic annotations for speech emotion recognition, addressing the bottleneck of sparse human annotations. Creates Synthetic Perceptual Proxies to improve ground-truth distribution reliability.

entry.title: Vision-Language Models on the Edge for Real-Time Robotic Perception

author.name: Sarat Ahmad, Maryam Hafeez, Syed Ali Raza Zaidi

entry.summary: Evaluates VLM deployment on edge infrastructure for robotic perception, comparing LLaMA-3.2-Vision at edge vs cloud using WebRTC streaming from Unitree G1 humanoid robot.

entry.title: Incentive-Tuning: Understanding and Designing Incentives for Empirical Human-AI Decision-Making Studies

author.name: Simran Kaur, Sara Salimzadeh, Ujwal Gadiraju

entry.summary: Investigates incentive design for human-AI decision-making studies on crowdsourcing platforms, providing guidance for researchers on how incentives affect participant behaviors and study validity.

entry.title: Uncertainty-guided Generation of Dark-field Radiographs

author.name: Lina Felsner, Henriette Bast, Tina Dorosti, Florian Schaff, Franz Pfeiffer, Daniela Pfeiffer, Julia Schnabel

entry.summary: Framework for generating dark-field radiograph images from standard X-rays using uncertainty-guided progressive GAN. Incorporates both aleatoric and epistemic uncertainty.

entry.title: DeltaDorsal: Enhancing Hand Pose Estimation with Dorsal Features in Egocentric Views

author.name: William Huang, Siyou Pei, Leyi Zou, Eric J. Gonzalez, Ishan Chatterjee, Yang Zhang

entry.summary: DeltaDorsal leverages dorsal hand skin deformation for egocentric hand pose estimation using dual-stream delta encoder. Reduces error by 18% in self-occluded scenarios.

entry.title: DuFal: Dual-Frequency-Aware Learning for High-Fidelity Extremely Sparse-view CBCT Reconstruction

author.name: Cuong Tran Van, Trong-Thang Pham, Ngoc-Son Nguyen, Duy Minh Ho Nguyen, Ngan Le

entry.summary: Presents DuFal, a dual-frequency-aware learning framework for sparse-view CBCT reconstruction using a High-Local Factorized Fourier Neural Operator with complementary branches for high-frequency recovery.

entry.title: SuperOcc: Toward Cohesive Temporal Modeling for Superquadric-based Occupancy Prediction

author.name: Zichen Yu, Quanli Liu, Wei Wang, Liyong Zhang, Xiaoguang Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes SuperOcc for autonomous driving occupancy prediction using superquadric representations, addressing temporal modeling limitations, query sparsity tradeoffs, and splatting efficiency.

entry.title: ThermoSplat: Cross-Modal 3D Gaussian Splatting with Feature Modulation and Geometry Decoupling

author.name: Zhaoqi Su, Shihai Chen, Xinyan Lin, Liqin Huang, Zhipeng Su, Xiaoqiang Lu

entry.summary: Proposes ThermoSplat for cross-modal 3D reconstruction integrating RGB and thermal infrared data through feature modulation and geometry decoupling in 3DGS framework.

entry.title: Agentic AI Meets Edge Computing in Autonomous UAV Swarms

author.name: Thuan Minh Nguyen, Vu Tuan Truong, Long Bao Le

entry.summary: Investigates integration of LLM-based agentic AI with edge computing for UAV swarms, discussing three deployment architectures for scalable and resilient autonomy.

entry.title: IntelliSA: An Intelligent Static Analyzer for IaC Security Smell Detection Using Symbolic Rules and Neural Inference

author.name: Qiyue Mei, Michael Fu

entry.summary: Proposes IntelliSA combining symbolic rules with neural inference for IaC security smell detection, addressing over-approximation issues in rule-based detection alone.

entry.title: Visual and Cognitive Demands of a Large Language Model-Powered In-vehicle Conversational Agent

author.name: Chris Monk, Allegra Ayala, Christine S. P. Yu, Gregory M. Fitch, Dara Gruber

entry.summary: Studies visual and cognitive demands of Gemini Live conversational agent during driving, comparing to phone calls and baseline tasks. Finds LLM interactions impose significant cognitive load measured via Detection Response Task.

entry.title: Feasibility Preservation under Monotone Retrieval Truncation

author.name: Sean Plummer

entry.summary: Formalizes retrieval as feasibility problem under truncation, proving monotone truncation guarantees finite witnessability for individual queries and characterizing conditions for query classes.

entry.title: Deep Learning for Perishable Inventory Systems with Human Knowledge

author.name: Xuan Liao, Zhenkang Peng, Ying Rong

entry.summary: Deep learning approach for perishable inventory management with unknown demand and lead time distributions. Uses marginal cost accounting for end-to-end learning with limited historical data.

entry.title: Variable Splitting Binary Tree Models Based on Bayesian Context Tree Models for Time Series Segmentation

author.name: Yuta Nakahara, Shota Saito, Kohei Horinouchi, Koshi Shimada, Naoki Ichijo, Manabu Kobayashi, Toshiyasu Matsushima

entry.summary: Variable splitting binary tree model based on Bayesian context trees for time series segmentation. Uses recursive logistic regression to represent arbitrary split positions.

entry.title: A Case for Hypergraphs to Model and Map SNNs on Neuromorphic Hardware

author.name: Marco Ronzani, Cristina Silvano

entry.summary: Proposes using hypergraphs instead of graphs to model spiking neural networks for mapping to neuromorphic hardware, reducing problem complexity as networks scale.

entry.title: An XAI View on Explainable ASP: Methods, Systems, and Perspectives

author.name: Thomas Eiter, Tobias Geibinger, Zeynep G. Saribatur

entry.summary: Survey on explainable AI methods for Answer Set Programming, providing XAI-perspective overview of explanation types and identifying gaps in current ASP explanation approaches.

entry.title: The Plausibility Trap: Using Probabilistic Engines for Deterministic Tasks

author.name: Ivan Carrera, Daniel Maldonado-Ruiz

entry.summary: Defines 'Plausibility Trap' where users deploy expensive LLMs for simple deterministic tasks. Quantifies ~6.5x latency penalty and proposes Deterministic-Probabilistic Decision Matrix framework.

entry.title: DiSPA: Differential Substructure-Pathway Attention for Drug Response Prediction

author.name: Yewon Han, Sunghyun Kim, Eunyi Jeong, Sungkyung Lee, Seokwoo Yun, Sangsoo Lim

entry.summary: Proposes DiSPA for drug response prediction using differential attention to disentangle structure-driven and context-driven mechanisms through bidirectional conditioning.

entry.title: Communication-Efficient Federated Risk Difference Estimation for Time-to-Event Clinical Outcomes

author.name: Ziwen Wang, Siqi Li, Marcus Eng Hock Ong, Nan Liu

entry.summary: FedRD enables federated risk difference estimation for survival analysis with minimal communication (1-3 rounds) without requiring persistent server connections. Designed for privacy-preserving medical research across hospitals.

entry.title: When Text-as-Vision Meets Semantic IDs in Generative Recommendation: An Empirical Study

author.name: Shutong Qiao, Wei Yuan, Tong Chen, Xiangyu Zhao, Quoc Viet Hung Nguyen, Hongzhi Yin

entry.summary: Investigates how semantic ID learning in generative recommendation handles symbolic, attribute-centric item descriptions that fragment poorly under standard text encoders. Proposes text-as-vision approach for better multimodal alignment.

entry.title: GAT-NeRF: Geometry-Aware-Transformer Enhanced Neural Radiance Fields for High-Fidelity 4D Facial Avatars

author.name: Zhe Chang, Haodong Jin, Ying Sun, Yan Song, Hui Yu

entry.summary: GAT-NeRF integrates Transformer attention into NeRF pipeline for high-fidelity 4D facial avatar reconstruction from monocular video, improving capture of high-frequency details like wrinkles.

entry.title: Differential Privacy Image Generation with Reconstruction Loss and Noise Injection Using an Error Feedback SGD

author.name: Qiwei Ma, Jun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes differential privacy image generation using Error Feedback SGD with reconstruction loss and noise injection, improving quality-privacy trade-off over existing methods.

entry.title: Attention-Informed Surrogates for Navigating Power-Performance Trade-offs in HPC

author.name: Ashna Nawar Ahmed, Banooqa Banday, Terry Jones, Tanzima Z. Islam

entry.summary: Proposes attention-based embeddings of HPC job telemetry for multi-objective Bayesian optimization to balance runtime and power consumption in job scheduling.

entry.title: Explainable AI to Improve Machine Learning Reliability for Industrial Cyber-Physical Systems

author.name: Annemarie Jutte, Uraz Odyurt

entry.summary: Applies Explainable AI (SHAP) to analyze ML models for industrial cyber-physical systems. Uses time-series decomposition to understand model predictions and improve reliability.

entry.title: Performance-guided Reinforced Active Learning for Object Detection

author.name: Zhixuan Liang, Xingyu Zeng, Rui Zhao, Ping Luo

entry.summary: MGRAL uses reinforcement learning to select informative samples for object detection active learning, guided by expected mAP changes rather than data distribution heuristics.

entry.title: ICON: Invariant Counterfactual Optimization with Neuro-Symbolic Priors for Text-Based Person Search

author.name: Xiangyu Wang, Zhixin Lv, Yongjiao Sun, Anrui Han, Ye Yuan, Hangxu Ji

entry.summary: ICON integrates causal and topological priors for text-based person search. Uses Rule-Guided Spatial Intervention and counterfactual optimization to handle distribution shifts.

entry.title: AfriEconQA: A Benchmark Dataset for African Economic Analysis based on World Bank Reports

author.name: Edward Ajayi

entry.summary: AfriEconQA is a benchmark for African economic analysis using 236 World Bank reports with 8,937 QA instances requiring numerical reasoning and temporal disambiguation.

entry.title: Domain-Specific Knowledge Graphs in RAG-Enhanced Healthcare LLMs

author.name: Sydney Anuyah, Mehedi Mahmud Kaushik, Hao Dai, Rakesh Shiradkar, Arjan Durresi, Sunandan Chakraborty

entry.summary: Evaluates knowledge graphs for healthcare RAG using three PubMed-derived graphs (T2DM, Alzheimer's, combined). Tests 7 LLMs across retrieval sources and temperatures.

entry.title: From Generation to Collaboration: Using LLMs to Edit for Empathy in Healthcare

author.name: Man Luo, Bahareh Harandizadeh, Amara Tariq, Halim Abbas, Umar Ghaffar, Christopher J Warren, Segun O. Kolade, Haidar M. Abdul-Muhsin

entry.summary: Studies LLMs as empathy editors for physician responses. Introduces Empathy Ranking Score and MedFactChecking Score showing LLM editing increases empathy while preserving facts.

entry.title: Persona Switch: Mixing Distinct Perspectives in Decoding Time

author.name: Junseok Kim, Nakyeong Yang, Kyomin Jung

entry.summary: Persona Switch dynamically combines zero-shot and role-play prompting at each decoding step based on logit gap confidence. Addresses inconsistency in role-play improvements.

entry.title: SteerEval: Inference-time Interventions Strengthen Multilingual Generalization in Neural Summarization Metrics

author.name: Silvia Casola, Ryan Soh-Eun Shim, Felicia K\"orner, Yuchen Mao, Barbara Plank

entry.summary: SteerEval uses inference-time activation steering toward English pivot to improve multilingual summarization metrics. Finds encoder- and decoder-based metrics benefit from steering.

entry.title: Transfer Learning from ImageNet for MEG-Based Decoding of Imagined Speech

author.name: Soufiane Jhilal, St\'ephanie Martin, Anne-Lise Giraud

entry.summary: Uses ImageNet-pretrained vision models for MEG-based imagined speech decoding. Transforms MEG signals to time-frequency images, achieving 90.4% accuracy for imagery vs silence.

entry.title: DeepSurvey-Bench: Evaluating Academic Value of Automatically Generated Scientific Survey

author.name: Guo-Biao Zhang, Ding-Yuan Liu, Da-Yi Wu, Tian Lan, Heyan Huang, Zhijing Wu, Xian-Ling Mao

entry.summary: Introduces DeepSurvey-Bench, a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating AI-generated scientific surveys, addressing limitations in existing evaluation methods that rely on flawed selection criteria and surface-level metrics. The benchmark includes academic dimension annotations for reliable ground truth.

entry.title: Evaluating Multimodal Large Language Models for Heterogeneous Face Recognition

author.name: Hatef Otroshi Shahreza, Anjith George, S\'ebastien Marcel

entry.summary: Systematic evaluation of state-of-the-art MLLMs for heterogeneous face recognition across visual, NIR, SWIR, and thermal modalities. Benchmarks multiple open-source MLLMs on cross-modality face recognition scenarios.

entry.title: Breaking the Resolution Barrier: Arbitrary-resolution Deep Image Steganography Framework

author.name: Xinjue Hu, Chi Wang, Boyu Wang, Xiang Zhang, Zhenshan Tan, Zhangjie Fu

entry.summary: Proposes ARDIS, the first arbitrary resolution deep image steganography framework enabling hiding and revealing secret images at different resolutions than cover images without resolution mismatch degradation.

entry.title: Keyframe-Based Feed-Forward Visual Odometry

author.name: Weichen Dai, Wenhan Su, Da Kong, Yuhang Ming, Wanzeng Kong

entry.summary: Proposes keyframe-based feed-forward visual odometry integrating traditional keyframe selection with foundation model-based pose estimation, using latent representation divergence for frame selection.

entry.title: Phi-SegNet: Phase-Integrated Supervision for Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Shams Nafisa Ali, Taufiq Hasan

entry.summary: Phi-SegNet incorporates frequency-domain (phase) information into medical image segmentation supervision, addressing limitations of purely spatial encoding in existing architectures.

entry.title: Claude's Constitution is an excellent guide for humans, too

author.name: Eye You

entry.summary: Commentary on Anthropic's newly released Claude Constitution, arguing it provides excellent guidance for human ethics and highlighting key excerpts applicable to personal conduct.

entry.title: GPU-accelerated simulated annealing based on p-bits with real-world device-variability modeling

author.name: Naoya Onizawa, Takahiro Hanyu

entry.summary: Reveals that device variability in p-bit implementations can enhance rather than degrade simulated annealing performance, particularly through timing variability. Provides open-source GPU framework.

entry.title: FunCineForge: A Unified Dataset Toolkit and Model for Zero-Shot Movie Dubbing in Diverse Cinematic Scenes

author.name: Jiaxuan Liu, Yang Xiang, Han Zhao, Xiangang Li, Zhenhua Ling

entry.summary: FunCineForge provides unified dataset toolkit and model for zero-shot movie dubbing, addressing limitations of existing datasets in scale, annotation quality, and scene diversity.

entry.title: HumanDiffusion: A Vision-Based Diffusion Trajectory Planner with Human-Conditioned Goals for Search and Rescue UAV

author.name: Faryal Batool, Iana Zhura, Valerii Serpiva, Roohan Ahmed Khan, Ivan Valuev, Issatay Tokmurziyev, Dzmitry Tsetserukou

entry.summary: HumanDiffusion combines YOLO-based human detection with diffusion trajectory planning for search and rescue UAVs, generating human-aware navigation directly from RGB imagery.

entry.title: Deaf and Hard of Hearing Access to Intelligent Personal Assistants: Comparison of Voice-Based Options with an LLM-Powered Touch Interface

author.name: Paige S. DeVries, Michaela Okosi, Ming Li, Nora Dunphy, Gidey Gezae, Dante Conway, Abraham Glasser, Raja Kushalnagar, Christian Vogler

entry.summary: Compares voice-based IPA accessibility for deaf/hard of hearing users against LLM-powered touch interface, finding touch method with task prompter provides better usability than ASR-dependent approaches.

entry.title: An Empirical Study on Ensemble-Based Transfer Learning Bayesian Optimisation with Mixed Variable Types

author.name: Natasha Trinkle, Huong Ha, Jeffrey Chan

entry.summary: Empirical study of ensemble-based transfer learning for Bayesian optimization with mixed variable types. Proposes weighting strategy for ensemble surrogate predictions.

entry.title: Diffusion Model-Based Data Augmentation for Enhanced Neuron Segmentation

author.name: Liuyun Jiang, Yanchao Zhang, Jinyue Guo, Yizhuo Lu, Ruining Zhou, Hua Han

entry.summary: Proposes diffusion-based data augmentation for neuron segmentation generating diverse image-label pairs with resolution-aware conditional diffusion and multi-scale conditioning.

entry.title: HVD: Human Vision-Driven Video Representation Learning for Text-Video Retrieval

author.name: Zequn Xie, Xin Liu, Boyun Zhang, Yuxiao Lin, Sihang Cai, Tao Jin

entry.summary: Proposes HVD (Human Vision-Driven) model for text-video retrieval with coarse-to-fine alignment mimicking human visual perception, using Frame Features Selection and Patch Features Compression modules.

entry.title: How to Build AI Agents by Augmenting LLMs with Codified Human Expert Domain Knowledge? A Software Engineering Framework

author.name: Choro Ulan uulu, Mikhail Kulyabin, Iris Fuhrmann, Jan Joosten, Nuno Miguel Martins Pacheco, Filippos Petridis, Rebecca Johnson, Jan Bosch, Helena Holmstr\"om Olsson

entry.summary: Proposes software engineering framework for capturing human domain knowledge in AI agents through RAG, expert rules, and visualization principles. Industrial case study in simulation data visualization.

entry.title: Hallucination-Free Automatic Question & Answer Generation for Intuitive Learning

author.name: Nicholas X. Wang, Aggelos K. Katsaggelos

entry.summary: Proposes hallucination-free multi-agent framework for educational MCQ generation with rule-based and LLM-based detection agents. Identifies four hallucination types specific to MCQ generation.

entry.title: Report for NSF Workshop on AI for Electronic Design Automation

author.name: Deming Chen, Vijay Ganesh, Weikai Li, Yingyan Celine Lin, Yong Liu, Subhasish Mitra, David Z. Pan, Ruchir Puri, Jason Cong, Yizhou Sun

entry.summary: NSF workshop report on AI for Electronic Design Automation covering physical synthesis, HLS/LLS, LLM applications, and formal verification. Includes recommendations for future research.

entry.title: Efficient reformulations of ReLU deep neural networks for surrogate modelling in power system optimisation

author.name: Yogesh Pipada Sunil Kumar, S. Ali Pourmousavi, Jon A. R. Liisberg, Julian Lesmos-Vinasco

entry.summary: Proposes linear programming reformulation for ReLU neural networks with non-negative weights, enabling tractable embedding of learned surrogate models in power system optimization problems.

entry.title: CAG-Avatar: Cross-Attention Guided Gaussian Avatars for High-Fidelity Head Reconstruction

author.name: Zhe Chang, Haodong Jin, Yan Song, Hui Yu

entry.summary: CAG-Avatar uses cross-attention to adaptively drive different facial regions (skin vs teeth) for high-fidelity 3D head reconstruction with 3D Gaussian Splatting.

entry.title: A Curriculum-Based Deep Reinforcement Learning Framework for the Electric Vehicle Routing Problem

author.name: Mertcan Daysalilar, Fuat Uyguroglu, Gabriel Nicolosi, Adam Meyers

entry.summary: Curriculum-based deep RL framework for electric vehicle routing with time windows, using three-phase curriculum to gradually increase problem complexity and maintain training stability.

entry.title: An Agentic Operationalization of DISARM for FIMI Investigation on Social Media

author.name: Kevin Tseng, Juan Carlos Toledano, Bart De Clerck, Yuliia Dukach, Phil Tinn

entry.summary: Operationalizes DISARM framework for foreign information manipulation investigation using LLM agents on social media, addressing threat characterization and response coordination challenges.

entry.title: Predicting Healthcare System Visitation Flow by Integrating Hospital Attributes and Population Socioeconomics with Human Mobility Data

author.name: Binbin Lin, Lei Zou, Hao Tian, Heng Cai, Yifan Yang, Bing Zhou

entry.summary: Integrates hospital attributes, population socioeconomics, and mobility patterns to predict healthcare visitation flows. Compares multiple models including Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks.

entry.title: Atlas-Assisted Segment Anything Model for Fetal Brain MRI (FeTal-SAM)

author.name: Qi Zeng, Weide Liu, Bo Li, Ryne Didier, P. Ellen Grant, Davood Karimi

entry.title: Progressive Power Homotopy for Non-convex Optimization

author.name: Chen Xu

entry.summary: Introduces Progressive Power Homotopy (Prog-PowerHP), a first-order method for non-convex optimization using power transformation and Gaussian smoothing with progressive parameter scheduling.

entry.title: Clustering-Guided Spatial-Spectral Mamba for Hyperspectral Image Classification

author.name: Zack Dewis, Yimin Zhu, Zhengsen Xu, Mabel Heffring, Saeid Taleghanidoozdoozan, Quinn Ledingham, Lincoln Linlin Xu

entry.summary: CSSMamba integrates clustering into spatial Mamba architecture for hyperspectral image classification. Reduces sequence length while improving spatial-spectral feature learning.

entry.title: Embedding Retrofitting: Data Engineering for better RAG

author.name: Anantha Sharma

entry.summary: Demonstrates data engineering framework for embedding retrofitting in RAG, showing annotation artifacts like hashtags create spurious edges that corrupt retrofitting. Preprocessing enables +6.2% improvement.

entry.title: Chunking, Retrieval, and Re-ranking: An Empirical Evaluation of RAG Architectures for Policy Document Question Answering

author.name: Anuj Maharjan, Umesh Yadav

entry.summary: Empirical evaluation of RAG architectures for CDC policy documents. Compares chunking, retrieval, and re-ranking strategies for mitigating hallucination in high-stakes policy QA.

entry.title: ExDR: Explanation-driven Dynamic Retrieval Enhancement for Multimodal Fake News Detection

author.name: Guoxuan Ding, Yuqing Li, Ziyan Zhou, Zheng Lin, Daren Zha, Jiangnan Li

entry.summary: ExDR uses explanation-driven dynamic retrieval for multimodal fake news detection. Leverages model-generated explanations to guide evidence selection and avoid redundant retrieval.

entry.title: Artificial Rigidities vs. Biological Noise: A Comparative Analysis of Multisensory Integration in AV-HuBERT and Human Observers

author.name: Francisco Portillo L\'opez

entry.summary: Compares AV-HuBERT responses to McGurk effect against human observers. Finds quantitative isomorphism in auditory dominance but deterministic bias toward phonetic fusion lacking human variability.

entry.title: Region-aware Spatiotemporal Modeling with Collaborative Domain Generalization for Cross-Subject EEG Emotion Recognition

author.name: Weiwei Wu, Yueyang Li, Yuhu Shi, Weiming Zeng, Lang Qin, Yang Yang, Ke Zhou, Zhiguo Zhang, Wai Ting Siok, Nizhuan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes RSM-CoDG framework for cross-subject EEG emotion recognition combining region-aware spatiotemporal modeling with collaborative domain generalization to handle inter-subject variability.

entry.title: Zero-Shot Product Attribute Labeling with Vision-Language Models: A Three-Tier Evaluation Framework

author.name: Shubham Shukla, Kunal Sonalkar

entry.summary: Introduces three-tier evaluation framework for VLMs on fashion attribute prediction: overall performance, attribute applicability detection, and conditional classification given applicability.

entry.title: TinySense: Effective CSI Compression for Scalable and Accurate Wi-Fi Sensing

author.name: Toan Gian, Dung T. Tran, Viet Quoc Pham, Francesco Restuccia, Van-Dinh Nguyen

entry.summary: Introduces TinySense, a VQGAN-based compression framework for Wi-Fi sensing CSI data, enabling scalable human pose estimation while maintaining accuracy through optimized codebook learning.

entry.title: Accurate Calibration and Robust LiDAR-Inertial Odometry for Spinning Actuated LiDAR Systems

author.name: Zijie Chen, Xiaowei Liu, Yong Xu, Shenghai Yuan, Jianping Li, Lihua Xie

entry.title: Social Robotics for Disabled Students: An Empirical Investigation of Embodiment, Roles and Interaction

author.name: Alva Markelius, Fethiye Irmak Do\u{g}an, Julie Bailey, Guy Laban, Jenny L. Gibson, Hatice Gunes

entry.summary: Empirical study comparing physical robots vs disembodied agents and different interaction roles for supporting disabled students, finding physical robots perceived as more understanding with lower social energy demands.

entry.title: FSX: Message Flow Sensitivity Enhanced Structural Explainer for Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Bizu Feng, Zhimu Yang, Shaode Yu, Zixin Hu

entry.summary: FSX combines internal message flow analysis with cooperative game theory for GNN explainability, balancing computational efficiency with interaction modeling accuracy.

entry.title: Knowledge Restoration-driven Prompt Optimization: Unlocking LLM Potential for Open-Domain Relational Triplet Extraction

author.name: Xiaonan Jing, Gongqing Wu, Xingrui Zhuo, Lang Sun, Jiapu Wang

entry.summary: KRPO uses knowledge reconstruction to iteratively improve LLM prompts for open-domain relation extraction, incorporating reflection mechanisms to internalize error signals.

entry.title: Tracing 3D Anatomy in 2D Strokes: A Multi-Stage Projection Driven Approach to Cervical Spine Fracture Identification

author.name: Fabi Nahian Madhurja, Rusab Sarmun, Muhammad E. H. Chowdhury, Adam Mushtak, Israa Al-Hashimi, Sohaib Bassam Zoghoul

entry.summary: Uses 2D projection-based approach for cervical spine fracture detection from 3D CT volumes, achieving 94.45% 3D mIoU for localization with reduced computational complexity.

entry.title: Data-Driven Conditional Flexibility Index

author.name: Moritz Wedemeyer, Eike Cramer, Alexander Mitsos, Manuel Dahmen

entry.summary: Proposes conditional flexibility index that extends traditional flexibility index by learning parameterized admissible uncertainty sets from data and using contextual information like forecasts.

entry.title: Out-of-Distribution Detection Based on Total Variation Estimation

author.name: Dabiao Ma, Zhiba Su, Jian Yang, Haojun Fei

entry.summary: Proposes TV-OOD, using Total Variation Network Estimator to calculate input contributions to total variation as score for out-of-distribution detection in image classification.

entry.title: IB-GRPO: Aligning LLM-based Learning Path Recommendation with Educational Objectives via Indicator-Based Group Relative Policy Optimization

author.name: Shuai Wang, Yaoming Yang, Bingdong Li, Hao Hao, Aimin Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes IB-GRPO for learning path recommendation, using indicator-based group relative policy optimization to align LLM recommendations with pedagogical objectives like Zone of Proximal Development.

entry.title: Implementing Knowledge Representation and Reasoning with Object Oriented Design

author.name: Abdelrhman Bassiouny, Tom Schierenbeck, Sorin Arion, Benjamin Alt, Naren Vasantakumaar, Giang Nguyen, Michael Beetz

author.name: Anjanava Biswas, Wrick Talukdar

entry.summary: Survey on guardrails for trust, safety, and ethical LLM deployment covering safety, privacy, and ethical concerns. Provides overview of challenges and mitigation approaches.

entry.title: Forest-Chat: Adapting Vision-Language Agents for Interactive Forest Change Analysis

author.name: James Brock, Ce Zhang, Nantheera Anantrasirichai

entry.summary: Forest-Chat integrates LLMs with vision-language models for interactive forest change analysis from satellite imagery. Enables natural language querying for pixel-level change detection and semantic interpretation.

entry.title: Multimodal system for skin cancer detection

author.name: Volodymyr Sydorskyi, Igor Krashenyi, Oleksii Yakubenko

entry.summary: Multi-modal melanoma detection system using conventional photos instead of dermoscopic images, combining image data with patient metadata through neural networks and boosting ensemble.

entry.title: Early predicting of hospital admission using machine learning algorithms: Priority queues approach

author.name: Jakub Antczak, James Montgomery, Ma{\l}gorzata O'Reilly, Zbigniew Palmowski, Richard Turner

entry.title: TempoNet: Learning Realistic Communication and Timing Patterns for Network Traffic Simulation

author.name: Jaekwon Im, Natalia Polouliakh, Taketo Akama

entry.title: Risk reversal for least squares estimators under nested convex constraints

author.name: Omar Al-Ghattas

entry.summary: Demonstrates risk reversal in constrained estimation: stricter feasible sets can paradoxically increase statistical risk. Provides explicit counterexample in Gaussian sequence model.

entry.title: Domain-Incremental Continual Learning for Robust and Efficient Keyword Spotting in Resource Constrained Systems

author.name: Prakash Dhungana, Sayed Ahmad Salehi

entry.title: MALTopic: Multi-Agent LLM Topic Modeling Framework

author.name: Yash Sharma

entry.title: ToxiTwitch: Toward Emote-Aware Hybrid Moderation for Live Streaming Platforms

entry.title: Can professional translators identify machine-generated text?

entry.summary: Studies whether professional translators can identify AI-generated Italian short stories. Statistically significant subset (16.2%) succeeded, but equal number misclassified human as AI.

entry.title: Adapter Fusion for Multilingual Text2Cypher with Linear and Learned Gating

author.name: Makbule Gulcin Ozsoy

entry.summary: Trains language-specific LoRA adapters for multilingual Text2Cypher and combines via linear merging or learned fusion MLP. Avoids full fine-tuning for new languages.

entry.title: Controlling Long-Horizon Behavior in Language Model Agents with Explicit State Dynamics

author.name: Sukesh Subaharan

entry.summary: Investigates whether imposing dynamical structure on external affective state (Valence-Arousal-Dominance) can induce temporal coherence in LLM agents during extended interactions, using first- and second-order update rules.

entry.title: Consistency-Regularized GAN for Few-Shot SAR Target Recognition

author.name: Yikui Zhai, Shikuang Liu, Wenlve Zhou, Hongsheng Zhang, Zhiheng Zhou, Xiaolin Tian, C. L. Philip Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Cr-GAN (Consistency-regularized GAN) for few-shot SAR target recognition, synthesizing diverse samples even with severe data scarcity through consistency regularization.

Kamrul Hasan, Jie Gan, Zhuonan Liang, Weidong Cai, Yuxin Huang, Gongning Luo, Mohammad Yaqub, Karim Lekadir

entry.summary: Develops an integrated framework combining analytical modeling, simulation, and machine learning for collision detection between robotic arms in laparoscopic surgery.

entry.title: Learning Functional Graphs with Nonlinear Sufficient Dimension Reduction

author.name: Kyongwon Kim, Bing Li

entry.summary: Introduces nonparametric functional graphical models based on sufficient dimension reduction, relaxing Gaussian and additive assumptions of existing approaches.

entry.title: Divide and Refine: Enhancing Multimodal Representation and Explainability for Emotion Recognition in Conversation

author.name: Anh-Tuan Mai, Cam-Van Thi Nguyen, Duc-Trong Le

entry.summary: Proposes information-theoretic approach to multimodal emotion recognition, identifying unique, redundant, and synergistic contributions from modalities and how data augmentation affects these.

entry.title: Transfer Learning from One Cancer to Another via Deep Learning Domain Adaptation

author.name: Justin Cheung, Samuel Savine, Calvin Nguyen, Lin Lu, Alhassan S. Yasin

entry.summary: Evaluates domain adaptation techniques for transferring cancer severity classification across different adenocarcinoma types. Addresses limited annotated data in medical imaging through cross-domain transfer.

entry.title: Anytime Optimal Decision Tree Learning with Continuous Features

author.name: Harold Kiossou, Pierre Schaus, Siegfried Nijssen

entry.summary: Proposes anytime algorithm for optimal decision tree learning with continuous features, overcoming depth limitations of existing exact methods through improved search strategy.

entry.title: Recommending Best Paper Awards for ML/AI Conferences via the Isotonic Mechanism

author.name: Garrett G. Wen, Buxin Su, Natalie Collina, Zhun Deng, Weijie Su

entry.summary: Proposes Isotonic Mechanism for eliciting author self-assessments to improve best paper award selection at ML conferences, aggregating author rankings with review scores.

entry.title: Benchmarking Deep Learning Models for Raman Spectroscopy Across Open-Source Datasets

author.name: Adithya Sineesh, Akshita Kamsali

entry.summary: First systematic benchmark comparing multiple deep learning classifiers specifically designed for Raman spectroscopy across multiple open-source datasets.

entry.title: FAIR-ESI: Feature Adaptive Importance Refinement for Electrophysiological Source Imaging

author.name: Linyong Zou, Liang Zhang, Xiongfei Wang, Jia-Hong Gao, Yi Sun, Shurong Sheng, Kuntao Xiao, Wanli Yang, Pengfei Teng, Guoming Luan, Zhao Lv, Zikang Xu

entry.summary: Proposes FAIR-ESI framework for electrophysiological source imaging with adaptive feature refinement across spectral, temporal, and patch-wise dimensions. Validated on simulation and clinical datasets.

entry.title: Measuring the State of Open Science in Transportation Using Large Language Models

author.name: Junyi Ji, Ruth Lu, Linda Belkessa, Liming Wang, Silvia Varotto, Yongqi Dong, Nicolas Saunier, Mostafa Ameli, Gregory S. Macfarlane, Bahman Madadi, Cathy Wu

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to automatically extract data and code availability features from transportation research papers, measuring open science practices at scale.

entry.title: Adaptive Fidelity Estimation for Quantum Programs with Graph-Guided Noise Awareness

author.name: Tingting Li, Ziming Zhao, Jianwei Yin

entry.title: Tailoring Adverse Event Prediction in Type 1 Diabetes with Patient-Specific Deep Learning Models

author.name: Giorgia Rigamonti, Mirko Paolo Barbato, Davide Marelli, Paolo Napoletano

entry.summary: Develops personalized blood glucose prediction using patient-specific deep learning, comparing leave-one-out vs per-patient training approaches for wearable glucose monitor data.

entry.title: DS@GT at TREC TOT 2025: Bridging Vague Recollection with Fusion Retrieval and Learned Reranking

author.name: Wenxin Zhou, Ritesh Mehta, Anthony Miyaguchi

entry.summary: Proposes class and confidence-aware reweighting scheme for long-tailed learning that adjusts based on both class imbalance and sample confidence levels.

entry.title: The Latency Wall: Benchmarking Off-the-Shelf Emotion Recognition for Real-Time Virtual Avatars

author.name: Yarin Benyamin

entry.title: Local Language Models for Context-Aware Adaptive Anonymization of Sensitive Text

author.name: Aisvarya Adeseye, Jouni Isoaho, Seppo Virtanen, Mohammad Tahir

entry.summary: Develops SFAA, a structured framework using local LLMs for context-aware anonymization of sensitive qualitative research data. Addresses limitations of pattern-matching approaches that fail to preserve meaning.

author.name: Nadine Meertens, Suet Lee, Ophelia Deroy

entry.summary: Argues awareness is more tractable than consciousness for evaluating AI systems. Proposes domain-sensitive, multidimensional evaluation method for assessing system abilities to process, store, and use information for goal-directed action.

entry.title: DDSA: Dual-Domain Strategic Attack for Spatial-Temporal Efficiency in Adversarial Robustness Testing

author.name: Jinwei Hu, Shiyuan Meng, Yi Dong, Xiaowei Huang

entry.title: Calibrated uncertainty quantification for prosumer flexibility aggregation in ancillary service markets
