entry.summary: Combines Monte Carlo dropout with conformal prediction to produce calibrated prediction intervals for prosumer flexibility in energy markets. Addresses uncertainty quantification under P90 reliability requirements.

entry.title: Fast-ULCNet: A fast and ultra low complexity network for single-channel speech enhancement

author.name: Nicol\'as Arrieta Larraza, Niels de Koeijer

entry.summary: Fast-ULCNet replaces GRU layers with FastGRNNs for low-latency speech enhancement, addressing state drifting in long audio via trainable complementary filter.

entry.title: ViT Registers and Fractal ViT

author.name: Jason Chuan-Chih Chou, Abhinav Kumar, Shivank Garg

entry.summary: Tests fractal ViT variant using attention masks between regular and summary tokens (like registers) with various positional encodings. Results don't improve upon standard ViT with registers.

entry.title: Machine Failure Detection Based on Projected Quantum Models

author.name: Larry Bowden, Qi Chu, Bernard Cena, Kentaro Ohno, Bob Parney, Deepak Sharma, Mitsuharu Takeori

entry.summary: Develops quantum computing-based failure detection using projected quantum feature maps on IBM's 133-qubit Heron processor. Validates on IoT sensor data from operational machines.

entry.title: Determinants of Training Corpus Size for Clinical Text Classification

author.name: Jaya Chaturvedi, Saniya Deshpande, Chenkai Ma, Robert Cobb, Angus Roberts, Robert Stewart, Daniel Stahl, Diana Shamsutdinova

entry.summary: Studies how training corpus size affects clinical text classification using BERT+Random Forest. Analyzes vocabulary properties including strong/noisy predictive words across dataset sizes 100-10,000.

entry.title: From Quotes to Concepts: Axial Coding of Political Debates with Ensemble LMs

author.name: Angelina Parfenova, David Graus, Juergen Pfeffer

entry.summary: Operationalizes axial coding (qualitative analysis) with ensemble LLMs plus moderator. Compares clustering-based vs direct LLM grouping for analyzing Dutch parliamentary debates.

entry.title: synthocr-gen: A synthetic ocr dataset generator for low-resource languages- breaking the data barrier

author.name: Haq Nawaz Malik, Kh Mohmad Shafi, Tanveer Ahmad Reshi

entry.summary: SynthOCR-Gen generates synthetic OCR datasets for low-resource languages like Kashmiri. Addresses lack of support in major OCR systems for Perso-Arabic scripts.

entry.title: LLM Prompt Evaluation for Educational Applications

author.name: Langdon Holmes, Adam Coscia, Scott Crossley, Joon Suh Choi, Wesley Morris

entry.summary: Presents systematic approach for evaluating LLM prompts in educational applications through tournament-style framework. Tests six prompt templates with different pedagogical strategies for generating follow-up questions in structured dialogue.

entry.title: SplatBus: A Gaussian Splatting Viewer Framework via GPU Interprocess Communication

author.name: Yinghan Xu, Th\'eo Morales, John Dingliana

entry.summary: SplatBus provides a framework for integrating 3D Gaussian Splatting into traditional mesh-based rendering pipelines using Nvidia's interprocess communication APIs, enabling practical integration with existing graphics workflows.

entry.title: Designing Persuasive Social Robots for Health Behavior Change: A Systematic Review of Behavior Change Strategies and Evaluation Methods

author.name: Jiaxin Xu, Chao Zhang, Raymond H. Cuijpers, Wijnand A. IJsselsteijn

entry.summary: Systematic review of behavior change strategies and evaluation methods used in social robots for health interventions, synthesizing 39 studies across four strategy categories.

entry.title: Airflow Source Seeking on Small Quadrotors Using a Single Flow Sensor

author.name: Lenworth Thomas, Tjaden Bridges, Sarah Bergbreiter

entry.summary: Presents flow-based source seeking on small quadrotors (<100g) using a custom sensor that detects both airflow magnitude and direction, implementing a modified Cast and Surge algorithm.

entry.title: A Beacon Based Solution for Autonomous UUVs GNSS-Denied Stealthy Navigation

author.name: Alexandre Albore, Humbert Fiorino, Damien Pellier

entry.summary: Proposes a beacon-based navigation solution for autonomous underwater vehicles in GNSS-denied environments, using aerial drones to deploy synthetic landmark networks.

entry.title: Improve the autonomy of the SE2(3) group based Extended Kalman Filter for Integrated Navigation: Theoretical Analysis

author.name: Jiarui Cui, Maosong Wang, Wenqi Wu, Peiqi Li, Xianfei Pan

entry.summary: Analyzes autonomy properties of SE2(3) Lie group-based navigation models under different reference frames, providing theoretical framework for high-precision navigation.

entry.title: On the Nonasymptotic Scaling Guarantee of Hyperparameter Estimation in Inhomogeneous, Weakly-Dependent Complex Network Dynamical Systems

author.name: Yi Yu, Yubo Hou, Yinchong Wang, Nan Zhang, Jianfeng Feng, Wenlian Lu

entry.summary: Develops theoretical framework for hyperparameter estimation in hierarchical Bayesian models of complex network dynamical systems, providing nonasymptotic bounds as system size grows.

entry.title: Multi-Behavior Sequential Modeling with Transition-Aware Graph Attention Network for E-Commerce Recommendation

author.name: Hanqi Jin, Gaoming Yang, Zhangming Chan, Yapeng Yuan, Longbin Li, Fei Sun, Yeqiu Yang, Jian Wu, Yuning Jiang, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes transition-aware graph attention network for e-commerce recommendation that models multi-behavior sequential data more efficiently than transformer-based approaches for large-scale systems.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Score-Based Despeckling for SAR Imagery via Log-Domain Transformation

author.name: Junhyuk Heo

entry.summary: Proposes self-supervised framework for SAR despeckling using score-based generative models in log domain, converting multiplicative speckle to approximately additive Gaussian for tractable modeling.

entry.title: Designing KRIYA: An AI Companion for Wellbeing Self-Reflection

author.name: Shanshan Zhu, Wenxuan Song, Jiayue Melissa Shi, Dong Whi Yoo, Karthik S. Bhat, Koustuv Saha

entry.summary: Describes KRIYA, an AI wellbeing companion designed for co-interpretive engagement with personal health data through features like Comfort Zone, Detective Mode, and What-If Planning.

entry.title: Proximal Policy Optimization with Evolutionary Mutations

author.name: Casimir Czworkowski, Stephen Hornish, Alhassan S. Yasin

entry.summary: POEM adds evolutionary mutation mechanisms to PPO that trigger when policy KL divergence indicates stagnation. Addresses premature convergence through adaptive exploration.

entry.title: A Comprehensive Benchmark of Language Models on Unicode and Romanized Sinhala

author.name: Minuri Rajapakse, Ruvan Weerasinghe

entry.summary: Benchmarks LLMs on Unicode and Romanized Sinhala using perplexity and sentence completion, finding Mistral models perform best. Highlights challenges for morphologically rich, low-resource languages.

entry.title: CAFE-GB: Scalable and Stable Feature Selection for Malware Detection via Chunk-wise Aggregated Gradient Boosting

author.name: Ajvad Haneef K, Karan Kuwar Singh, Madhu Kumar S D

entry.summary: CAFE-GB proposes chunk-wise aggregated gradient boosting for scalable malware feature selection. Produces stable, globally consistent feature rankings for high-dimensional malware datasets.

entry.title: Computing Fixpoints of Learned Functions: Chaotic Iteration and Simple Stochastic Games

author.name: Paolo Baldan, Sebastian Gurke, Barbara K\"onig, Florian Wittbold

entry.summary: Generalizes dampened Mann iteration for computing fixpoints of learned functions. Enables chaotic iterations and applies to simple stochastic games.

entry.title: Enhanced LULC Segmentation via Lightweight Model Refinements on ALOS-2 SAR Data

author.name: Ali Caglayan, Nevrez Imamoglu, Toru Kouyama

entry.summary: Presents lightweight refinements for national-scale land-use/land-cover segmentation on ALOS-2 SAR data, addressing boundary smoothing, thin structure detection, and rare-class handling.

entry.title: An Optimized Decision Tree-Based Framework for Explainable IoT Anomaly Detection

author.name: Ashikuzzaman, Md. Shawkat Hossain, Jubayer Abdullah Joy, Md Zahid Akon, Md Manjur Ahmed, Md. Naimul Islam

entry.summary: Proposes explainable decision tree-based framework for IoT anomaly detection combining SHAP values and Morris sensitivity analysis for both local and global explanations.

entry.title: From Observation to Prediction: LSTM for Vehicle Lane Change Forecasting on Highway On/Off-Ramps

author.name: Mohamed Abouras, Catherine M. Elias

entry.summary: Applies multi-layer LSTM to predict vehicle lane changes on highway on/off-ramps using drone-captured data, achieving 76% accuracy for ramp scenarios up to 4 seconds ahead.

entry.title: Improve the autonomy of the SE2(3) group based Extended Kalman Filter for Integrated Navigation: Application

author.name: Jiarui Cui, Maosong Wang, Wenqi Wu, Peiqi Li, Xianfei Pan

entry.summary: Companion paper to theoretical analysis, presenting real-world SINS/odometer experiments demonstrating improved SE2(3) group-based high-precision navigation models.

entry.title: DARA: Few-shot Budget Allocation in Online Advertising via In-Context Decision Making with RL-Finetuned LLMs

author.name: Mingxuan Song, Yusen Huo, Bohan Zhou, Shenglin Yin, Zhen Xiao, Jieyi Long, Zhilin Zhang, Chuan Yu

entry.summary: Introduces DARA using GRPO-Adaptive, an LLM post-training strategy for few-shot budget allocation in online advertising. Leverages in-context learning with enhanced numerical precision.

entry.title: A Cloud-Based Cross-Modal Transformer for Emotion Recognition and Adaptive Human-Computer Interaction

author.name: Ziwen Zhong, Zhitao Shu, Yue Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes cloud-based cross-modal transformer integrating visual, auditory, and textual signals using pretrained encoders (ViT, Wav2Vec2, BERT) with cross-modal attention for emotion recognition.

entry.title: HCVR Scene Generation: High Compatibility Virtual Reality Environment Generation for Extended Redirected Walking

author.name: Yiran Zhang, Xingpeng Sun, Aniket Bera

entry.summary: HCVR generates VR environments optimized for compatibility with Redirected Walking techniques, ensuring physical space constraints are respected while enabling large virtual scene exploration.

entry.title: Dynamic Management of a Deep Learning-Based Anomaly Detection System for 5G Networks

author.name: Lorenzo Fern\'andez Maim\'o, Alberto Huertas Celdr\'an, Manuel Gil P\'erez, F\'elix J. Garc\'ia Clemente, Gregorio Mart\'inez P\'erez

entry.summary: MEC-oriented anomaly detection system for 5G networks using deep learning with dynamic management capabilities for real-time autonomous operation.

entry.title: Data-driven Lake Water Quality Forecasting for Time Series with Missing Data using Machine Learning

author.name: Rishit Chatterjee, Tahiya Chowdhury

entry.summary: Studies Secchi Disk Depth forecasting on lakes with irregular volunteer-collected data. Uses MICE imputation and evaluates ridge regression as best performer with minimal sample size analysis.

entry.title: Enhanced Convergence in p-bit Based Simulated Annealing with Partial Deactivation for Large-Scale Combinatorial Optimization Problems

author.name: Naoya Onizawa, Takahiro Hanyu

entry.summary: Investigates limitations of probabilistic bit-based simulated annealing (pSA) for combinatorial optimization, identifying oscillation issues. Proposes TApSA and PDpSA algorithms to address energy stagnation.

entry.title: A Lightweight Brain-Inspired Machine Learning Framework for Coronary Angiography: Hybrid Neural Representation and Robust Learning Strategies

author.name: Jingsong Xia, Siqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes lightweight brain-inspired neural framework for coronary angiography classification. Uses selective neural plasticity training and attention mechanisms for class imbalance.

entry.title: Elsewise: Authoring AI-Based Interactive Narrative with Possibility Space Visualization

author.name: Yi Wang, John Joon Young Chung, Melissa Roemmele, Yuqian Sun, Tiffany Wang, Shm Garanganao Almeda, Brett A. Halperin, Yuwen Lu, Max Kreminski

entry.summary: Elsewise is an authoring tool for AI-based interactive narratives implementing Bundled Storyline concept for possibility space visualization. Bridges author intent and player experience.

entry.title: The Dark Side of AI Transformers: Sentiment Polarization & the Loss of Business Neutrality by NLP Transformers

author.name: Prasanna Kumar

entry.summary: Observes that transformer-based sentiment analytics improvements in one sentiment class come at the cost of polarization of another class and failure of neutrality, posing problems for business applications.

entry.title: High-Fidelity 3D Tooth Reconstruction by Fusing Intraoral Scans and CBCT Data via a Deep Implicit Representation

author.name: Yi Zhu, Razmig Kechichian, Rapha\"el Richert, Satoshi Ikehata, S\'ebastien Valette

entry.summary: Proposes a pipeline for fusing CBCT and intraoral scan data for 3D tooth reconstruction using deep implicit representations, combining high-fidelity crown data with root structure from CT scans.

entry.title: D-Optimality-Guided Reinforcement Learning for Efficient Open-Loop Calibration of a 3-DOF Ankle Rehabilitation Robot

author.name: Qifan Hu, Branko Celler, Weidong Mu, Steven W. Su

entry.summary: Proposes D-optimality-guided reinforcement learning for calibration of a 3-DOF ankle rehabilitation robot, framing calibration as a combinatorial design-of-experiments problem.

entry.title: Prosody-Guided Harmonic Attention for Phase-Coherent Neural Vocoding in the Complex Spectrum

author.name: Mohammed Salah Al-Radhi, Riad Larbi, M\'aty\'as Bartalis, G\'eza N\'emeth

entry.summary: Proposes neural vocoder with prosody-guided harmonic attention that directly predicts complex spectral components for phase-coherent waveform synthesis.

entry.title: Semantic-Guided Unsupervised Video Summarization

author.name: Haizhou Liu, Haodong Jin, Yiming Wang, Hui Yu

entry.summary: Proposes semantic-guided unsupervised video summarization using frame-level semantic alignment attention, addressing limitations of GAN-based approaches that overlook semantic information.

entry.title: Call2Instruct: Automated Pipeline for Generating Q&A Datasets from Call Center Recordings for LLM Fine-Tuning

author.name: Alex Echeverria, S\'avio Salvarino Teles de Oliveira, Fernando Marques Federson

entry.summary: Presents automated pipeline for generating Q&A instruction datasets from call center audio recordings including diarization, noise removal, transcription, and anonymization steps.

entry.title: MapViT: A Two-Stage ViT-Based Framework for Real-Time Radio Quality Map Prediction in Dynamic Environments

author.name: Cyril Shih-Huan Hsu, Xi Li, Lanfranco Zanzi, Zhiheng Yang, Chrysa Papagianni, Xavier Costa P\'erez

entry.summary: Introduces MapViT, a Vision Transformer framework for predicting radio signal quality maps in dynamic environments for robotic navigation. Uses pre-train and fine-tune paradigm inspired by LLMs.

entry.title: Delayed Assignments in Online Non-Centroid Clustering with Stochastic Arrivals

author.name: Saar Cohen

entry.summary: Introduces online non-centroid clustering with delayed assignments where points in metric spaces can postpone cluster assignment at a cost.

entry.title: Computational Representations of Character Significance in Novels

author.name: Haaris Mian, Melanie Subbiah, Sharon Marcus, Nora Shaalan, Kathleen McKeown

entry.summary: Applies six-component literary theory of character significance to 19th-century British novels. Compares LLMs with task-specific transformers for operationalizing character theory.

entry.title: Preparation and Motion Study of Magnetically Driven Micro Soft Robot Mimicking the Cownose Ray

author.name: Jiaqing Chang, Song Gao, Chaowei Dong, zhaobang Li, Yang Liu

entry.summary: Designs a magnetically-driven micro soft robot inspired by cownose ray swimming, made from NdFeB and PDMS, for use in narrow underwater environments and medical procedures.

entry.title: Breaking the accuracy-resource dilemma: a lightweight adaptive video inference enhancement

author.name: Wei Ma, Shaowu Chen, Junjie Ye, Peichang Zhang, Lei Huang

entry.summary: Proposes fuzzy controller-based framework for adaptive video inference enhancement that balances accuracy and resource usage based on real-time system conditions.

entry.title: Emergent, not Immanent: A Baradian Reading of Explainable AI

author.name: Fabio Morreale, Joan Serr\`a, Yuki Mistufuji

entry.summary: Develops philosophical reading of XAI through Barad's agential realism, arguing interpretations are material-discursive performances emerging from situated entanglements rather than immanent properties of models.

entry.title: Vehicle Routing with Finite Time Horizon using Deep Reinforcement Learning with Improved Network Embedding

author.name: Ayan Maity, Sudeshna Sarkar

entry.summary: Proposes novel network embedding module for vehicle routing with finite time horizon using deep RL, incorporating remaining time into context-aware representations.

entry.title: GEGO: A Hybrid Golden Eagle and Genetic Optimization Algorithm for Efficient Hyperparameter Tuning in Resource-Constrained Environments

author.name: Amaras Nazarians, Sachin Kumar

entry.summary: GEGO hybridizes Golden Eagle Optimization with genetic operators for hyperparameter tuning in resource-constrained environments. Embeds genetic operations directly into iterative search rather than as separate evolutionary stages.

entry.title: A Machine Vision Approach to Preliminary Skin Lesion Assessments

author.name: Ali Khreis, Ro'Yah Radaideh, Quinn McGill

entry.summary: Evaluates automated skin lesion assessment combining the clinical ABCD rule with ML classifiers on HAM10000 dataset. Compares traditional rule-based dermoscopy scoring against deep learning for malignancy detection.

entry.title: Automatic Classification of Arabic Literature into Historical Eras

author.name: Zainab Alhathloul, Irfan Ahmad

entry.summary: Uses neural networks and deep learning to automatically classify Arabic texts into historical eras. Evaluates on two datasets from public corpora beyond just poetry.

entry.title: AI-Based Culvert-Sewer Inspection

author.name: Christina Thrainer

entry.summary: Thesis exploring methods to improve automated defect segmentation in culverts and sewer pipes using limited annotated data. Proposes three methods to enhance segmentation and handle data scarcity.

entry.title: Glove2UAV: A Wearable IMU-Based Glove for Intuitive Control of UAV

author.name: Amir Habel, Ivan Snegirev, Elizaveta Semenyakina, Miguel Altamirano Cabrera, Jeffrin Sam, Fawad Mehboob, Roohan Ahmed Khan, Muhammad Ahsan Mustafa, Dzmitry Tsetserukou

entry.summary: Glove2UAV is a wearable IMU-glove interface for intuitive UAV control through hand gestures with vibrotactile feedback for speed warnings.

entry.title: Assessing the informative value of macroeconomic indicators for public health forecasting

author.name: Shome Chakraborty, Fardil Khan, Soutik Ghosal

entry.summary: Examines whether macroeconomic indicators provide predictive value for public health capacity forecasting using multiple ML approaches including neural networks and GAMs.

entry.title: Generative Artificial Intelligence, Musical Heritage and the Construction of Peace Narratives: A Case Study in Mali

author.name: Nouhoum Coulibaly, Ousmane Ly, Michael Leventhal, Ousmane Goro

entry.summary: Explores generative AI for creating peace narrative music in Mali, examining cultural authenticity in AI-assisted musical co-creation rooted in national languages and traditions.

entry.title: The Ontological Neutrality Theorem: Why Neutral Ontological Substrates Must Be Pre-Causal and Pre-Normative

author.name: Denise M. Case

entry.summary: Establishes a formal impossibility result showing that ontological neutrality in data systems is incompatible with causal or normative commitments at the foundational layer. Argues neutral substrates must be pre-causal and pre-normative to support accountability across disagreements.

entry.title: Towards Bound Consistency for the No-Overlap Constraint Using MDDs

author.name: Amaury Guichard, Laurent Michel, H\'el\`ene Verhaeghe, Pierre Schaus

entry.summary: Derives first bound-consistent algorithm for the no-overlap constraint by building on MDD representations, enabling tightening of start and end times in polynomial time.

entry.title: From Textbook to Talkbot: A Case Study of a Greek-Language RAG-Based Chatbot in Higher Education

author.name: Maria Eleni Koutsiaki, Marina Delianidi, Chaido Mizeli, Konstantinos Diamantaras, Iraklis Grigoropoulos, Nikolaos Koutlianos

entry.summary: Case study on Greek-language RAG-based educational chatbot for higher education, addressing linguistic challenges specific to Greek while grounding responses in course content.

entry.title: A comprehensive overview of deep learning models for object detection from videos/images

author.name: Sukana Zulfqar, Sadia Saeed, M. Azam Zia, Anjum Ali, Faisal Mehmood, Abid Ali

entry.summary: Comprehensive review of deep learning methods for object detection in video/image surveillance, classifying methods by architecture, data processing, and domain-specific challenges like occlusions and lighting.

entry.title: Beyond Off-the-Shelf Models: A Lightweight and Accessible Machine Learning Pipeline for Ecologists Working with Image Data

author.name: Clare Chemery, Hendrik Edelhoff, Ludwig Bothmann

entry.summary: Presents a lightweight ML pipeline lowering barriers for ecologists to train image classifiers. Combines command-line preprocessing/training with graphical annotation and analysis interface.

entry.title: A Rolling-Space Branch-and-Price Algorithm for the Multi-Compartment Vehicle Routing Problem with Multiple Time Windows

author.name: El Mehdi Er Raqabi, Kevin Dalmeijer, Pascal Van Hentenryck

entry.summary: Develops branch-and-price algorithm for multi-compartment vehicle routing with multiple time windows. Handles compartment flexibility and item compatibility.

entry.title: Abusive music and song transformation using GenAI and LLMs

author.name: Jiyang Choi, Rohitash Chandra

entry.summary: Explores using GenAI and LLMs to transform abusive content in music by modifying tone, intensity, and sentiment rather than simply muting or replacing words. Presents comparative analysis of four songs and their transformed counterparts.

entry.title: Recursivism: An Artistic Paradigm for Self-Transforming Art in the Age of AI

author.name: Florentin Koch

entry.summary: Introduces Recursivism as conceptual framework for AI art analysis, developing five-level scale from simple iteration to meta-recursion distinguishing variation within fixed rules from genuine self-modification.

entry.title: Balancing Security and Privacy: The Pivotal Role of AI in Modern Healthcare Systems

author.name: Binu V P, Deepthy K Bhaskar, Minimol B

entry.summary: Survey paper exploring AI's role in balancing security and privacy in healthcare systems. Discusses threat detection, automated responses, and privacy-preserving implementations.

entry.title: Relative Classification Accuracy: A Calibrated Metric for Identity Consistency in Fine-Grained K-pop Face Generation

author.name: Sylvey Lin, Eranki Vasistha

entry.summary: Proposes Relative Classification Accuracy (RCA) metric for evaluating identity consistency in fine-grained face generation, demonstrated on K-pop idol face generation at 32x32 resolution.

entry.title: Algebraic Statistics in OSCAR

author.name: Tobias Boege, Antony Della Vecchia, Marina Garrote-L\'opez, Benjamin Hollering

entry.summary: Introduces algebraic statistics functionality in the OSCAR computer algebra system, including serialization and implicitization algorithms.

entry.title: VegaChat: A Robust Framework for LLM-Based Chart Generation and Assessment

author.name: Marko Hostnik, Rauf Kurbanov, Yaroslav Sokolov, Artem Trofimov

entry.summary: arXiv:2601.15385v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Natural-language-to-visualization (NL2VIS) systems based on large language models (LLMs) have substantially improved the accessibility of data visual...

entry.title: Scalable Knee-Point Guided Activity Group Selection in Multi-Tree Genetic Programming for Dynamic Multi-Mode Project Scheduling

author.name: Yuan Tian, Yi Mei, Mengjie Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a knee-point guided activity group selection strategy for genetic programming applied to dynamic project scheduling, addressing scalability issues in larger problem instances.

entry.title: A Mobile Application for Flower Recognition System Based on Convolutional Neural Networks

author.name: Mustafa Yurdakul, Enes Ayan, Fahrettin Horasan, Sakir Tasdemir

entry.summary: Develops CNN-based mobile application for flower recognition using various architectures and transfer learning, achieving recognition across multiple flower types.

entry.title: Does Pentagon Pizza Theory Work?

author.name: rba

entry.summary: Analyzes the historical 'Pentagon Pizza Theory' - using pizza delivery patterns to predict military operations - and examines whether such open source intelligence approaches actually work.

entry.title: Like night and day: Light glasses and dark therapy can treat non-24 (and SAD)

author.name: JennaS

entry.summary: Personal account of treating non-24-hour sleep disorder using light glasses and dark therapy with red lights, showing dramatic improvement in sleep pattern regularity.

entry.title: An IoT-Based Smart Plant Monitoring and Irrigation System with Real-Time Environmental Sensing, Automated Alerts, and Cloud Analytics

author.name: Abdul Hasib, A. S. M. Ahsanul Sarkar Akib

entry.summary: Presents IoT-based smart plant monitoring system integrating environmental sensors with ESP32 microcontroller, automated irrigation, OLED display, and cloud analytics.

entry.title: How Could I Have Learned That Faster?

author.name: Dom Polsinelli

entry.summary: Meta-discussion on how to efficiently discover relevant research papers, noting the challenge of knowledge gaps even after years of studying a field.

entry.title: Resisting Reality

author.name: robertzk

entry.summary: Philosophical reflection on rational response to unwanted information and updating beliefs when evidence points in uncomfortable directions.
